Policy: Loi n°2019-032 du 24 juillet 2019 portant modification de la loi n°10-013 du 20 mai 2010 portant réglementation des systèmes financiers décentralisés.
Policy_Content: La présente loi modifie les dispositions de l’article 6 de la loi n°10-013 du 20 mai 2010 portant réglementation des systèmes financiers décentralisés. Aux termes de l’article 6 (nouveau), les Systèmes financiers décentralisés sont classés en deux (2) catégories, selon la nature des opérations qu’ils sont autorisés à effectuer: les institutions qui collectent des dépôts et accordent des prêts à leurs membres ou aux tiers; et les institutions qui accordent des prêts, sans exercer l’activité de collecte de dépôts. Les Systèmes financiers décentralisés d’une catégorie ne peuvent exercer les activités d’une autre catégorie sans l’autorisation préalable du ministre, accordée comme en matière d’agrément. Les Systèmes financiers décentralisés peuvent exercer des activités conformes aux principes de la finance islamique. Des instructions de la Banque centrale précisent les modalités de l’exercice par les Systèmes financiers décentralisés des activités conformes aux principes de la finance islamique. Les Systèmes financiers décentralisés qui envisagent d’exercer des activités ou professions régies par des dispositions spécifiques doivent solliciter les autorisations requises et se soumettre aux réglementations applicables aux opérations envisagées, sous réserve des dispositions contraires de la présente Loi.

Policy: Loi n°2019-041 du 24 juillet 2019 portant création, organisation et modalités de contrôle de la zone de développement des régions du nord du Mali.

Le Conseil consultatif interrégional de la ZODEREN-Mali est placé sous la tutelle du ministre chargé des Collectivités territoriales. Ce Conseil est obligatoirement consulté sur: les orientations générales d’intervention dans la Zone de Développement; la création des Zones économiques et de leurs activités; la coordination des actions de développement dans la Zone de Développement; les efforts de mutualisation des moyens;  les objectifs annuels à atteindre; le plaidoyer pour le développement conformément à la loi; la mobilisation des financements nécessaires à la réalisation des programmes retenus; et toute autre question en rapport avec le développement de la Zone de Développement.

Policy: Republic Act No. 11310 institutionalizing the "Pantawid Pamilyang" Filipino Program (4Ps).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 27 sections institutionalizes the "Pantawid Pamilyang" Filipino Programme (4Ps). The Congress shall give highest priority to the following sectors: protection and enhance the right of all the people to human dignity, reduce social, economic, and political inequalities, and remove cultural inequities by equitably diffusing wealth and political power for the common good; promotion of social justice, including the commitment to create economic opportunities based on freedom of initiative and self-reliance. The State shall establish programmes aimed at investing on human capital and improve delivery of basic services to the poor, particularly education, health and nutrition, which is an intervention anticipated to break the inter-generational cycle of poverty, through basic services to the poor and early childhood care and development; Promote gender equality and empowerment of women and children's rights; Achieve universal primary education; Reduce child mortality and malnutrition; Improve maternal health; and Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all.

Policy: Regulation establishing criteria of environmental damage assessment.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of six articles, establishes, in accordance with European Union legislation, criteria for assessing the occurrence of environmental damage in protected species or protected natural habitats, in waters and in the surface of land. The criteria for assessing the occurrence of environmental damage in the protected species is a change or changes causing one or more of the following measurable effects that have a significant adverse effect on the achievement or maintenance of proper protection status for these species: (1) destruction of a protected species habitat; (2) deterioration of the condition or function of the protected species population, consisting in particular of: (a) reducing the population size of protected species or reducing their density; (b) deterioration of the reproductive species population, their spread or deterioration of other vital functions; (c) an increase in mortality; (d) reducing the possibility of contact between the protected species population and neighboring populations.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 74 validating the Regulation on the Agency of the Republic of Kazakhstan on counteraction to corruption (anticorruption service).
Policy_Content: Regulation on the Agency of the Republic of Kazakhstan on counteraction to corruption (anticorruption service) is a state anti-corruption body directly subordinate and accountable to the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan, carrying out formation and implementation of the anti-corruption policy of the Republic of Kazakhstan and coordination in the field of combating corruption, as well as identification, suppression, disclosure and investigation of corruption offenses. The Agency is a legal entity in the organizational and legal form of a state institution, has seals and stamps with its name in the state language, standard forms, as well as in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan, accounts in the treasury bodies. The Agency is prohibited from entering into contractual relations with business entities for the performance of duties, which are the functions of the Agency. The Agency shall perform the following tasks: (a) formation and implementation of state policy in the field of anti-corruption; (b) identification of conditions and reasons conducive to the commission of corruption offenses, and elimination of their consequences; (с) organization of a set of measures aimed at the formation of anti-corruption culture in society; (d) coordination of the activities of state bodies, organizations and actors of the quasi-public sector in the prevention of corruption; (e) development of international cooperation to counter corruption; and (f) identification, suppression, disclosure and investigation of corruption offenses. Official functions of the Agency shall include: (a) development and implementation of strategic and program documents in anti-corruption sphere; (b) development and adoption of regulatory legal acts in the field anti-corruption in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan; (c) implementation of external analysis of corruption risks; (d) monitoring the implementation by state bodies, organizations and by actors of the quasi-public sector recommendations made on the results of an external analysis of corruption risks; (e) submission to the Government of the Republic of Kazakhstan for consideration of recommendations for eliminating the causes and conditions of corruption; (f) determination of the standard procedure for conducting internal analysis of corruption risks; (g) conducting anti-corruption monitoring; (h) organization of anti-corruption education; (h) interaction with civil society institutions on issues of anti-corruption; (i) annual formation of the National Report on Counteraction corruption in the Republic of Kazakhstan and its introduction in the manner prescribed by the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan; and (j) reception, registration and consideration of applications, messages and other information about criminal offenses.

Policy: Regional Law No. 55-kz “On conservation and reproduction of protection forests on agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal grounds for regulation of the issues of conservation and reproduction of protection forests on agricultural land pertaining to public property. Management and disposal of public agricultural land under protective forest plantations shall be performed by the Regional Government and authorized regional executive bodies in accordance with their competence. Performance of afforestation and reconstruction of protection forests shall be performed by the authorized institution by planting of saplings, seedlings, cuttings and conversion cuts. Afforestation arrangements shall be performed with instructions for projecting and growing protection forest plantations that must ensure: (a) protection of agricultural land against unfavorable factors; (b) soil improvement; and (c) environmental improvement. Economic and other activities on land plots under protective forest plantations not related to improvement of land conditions, should not lead to the deterioration of supply of water, air and nutrients to the soil. Protection forests shall be subject to mandatory state registration.

Policy: Regional Law No. 2394-ZRK “On village chiefs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues of the activities of village chiefs as a form of public participation of the population in local government. Village chief is appointed by the representative body of the rural settlement or the urban district, of which it is a part, in conformity with the proposal by meeting of rural residents, from among the persons residing on the territory of the given municipality of rural area and having active voting rights. Village chief can be vested with the following powers: (a) assistance to local government, municipal institutions and other organizations in addressing the  issues of local significance in rural settlement; (b) interaction with the population by participating at meetings, gatherings, conferences of citizens, submittal, by the outcome thereof, of appeals and proposals, including those arranged in form of draft municipal legal acts subject to mandatory consideration by the local government; (c) informs the villagers on issues related to the organization and implementation of local government, and brings information received from the authorities of local government to their attention; and (d) assists local self-government bodies in organizing and holding public hearings and public discussions, public disclosure of their results in the rural community.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 610 validating the Regulation on connection to the unified electric power system of business entities generating electric power, also from renewable energy sources.
Policy_Content: This Regulation determines the procedure for connection of business entities generating electricity, including from renewable energy sources, to the electric power grids of the unified electric power system and ensures non-discriminatory access of business entities to the electric grids. At the same time, the requirements of this Regulation shall apply to the following cases: (a) connection to the unified electric power system of newly commissioned capacities of the electric power producer; (b) increase in capacity of the producer's previously connected electric installations; and (c) change in the connection point of the producer's previously connected electric installations to the unified electric power system. Manufacturers, including those who have installed generating sets in private residential buildings, have the right to connect to the unified electric power system according to the procedure established by this Regulation, according to the scheme according to Appendix 1. The manufacturer's electrical installations shall be connected to the optimal point of the unified electric power system. In order to connect its electric installations to the unified electric power system, the manufacturer shall be obliged to obtain technical specifications for connection of new or additional generating capacities from the organization to which the connection to the power grids is supposed to be made.

Policy: Law No. 95 On public private partnership.
Policy_Content: Public private partnership shall be intended interaction between public and private partners on the issues of involving a public partner in designing, financing, construction, rehabilitation, reconstruction of infrastructure facilities, as well as in managing existing or newly created infrastructure facilities and/or providing infrastructure services. PPP shall be applicable to energy generation, distribution and trade, utilities, tourism and recreation, and management of water resources. Policy: Law No. ZRU-549 “On tourism”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be to regulate relations in the field of tourism. The main principles of this Law shall be as follows: (a) priority of protection of rights, freedoms, legitimate interests and safety of tourists, excursionists and subjects of the sphere of tourism; (b) stability of tourism development and creation of favorable conditions for it; (c) state support of entrepreneurship and development of competition in the sphere of tourism; and (d) publicity and openness in tourism sphere. Tourism shall be classified into the following categories: (a) cultural-historical; (b) pilgrimage; (c) ecological; (d) cognitive; (e) ethnographic (f) gastronomic; (g) business; (h) social; (i) sports; (j) medical; (k) youth; (l) agro-tourism; and (m) other types of tourism. The main directions of the state policy in the sphere of tourism shall be as follows: (a) development of tourism as a strategic branch of the country's economy; (b) ensuring the rights of citizens to rest, freedom of movement and other rights when traveling; (c) rational use and preservation of tourist resources; (d) improvement of the legal framework; (e) creation of necessary conditions for the development of domestic tourism, including the organization of tourism and excursions for children, young people, the elderly, as well as persons with disabilities and low-income groups of the population within the framework of social tourism development; (f) attraction of investments and creation of favorable conditions for investment into tourism sphere; (g) development of public-private partnership in this sphere; (h) creation of equal opportunities in the market of tourist services for business entities; (i) stimulation through the establishment of tax and customs benefits for tourism entities; (j) ensuring the safety of tourists and excursionists, protection of their rights, freedoms and legitimate interests and property; (k) organization and development of scientific research; (l) training, retraining and professional development of personnel; (m) development of international cooperation; (n) improvement of the image of the Republic of Uzbekistan as a country attractive for tourism; (o) provision of tourism entities with state support in promoting the national tourism product in the tourism markets; (p) stimulation of the introduction of advanced innovative and information and communication technologies; and (q) stimulation of the development of tourist zones and tourism clusters. This Law contains 10 Chapters divided into 45 Articles. Chapter 1 lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 regards regulation of tourism. Chapter 3 regards tourism industry. Chapter 4 regards tourism areas and tourism clusters. Chapter 5 establishes terms and conditions for the performance of tourism. Chapter 6 regards the particulars of formation promotion and offer of tourism product. Chapter 7 establishes rights and duties of tour operators and travel agents, tourists and excursionists, guides (interpreters).  Chapter 8 regards tourism associations. Chapter 9 regards security of tourism. Chapter 10 lays down final provisions.

Policy: Law No. 44/2019 amending the Criminal Code of the Republic of Albania No. 7895, dated 27.1.1995.
Policy_Content: This Law makes several amendments in the Penal Code by strengthening the penalties and sanctions in the fields of pollution control; protection of environment; protection of air, soil and water; ecosystem preservation; biodiversity conservation; protection of flora and fauna; protection of species; management of waste and hazardous substances; animal welfare; and food safety. This Law amends Article 201 by imposing imprisonment in case of breach of the norms permitted by law regarding air pollution, surface and groundwater pollution, surface pollution or insoil depth, severe damage to animals or plants, through discharge, emission or the introduction of ionizing radiation or a quantity of materials into the air, soil or water. The following paragraph of this Article sets forth penalty increase for the same act when committed in areas specially protected by law, including areas of environmental, cultural, artistic, historical, architectural or archaeological value, or when cause or is likely to cause severe damage to the ecosystem, biodiversity, flora or fauna. This Law adds Articles 201/a, 201/b, 201/c and 201/ç to lay down penalties for the violation of requirements for collection, transportation, recovery or disposal of waste; storage and use of hazardous substances and preparations; and production, processing, handling, use, storage, transportation, import, export or disposal of nuclear materials or other radioactive substances. Furthermore, Article 202 lays down penalties for violation of the requirements of the legislation in force for the protection of wild fauna and flora as well as for the protected areas or permits and authorizations issued by the competent authorities. To this end, 202/a and 202/b are added to this Law to regulate the trade of specimens of protected species of wild flora and fauna or parts or their by-products and to prevent deterioration of habitats in environmentally protected areas. Article 203 is amended regarding the penalties in case violating the requirements of relevant legislation or permits and authorizations issued by competent bodies for the production, import, export, placing on the market or use of ozone depleting substances. Moreover, articles 207/a, 207/b, 207/c and 207/ç are added lay down penalties for the violation of requirements in the fields of animal welfare. In order to ensure the health or life of people through food safety, this Law amends Article 288. Thereby, this Law sets forth penalties for the violation of food safety requirements through import, production, sale and storage of hazardous foods. Additionally, Article 288/c and Article 288/ç are inserted regarding food fraud and demolition of security signs placed by state bodies for the purpose of supervising, controlling or suspending commercial activity in economic premises, on means of transport or on goods.

Policy: Loi n° 19-05 du 14 Dhou El Kaâda 1440 correspondant au 17 juillet 2019 relative aux activités nucléaires.
Policy_Content: La présente loi fixe les dispositions générales applicables aux activités liées aux utilisations pacifiques de l’énergie nucléaire et des techniques nucléaires ainsi qu’aux sources de rayonnements ionisants. Elle vise également à : la protection des personnes, des biens et de l’environnement ; la sûreté et la sécurité nucléaires des installations nucléaires et des matières nucléaires; la sûreté et la sécurité nucléaires des sources de rayonnements ionisants. A ce titre, ce texte s’applique aux activités liées aux matières nucléaires et sources de rayonnements ionisants ; installations nucléaires et radiologiques ; déchets radioactifs ; minerais d’uranium et du thorium. Toutefois, elle ne s’applique pas lorsque : le risque radiologique est suffisamment faible ou la valeur de l’exposition aux rayonnements est inférieure aux limites d’exemption fixées par voie réglementaire ; les expositions sont dues aux rayonnements cosmiques au niveau du sol ; l’exposition est due à la radioactivité naturellement présente dans le corps humain. Par ailleurs, la loi n° 19-05 du 14 Dhou El Kaâda 1440 correspondant au 17 juillet 2019 relative aux activités nucléaires crée une autorité nationale de sûreté et de sécurité nucléaires dont la mission est de veiller au respect et à l’application des règles de sûreté et de sécurité nucléaires et de radioprotection, définies par les dispositions de la présente loi et des textes pris pour son application.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 599 determining the procedure for the use of agricultural land and cadastral information related thereto on the official websites of ministries, departments and local government.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Governmental Decree is the introduction of modern and transparent mechanism of access to information on land cadastre of agricultural land to be displayed on the official websites of ministries, departments and local government. Land cadastre information is the state information resource of the Republic of Uzbekistan and is intended for use by relevant ministries and agencies, local authorities, interested legal entities and natural persons. Land cadastre information shall be classified as follows: (a) land cadastre information of limited access; and (b) open land cadastre information. Land use cadastre information includes information on land parcels allocated to agricultural organizations in accordance with the established procedure for agricultural management, which is used by authorized ministries, agencies and organizations. Open information of land cadastre includes information on agricultural land that is not currently being distributed to agricultural organizations in the prescribed manner and is used by authorized ministries, agencies and organizations, and all legal entities and natural persons. Land cadastre database includes the following information: (a) legal regime of land parcel, location, boundaries, reference number, area, soil fertility and quality characteristics of land; (b) water availability for agricultural land, land reclamation, irrigation networks and structures; (c) crop cultivation (including crop rotation plan); (d) availability of vineyards, mulberry trees and fruit trees; and (e) profile (specialization) of farms.

Policy: Law of the Republic of Armenia on Public-Privatе Partnership.
Policy_Content: This Law shall define the legal framework for regulation of public-private partnership, including the rules and procedures related to the development and implementation of public-private partnership projects, the institutional framework for governance, applicable to criteria and other issues related to the PPPs. The objectives of PPP for ensuring and managing public infrastructure and public service shall include: (a) reducing the costs needed during the life cycle of the public infrastructures and improving the quality of buildings, construction,  operation and maintenance thereof; (b) ensuring proper and timely maintenance of the asset during the operation period thereof; (c) increasing access to public infrastructures and services; (d) receiving benefits from the private sector practice, resources, technologies, efficiency and innovation capacities; (e) increasing accountability and transparency towards the public in the field of public infrastructures and public services; (f) improving the information database on public infrastructures and public services covered by PPP projects in the Republic of Armenia; and (g) attracting investments for new public infrastructures, where necessary. The decision of the Government shall define the sectors of public services being rendered within the scope of PPP projects, which must comply with the priorities set in the public investment management policy adopted by the Government. The competent authority shall select a private partner in accordance with the private partner selection procedure. The competent authority shall conclude a PPP contract with a successful tender applicant for becoming a public partner. The competent authority shall have the right to authorize the state and/or community organizations and/or other legal persons to organize the tender and act as a third party to a PPP contract. Main information and conditions of PPP contracts shall include the procedure and conditions for allotment of land plots required for the implementation of a PPP project (where necessary), as well as the description of their condition. Land plots shall be allotted on the basis of purchase and sale contract.
Subject: Land & soil, General

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 587 validating the Regulation on the procedure for reimbursement of feed crop producers’ costs related to drilling of irrigation vertical wells for introduction of drip and sprinkler irrigation technology on rainfed and pasture land plots.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes the procedure for reimbursement of feed crop producers’ costs related to drilling of irrigation vertical wells for introduction of drip and sprinkler irrigation technology on rainfed and pasture land plots. It shall not be applicable to the reimbursement of expenses related to the rehabilitation of irrigation wells, which have become defective or temporarily closed. A subsidy of 100,000 sums per meter of drilled irrigation vertical wells (hereinafter referred to as subsidies) will be provided to cover part of the costs of fodder crop producers for drilling and sprinkler irrigation technology. The costs of drilling irrigation vertical wells for the introduction of drip irrigation and sprinkler irrigation technology are covered in accordance with the scheme in Annex 1. The list of producers of fodder crops receiving subsidies to cover the costs associated with drilling irrigation vertical wells shall be compiled by the regional working groups, which are formed in the sample structure in Annex 2. Producers of fodder crops shall submit the following documents to the working group for subsidies: (a) copy of the working project on construction (drilling) of irrigation vertical wells for implementation of drip and sprinkler irrigation technology; (b) copy of the contract with the contractor for the construction (drilling) of irrigation vertical wells for the introduction of drip and sprinkler irrigation technology; (c) copy of certificate of commissioning and acceptance of completed works on construction (drilling) of irrigation vertical wells for introduction of drip and sprinkler irrigation technology.

Policy: Decree-Law No.  93/2019 creating the Multi-municipal water supply and sanitation system in the Algarve Region, assigning the related exploitation and management concession to Águas do Algarve, S.A, under a public and exclusive service regime.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 26 articles, creates the Multi-municipal water supply and sanitation system in the Algarve Region, and assigns the related exploitation and management concession to Águas do Algarve, S.A, under a public and exclusive service regime. The system covers the abstraction, treatment and supply of water for public consumption and the collection, treatment and disposal of domestic effluents resulting from the mixing with industrial or rainwater effluents called urban effluents and the receipt of effluents from septic tank cleaning, which comply with the provisions of the operating and service regulations for the wastewater sanitation activities in force in the system, as well as their treatment and rejection, activities that must be carried out on a regular basis. The system results from the aggregation of the multi-municipal water supply system of the Algarve, created by Decree-Law No. 285/2003 of 8 November and the multi-municipal sanitation system of the Algarve, created by Decree-Law no. 167/2000 of 5 August.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 575 validating regulatory legal acts regulating the activity of Inspectorate for supervision over agro-industrial complex under the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
Policy_Content: This Regulation defines the main tasks, functions, rights and obligations of the Inspectorate for supervision over agro-industrial complex under the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan as well as the procedure for organization of its activities. The Inspectorate is a state body that exercises control over the agro-industrial complex of the Republic of Uzbekistan. Inspectorate in its activity is guided by the Constitution and laws of the Republic of Uzbekistan, decisions of Chambers of the Oliy Majlis of the Republic of Uzbekistan, decrees, decisions and orders of the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan, resolutions and orders of the Cabinet of Ministers. The Inspectorate system includes: (a) Central Inspection Office; (b) State Unitary Enterprise “Center for rendering services in agro-industrial complex” under Inspectorate; (c) Karakalpakstan and regional departments of the Inspectorate; and (d) District inspection offices. The Inspection operates independently of the local executive authorities, and subordinate to executive bodies, and directly to the Cabinet of Ministers. The decisions of the Inspectorate within the limits of its authority shall be binding for the state and economic management, local executive authorities, other organizations and their officials, as well as citizens. Inspectorate carries out its activities in cooperation with state and economic management, law enforcement agencies, local authorities, non-governmental non-profit organizations, foreign, international and other organizations. Inspectorate activity is financed by the State budget of the Republic of Uzbekistan and the Fund for development of control over the agro-industrial complex under the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan. The main tasks of the Inspectorate shall be as follows: (a) compliance with agricultural and water legislation; (b) observance of the state order for seeds, including seeds of cotton and cereals, preparation, processing and storage of seeds; (c) compliance with the requirements for the formation of agricultural and food stocks in the volume in accordance with the planned implementation of the state order; (d) quality control of cotton, cereals and other crops and their seeds, as well as the products of their processing, their rational and targeted use, their quality preservation and reduction of loss; (e) implementation of state policy in the field of genetic purity and seed quality of seeds, implementation of seed certification in accordance with the accreditation field, identification and control of seed and plant material quality; (e) rational use and protection of agricultural land, the unconditional observance of legislative requirements within the duties assigned to the Inspectorate; (g) rational and efficient use water at artificial water bodies and observance of water use rules; (h) observance of livestock breeding legislation and other normative documents at all enterprises, institutions and organizations, regardless of their departmental subordination and forms of ownership; (i) control over the technical condition of agricultural, reclamation and road-building machinery, their operation efficiency, as well as the quality of service and repair services; (j) obligatory state inspection of export, import and domestic transportation of raw cotton, cereals and other agricultural crops and their seeds and products of their processing; and (k) identification of violations and application of  measures to eliminate their causes and conditions, and performance of administrative proceedings in the manner prescribed by law.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 578 “On measures for further strengthening of the material and technical base of agricultural producers”.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree, with a view of renewal and modernization of the agricultural machinery park, provide farmers with high-quality and affordable machinery, provide them with timely after-sales service, as well as large-scale  introduction of market mechanisms in financing the production of competitive agricultural machinery, validates the Regulation on the procedure for providing state support for the purchase of agricultural machinery on credit and leasing. It defines the procedure for the allocation of subsidies in order to increase the efficiency of agricultural enterprises and state support for their equipping with modern high-performance agricultural machinery. The amount of the subsidy must be specified in the terms of the contract concluded between the borrower and the leasing organization or commercial bank. The subsidy is allocated to a leasing organization or a commercial bank for partial compensation of interest payments if there is a warranty period of at least 1 year for agricultural equipment purchased under leasing and credit terms, as well as service centers for this equipment in the Republic of Uzbekistan. A subsidy to compensate the leasing or credit interest of the borrower is allocated in the amount of 10 percentage points of the rate established by a commercial bank or leasing organization.

Para la interpretación y aplicación de la presente Ley, se entenderá por movilidad sostenible aquella que es capaz de satisfacer las necesidades de la sociedad de moverse libremente, acceder, comunicarse, comercializar o establecer relaciones sin sacrificar otros valores humanos ecológicos básicos actuales o futuros. Es decir, debe incluir principios básicos de eficiencia, seguridad, equidad, bienestar (calidad de vida), competitividad y salud de conformidad a lo dispuesto por el World Business Council for Sustainable Development.

Policy: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) Policy, 2019
Policy_Content: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) play a key role in the growth and sustainability of Somaliland's economy. MSMEs are core to the emerging private sector in Somaliland and constitute the base for private sector led growth in the country. According to Somaliland's Vision 2030 and the 2nd National Development Plan (2017-2021), the country's susceptibility to climate change shocks poses long term risks to the Country's traditional economy dominated by the livestock industry. The country therefore needs to leverage its MSMEs to drive economic diversification with a focus on value addition for exports, import substitution, provision of services to other countries in the region, and others to achieve long-term growth. The Policy is also oversee a recognition of the vital role of the informal economy in development. The Vision 2030 essentially recognizes that MSMEs play a vital role to national development. Hence, the Policy seeks to create a well-developed private sector that provides investment, employment, sustained livelihoods and vital services to strengthen the economic foundation of peace. The guiding principles of the Policy include; • Access of key MSME stakeholders, across all sectors of the economy, to Government through Somaliland's Public Private Dialogue (PPD) platforms. • Support for development of an inclusive economy that benefits all citizens of Somaliland. • Creating full and fair opportunity for all, including marginalised groups and disadvantaged regions of the country. • Appropriate formalisation of the large informal sector leading to a well facilitated and supported formal economy that provides quality employment for the citizens of Somaliland. • Support for development and creation of an open market and competitive MSME sector and economy. The vision of the Policy is a vibrant and dynamic MSME sector that is competitive, innovative, technology driven, environmentally sensitive and contributing to sustainable national development and elimination of poverty. The overall objective of this policy is to support creation of new MSMEs, facilitate formalization of informal enterprise and to nature and strengthen existing enterprises to ensure realization of their full potential. The specific objectives include; 1. Support formalization of informal enterprises by streamlining and rationalizing business registration services at the Ministry of Trade, Industry and Tourism and across other MDAs, creating awareness about business opportunities and sharing information. This will enable growth of the formal economy and reduction of Somaliland's large informal sector; 2. Promote potential high growth sub-sectors of the economy and sector-specific initiatives to support diversification of the economy from the current high dependence on livestock and general trade; 3. Support and promote transformation of MSMEs from trade and commerce towards production, value addition and industry and utilization of local raw materials to develop high value products. Encourage production and export of value added products; 4. Promote and support development of MSMEs with emphasis on value chains with high potential for quality employment creation and production for both domestic and export markets. Identify and support development of promising value chains where MSMEs are predominant; from input supply to processing and export of final products; And 5. Promote and facilitate MSMEs with high potential for employment creation to address the big youth employment challenge which Somaliland faces. The Policy strategies include to; Create an Enabling Environment for Growth and Sustainability of MSMEs;  encourage entrepreneurship, Enterprise Culture and Skills Development; enable access to finance; enable market access and facilitation, among others.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 571 validating the Regulation on the Ministry of Agriculture.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree determines the status, main tasks, functions of the Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Uzbekistan, defines rights, responsibilities, procedures for organizing and reporting activities, as well as the functional duties and responsibilities of its managers. The Ministry in its activities is guided by the Constitution and laws of the Republic of Uzbekistan, decisions of the Chambers of the Oliy Majlis of the Republic of Uzbekistan, decrees, resolutions and orders of the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan. The Ministry carries out its activities in cooperation with state and economic management bodies, local authorities and other organizations. The decisions of the Ministry within the limits of its competence are mandatory for execution by state and economic management bodies, local executive bodies, other organizations and their officials, as well as legal and physical persons. The Ministry system includes: (a) Central Office of the Ministry; (b) Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Karakalpakstan, regional Departments of Agriculture; (c) Research and Production Center for Agriculture and Food Supply; (d) Agency for viticulture and winemaking; (e) Gardening and Greenhouse Development Agency; (f) Tashkent State Agrarian University; (g) Seed  Development Center; (h) Center for Testing of Agricultural Varieties; (i) State Center for Certification and Testing of Agricultural Machinery and Technologies; (j) State Unitary Enterprise "Agro-innovation"; (k) State Unitary Enterprise "Center for Agricultural Standardization"; (l) State Enterprise "Administrative and Economic Service"; and (m) Monitoring Service.  The main tasks of the Ministry shall be as follows: (a) implementation of the unified state policy in the field of agriculture and food security, primarily envisaging the digitization of agriculture, the introduction of market principles in the interrelations between agricultural entities, advanced experience and science, the introduction of modern resource-saving and intensive agricultural technologies; (b) stimulation of the creation of a value-added chain of agricultural and food products through the expansion of modern cooperative relationships in the production, storage, processing and trade of agricultural and food products; (c) implementation of measures for large-scale introduction of the cluster model of agribusiness, improvement of the legal and economic basis of the clustering process, assistance in the implementation of investment projects for the establishment and development of clusters in the agricultural sector; (d) coordinating government support measures for timely financing of agricultural activities, financial sustainability of agricultural producers, increasing productivity of low-yield land, ensuring food security and increasing agricultural exports; (e) stimulating the mechanization of agriculture and deep processing of agricultural products through the development of a wide range of modern financial services and improved access to high-quality agricultural machinery; (f) formation of modern system of preparation, use and export of seeds of agricultural crops, organization and development of primary and local breeds of varieties, including biotechnological primary seeds; (g) implementation of unified state policy in the field of plant protection, implementation of systemic measures on pest and weed control, agrochemical services and soil protection; and (h) provision of systematic integration of education, science and agricultural production, training and advanced training of personnel taking into account the current and future needs of highly qualified specialists in the agricultural sector.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-4388 “On measures for stable provision of the economy and population with energy resources, financial rehabilitation for improving oil and gas industry management system.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree, with a view of fully meeting energy needs of the national economy and the population, to ensure financial recovery of oil and gas enterprises, to create favorable conditions for the development of healthy competition, to introduce modern digital technologies and advanced management methods based on generally accepted international practice, to assign to Uztransgaz JSC the following functions: (a) acquisition of natural gas from gas production and processing organizations, including joint ventures and foreign companies operating under production sharing agreements, for its further transportation, including export and import of natural gas, as a single operator; and (b) trade of natural gas  under direct contracts to consumers connected to gas pipelines, as well as under commission agreements with JSC  Khududgaztaminot for consumers connected to gas distribution networks.  JSC “Khududgaztaminot” shall be assigned the following functions: (a) operation of gas distribution networks and related equipment in compliance with regulatory requirements for safe operation; and (b) purchase, supply, storage and trade of liquefied natural gas to the population and social facilities. JSC "Uzbekneftegaz" shall be assigned the following tasks: (a) increase of the volume of hydrocarbon production, including natural gas - up to 42.3 billion cubic meters and liquefied gas - up to 1.5 million tons in 2024; (b) ensuring profitability of the company; (c) attraction of the world's major oil and gas companies to the production of hydrocarbons at fields with hard-to-recover reserves on the basis of the conditions and investment mechanisms widely spread in foreign practice; (d) increase operational efficiency and optimizing costs of oil and gas companies, as well as reducing their debt burden with the involvement of independent international experts; (e) intensification of hydrocarbon production at the developed fields on the basis of modern technologies; (f) wide introduction of modern information and communication technologies into the activity with due account of foreign experience, including on the basis of implementation of the concept "Digital field"; and (g) critical study and optimization of investment projects in the oil and gas industry with the involvement of international consulting companies based on the real financial capabilities of domestic oil and gas companies.

Policy: Poverty Reduction Act, SC 2019, c 29, s 315
Policy_Content: Whereas poverty reduction contributes to meeting Canada’s international human rights obligations, including under the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, the Convention on the Rights of the Child, the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities and the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women, the purpose of the Act is to support continuous efforts in, and continuous monitoring of, poverty reduction in Canada.The targets for poverty reduction in Canada to which the Government of Canada aspires are the following: (a) 20% below the level of poverty in 2015 by 2020; and(b) 50% below the level of poverty in 2015 by 2030. A council is established, to be known as the National Advisory Council on Poverty, consisting of 8 to 10 members, including a Chairperson and a member with particular responsibilities for children’s issues.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic
Entry into force notes: [Enacted by section 315 of chapter 29 of the Statutes of Canada, 2019, sections 9 to 12 in force July 9, 2019, see SI/2019-58.]

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 511/2019 “On some measures for forest conservation and rational use of forest resources.”
Policy_Content: The President, with a view of conservation of forests and ensuring rational use of forest resources, combating illegal logging and illegal timber trafficking, decrees as follows: (a) to introduce trade of timber through tenders; (b) to set up system of control and monitoring of timber circulation on the market from the moment of its harvesting to sale through the functioning of the unified state system of electronic timber accounting, which is obligatory for all permanent forest users; (c) to establish administrative and criminal liability for non-submission, late submission, submission of knowingly unreliable information to the unified state system of electronic timber accounting; (d) to establish the procedure for monitoring domestic consumption of unprocessed domestic timber, as well as control over the excess of domestic consumption of unprocessed domestic timber; (e) to provide access to information on the circulation of timber in the format of open data; and (f) to introduce by November 1, 2019 electronic timber accounting by state enterprises within the scope of management of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, as well as to ensure the publication on the Unified web portal of executive bodies monthly reports on the implementation and operation of such electronic accounting.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Commission Implementing Decision (EU) 2019/1175 of 9 July 2019 on recognition of the ‘Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil RED’ voluntary scheme for demonstrating compliance with the sustainability criteria under Directives 98/70/EC and 2009/28/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council.
Policy_Content: By virtue of this Decision the Commission of the European Union recognizes the Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil RED voluntary scheme. It has been demonstrated that consignments of biofuels and bioliquids produced in accordance with the standards for the production of biofuels and bioliquids set in the scheme comply with the sustainability criteria laid down in article 7b(3), (4) and (5) of Directive 98/70/EC andaArticle 17(3), (4) and (5) of Directive 2009/28/EC.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Regional Law No. 46 “On some issues in the field of horticulture and gardening for individual personal needs.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues in the field of horticulture and gardening for individual personal needs. Regional Government shall have the following powers: (a) establishment of state support measures for horticulture and gardening; and (b) purchase of common property in state ownership. Horticulture plots and garden plots pertaining to the regional state property or municipal property, shall be provided to citizens in ownership free of charge in cases, established by federal and regional laws. Regional state bodies and local government shall have the right to grant state and municipal support to horticulture and gardening in forms envisaged by the legislation of the Russian Federation. Financing of regional state support measures for horticulture and gardening shall be granted within the limits of regional budget. Financing of local state support measures for horticulture and gardening shall be granted within the limits of local budgets.

Policy: Law No. 8.878 providing for Regularization of Rural and Non-Rural Public Lands Occupation within the State of Pará.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 34 articles divided into five Chapters, provides for Regularization of Rural and Non-Rural Public Lands Occupation within the State of Pará. Through the Instituto de Terras do Pará (ITERPA), authorizes to dispose of the public lands, pursuant to the Federal Constitution, and the Constitution of the State. The allocation of rural and non-rural public lands within the State of Pará will be compatible with Agricultural, Environmental, Agrarian, Extractive Forestry, Non-Timber Forestry Products, Urban Development, Land and Industrial Policies. ITERPA is responsible to promote the sale of state public lands, both rural and non-rural, in the form of direct sale to the legitimate applicants or through bidding, in the modality of public competition. The State of Pará shall promote measures that allow the rational and economic use of public, rural and non-rural lands, ensuring that all those who exercise or intend to exercise productive occupation, the opportunity to access property and/or land regularization, in order to comply to the principles of social justice, social function of property, economic order and protection of the environment.

Policy: Loi n° 23-2019 du 05 juillet 2019 portant création du fonds d’impulsion, de garantie et d’accompagnement des très petites, petites et moyennes entreprises et de l’artisanat.
Policy_Content: La présente loi créé le fonds d’impulsion, de garantie et d’accompagnement des très petites, petites et moyennes entreprises et de l’artisanat (FIGA). Le fonds d’impulsion, de garantie et d’accompagnement des très petites, petites et moyennes entreprises et de l’artisanat facilite l’accès des très petites, petites et moyennes entreprises et de l’artisanat aux services financiers et non financiers. A ce titre, il a pour missions de : soutenir les projets de création d’entreprises et de l’artisanat dans le montage des dossiers financiers, en particulier les plans d’affaires ; garantir les crédits d’investissements consentis par les établissements bancaires et de Crédits aux très petites, petites et moyennes entreprises et à l’artisanat ; négocier et nouer des partenariats avec tout organisme intervenant dans l’appui à la création et au développement des entreprises et de l’artisanat ;  financer les programmes de renforcement des capacités des créateurs et dirigeants d’entreprises et d’ateliers de l’artisanat.

Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 014-2019-EM ─ Reglamento para la Protección Ambiental en las Actividades Eléctricas.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Reglamento para la Protección Ambiental en las Actividades Eléctricas, tiene por objeto promover y regular la gestión ambiental de las actividades de generación, transmisión y distribución de energía eléctrica, con la finalidad de prevenir, minimizar, rehabilitar y/o compensar los impactos ambientales negativos derivados de tales actividades, en un marco de desarrollo sostenible. El presente Reglamento es de aplicación a toda persona natural o jurídica, nacional o extranjera, de derecho público, privado o de capital mixto; que proyecte ejecutar o desarrolle actividades de generación, transmisión y/o distribución de energía eléctrica en el territorio nacional, en sus distintas etapas: construcción, operación o abandono.

Policy: Decreto Nº PCM-035-2019 ─ Crea la Subcomisión Interinstitucional de titulación, ampliación, saneamiento y protección de los territorios y recursos naturales de la Región de la Mosquitia Hondureña (Subcomisión Mosquitia).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea la Subcomisión Interinstitucional de titulación, ampliación, saneamiento y protección de los territorios y recursos naturales de la Región de la Mosquitia Hondureña (Subcomisión Mosquitia). La Región de la Mosquitia Hondureña comprende los territorios del departamento de Gracias a Dios que ancestralmente han poseído los pueblos Miskitu, Pech, Tawahka y Garífuna. Las Funciones de la Subcomisión Mosquitia son: 1) Liderar y ejecutar la coordinación, integración, compatibilización y orientación de las políticas, acciones y actividades relacionadas con la titulación, saneamiento, ampliación y protección de los territorios y recursos naturales de la Región de la Mosquitia, para lo cual elaborará el respectivo plan de trabajo y presupuesto; 2) Conformar las Unidades Técnicas Especializadas necesarias para desarrollar, implementar y ejecutar el Plan de Trabajo; 3) Velar por el respeto y cumplimiento de los derechos ancestrales sobre los territorios de las comunidades de la Región de la Mosquitia, mediante la implementación de mecanismos técnicos y legales en todas las instancias de gobierno; 4) Dentro del marco de la Consulta Libre, Previa e Informada, fomentar el diseño de políticas y la formulación, gestión, ejecución, seguimiento y evaluación de proyectos de desarrollo de las comunidades de la Región de la Mosquitia, relacionadas con el otorgamiento de derechos de propiedad sobre los territorios, la protección de los recursos naturales y el medio ambiente; 5) Recibir, canalizar y dar seguimiento a las denuncias interpuestas por las ocupaciones ilegitimas por parte de terceros de mala fe.

Policy: Decree No. 204 regulating the procedures for seizure, donation and alienation of products and by-products seized by the competent environmental agency, in the State of Pará, in cases of environmental infractions.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 23 articles divided into four Chapters, regulates the procedures for seizure, donation and alienation of products and by-products seized by the competent environmental agency, in the State of Pará, in cases of environmental infractions. The Decree regulates the seizure of products and by-products of the environmental infraction, to be carried out by the competent environmental agency. The environmental inspector, at the moment of drawing up the Seizure and Deposit, shall describe the state of conservation of the seized products or by-products, as well as make photos, for the purposes of procedural instruction in cases of alienation, compensation to the Treasury or indemnification. The products or by-products seized shall be under the custody and responsibility of the environmental agency that conducted the seizure, and may be entrusted to the trustee until the administrative process is judged, observing the norms of cooperation between the state organs and other entities of the Federation. Removal of the products or byproducts of the environmental infraction may be provided to a place other than that seized or initially deposited, whenever the competent environmental body deems it convenient to the interest of the Public Authorities. In cases of seizure, auctioning and donation of cars, cargo vehicles or vessels, the Transit Department of the State of Pará (DETRAN/PA) or the Port Authority shall be notified for the appropriate measures.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 546 “On measures for further improvement of the procedure for issuing licenses for the right to use subsoil areas containing non-metallic mineral resources.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes the procedure of electronic auction on the electronic trading platform "E-IJRO AUKSION" for the right to use subsoil areas containing non-metallic minerals, as well as the issuance of licenses for the right to use these areas. The right to use subsoil plots containing non-metallic minerals is granted on the basis of a license for: (a) geological exploration; (b) mining; (c) use of technogenic mineral formations. Licenses shall be issued separately for each type of subsoil use. Licenses shall be issued by the State Committee for Geology and Mineral Resources.  The license for the right to use subsoil areas for geological exploration confirms the right to explore, evaluate and assess non-metallic mineral deposits (at the expense of own funds of subsoil users) on the basis of entrepreneurial risk. It is not required to obtain a license for the right to use subsoil areas for conducting at the stage of geological exploration of experimental (test) and pilot production of non-metallic minerals in the volumes justified by design and estimate documentation and sufficient to calculate reserves and assess their quality. The license for the right to use subsoil areas for the extraction of non-metallic minerals gives its owner the right to develop the deposit, process the extracted mineral raw materials, including the use (processing) of technogenic mineral formations obtained in the process of extraction, unless otherwise provided for by the terms of the license. The license for the right to use a subsoil plot for the extraction of non-metallic minerals is issued for the development of the deposit, the reserves of non-metallic minerals on which are approved in accordance with the procedure established by law. The license for the right to use subsoil areas for the use of technogenic mineral formations certifies the right of its owner to carry out processing of waste of mining and processing industries containing non-metallic useful components. The right of ownership of technogenic mineral formations, received in the process of extraction of non-metallic minerals and processing of mineral raw materials in accordance with the license for the right to use a plot of subsoil for extraction of non-metallic minerals, remains with the owner of the license for the period of validity of the right to use a plot of subsoil. In this case, it is not required to obtain a license for the use (processing) of technogenic mineral formations. Subsoil plots for geological exploration, extraction of non-metallic minerals and use of technogenic mineral formations are provided for limited period of time: (a) for geological exploration - for the term up to five years; and (b) for extraction of minerals and use of technogenic mineral formations - for the term of development of a mineral deposit or technogenic mineral formations defined by the technical and economic substantiation. Terms of subsoil use are specified in the license and are calculated from the date of its issuance.
Subject: Mineral resources

The Agency shall be autjhorized body of state administration, which carriesd out unified state policy in the fielf of protection of intellectual property rights.

Policy: Ley Nº 30977 - Ley de Promoción de la Amazonía Sostenible.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de Promoción de la Amazonía Sostenible, tiene por objeto promover el desarrollo sostenible e integral de la Amazonía. La Presidencia del Consejo de Ministros elaborará un Plan Multisectorial de Promoción de la Amazonía Sostenible con participación de los gobiernos regionales amazónicos y las comunidades nativas de conformidad con los siguientes ejes: 1) Primer Eje: Seguridad Alimentaria, el cual está disgregado en los siguientes componentes: Manejo de pesquerías en cochas y ríos, Cambio de canasta nutricional para los niños, Lucha contra la anemia y desnutrición. 2) Segundo Eje: Territorio, el cual está disgregado en los siguientes componentes: Ordenamiento territorial, Nuevos modelos de acceso al bosque (áreas de desarrollo sostenible), Seguridad jurídica de los bosques inundables, Titulación de tierras comunales. 3) Tercer eje: Condiciones para el desarrollo sostenible de la Amazonía, el cual está disgregado en los siguientes componentes: Energía sostenible, Conectividad sostenible, Incentivos,– Acceso a crédito, Creación de un fondo de desarrollo de la Amazonía que permita conservar los bosques como sumideros de carbono. 4) Cuarto eje: Puesta en valor, el cual está disgregado en los siguientes componentes: Bionegocios, Turismo, Madera con valor agregado, Servicios ambientales, Conocimiento ancestral, Promoción de la asociatividad.

Policy: Climate Change Resilience Act 2019.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down rules to strengthen the legal and policy frameworks for climate change resilience in line with the agreements related to climate change; promote low carbon development; establish effective governance structures for the implementation of sound climate change policies and coordination of climate change actions; and promote public awareness and involvement in climate change issues. The international conventions that Tuvalu is a party to are listed in the Schedule annexed to this Act. The emissions reduction targets for Tuvalu are in line with its nationally determined contributions made pursuant to the Paris Agreement. Furthermore, this Act sets forth provisions on the duties and powers of the Minister taking into consideration the gender perspective; the establishment and duties of the Department of Climate Change and Disaster; the creation of a National Climate Change Resilience Forum and National Advisory Council on Climate Change; the development and implementation of national climate change policy and other strategies and plans to address climate change; the establishment of the Climate Change and Disaster Survival Fund and its administration in accordance with the Climate Change and Disaster Survival Fund Act 2015; prohibition on the exploration, mining and extraction of fossil fuels; offences and penalties.

Policy: Customs Code of Georgia (No. 4905-IIS of 2019)
Policy_Content: This Code sets forth customs rules and formalities in connection with movement of goods in and out of Georgia. It consists of eleven books: General provisions (I); Protective measures in trade, customs value of goods (II); Customs duty and guarantee for import dues (III); Importing goods into the customs territory of Georgia (IV); Customs status of goods, subjecting goods to customs formalities, verifying customs declaration, releasing goods and disposal of goods by the customs authority (V); Releasing goods into free movement and special cases where goods are exempted from import tax (VI); Special procedures (VII); Removing goods from the customs territory of Georgia (VIII); Customs violations and liability (IX); Exemption from customs duties (X); and Transitional and final provisions (XI). The Code, among others, provides for special rules for taxation, importing and exporting of agricultural commodities, food, fish products, seeds, animals, plants, and chemical substances.

Policy: Arrêté royal du 28 juin 2019 fixant les conditions d’agrément comme entreprise agricole et comme entreprise sociale.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté, constitué par 16 articles divisés par six Chapitres et quatre Annexes, établit qu'un agrément comme entreprise agricole est octroyé par le Ministre de l’Economie à une des sociétés visées à l’article 8:2 du code lorsque les statuts, le fonctionnement et les activités de la société concernée sont conformes aux conditions suivantes : la société a principalement pour objet l’exploitation d’une activité agricole; seules des personnes physiques peuvent être associés; la société est composée d’au moins deux associés, dont au moins un associé est associé gérant; les actions de la société sont nominatives et sont de valeur égale; l’associé gérant consacre au moins la moitié de son temps de travail à l’exploitation de l’activité agricole et tire au moins la moitié de son revenu professionnel de l’exploitation active de l’activité agricole; l’assemblée générale de la société décide, dans le respect des conditions de quorum et de majorité requises pour la modification des statuts, des points suivants : a) la fin du mandat d’associé gérant et le préavis qui en découle; b) la désignation d’un associé gérant et l’octroi des compétences de cet associé gérant; c) la révocation de l’associé gérant pour motifs graves; 7° le consentement de l’assemblée générale de la société est requis lors de la cession d’actions d’un ou de plusieurs associés en cas de décès ou entre vifs; 8° pour toute cession de parts entre vifs, chaque associé gérant a un droit de préemption, etc.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Uasin Gishu County Equitable Development Act, 2019 (No. 2 of 2019).
Policy_Content: This Act is enacted to provide a legal framework that promotes equitable development across all Wards in the County to, ensure equitable sharing of resources within the County, promote the decentralization of functions and provision of services by the County Governments to the extent that it is efficient and practicable and provide a framework for the participation of the residents of each Ward in the identification of priority projects in the County in respect of which funds are allocated for. The Act entrenches the following guiding principles for all persons and entities: persons and entities shall perform their functions while promoting the social and economic development of all persons within the Ward; persons and entities shall recognize the need that persons residing in marginalized areas in the Wards should have access to facilities and services that are available to other residents; and persons and entities shall promote the national values and principles of governance. The Act provides essentially that the County Government shall ensure equitable development, and that this should be manifested in the identification and selection of projects. It provides for certain criteria to guide the selection of projects, the foremost criteria is that projects must be community based. Community projects are eligible for funding.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regional Law No. 94 “On apiculture”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of beekeeping, reproduction and management of bees for obtaining of apiculture products, protection of rights and interests of natural and legal persons performing apiculture. State protection of apiculture shall include the following arrangements: (a) access to information on regional state policy in the field of apiculture; (b) extension services; (c) involvement of apiarians in voluntary labelling of apiculture products with quality certification label “Trans-Ural quality”; and (d) other activities established by regional legislative acts. The development of apiculture shall be ensured by: (a) arrangements for the prevention of bee diseases and cure thereof; (b) access to complete and reliable information released by state bodies related to the state of environment and risks for bees; (c) activity of apiculture associations; (d) compliance with veterinary and sanitary requirements for beekeeping; (e) compliance with requirements for location of beehives and transport of bees for honey harvest; and (f) registration of subsidiary smallholders performing apiculture.

Policy: Decree No. 9.864 regulating Law No. 10.295 establishing the National Policy on Conservation and Rational Use of Energy and creating the Management Committee for Indicators and Levels of Energy Efficiency.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 20 articles, regulates the National Policy on Conservation and Rational Use of Energy and creates the Management Committee for Indicators and Levels of Energy Efficiency. This Decree regulates the maximum levels of energy consumption or minimum levels of energy efficiency of energy consuming machines manufactured or marketed in the Country, through the Management Committee of Indicators and Levels of Energy Efficiency, under the coordination of the Ministry of Mines and Energy. This Management Committee is responsible to perform the following activities: implement the National Policy for the Conservation and Rational Use of Energy, created by Law No. 10.295 of 17 October 2001, in accordance with national energy planning; draw up specific regulations for each type of energy-consuming machine; establish a programme of targets indicating the levels to be achieved for each regulated equipment; establish technical committees to analyze and give advise on specific matters under the Energy Efficiency Indicators and Levels Management Committee; monitor and evaluate the regulatory process; deliberate on the proposals of the Technical Group for Energy Efficiency in Buildings; propose the creation or modification of norms, programmes, projects and actions that contribute to the application of the provisions of Law 10.295, etc. The Management Committee of Indicators will be technically supported by several National Agencies.

Policy: Resolución Nº 468-2019 ─ Aprueba la Propuesta de la Política Nacional de Ordenamiento Territorial de Panamá, el Plan de Implementación y los Instrumentos de Gestión Territorial.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la Propuesta de la Política Nacional de Ordenamiento Territorial de Panamá, el Plan de Implementación y los Instrumentos de Gestión Territorial, y su Anexo. La Política Nacional de Ordenamiento Territorial (PNOT) asume la concepción moderna del ordenamiento territorial, caracterizada por integrar la planificación socioeconómica con la física, y orientada a la transformación óptima del espacio, constituyendo la expresión espacial de las políticas económicas, sociales, culturales y ambientales de toda sociedad. En este sentido, la Política Nacional de Ordenamiento Territorial (PNOT) es a la vez es una disciplina científica, una técnica administrativa y una política articuladora de las demás, concebidas como una actuación interdisciplinaria y global, cuyas directrices tienen como objetivo desarrollo equilibrado de las regiones y de la organización física del espacio.

Policy: Food Security and Nutrition Program in the Kyrgyz Republic for 2019-2023.
Policy_Content: Food security is one of the main directions of ensuring the national security of the country, a factor in preserving its statehood and food independence. Food Security and Nutrition Program in the Kyrgyz Republic for 2019-2023 the main directions for ensuring food security in the Kyrgyz Republic. It is nationwide cross-sectoral policy document. Ensuring food security is a priority issues and the goal of the Program is to ensure food security and high-quality nutrition.  Provisions of the Program shall be integrated into sectoral programs of healthcare, economic and social sectors. Currently, households' average per capita food expenditures are below the established minimum standards. Low purchasing power of the population does not ensure sufficient economic access to quality food for the majority of the population. Insufficient consideration is given to the needs of children, youth and women. Kyrgyz Republic has not achieved food independence in terms of sugar and confectionery products, vegetable oil, fruits and berries, bread and bread products. In general, there is insufficient consumption of meat and meat products, fruits and berries, eggs and sugar in the Kyrgyz Republic. Food security and nutrition in the Kyrgyz Republic shall be ensured by the availability and accessibility of sufficient food, quality and safety foodstuffs, for all groups of the population.

Policy: Décret n° 2019-160 du 26 juin 2019 portant création, attributions, organisation et fonctionnement de la commission nationale de suivi et d’évaluation de la mise en œuvre de l’accord portant création de la zone de libre-échange continentale africaine (ZLECAf).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée la commission nationale de suivi et d’évaluation de la mise en œuvre de l’accord portant création de la zone de libre-échange continentale africaine. La commission nationale de suivi et d’évaluation de la mise en œuvre de l’accord portant création de la zone de libre-échange continentale africaine est chargée, notamment, de : promouvoir l’accord portant création de la zone de libre-échange continentale africaine au niveau national ; assurer la coordination, le suivi et l’évaluation des activités de mise en œuvre de l’accord ; diffuser et vulgariser, au niveau national, les informations et les publications du secrétariat de la zone de libre-échange continentale africaine ; impulser l’élaboration des stratégies nationales des négociations ; traiter de toutes les questions liées aux négociations et à la mise en œuvre de l’accord ; contribuer au renforcement des capacités des acteurs nationaux, notamment les opérateurs économiques, sur l’accord portant création de la zone de libre-échange continentale africaine ; recueillir les propositions des acteurs nationaux en vue d’une meilleure participation à l’accord ; mener, de concert avec les administrations concernées, des réflexions et des études en vue de définir les politiques, les stratégies et les mesures capables d’assurer la promotion et la croissance des exportations vers les autres pays signataires de l’accord ; faire des recommandations au Gouvernement sur toutes les questions relatives à la mise en œuvre de l’accord ; évaluer les progrès dans la mise en œuvre de l’accord ; proposer au Gouvernement les projets de textes législatifs et réglementaires indispensables à la mise en œuvre de l’accord ; mobiliser les ressources nécessaires pour la promotion et la vulgarisation des activités relatives au suivi de la mise en œuvre, au niveau national de l’accord.

Policy: Loi n°2019‐006 du 26 juin 2019 relative à la décentralisation et aux libertés locales
Policy_Content: La présente loi prévoit la décentralisation et aux libertés locales. La loi énonce que, dans le respect de l’unité nationale et de l’intégrité du territoire, l’Etat et les collectivités territoriales concourent à l’administration territoriale de la République togolaise, conformément aux dispositions de la Constitution. Le territoire national est divisé en collectivités territoriales dotées de la personnalité morale et de l’autonomie financière. Ces collectivités territoriales sont : la commune et la région. Les collectivités territoriales sont créées ou supprimées par la loi. La loi fixe la dénomination des collectivités territoriales. Des compétences spécifiques constituant le domaine des affaires d’intérêt local sont reconnues à chaque type de collectivité territoriale. Les besoins et les projets spécifiques des habitants d’une collectivité territoriale liés par un destin commun et une solidarité d’intérêts constituent les affaires d’intérêt local. Les collectivités territoriales ont vocation à exercer les compétences qui peuvent, le mieux, être mises en œuvre à leur échelon. Les collectivités territoriales disposent d’un pouvoir réglementaire pour l’exercice de leurs compétences. Aucune collectivité territoriale ne peut établir ou exercer de tutelle sur une autre collectivité territoriale. En outre, la loi concerne la libre administration des Collectivités territoriales ; la participation des citoyens à la gestion des affaires locales ; dispositif institutionnel de suivi de la décentralisation ; la coopération entre les Collectivités territoriales ; l’organisation générale des Collectivités territoriales ; compétences et des organes de la Commune ; l’exercice du contrôle de légalité ; compétences et des organes de la Région ; l’exercice du contrôle de légalité ; ressources et des dépenses des Collectivités territoriales ; et l’élaboration, de l’exécution et du contrôle du budget des Collectivités territoriales. Entre les compétences de la Commune sont développement local et aménagement du territoire ; urbanisme et habitat ; infrastructures, équipements, transports et voies de communication ; énergie et hydraulique ; assainissement, gestion des ressources naturelles et protection de l’environnement ; commerce et artisanat ; et santé, population, action sociale et protection civile.

Policy: Law No. 10.908 creating the State Policy to Encourage the Cultivation, Extraction, Marketing, Consumption and Transformation of Bocaiuva and other Oleaginous Palms (Pró-Bocaiuva).
Policy_Content: This Law creates the State Policy to Encourage the Cultivation, Extraction, Marketing, Consumption and Transformation of Bocaiuva and other Oleaginous Palms (Pró-Bocaiuva). This Policy aims at promoting the integration of communities that traditionally exploit these palms, by encouraging the use and rational management of these palm species, and transform their activity as an alternative to family farming and agribusiness, complying with the requirements for environmental sustainability. The Policy guidelines are: identify areas where there are communities that traditionally live from bocaiuva and other oleaginous palm plantations; create incentive mechanisms for the preservation of the areas of palm species susceptible to be cutted; create mechanisms so that community cooperatives or other associations, may use legal reserve areas in their properties for collecting bocaiuva fruits and other oleaginous palm trees; develop, research and experiment the production of seedlings, planting, management, harvesting, processing and marketing of fruits of bocaiuva and other oleaginous palm trees, as well as products, by-products and derivatives of these palm trees, improving its quality; disclose the nutritional and medicinal components of bocaiuva and other oil palm; encourage the commercialization and industrialization of these palms, through its processing, by-products and derivatives, aiming at their use for various purposes; create a certification model that identifies the production area and certifies the quality of products, by-products or derivatives of these palms; create mechanisms to promote the commercial planting of these palm trees, through financing with funds from state financial institutions; encourage the creation of integration projects between the producer and the industry.
