Policy: Law of Georgia on Determination of the Designated Purpose of Land and on Sustainable Management of Agricultural Land (No. 4849-IIS of 2019)
Policy_Content: This Law regulates issues related to the designated purpose of land, determines the categories of agricultural land and the procedure for changing such categories, as well as the principles of sustainable management of agricultural land, and the status and the legal grounds for the activities of the Legal Entity under Public Law called the National Agency for Sustainable Land Management and Land Use Monitoring operating under the Ministry of Environment Protection and Agriculture of Georgia. The purpose of this Law is to ensure the rational use and protection of land, to facilitate the development of the land market, and to create legal grounds for drawing up a balance sheet for land and for registration, intended use and state monitoring of agricultural land resources. Among others, the Law defines pasture and hayfield and establishes them as categories of a plot of agricultural land. It also provides that the land fund of Georgia includes the agricultural lands and non-agricultural lands in the territory of Georgia, including lands covered with forests and bodies of water. The functions of the National Agency for Sustainable Land Management and Land Use Monitoring include, among others, to participate in the planning of activities in the fight against desertification and land degradation, and in the restoration of soil fertility; to participate in the planning and carrying out of activities related to the management of windbreak belts (shelter belts); to receive and review applications regarding investment plans related to privately owned plots of agricultural land; and to prepare thematic maps related to land use. The Law also provides that the damage caused by degrading the quality of land as a result of the misuse of agricultural land shall be subject to compensation, which is calculated in accordance with the methodology approved by the Government of Georgia, taking into consideration the amount of compensation determined for the municipalities and territories of special regulation of Georgia. Additionally, it states that if there is a reasoned necessity, based on state policy on the sustainable management of agricultural land and state policy on the protection and rational use of land resources, the State shall have a pre-emptive right to the acquisition of a plot of agricultural land and the buildings and structures firmly attached thereto in the case of the alienation of the plot of land by its owner. The Law also provides for pre-emptive right of a co-owner/lessee to the acquisition of a plot of agricultural land; making decisions based on an investment plan; and failure to fulfil the obligations provided for by an investment plan.

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 280 of 2019 on the Latvian Construction Standard LBN 002-19, Thermotechnics of Building Envelopes
Policy_Content: The Regulation approves the Latvian Construction Standard LBN 002-19, Thermotechnics of Building Envelopes. This Regulation contains legal norms arising from Directive 2010/31/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 19 May 2010 on energy performance of buildings. The Construction Standard prescribes the procedures for the energy efficiency design of the structure elements of external building envelopes and their connections for heated buildings to be newly erected, rebuilt, and renewed, and also for new heated premises to be installed in already built buildings the temperature in which during the heating season is maintained at 8 °C and higher; and the thermotechnical parameters to be used in the calculations during the designing of heating, ventilation, and systems. The purpose of the Construction Standard is to reduce energy consumption in buildings by increasing the efficiency of energy use and to prevent the formation of structural-physical defects in buildings and their structure elements. Energy efficient structure elements limiting carbon dioxide emissions shall be provided for in the construction of buildings.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 202/19 approving the Regulation of the State's Local Administration Law.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree, approves the Regulation of the State's Local Administration Law. This Regulation, consisting of 136 articles divided into nine Chapters and six Annexes, establishes the principles and rules for the organization and functioning of the State's Local Administration Bodies, establishing the respective structures, as well as the implementing mechanisms, applicable to all Local State Administration Bodies at the provincial, municipal levels. In addition, it defines the principles and objectives, regulating the administration of the province, the administrative commission of the municipality, the municipal administration, administration of the commune and the urban district. Local State Administration is exercised by administrative bodies devolved from the Central Administration aiming to ensure, at the respective territorial levels, the fulfillment of the specific duties and interests of the State Administration and citizens, communities and companies, promoting socio-economic development and guaranteeing the provision of public services in the respective administrative district, without prejudice to the autonomy of local authorities.

Policy: Decreto Nº 30 - Reglamenta la Ley Nº 11, que crea el Programa Nacional de Buenas Prácticas y Trazabilidad Agrícola (BPTA).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento de la Ley que crea el Programa Nacional de Buenas Prácticas y Trazabilidad Agrícola (PN-BPTA) de la Dirección Nacional de Sanidad Vegetal del Ministerio de Desarrollo Agropecuario, el cual dispone que todas las personas naturales o jurídicas que se dediquen a la producción de alimentos de origen vegetal para el consumo humano y animal dirigidos al mercado nacional y de exportación, deben adoptar e implementar el Manual de Procedimientos del PN-BPTA, en conjunto con las recomendaciones contenidas en la Guía Técnica General de Buenas Prácticas Agrícolas para la Producción de Alimentos de Origen Vegetal vigente. Asimismo, toda explotación agrícola que se dedique a la producción primaria de alimento de origen vegetal para el consumo humano y animal en el territorio nacional, debe aplicar Las Buenas Prácticas Agrícolas de las fases preparatoria y de producción en campo de manera obligatoria, e implementar un sistema de registro de manera tal que permita registrar el cumplimiento de todas las actividades en la producción primaria, cosecha, empaque en campo sin transformación y transporte interno en finca. La certificación oficial se obtiene por el cumplimiento de las Buenas Prácticas Agrícolas, siendo esta certificación de carácter voluntario.

Policy: Loi n°19-007 portant Cadre Juridique de Partenariat Public-Privé en République Centrafricaine.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet de déterminer les principes fondamentaux relatifs a la conclusion de contrats de partenariat public-privé et de fixer le régime juridique de la conclusion, de l'exécution, des modalités de contrôle et de la fin des contrats de partenariat public-privé en République Centrafricaine.  Au sens de la présente Loi, on entend par Contrat de partenariat Public-Privé par le contrat lequel une personne publique confie a un partenaire privé, personne morale de droit privé, pour une période déterminée, en fonction de la durée d'amortissement des investissements ou des modalités de financement retenues, une mission globale ayant pour objet la construction ou la transformation, l'entretien, la maintenance, l'exploitation ou la gestion d'ouvrages, d'équipements ou de biens immatériels nécessaires au service public dont l'autorité contractante a la charge, ainsi que tout ou partie de leur financement. Le contrat de partenariat public-privé peu également avoir pour objet tout ou partie de la conception de ces ouvrages, équipements ou biens immatériels ainsi que des prestations de service concourant a l'exercice, par l'autorité contractante, de la mission de service public dont elle est chargée.

Policy: Regional Law No. 61 “On state support of gardening and horticulture for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of state support of gardening and horticulture conducted by natural persons for individual personal needs. The main goals of the state support of citizens' horticulture and gardening are: (a) ensuring the realization of the rights of citizens in the field of horticulture and gardening; (b) increasing the efficiency of land use and its protection; (c) providing favorable conditions for the development of horticulture and gardening; and (d) meeting the needs of the regional population in agricultural and fruit and berry products grown on agricultural land allotted for orchards and gardens. The main principles of state support for natural persons conducting horticulture and gardening are: (a) targeting of state support and targeted use of state support funds; (b) equal availability and security of state support measures; and (c) increase of performance (efficiency and cost-effectiveness) of budget funds use.

Policy: Law No. 70 of 2019 relative to ports and navigable waters.
Policy_Content: This Law provides rules relative to proper and environmentally sustainable use of territorial, inner waters and harbours of Norway and safe navigation in those waters with a view in particular to fishery activities and aquaculture. The law applies also to rivers and lakes, as far as they are navigable by vessels from the sea, or as far as the Ministry decides by Regulation. The Law applies to Svalbard and Jan Mayen to the extent the King decides. The King can make exceptions to the law and set such special rules as the local conditions dictate. Municipalities shall be the main authority for purposes of regulating navigation and staying in port of vessels within their area of jurisdiction. The Ministry shall be the competent authority in respect of authorization of aquaculture facilities.

Policy: Budget Implementation Act, 2019, No. 1 (S.C. 2019, c. 29)
Policy_Content: This act has the purpose to implement certain provisions of the budget tabled in Parliament on March 19, 2019 and other measures.  Part 1 implements certain income tax and related measures by, among other things, providing a temporary enhanced first-year capital cost allowance rate of 100% in respect of eligible zero-emission vehicles; eliminating the requirement that sales be to a farming or fishing cooperative corporation in order to be excluded from specified corporate income for the purposes of the small business deduction; extending the mineral exploration tax credit for an additional five years; expanding tax support for electric vehicle charging stations and electrical energy storage equipment. This act also amends several acts, including the the Food and Drugs Act to improve safety and enable innovation by introducing measures to (a) allow the Minister of Health to classify certain products exclusively as foods, drugs, cosmetics or devices;(b) provide oversight over the conduct of clinical trials for drugs, devices and certain foods for special dietary purposes;(c) provide a regulatory framework for advanced therapeutic products; and(d) modernize inspection powers.

Policy: Law No. 1618 “On pastoralism”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates public relations related to the management, use and protection of pastures. Boundaries of pastures between pasture users of settlements and villages of the district (city), cities and districts on the territory of one province, districts (cities) and provinces are established with the consideration of the boundaries of administrative-territorial units, livestock, population and functioning farms in a given administrative-territorial unit. The use of pastures is based on the following principles: (a) ensuring effective and integrated use of pastures; (b) accessibility of pastures for individuals and legal entities; (c) control over the use and protection of pastures and the environment to ensure the interests of the state and society; (d) broad participation of the population and public associations in the implementation of measures to protect pastures; (e) transparency of activities related to the use of pastures; (f) attraction of domestic and foreign investments to increase yields and effective use of pastures; and (g) regulation of pastures grazing international cooperation on effective use and protection of pastures. Pastures allocated as seasonal pastures are managed on their territories by local executive bodies of state power, while an authorized state body in the field of forestry manages the lands of the state forest fund. To ensure the management of pastures, the following activities are carried out: (a) state monitoring of pastures; (b) improvement of pastures; (c) state registration of pastures; and (d) environmental audit of pastures. Depending on the purpose, season of use and location, pastures of the Republic of Tajikistan are classified as follows: (a) pastures for cattle driving, rest and sanitary-epizootic measures; (b) winter pastures; (c) spring-summer pastures; (d) summer pastures; (e) permanent pastures; (f) pastures of foothill zones; (g) pastures of mountain zones; and (h) pastures of high mountain zones. The right to use pastures is exercised by individuals and legal entities in accordance with the procedure established by the legislation of the Republic of Tajikistan, and undergoes state registration. A limited right to use pastures may be established with the consent of the parties. In necessary cases, the limited right to use pastures is established on the basis of the decision of local executive bodies of the state power of cities and districts or by court. Pasturelands for use shall be provided at the expense of the lands of the state reserve, state forest fund, populated areas, as well as lands of agricultural purpose according the procedure established by the Land Code of the Republic of Tajikistan. Pastures shall be provided for temporary and open-ended use. The right to use the pasture is terminated in the following cases: (a) improper use of pastures and negative impact on the potential and productivity of pastures; (b) expiration of the pasture use period; (c) regular failure of the pasture user to comply with the established rules; (d) submission of a statement by the pasture user on the voluntary renunciation of the right to use pastures; (e) seizure of land plot of pastures for the needs of the state and society; (f) liquidation of dekhkan (peasant) farms, other agrarian farms, pasture user societies or termination of the  activities of natural and legal persons; and (g) in other cases envisaged by the national land legislation. This Law consists of V Chapters divided into 32 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards state regulation and protection of pastures. Chapter III regards use and lease of pastures. Chapter IV regards protection and improvement of pastures. Chapter V lays down final provisions.

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2019/1021 of the European Parliament and of the Council on persistent organic pollutants.
Policy_Content: Based upon the precautionary principle, the objective of this Regulation is to protect human health and the environment from persistent organic pollutants by prohibiting, phasing out as soon as possible, or restricting the manufacturing, placing on the market and use of substances subject to the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants, or the Protocol to the 1979 Convention on Long-Range Transboundary Air Pollution on Persistent Organic Pollutants, by minimising releases of such substances, and by establishing provisions regarding waste consisting of, containing or contaminated by any of those substances. Where appropriate, Member States may apply stricter requirements than those laid down in this Regulation.

Policy: Law No. 198-Z “On radiation safety”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal framework for the functioning of the system ensuring radiation safety, handling of sources of ionizing radiation and aims to prevent and minimize harmful effects of ionizing radiation on human health and the environment. Radiation accident shall be intended loss of control of source of ionizing radiation, which resulted in staff exposure above and beyond the established radiation dose limits, public exposure, radioactive contamination of the environment, and requires protective measures. Radiation safety shall be intended condition of safety of population, staff and environment from the harmful effects of ionizing radiation.  Radiation situation shall be intended state of environment characterized by indicators of gamma radiation dose rate, radioactive contamination levels and other indicators derived from radiation monitoring. Objects of relations in the field of ensuring radiation safety are sources of ionizing radiation, radiation objects, surrounding environment, human habitat, human body, products. The main principles of ensuring radiation safety shall be as follows: (a) rate setting principle – non excess of planned radiation exposure (except for medical exposure), maximum permissible radiation dose for staff and irradiation of the population from all sources of ionizing radiation; (b) substantiation principle - prohibition of all handling activities related to sources of ionizing radiation, the benefit  of which does not exceed the risk of possible harm caused by radiation, exceeding natural radiation level; (c) optimization principle - maintaining radiation at an achievable low level. This Law establishes the competence and responsibility of governmental bodies and authorized institutions in the field of ensuring radiation safety. Sources of ionizing radiation shall be subject to mandatory state registration. It also regulates import of sources of ionizing radiation to the Republic of Belarus. Management of radioactive waste includes collection, sorting (separation) by class of radiation hazard, processing, storage or disposal, as well as transportation of radioactive waste. This Law consists of VIII Chapters divided into 53 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards state management in the field of ensuring radiation safety. Chapter III regards rate setting in the field of ensuring radiation safety. Chapter IV regards ensuring radiation safety. Chapter V regards application of radiation safety in the process of radioactive waste management. Chapter VI regards ensuring radiation safety in case of nuclear disaster. Chapter VII regards state supervision in the field of radiation safety. Chapter VIII lays down final provisions.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Presidential Decree No. UP-5742 “On measures for efficient use of land and water resources in agriculture”.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree validates the Concept of efficient use of land and water resources in agriculture in accordance with the Annex 1 and "Road map" for the implementation of the Concept of efficient use of land and water resources in agriculture in accordance with the Annex 2. It estabnlishes that To establish that within the framework of implementation of the Concept, for introduction into use by rehabilitation and reconstruction of irrigation and drainage networks, introduction of water-saving technologies, as well as sowing of drought-resistant crops on the basis of investment agreement or public-private partnership for a period of up to 50 years shall be allocated: (a) irrigated land, as well as rainfed land and forest land previously removed from agricultural production - to citizens of the Republic of Uzbekistan and agricultural enterprises; and (b) pastures, deposits, perennial plantings and other land - to citizens of the Republic of Uzbekistan, agricultural enterprises, as well as investors who are residents of the Republic of Uzbekistan. In the process of introduction of land areas in agricultural production within the framework of the Concept implementation shall be applied the following procedure: (a) land users shall have the right to independently locate agricultural crops, sow crops without tillage and transfer of land to sublease; (b) the aforesaid land areas shall not be not subject to optimization, while expropriation of land plot or part thereof for state and public needs shall be allowed with the consent of the land user after full compensation of the market value of the spent funds and losses caused to owners in connection with such expropriation; (c) placement of infrastructure facilities (field mills, storage facilities, irrigation facilities and others) on these land plots shall be allowed; (d) after the expiration of the preferential period envisaged by legislation with regard to the newly tilled land plot, tax rates established prior to its putting into use shall be applied for 10 years; (e) in cases stipulated by the investment agreement or the agreement on public-private partnership, 50 percent of the costs associated with the introduction into use of each hectare of agricultural land shall be reimbursed at the expense of the State Budget of the Republic of Uzbekistan in the part not exceeding 50 times the size of the basic estimated value; and (f) land areas shall be allocated on the basis of the decision of the state body (official) authorized by the legislation after signing the investment agreement or the agreement on public-private partnership. Irrigated agricultural land shall be put under special protection, it is not allowed to allocate these land for non-agricultural purposes, including the construction of industrial and civil facilities (buildings and structures), except for the land areas allocated by the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan. Compensation payments for irrigated land expropriated for non-agricultural use shall be calculated in the amount of 10 times the amount of funds required for the development of similar new land areas, without the application of coefficients taking into account the location of the expropriated land areas, as well as in the amount of 20 times the costs associated with radical improvement of the condition of rainfed and non-irrigated land under perennial plantings, hayfields and pastures. The Concept envisages creation of a system of preferential terms for producers of agricultural commodities for the introduction of technologies to improve the ameliorative state, fertility and water supply of land previously withdrawn from agricultural production and land re-introduced in agricultural production, as well as land of the forest fund. Provision of state guarantees to business entities that have introduced, repaired or re-created unsuitable water wells, irrigation pumps, irrigation and melioration networks on the basis of an investment agreement or on the basis of public-private partnership in order to put into agricultural production of rainfed, pasture and other agricultural land.

Policy: Loi uniforme n° 2019-004 du 17/06/2019 relative au crédit-bail au Togo.
Policy_Content: La présente loi régit le crédit-bail en République togolaise, notamment les droits, obligations et responsabilités des parties intervenant dans une opération de crédit-bail. Lorsque le contrat de crédit-bail a pour objet un immeuble, le crédit bailleur, procède sous peine d’inopposabilité, à l’inscription du contrat sur le livre foncier du lieu de situation de l’immeuble. Le contrat de crédit-bail est opposable aux tiers à compter de son inscription au RCCM ou au registre foncier. Le crédit-bail immobilier peut porter sur: l’achat et la location d’un immeuble construit; l’achat d’un terrain et le financement des constructions; le financement des constructions à réaliser sur un terrain appartenant au crédit-preneur. L’immeuble, donné en crédit-bail, satisfait aux exigences formulées par les textes législatifs, fiscaux et réglementaires relatifs au régime foncier et domanial.

Policy: Loi n° 2019-005 du 17/06/2019 portant code des investissements en République togolaise.
Policy_Content: La présente loi portant code des investissements a pour objet de promouvoir, faciliter et protéger l’investissement durable et responsable au Togo dans le but de : soutenir la politique de l’emploi et les activités génératrices de revenus aux populations en général et, en particulier, à la jeunesse, aux femmes et aux personnes en situation de handicap ; favoriser la création d’emplois pérennes et qualifiés ; favoriser la création d’activités à forte valeur ajoutée ; encourager l’utilisation et la valorisation des ressources naturelles et des matières premières locales ; encourager le transfert de compétence et l’utilisation de nouvelles technologies ; développer les exportations ; encourager la décentralisation des activités économiques ; promouvoir et conduire certains grands travaux ; stimuler l’innovation technologique.  Le présent code définit les avantages et garanties qui sont accordés au titre des investissements réalisés par les entreprises, ainsi que les obligations correspondantes. A ce titre, ce texte prévoit des garanties des investissements (principes de l’égalité de traitement et de non-discrimination, la garantie de transfert des capitaux et des rémunérations, la liberté de gestion, la protection des investissements par l’Etat); et règlements des différends.

Policy_Content: This Administrative Order aims at accelerating Rural Progress through Robust Development of Special Economic Zones in the Countryside. The Department of Information and Communications Technology, Department of Trade and Industry, Department of Transportation, Department of Public Works and Highways, Technical Education and Skills Development Authority, and PEZA are hereby directed to hasten human capital and infrastructure development, as well as to provide needed interventions to strengthen ecozones in the countryside, and ensure the development of backward and forward linkages of industries in and around such ecozones. Moratorium on the Processing of Applications for Ecozones in Metro Manila. To complement existing strategies and policies on rural development, the PEZA shall no longer accept, process or evaluate applications for the establishment of ecozones in Metro Manila immediately upon the effectivity of this Order and until such moratorium is lifted. The herein moratorium shall not prevent locator companies from commencing their operations on existing ecozones in Metro Manila. Transitory Provision. An application endorsed by PEZA and already submitted to the Office of the President (OP) as of the date of effectivity of this Order shall not be covered by the moratorium under Section 2 in specific instances.

Policy: Infrastructure Act No. 6 of 2019.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down rules for the planning, delivery, and management of certain classes of infrastructure set out in the text; the rights of the infrastructure managers, and owners and occupiers of land, in relation to access to land for the purposes of the construction, installation, and maintenance of infrastructure; and the rights of owners and occupiers of land whose land is affected by the construction, installation, and maintenance of infrastructure. This Act deals with the certain classes of infrastructure, including all physical assets owned by the Crown but managed by an infrastructure manager for the benefit of the public such as wastewater and water networks, inland and coastal flood and erosion protection works, wharves, harbours, solid and hazardous waste facilities, storm water drains and networks, and hydro-electric storage and generation. In case of an emergency, an infrastructure manager has a right of access to any accessway or land, without giving notice to or obtaining consent from any person, if the access is urgently required for protecting any person from injury, protecting property from material damage, protecting public health or safety, protecting and restoring infrastructure, or preventing environmental damage and the loss of resources.

Policy: Ordinance on the Fourth Forest Inventory
Policy_Content: Regulations exist at state (Länder) level regarding the procedure and regularity of forest inventories. At Federal level, an ordinance is issued with every national forest inventory. The most recent ordinance regards the fourth forest inventory, which will be conducted from 1st April 2021 until 31st December 2022 which is regulated by this ordinance. The sampling procedure is carried out with a uniform, systematic measurement of samples over the entire territory of the Federal Republic of Germany, whereby the federal forest inventory is set up by a 4 x 4 km2 system. More specific regulations to be found in the Annex. The basic data measured at the sample points covers: 1. Operating mode, 2. Type of property, 3. Forest structure, 4. Tree types, 5. Age, 6. Tree diameter, 7. Tree height on selected sample trees, 8. Terrain features, 9. special tree features, 10. dead wood, and 11. land use before or after forest.

Policy_Content: This Resolution, consisting of 6 articles, creates the Interministerial Articulation Committee for the Climate Fund. Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes the main tasks of modern agricultural cluster in Bukhara province as follows: (a) introduction of advanced scientific achievements, modern and effective methods of growing raw cotton and other types of crops; (b) introduction of efficient and highly profitable methods of primary processing of raw cotton, as well as technologies of deep processing; (c) production, preparation and trade of cotton seeds and other agricultural crops in accordance with the requirements of state and international standards; (d) introduction of advanced agro-technical and water-saving technologies in the process of production of raw cotton and other agricultural commodities; (e) organization of deep processing of agricultural raw materials and production of competitive, export-oriented commodities by attracting direct investments, including foreign investments, as well as loans from international financial institutions; (f) large-scale introduction of modern information and communication technologies in the processes of accounting and control over the quality and quantity of produced cotton and other agricultural commodities; (g) performance jointly with scientific and educational institutions of research in the field of seed breeding and seed production, creation of new varieties and hybrids of agricultural crops, as well as primary processing technologies for raw cotton.

Policy: Land Registry Law.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the organization, arrangement, keeping and storage of land registers, determines the subject and types of registration and the conduct of land registry procedures. Land registers are based on the data of the cadastral operator or cadastral survey. Land registers shall be kept on the legal status of real estate in the territory of the Republic of Croatia, relevant for legal transactions, unless otherwise specified for certain lands. Real rights on lands shall be entered in the land books, as well as other rights for which this is determined by special laws. When entry in the land register is a presumption of acquisition, change, restriction and termination of land rights, it shall be determined by a special law. The Republic of Croatia shall be objectively liable for damage caused by errors in the keeping of land registers.

Policy: Resolution of the Council of Ministers No. 107/2019 approving the Roadmap for Carbon Neutrality 2050.
Policy_Content: The Paris Agreement reached in 2015 set long-term goals of containing the rise in global average temperature to a maximum of 2° C above pre-industrial levels, with a commitment by the international community to continue increase does not exceed 1.5° C, values ​​that science defines as maximum to ensure the continuation of life on the planet without too heavy changes. It also set goals for increasing adaptability to adverse impacts of climate change and mobilizing financial flows consistent with low emission trajectories and resilient development, emphasizing the need to strengthen international cooperation among states to achieve these goals. Portugal has presented excellent results in terms of climate policy in the last decades, having exceeded the objectives defined in the framework of the Kyoto Protocol and being in line with the targets set for 2020 to reduce GHG emissions, energy efficiency and the promotion of sources of renewable energy. Since 2005, the national economy has tended to dissociate between economic growth and GHG emissions. In 2016, the Government of Portugal took on the commitment to achieve carbon neutrality by 2050, providing a clear picture of the decarbonisation of the national economy and contributing to the more ambitious objectives of the Paris Agreement. The Annex approves the Long Term Strategy for the Carbon Neutrality of the Portuguese Economy in 2050.

This urban development policy is a public policy that is a key instrument for achieving sustainable urban development using an integrated approach. Policy: Zimbabwe National Industrial Development Policy, 2019-2023
Policy_Content: The country's industrial sector is diversified and integrated with the rest of the economy, exhibiting linkages with agriculture, mining, construction and commerce. This Policy is made on the backdrop of the country's economy suffering de-industrialisation as a result of a plethora of challenges which impacted negatively on all productive sectors. The vision of the Policy is to achieve a technologically advanced, competitive and diversified industry by 2030. On the short term, the Policy aims to facilitate and promote the development of sustainable, innovative, inclusive and globally competitive industrial and commercial enterprises for improved consumer welfare and economic growth. The specific policy objectives are to attain: • Manufacturing sector growth rate of at least 2% per annum • Contributing towards attainment of a gross domestic savings rate of at least 30% of GDP;  • Manufacturing Value Added growth of 16% per annum; • Merchandise export growth rate of (10)% per annum to orient the manufacturing sector toward exports  and generate capital for a high savings rate; and • Increasing the manufacturing sector share of employment to 20% in 2023.  The Policy thrust anchors on investment-led and innovation-led industrialization. The guiding principles and core values of the Policy include;• Stable macro-economic environment; • Policy consistency;  • Value addition and beneficiation; • The upgrading and modernization of industrial equipment and machinery; • Prioritization of standards and quality infrastructure; • Promoting sustainable industrial development (green industry); • Rural industrialization in line with the devolution agenda; • Strong research and innovation; • Effective cooperation between private sector and government; • Encourage corporate social responsibility; and • Promoting gender and youth mainstreaming in industrialization programmes. The pillars of the Policy include; • Development and Strengthening of Industrial Value Chains; • Agro-Based Industrialization; • Mineral beneficiation; • Export led industrialization; • Commercializing of intellectual property; • Heritage/Natural Advantage based industrialization; • ICT Led Industrialization; • Emerging Industries and Startups; • Backward linkages with SMEs; • Anchor Industries and Industrial Clusters; and • Industrial Parks and Innovation hubs. For the pillar of agro-based industrialization, the major activities will include; • Coordinating to strengthen linkages between agricultural producers and the agro-processing industry; • Using the Local Content Strategy to increase value addition of agricultural produce; • Promoting the utilization of locally produced inputs such seed, fertilizer and agro-chemicals in agriculture; • Encouraging Research and Development targeted at the Agro-processing industry; and • Adopting and using best agricultural practices. To capture the contribution of micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs), the Policy provides that efforts will be made to ensure that industrialization programmes and projects provide for the effective participation of MSMEs. Focus will be made on addressing industrialization constraints being faced by MSMEs. The government is to promote a decentralization of industrialization; Provincial and District Authorities will be required to come up with local industrialization and incentive frameworks. The government will promote industrialization through provision of incentives and targeted financing, policy support and business development services for the establishment of micro, small, medium and large scale manufacturing industries in rural areas. The Policy is to be implemented by the Ministry of Industry and Commerce through the Industry Trade and Economic Relations Committee (ITERC). The ITERC, an inter- institutional consultative forum, will draw membership from government  economic ministries, parastatals, private sector, academia and civil society.

Policy: Strategy for biodiversity conservation in the Republic of Uzbekistan for the period of 2019-2028.
Policy_Content: Strategy for biodiversity conservation in the Republic of Uzbekistan for the period of 2019-2028 shall be multisectoral, covering the whole national territory. The Strategy, with a view conservation of biodiversity, pursues the following objectives: (a) expansion of protected areas up to 12 percent of the country's territory; (b) afforestation of the dried seabed of the Aral Sea, bringing the area of forests to 1.2 million hectares; (c) breeding of  goitered gazelle (Gazella subgutturosa) in the Bukhara specialized nursery "Dzheyran" (goitered gazelle), increasing their number to 1,000 species; (d) creation of a unified system of monitoring of biodiversity components with the central link - the reference ecosystems of state reserves; (e) creation of a unified information database of state monitoring and state registration of biodiversity on the basis of modern geoinformation technologies (GIS-technologies); (f) carrying out an annual geobotanical survey of the vegetation of natural pastures and hayfields in the amount of 2 million hectares; and (g) integration of biodiversity conservation issues into all sectors of the economy. This Strategy for biodiversity conservation in the Republic of Uzbekistan for the period of 2019-2028 is aimed at identifying priority areas, goals and objectives, planning, ways to achieve them effectively, as well as stages of implementation of the state policy in the field of formation and development of a sustainable system in the field of biodiversity conservation and use for the long term period.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 481 validating regulatory legal acts regulating the activities of Horticulture and Greenhouse Development Agency under the Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree validates the Regulation on the Agency on Horticulture and Greenhouse Economy under the Ministry of Agriculture in accordance with the Annex 1 and the Regulation on Horticulture and Greenhouse Development Fund subordinated to the Agency on Horticulture and Greenhouse Economy in accordance with the Annex 2. Regulation on the Agency on Horticulture and Greenhouse Economy under the Ministry of Agriculture defines the status, main tasks, functions, rights and responsibilities of the Agency, the procedure for organizing and reporting its activities, as well as functional responsibilities of its executives. The Agency is the state body responsible for improving the management system in the field of horticulture and greenhouse management and the introduction of effective public support mechanisms, as well as the production of high quality, competitive and export-oriented products based on modern resource-saving technologies. The Agency is accountable to the Cabinet of Ministers and the Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Uzbekistan for its activities.  The Agency is a legal entity and has an independent balance, personal treasury accounts, bank accounts in the Treasury of the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Uzbekistan, including foreign currency accounts, seals and forms with the image of the State Emblem of the Republic of Uzbekistan and in the state language. In its activities the Agency coordinates and supervises the activities of horticulture and greenhouse units (specialists) and specialists of the Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Karakalpakstan, Agriculture Departments of the regions and Agriculture Departments of the districts (Kuvasai city). The main tasks of the Agency shall be as follows: (a) development and implementation of specific targeted programs aimed at sustainable development of horticulture and greenhouse farms; (b) expansion of intensive horticulture and greenhouse farms using modern resource-saving technologies, including drip and rainfall irrigation systems, as well as measures to increase the range of fruit products, taking into account market situation analysis; (c) large-scale application of scientific achievements, advanced scientific researches and intensive agrotechnology in horticulture and greenhouse economy taking into account soil-climatic conditions of the regions; (d) assistance with Uzstandard in the implementation of international certification standards for horticulture and greenhouse farms; (e) implementation of measures for the development of cluster form and development of cooperative system, including the entire chain of production, preparation, selection, calibration, packaging and trade of fruit products; (f) assistance in attraction of investments, including foreign direct investments, for the purpose of production of competitive agricultural commodities, organization of trade, increase of export potential through deep marketing researches on market situation; (g) development of recommendations for placement and cultivation of fruit varieties that are in demand in foreign markets; (h) cooperation with local and foreign educational institutions, research institutes, specialized foreign organizations and manufacturers on training, advanced training, development and implementation of innovations in the field of horticulture and greenhouses; and (i) keeping an electronic register of parks and greenhouses with the State Committee on Land Resources, Geodesy, Cartography and State Cadastre of the Republic of Uzbekistan. Regulation on Horticulture and Greenhouse Development Fund subordinated to the Agency on Horticulture and Greenhouse Economy determines the procedure for managing the Horticulture and Greenhouse Development Fund, as well as the procedure for its formation and management. The Fund was established by the Agency on Horticulture and Greenhouse Economy under the Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Uzbekistan with a view of not establishing a legal entity for the following purposes: (a) financing of projects for development of horticulture and greenhouse economy, as well as support of their financial activity; (b) maintenance of the central office of the Agency and strengthening of material and technical base of its subordinated organizations, as well as financing of expenses related to the activities of the Agency; and (c) material incentives and social protection of employees of the central office of the Agency. The Fund activities are approved by the Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Uzbekistan and supervised by the Board of Horticulture and Greenhouse Development Fund.

Policy: National Environment and Climate Change Policy.
Policy_Content: This  National Environment and Climate Change Policy is a cross-sectoral policy document. The policy goal is for “Rwanda to have a clean and healthy environment resilient to climate variability and change that supports a high quality of life for its society.”  The seven objectives of the policy are (1) Greening economic transformation (2) Enhancing functional natural ecosystems and managing biosafety, (3) Strengthening meteorological and early warning services (4) Promoting climate change adaptation, mitigation and response (5) Improving environmental well-being for Rwandans (6) Strengthening environment and climate change governance (7) Promoting green foreign and domestic direct investment and other capital inflows. To implement these policies, 22 policy statements and 127 policy actions have been identified.

Policy: Resolución Nº OAL-059-ADM-2019 ─ Adopta e implementa el Plan Nacional de Cambio Climático para el Sector Agropecuario y crea el Comité Interinstitucional de Cambio Climático para el Sector Agropecuario.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución adopta e implementa el Plan Nacional de Cambio Climático para el Sector Agropecuario y crea el Comité Interinstitucional de Cambio Climático para el Sector Agropecuario, con la finalidad de contribuir al cumplimiento de los acuerdos asumidos por el Estado panameño en relación al cambio climático, teniendo en cuenta que las actividades agropecuarias son consideradas como unas de las más vulnerables a los impactos del cambio climático. El objetivo del Plan es contar con un sector agropecuario resiliente, participativo, competitivo, con una economía baja en carbono, mediante la adopción e implementación de acciones que estimulen la producción y consumo responsable, sostenible con competitividad, en un ambiente incluyente y equitativo que contribuya a la Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional. Lograr las metas de desarrollo sostenible supone concretar esfuerzos en materia de seguridad alimentaria, erradicación del hambre, malnutrición, pobreza, acceso a agua limpia para todos, producción y consumo responsable y la acción por el clima, entre otros. Es indiscutible el potencial que tiene la agricultura para abordar simultáneamente la pobreza, el hambre y el cambio climático.

Policy_Content: This Decree provides for the Deliberative Council of the Amazon Protection System. The purpose of Sipam is to integrate, evaluate and disseminate information for the planning and coordination of global government actions with operations in the Amazon region, with a view to enhancing the sustainable development of the region. Policy: Soil Protection Act.
Policy_Content: The Law consists of 26 articles. The Bill regulates issues of prevention and control of pollution, degradation and erosion of soil, its utilization in compliance with technical criteria of sustainable soil exploitation and responsibility for pollution and other soil damages. In particular, the Bill determines that, among other duties, the Ministry of Agriculture is responsible for ensuring the soil protection; establishment of the national soil database and soil mapping; quantitative and qualitative monitoring of soils, with a priority given to the agricultural lands and gardens that require protection of soil fertility and enrichment; supervision of import, production, sale and consumption of fertilizers and pesticide, and soil assessment.  The Ministry in cooperation with the Environmental Protection Organization is obliged to develop a policy on management, protection and sustainable use of soil and submit for approval of the government. Any mining operations must be performed in compliance with the 1998 Mining Law and environmental regulations. The transfer of soil out of the country is prohibited and subject to punishment under the Islamic Penal Code (article 21).

Policy: Act on the coordination of certain environmental-related permit procedures (2019/764).
Policy_Content: This Act introduces coordination mechanisms for the application for and granting of authorizations  relating to the environment. Its aims to speed up the licensing procedure for projects that affect the environment. It applies to the handling of permits pursuant to the Environmental Protection Act (527/2014), the Water Act (587/2011), the Land Act (555/1981), the Mining Act (621/2011), the Nature Conservation Act (1096/1996), Act on land use and building (132/1999) and Act on safety measures when handling hazardous chemicals and explosives (390/2005). If an environmental permit is required for the implementation of a project, according to the Environmental Protection Act, permit under the Water Act or permit for activities in accordance with the Land Act, the processing of the permit application at the applicant's request can be coordinated with applications for the following permits: 1) Exemption law pursuant to sections 31 and 48 and section 49, subsection 3. in the Nature Conservation Act, 2) building permits pursuant to section 125 of the Land Use and Construction Act, as well as a permit for operations in accordance with section 126, demolition permit for buildings according to section 127 and permits for environmental measures pursuant to section 128 of that law; 3) ore mining permit pursuant to section 9 of the Mining Act and mining permit according to section 16 and gold washing permit according to section 22 of that law; 4) permits for extensive industrial handling and storage of a hazardous chemical in accordance with section 23 of the Act on Safety in the Management of Dangerous Chemicals and Explosive Goods and permits for the manufacture and storage of explosive products in accordance with Section 58 of that Act. The regional administration is a coordinating authority, if the coordination applies to the processing of a permit under the Water Act or such permit according to the Environmental Protection Act to be decided by that authority. In other cases, the municipal environmental authority is the coordinating authority. The applicant shall request coordination of the permit procedures before the permit application is announced. The Act sets out the procedures for permit coordination.

El Capítulo IV, Sobre Exenciones y No Sujeciones, dispone que están exentos del pago de Impuesto al Valor Agregado, entre otros, los siguientes supuestos: 1) La compra de bienes y servicios que realicen las asociaciones de desarrollo comunal; 2) Los servicios y los bienes comprados o adquiridos por las Asociaciones administradoras de los sistemas de acueductos y alcantarillados comunales en Costa Rica (Asadas), siempre y cuando sean necesarios para la realización de sus fines y en beneficio de las comunidades o zonas que les corresponda atender; 3) Las comisiones por el servicio de subasta ganadera y agrícola, siempre y cuando la subasta esté autorizada por el ente público competente; 4) El servicio de matanza de animales (semovientes) la misma deberá realizarse en los mataderos autorizados por el Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería (MAG); 5) El autoconsumo de energía eléctrica generada por medio de la utilización de paneles solares, así como otras fuentes renovables, tales como el viento, el sol y la biomasa; esta exención comprende la cogeneración de energía, entendida como el procedimiento mediante el cual se obtiene simultáneamente energía eléctrica y térmica útil, por ejemplo, vapor y agua caliente.

Policy: Regulation on the research and application centre on agriculture and climate change of the Selcuk University.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth provisions on the purpose, scope, management, functions and administration of the center of the Selcuk University. The main functions of the research and application centre on agriculture and climate change of the Selcuk University are (I) to carry out research for the impacts of climate variability on agricultural practices, (II) to offer solutions for problems encountered in practice, and (III) to raise awareness of both producers and scientific councils on climate-smart agriculture through training sessions, seminars, conferences and publications. Furthermore, the centre shall carry out studies on climate change in line with the horticultural crops, plant protection, food engineering, agricultural economy, agricultural engineering, irrigation, soil conservation, plant production and zootechnical disciplines. The centre shall conduct research for the climate-resilient crops and livestock. In order to carry out all these activities, the Centre shall develop the infrastructure of the laboratories and other related structures. Moreover, the Centre shall strengthen the coordination and cooperation with the cross-sectoral actors and national and international professional organizations. The Centre shall offer solutions to mitigate the impacts of climate change on agriculture to the relevant institutions in the policy development process.

Policy: Environmental Protection and Management Act No. 10 of 2019.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down rules for the establishment of an integrated system for the sound and sustainable management of the environment for the benefit of present and future generations; control and mitigation of all forms of environmental degradation or pollution including hazardous substances and wastes for the purposes of protecting human health and maintaining the quality of the environment; the implementation of environmental standards in compliance with various multilateral environmental agreement; sustainable financing for the management of the environment and conservation of natural resources; environmental awareness-raising; and the development of the legal, regulatory and institutional framework for environmental management. Therefore, this Act sets forth provisions on the establishment, administration and functions of the Department of Environment in Part II; powers of inspector and director in Part III; environmental management planning and development of National Environmental Policy Framework in Part IV; procedures for pollution control permits and registration of sources of pollution in Part V; Environmental Impact Assessment processes in Part VI; environmental management and monitoring and related standards, procedures and guidelines in Part VII; natural resources management in the fields of protected area, watershed, and international trade in endangered species of wild fauna and flora in Part VIII; access and benefit sharing of genetic resources in Part IX; registry, database and inventory related to environmental information in Part X; negotiation and accession to multilateral environmental agreements in Part XI; establishment, purpose, functions and duties of the Sustainable Island Resources Framework Fund in Part XII; compliance and enforcement in Part XIII; offences and penalties related to management and protection of water resources, atmosphere and wildlife in Part XIV; environmental information, research, education and training in Part XV; and miscellaneous provisions on Part XVI.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Joint Order No. 29/2019 on the Designing of the Plan for Coastal and Adjacent Sea (POOC_M) Planning in the island of Boa Vista.
Policy_Content: This Joint Order aims at establishing the designing of the Plan for Coastal and Adjacent Sea (POOC_M) Planning in the island of Boa Vista. The development of the POOC_M covers the entire coast of Boa Vista. The area of intervention of the POOC_M comprises the island of Boavista, integrating a terrestrial zone and the adjacent maritime zone. The land area corresponds to a strip of 1,500 metres from the maximum high-water line, measured horizontally to the land side, the adjacent maritime zone corresponds to a band with a width of 3 nautical miles from the topographic zero measured horizontally to the sea side. The terrestrial zone referred to in the previous number may be reduced, by justification presented, and can not be less than 500 meters. The coastal and adjacent sea planning aims to regulate the criteria for the occupation and deployment of infrastructures, the safeguarding and protection of territorial, environmental and patrimonial resources and values, and to guide the use of identified marine resources.

Policy: Resolution of the Council of Ministers No. 130/2019 approving the Action Programme for the Adaptation to Climate Change (P-3AC).
Policy_Content: The Action Programme for the Adaptation to Climate Change (P-3AC) aims to achieve the second objective of ENAAC 2020: to implement adaptation measures; essentially by identifying physical interventions with direct impact on the territory. To this end, it sets out the lines of action and priority adaptation measures, identifying the entities involved, the monitoring indicators and potential sources of funding. The climate change adaptation policy in Portugal is in a state of maturity that allows the identification of priorities regarding key decision support instruments and the implementation of direct intervention actions in the territory and infrastructures. Resources should be made available for these responses to be realized, thus contributing to the implementation of the various adaptation plans and strategies.

Policy: Resolución Nº 193-2019 ─ Aprueba la utilización de un sello de seguridad durante el transporte en contenedores cerrados de madera proveniente de plantaciones comerciales para la exportación a nivel nacional.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la utilización de un sello de seguridad durante el transporte en contenedores cerrados de madera proveniente de plantaciones comerciales para la exportación a nivel nacional y establece el procedimiento especial para su utilización. La Asociación Panameña de Reforestadores y Afines de Panamá (ANARAP), suministrará los sellos de seguridad a sus asociados y no asociados que estén ejecutando aprovechamiento forestal en las áreas plantadas, y reportará semanalmente a las Direcciones Regionales del Ministerio de Ambiente la numeración de los sellos de seguridad entregados y los nombres de las respectivas personas naturales o jurídicas que lo adquieren. Una vez que se adquiera el sello de seguridad, el contenedor cargado se dirigirá a las oficinas o puestos de Ministerio de Ambiente donde se le entregará la guía de transporte terrestre correspondiente y una vez verificada la carga, se procederá a la colocación de éste. En la guía de trasporte terrestre emitida, el personal del Ministerio de Ambiente deberá colocar el número de sello de seguridad, que no se podrá retirar hasta tanto el contenedor llegue al punto de fumigación, y será el funcionario del Ministerio de Ambiente quien lo retirará para que se proceda con la fumigación.

Policy: Directive (EU) 2019/904 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the reduction of the impact of certain plastic products on the environment.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Directive is to prevent and reduce the impact of certain plastic products on the environment, in particular the aquatic environment, and on human health, as well as to promote the transition to a circular economy with innovative and sustainable business models, products and materials. The application scope covers the single-use plastic products listed in the Annex, products made from oxo-degradable plastic and fishing gear containing plastic. Member States shall take the necessary measures to achieve an ambitious and sustained reduction in the consumption of the single-use plastic products listed in Part A of the Annex, in line with the overall objectives of the Union’s waste policy, in particular waste prevention. Those measures shall achieve a measurable quantitative reduction in the consumption of the single-use plastic products listed in Part A of the Annex on the territory of the Member State by 2026 compared to 2022.

ACER shall also contribute to the establishment of high-quality common regulatory and supervisory practices, contributing to the consistent, efficient and effective application of European Union law in order to achieve the Union's climate and energy goals.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Directive (EU) 2019/944 of the European Parliament and of the Council on common rules for the internal market for electricity and amending Directive 2012/27/EU (recast).
Policy_Content: This Directive establishes common rules for the generation, transmission, distribution, energy storage and supply of electricity, together with consumer protection provisions, with a view to creating truly integrated competitive, consumer-centred, flexible, fair and transparent electricity markets in the European Union. It aims to ensure affordable, transparent energy prices and costs for consumers, a high degree of security of supply and a smooth transition towards a sustainable low-carbon energy system. It lays down key rules relating to the organisation and functioning of the Union electricity sector, in particular rules on consumer empowerment and protection, on open access to the integrated market, on third-party access to transmission and distribution infrastructure, unbundling requirements, and rules on the independence of regulatory authorities in the Member States.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Blue Opportunities: The Norwegian Government's updated ocean strategy.
Policy_Content: The present document presents Norway’s ocean strategy, providing both a status report on Norway’s ocean policy and charting a course for future action. Together with the ocean management plans and other policy documents, this updated ocean strat- egy aims at continuing Norway’s clear and integrated strategic focus on ocean issues. The basic principles for the Government’s ocean policy are as follows: i) to strengthen and further develop the Law of the Sea, ii) to promote the conservation and sustainable use of marine ecosystems, iii) to contribute to knowledge-based management, iv) to support the implementation of international instruments, and v) to work towards an integrated approach to ocean management that will facilitate the development of a sustainable ocean economy.

Policy: Décret n° 2019-134 du 31 mai 2019 portant création, attributions et organisation du registre social unique.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée, auprès du ministère en charge des affaires sociales, un registre social unique qui est un système d’information gérant les données et les statistiques des ménages pauvres à l’usage des programmes de protection sociale.  Le registre social unique est une plateforme Web centralisée de données sociales dans laquelle sont regroupées les informations des ménages et des personnes, leurs données personnelles, leurs conditions de revenus ainsi que les prestations qu’ils touchent. A ce titre, il est chargé, notamment, de : enregistrer, centraliser et orienter la demande sociale des ménages et personnes pauvres et vulnérables ; produire pour chaque ménage ou chaque personne enregistré et enquêté un code d’identification unique ou un numéro d’identification sociale à l’usage des programmes de protection sociale ; extraire, à la demande des structures de prise en charge, les listes de bénéficiaires potentiels répondant à un ensemble de critères prédéfinis ; fournir des indicateurs sur l’efficacité des programmes de protection sociale sur la population ciblée.

Policy: Decree No. 12 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on the procedure for work with non-pathogenic genetically modified organisms.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for detoxication of non-pathogenic genetically modified organisms.  Waste generated in the process of genetic engineering shall be subject to detoxication (animal carcasses, dead plants, microorganisms), and remains of genetically-engineering organisms. Genetically modified organisms to be detoxicated shall be destroyed on equipment located in the experimental field and other facilities designed for testing and work with non-pathogenic genetically modified organisms. Detoxication shall take place in the presence of the following representatives: (a) legal entity or individual entrepreneur performing testing of genetically engineered organisms; (b) National Biosafety Coordination Center (with their consent); and (c) owner of the facility. Detoxication of non-pathogenic genetically modified organisms shall be legalized by Detoxication Act in accordance with the model form contained in the Annex 1.

Policy: Decree No. 9.810 creating the National Policy for Regional Development (PNDR).
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of five  divided into  articles, establishes the National Policy for Regional Development (PNDR). The Policy aims to reduce economic and social inequalities, intra and inter-regional, through the creation of development opportunities that result in economic growth, income generation and quality improvement of population. PNDR is based on the planned and coordinated mobilization of federal, state, district and municipal, public and private actions, through which programmes and investments of the Federal Government and entities stimulate and support development processes. PNDR's objectives are: promote the convergence of Brazilian inter- and intra-regional levels of development and quality of life and equity in access to development opportunities in regions with low socio-economic indicators; consolidate a decentralized network in support of the internalization of regional and national development, in order to take into account the peculiarities of each region; stimulate productivity gains and increase regional competitiveness, especially in regions with declining populations and high emigration rates; and foster added value and economic diversification in productive chains that are strategic for regional development, with criteria such as income generation and sustainability, especially in regions with a strong specialization in the production of agricultural or mineral commodities.

Policy: National Reform Programme ESTONIA 2020
Policy_Content: The National Reform Programme ESTONIA 2020 is a national multi-sectoral programme for the period 2011-2020. The two central objectives of the Programme are increasing productivity and employment in Estonia. The main focus in the coming years is on education and employment, with an emphasis on the integration of the young or long-term unemployed people in the labour market and on the development of their skills as well as on measures to promote productivity and improvements to the business environment. Specifically, it provides for implementing long-term structural changes in the energy sector in accordance with Estonia’s energy security and energy efficiency objectives; reducing the general resource and energy intensity of the economy; formulating a policy to facilitate long-term increase in the international competitiveness of companies; creating an appropriate environment to attract more direct foreign investments into sectors with greater export potential and added value; creating preconditions for increasing the volumes of research and development in the private sector and raising the number and quality of innovation outputs; broader use of the potential of creative industries, ICT and other key technologies to increase the added value of other sectors; developing human resources engaged in research and ensuring a future supply of engineers and top-level specialists; bringing transportation, ICT and other public infrastructure, living environment and institutions that support business to an international level.

Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica el Artículo 64 de la Ley de suministro de hidrocarburos, que queda redactado así: "Artículo 64. Contratos de suministro de hidrocarburos de las Generadoras de Energía. A partir de la entrada en vigencia de esta ley, y para garantizar la seguridad en el suministro de hidrocarburos en el país, todos los contratos de suministro de derivados del petróleo que tengan los Generadores de Energía en el país, serán asumidos por proveedores nacionales o internacionales que garanticen el suministro de los mismos en las mismas o mejores condiciones financieras y de calidad que las actualmente vigentes a efectos de proteger la tarifa final de los consumidores. El Instituto Nicaragüense de Energía, deberá aprobar dichos contratos a efectos de su reconocimiento para transferir a tarifas de los clientes finales y considerando los costos internos y externos y los efectos de inflación nacional e internacional que influyan en los mismos. Sin perjuicio de lo anterior, la Empresa Nicaragüense de Petróleo (PETRONIC), deberá realizar las gestiones pertinentes y garantizar reservas suficientes y permanentes de combustibles que permitan el funcionamiento adecuado de los servicios básicos a la población, entre ellos, agua potable, energía eléctrica y transporte. La programación de importaciones será supervisada por el INE en función de asegurar los niveles de inventarios y reservas nacionales que el marco normativo contempla."

(CVM), empresa exclusiva propiedad de la República, para el ejercicio de las actividades requeridas a los fines de llevar a cabo dicha exploración y explotación, con arreglo al principio del desarrollo sostenible, la conservación del ambiente y la ordenación del territorio, en los términos técnicos y económicos más convenientes para su racional explotación. Policy: Kaduna State Forestry Law, 2019- 29th May, 2019
Policy_Content: This Law is divided into 4 parts. The 1st part makes a general introduction of the Law. The 2nd part provides for the Forestry Unit within the state Civil Service. This consists of the Forestry Department, headed by a Director and other Officers to oversee forestry matters in the state. The Director is charged with supervising and regulating the conservation and management of forests, preparing forest inventories and demarcating and maintaining forest reserve boundaries, controlling the cutting, harvesting, milling and sale of timber, among others. The 3rd part provides for forest reserves and lists places in the first schedule of the Law that are designated as forest reserves. The Governor of the state is given the power to declare new places as forest reserves and the procedure for such designation is specified in subsequent provisions. The 2nd schedule of the Law contains a list of trees or plants designated as protected species. The 4th part provides for forestry activities. Certain acts are prohibited in forest reserves including; to take any forest produce; to uproot, burn, de-bark or remove leaves from a tree therein; to reside or erect structures or camps in a reserve; to set fire without due precaution to prevent its spreading; to set fire in any part of a forest reserve, protected forest, conservation area or communal forest; to graze animals or allow animals to trespass forest reserves, among others. The 5th part provides for offences and sanctions for prohibited acts. The final part provides for a wide range of issues related to forestry including issues relating forest fires, bush burning, forest produce, legal proceedings, among others. The Director is charged with setting up a forest fire control unit to carry out acts necessary for the purpose of preventing, controlling and averting forest fires. The Law prescribes punishments for bush burning and setting wild fires in forest reserves and ends with the manner in which forest officers may institute legal proceedings.

Policy: Regional Law No. 475-OZ “On state support of business entities operating in the field of solid domestic waste management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes forms, terms, conditions and the procedure for granting state support to business entities in the field of solid domestic waste management. State support shall be based upon the following principles: (a) social and economic substantiation of decisions on state support; (b) transparency and accessibility of all business entities to state support; (c) equal rights for all business entities applying for state support; and (d) balance of public and private interests in granting state support. The objectives of state support shall be waste prevention, waste reduction and increase of the amount of recycled waste. State support shall be granted in the following forms: (a) subsidies out of the regional budget; (b) preferential taxation terms; and (c) stimulation of investments in the field of solid domestic waste management.

Policy: Decree No. 435 of the Cabinet of Ministers “On introduction of voluntary ecological labelling of produce”.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Cabinet of Ministers introduces voluntary ecological labelling of produce and establishes that: (a) ecolabelling of products shall be performed by ecolabelling authorities accredited in accordance with the established procedure;(b) the object of ecological labelling shall be the produce, use, consumption, transportation, storage and utilization of which has the least harmful impact on the environment, public health and biological resources; (c) manufacturers mark their products with the environmental safety label on a voluntary basis, after receiving a certificate of voluntary environmental labeling of products; (c) it shall be prohibited to use the word "eco" in the name, on the package, in the shipping documentation of products and in its advertising in the absence of a certificate of voluntary ecolabelling of products; (d) voluntary ecolabelling does not apply to medicines, veterinary drugs, medical devices, goods containing substances, drugs and mixtures classified as toxic, mutagenic, carcinogenic and dangerous to the environment. State Committee on Ecology and Environmental Protection shall be appointed authorized state body responsible for voluntary ecological labelling of the produce, expertise and approval of environmental standards with the inclusion of environmental criteria and improvement of ecological labelling system in accordance with the requirements of international standards. The ecological safety mark shall be used for labelling products manufactured in the Republic of Uzbekistan in accordance with the category of ecological safety assigned thereto according to the Annex No. 1. The eco-safety label is placed on the product or on the label (package), in the accompanying documents and when advertising products. Use of the ecosafety mark in the characteristics and names of goods, products, as well as in advertising, indication of any properties, products related to environmental characteristics, as well as the use of such inscriptions as "ecologically clean", "ecologically safe", "ecologically favorable" without passing the procedure of ecolabelling and in the absence of a certificate for marking the products with the ecological safety sign is prohibited.

Policy: Concept of Development of the Forest Sector in the Kyrgyz Republic until 2040.
Policy_Content: Concept of Development of the Forest Sector in the Kyrgyz Republic until 2040 is a nationwide sectoral policy document elaborated for the purpose of ensuring sustainable management of forest ecosystems and rational forest management, including forest conservation and expansion of forest area through improvement of joint forest management system and introduction of digital infrastructure. The goal of the forest sector development until 2040 is sustainable forest management to ensure economic well-being of the people, social welfare, environmental security and a favourable environment for the citizens of Kyrgyz Republic. To achieve the aforesaid goal, priorities have been identified that ensure the sustainable development of forestry in the Republic and reflect all components of sustainability: economy, social relations, environment and institutional frameworks. According to Kyrgyz legislation, all forests and forest funds are under the exclusive ownership of the state and are managed by the state.

The Environmental Regularization Programme (PRA) aims to adjust and promote the regularization of the environmental liabilities of rural properties within the State of Mato Grosso, through actions or initiatives to be developed by owners, as established in Chapter XIII of Federal Law No. 12.651 of 25 May 2012; Chapter III of Federal Decree No. 7.830 of 17 October 2012; and in Chapter II of Federal Decree No. 8.235 of 5 May 2014. Policy: National Agricultural Seeds Council Act, 2019
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the National Agricultural Seeds Council as a legal entity and provides for its composition, board and administration. Essentially, the Council functions to; analyze and formulate programme, policies and actions regarding seed development and the seed industry in general, including research on issues relating to seed testing, registration, release, production, marketing, distribution, certification, quality control, supply and use of seeds in Nigeria, importation and exportation of seeds; design improved management system and procedure relating to the administration of seed activity; implement official quality control and certification of seeds, and facilitate enrolment of any approved private body in seed certification programmes; advice the Federal Government on the organisation, management and financing of seed program; approve seed standards ; advise the national research system on the changing pattern of seed demand and farmers' needs; plan, monitor and evaluate the achievements of the national seed system and recommend improvement thereto; encourage the establishment in Nigeria of seed companies for the purpose of carrying out research, production, processing and marketing of seed; issue licenses and permits under this Act; approve policies and strategies to protect all seed producers, local varieties and to promote quality seed production; regulate the seed industry in Nigeria; represent Nigeria and work closely with the West African Committee on Seeds for the development of the seed sector; and to establish and manage a seed sector support fund; among other things. Th Act provides for the appointment of Seed Inspectors who perform functions like taking samples of seed varieties; entering and searching for seed samples in premises, buildings, warehouses, or the likes; sending the seed samples to seed analysts; undertake all inspection necessary to implement and monitor seed production and certification, among others. The Council is to maintain and regularly publish a National Seed Catalogue with a list of released varieties that are eligible for certification in Nigeria. The Council is to also establish the Seed Registration and Release Subcommittee to advise the Council on the establishment and update of the National Seed Catalogue, for registration of seed varieties, and the evaluation of information from National Performance Trials from the compilations of independently conducted trials. The Council is to also establish an official quality control and certification service to certify that the seeds are of acceptable variety or generic purity, in good physiological and health conditions and meet the seed standards as appropriate. Registrations are also extended to the seed producers. The Act prohibits the importation and exportation of seeds without a written authorization from the Council, with measured exceptions, like seeds coming from ECOWAS member States. Importantly, the Council supports research on plant varieties by approving programmes designed to promote genetic improvement of plant varieties and the protection of breeders' rights, and also by participating in the registration of new crop varieties. Also, Council takes adequate measures to protect breeders' rights.
