Policy: Decreto Nº 34 - Estrategia Nacional de Cambio Climático 2050.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba la Estrategia Nacional de Cambio Climático 2050, la cual deberá contar con un Plan de Acción para su implementación a nivel nacional que incluya los objetivos de las contribuciones nacionalmente determinadas, sus metas estratégicas y líneas de inversión previstas que se ejecutarán fundamentadas en el constante monitoreo y evaluación, para mantener a la vanguardia la dinámica que se debe ejecutar en un momento preciso. Se adopta como visión de la Estrategia Nacional de Cambio Climático 2050 la siguiente: El sector productivo panameño genera empleos verdes, contribuye al bienestar socioecológico y económico, nacional y mundial, mediante la producción de bienes y servicios ecosistémicos, la oferta de bienes y servicios ambientales y la lucha contra el cambio climático. Mediante la la Estrategia Nacional de Cambio Climático 2050 se busca establecer una hoja de ruta que conduzca hacia una economía baja en carbono con acciones de mitigación y adaptación, las cuales a su vez permitirán contribuir al logro de los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible.

Policy: Décret n°2019-246 du 24 mai 2019 portant réorganisation de l'Agence de Promotion des Zones Economiques.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe la réorganisation et fonctionnement de l'Agence de Promotion des Zones Economiques (APZE). L'Agence a pour mission d'assurer la supervision et le développement des zones économiques au Cameroun. Ace titre, elle est notamment chargée de: recevoir et d'instruire les dossiers de demande de création des zones économiques, en liaison avec les administrations et organismes concernés; délivrer les agréments aux entreprises sur la base d'une demande présentée par le promoteur de la zone économique concernée; soumettre au Gouvernement les projets de décret de création des zones économiques; définir les normes de maitrise d'ouvrage des infrastructures dans les zones économiques et d'en assurer le respect; suivre la performance et la croissance des zones économiques; définir les cahiers de charges des promoteurs et des entreprises agréées en liaison avec les administrations et organismes concernes, et de s'assurer de leur respect; connaitre, le cas échéant, des litiges entre les promoteurs, les entreprises, les administrations et les populations riveraines, et de conduire les procédures de règlement amiable; nouer des partenariats avec tout autre organisme public ou privé pouvant concourir à la réalisation de son objet social; participer à la recherche des financements, en vue du développement de ses activités, en liaison avec les administrations et organismes concernés.

Policy: Ministerial Order No. 51/2019 approving the Regulation for Customs Clearance of Goods.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Order approves the Regulation for Customs Clearance of Goods. The Regulation, consisting of 82 articles divided into eleven Chapters and one Glossary, applies to goods, valuables and means of transport subject to customs clearance and to the control of persons in the customs territory. The entry or exit of persons, goods, valuables, and respective means of transport, in or from the customs territory, is subject to Customs control and must be carried out through duly authorized ports, airports and customs offices. Persons entering or leaving customs territory are also subject to customs control. Goods entering, staying in or leaving customs territory are subject to customs control until they are outside the area under the competence of such Customs, including goods that are on board and in travellers' luggage.

Policy: National Environmental Management: Protected Areas Act: Regulations: Management of Addo Elephant National Park Marine Protected Area (No. R. 777 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations of the Minister of Environmental Affairs, made under sections 48A and 86 of the National Environmental Management: Protected Areas Act, 2003, provides rules for the administration, conservation and management of the Addo Elephant National Park Marine Protected Area. The Marine Protected Area consists of offshore or inshore Restricted Zone and Coastal Controlled Zones. The Regulations set out general restrictions within the Marine Protected Area including the use of vessels and prohibits fishing in the Restricted Zone. No person may fish, or attempt to fish, in a Restricted Zone of the Marine Protected Area. Fishing gear on board of vessels entering the zone must be stowed in the prescribed manner. Fishing in a Controlled zone is restricted. The Regulations also provide for dumping at sea and discharge into Marine Protected Area. No person shall in any Controlled Zone, fish or attempt to fish, from a vessel or the shore unless they are in possession of a valid fishing permit, and such fishing is subject to the species, quantity, fish size limits, allowable effort, closed seasons or bag limits authorised by such fishing permit.

Policy: National Environmental Management: Protected Areas Act: Regulations: Management of Uthukela Protected Area (No. R. 790 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations of the Minister of Environmental Affairs, made under sections 48A and 86 of the National Environmental Management: Protected Areas Act, 2003, provide rules for the administration, conservation and management of the uThukela Marine Protected Area. The Marine Protected Area is zoned as in terms of the Act as follows: the inshore area consists of two Inshore Restricted Zones and two Inshore Controlled Zones. The offshore area consists of three Offshore Controlled Zones, one Offshore Controlled-Pelagic Linefish Zone and one Offshore Restricted Zone. Scientific research within the Marine Protected Area requires a permit issued by the Minister. Use of vessels in the zones is restricted. Fishing gear in the Zone must be stowed as prescribed. No person shall fish, or attempt to fish in a Controlled-Pelagic Linefish or Controlled zone, unless they are in possession of a fishing permit. Shark fishing is prohibited except catch and release fishing. No person may collect broodstock in a Controlled or Controlled Pelagic Linefish Zone for undertaking aquaculture, without a permit from the Minister. Commercial fishing in the uThukela Offshore Controlled Commercial Zone is allowed with the right authorization. Any existing authorized discharge of effluent as contemplated in section 69 of the Integrated Coastal Management Act, may continue within the Marine Protected Area but new discharges shall not be authorized.

Policy: Mauritius Research and Innovation Council Act 2019 (No. 5 of 2019).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for the establishment of the Mauritius Research and Innovation Council as a body corporate and defines its objects, functions and powers. The objects of the Council shall include: (a) promote and coordinate applied research, innovation and research and development according to the needs of the country and to improve the quality of life; (b) foster a research, innovation and entrepreneurship culture; (c) encourage the development and application of advanced and innovative technology to meet the needs of industries; (d) enhance private sector participation in research and development and innovation; and (e) promote commercial utilisation of the results of research and development and innovation, in the national interest. The Minister may give such directions of a general nature to the Council, not inconsistent with this Act, as he or she considers necessary in the national interest and the Council shall comply with these directions. The Council shall establish a National Research and Innovation Fund and set up a General Fund.

Il définit aussi le contenu et la durée de validité des études géotechniques mentionnées aux articles L. 112-21, L. 112-22 et L. 112- 23 du code de la construction et de l'habitation. Policy: Ley Núm. 33 del año 2019 - Ley de Mitigación, Adaptación y Resiliencia al Cambio Climático de Puerto Rico.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley busca atender las preocupaciones relacionadas con el cambio climático. En particular, se persiguen los siguientes objetivos: 1) garantizar el derecho a un medio ambiente sano y establecer las facultades para la elaboración y aplicación de políticas públicas para la adaptación al cambio climático y la mitigación de emisiones de gases y compuestos con efecto invernadero; 2) regular las emisiones de gases y compuestos de efecto de invernadero para lograr una reducción de sus concentraciones a un nivel que impida las intervenciones humanas peligrosas en el sistema climático; 3) reducir la vulnerabilidad de la población y los ecosistemas frente a los efectos adversos del cambio climático; 4) promover la transición hacia una economía competitiva, sustentable y de bajas emisiones de carbono, con un sistema energético descentralizado y con energías renovables, encaminadas a disminuir sustancialmente la dependencia de combustibles fósiles en el 2035; 5) adaptar los sectores productivos e incorporar el análisis de la resiliencia al cambio climático en la planificación, las actividades, las infraestructuras y las edificaciones; 6) fomentar la educación, la investigación, el desarrollo y la transferencia de tecnología, y difundir el conocimiento en materia de mitigación, adaptación y resiliencia al cambio climático; 7) establecer mecanismos que provean información objetiva y evaluable sobre todos los aspectos relacionados con el cambio climático, su evolución temporal y sus impactos; 8) promover la participación ciudadana y la de los agentes económicos y sociales en la elaboración y evaluación de las políticas climáticas; 9) fijar los instrumentos de seguimiento de las emisiones de gases de efecto de invernadero para los diversos sectores, productos y servicios.

Policy: Carbon Tax Act, 2019 (No. 15 of 2019).
Policy_Content: This Act, imposes a carbon tax for the benefit of the National Revenue Fund. A carbon tax is a tax on the carbon dioxide (CO2) equivalent of greenhouse gas emissions. A person is— (a) a taxpayer for the purposes of this Act; and (b) liable to pay an amount of carbon tax as calculated in accordance with this Act, if that person conducts an activity in South Africa resulting in greenhouse gas emissions above the threshold set out in Schedule 2. The carbon tax must be levied in respect of the sum of the greenhouse gas emissions of a taxpayer in respect of a tax period expressed as the carbon dioxide equivalent of those greenhouse gas emissions resulting from fuel combustion and industrial processes, and fugitive emissions in accordance with the emissions factors determined in accordance with a reporting methodology approved by the Department of Environmental Affairs. A taxpayer that conducts an activity in respect of fuel combustion emissions that is listed in Schedule 2 must receive an allowance in respect of those emissions. There are various types of allowances. The Commissioner must annually submit to the Minister a report, in the form and manner that the Minister may prescribe, within six months from the date of submission of environmental levy accounts and payments, advising the Minister in respect of that tax period of— (a) the total amount of greenhouse gas emissions reported in respect of which taxpayers are liable for the carbon tax; and (b) the amount of carbon tax collected.

Policy: Law No. ZRU-539 “On use of renewable energy sources”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be regulation of the relations in the field of the use of renewable energy sources. Renewable energy sources shall be intended solar, wind, earth's (geothermal) heat, natural water flow, biomass, which are naturally restored in the environment. Use of renewable energy sources shall be intended activities related to research and development, experimental design, survey, implementation, design, construction, installation and maintenance works, as well as energy generation from renewable energy sources, its transportation, storage, trade and consumption. The main directions of the state policy in the field of renewable energy sources shall be as follows: (a) determination of priority directions and implementation of measures in the field of renewable energy sources use; (b) development and implementation of state and other programs in the field of renewable energy sources; (c) strengthening energy security of the country, diversification of the fuel and energy balance in terms of electricity, heat and biogas production using renewable energy sources; (d) stimulation of introduction of innovative technologies, scientific and technical developments in the field of renewable energy, energy efficiency, expansion and localization of production of renewable energy plants; (e) improvement of organizational and legal mechanisms for the involvement of business entities in the creation of generating capacities on the basis of proven technologies for the use of renewable energy sources; (f) state support and stimulation of energy producers from renewable energy sources, as well as producers of renewable energy installations; and (g) development of international cooperation in the field of renewable energy sources use. This Law contains VII Chapters divided into 28 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards regulation in the field of the use of renewable energy sources. Chapter III regards state support and stimulation in the field of the use of renewable energy sources. Chapter IV defines the particulars of the use of renewable energy sources. Chapter V regards state registration and application of  electricity tariffs in the field of the use of renewable energy sources. Chapter VI regards technical regulation, standardization, conformity assessment and requirements in the field of renewable energy. Chapter VII lays down final provisions.
Subject: Energy

The Department of Agricultural Services carries out activities in the fields of animal and plant health, plant varieties, seed production, vehicles which are listed by the Cabinet of Ministers, public services related to other agricultural machinery, and state control over plant varieties, seed production and agricultural machinery. Policy: Turkana County Water Act, 2019 (No. 3 of 2019).
Policy_Content: This Act is made to provide for a comprehensive legal framework to establish and regulate water supply, sewerage and sanitation and sewerage services in the County. Other purposes include the coordination of the activities of institutional stakeholders in water services provision in the County; the promotion of public participation in the water services regulation in the County; the management of public private partnerships for water services in the County, the coordination of waterworks development, among others. the Act essentially provides that everyone in the County has the right to water and sanitation, the rights to use and benefit from attendant services; this includes the use of water by livestock. The Act further provides that special measures should be made to ensure the provision of water and sanitation services to vulnerable groups. The Act extensively provides for the composition, administration and management of water and sanitation services.

Policy: Law No. 65 “On organic agricultural production.”
Policy_Content: This Law defines the legal framework for the production of organic agricultural commodities, certification thereof, regulates the relations arising between certification bodies, organic agricultural producers, natural persons and legal entities, authorized bodies in the field of production of organic agricultural commodities, and creates conditions for the development of the domestic market of organic agricultural commodities in order to meet the needs of the population and increase export thereof. Organic agricultural products shall be intended agricultural products produced in accordance with requirements of this Law without use of agrochemicals, pesticides, antibiotics, hormonal preparations, genetically modified (genetically engineered, transgenic) organisms, not subjected to ionizing radiation. Organic foodstuffs shall be intended foodstuffs produced in accordance with this Law containing at least 95 percent of organic food ingredients by weight in relation to all ingredients (except for alimentary salt and water). This Law classifies the following types of organic commodities: (a) agricultural commodities of animal and plant origin; (b) products of primary processing of agricultural plants, animal husbandry, aquaculture intended for consumption as food products or feedstuffs; (c) feedstuffs; (d) planting materials and seeds; (d) yeast used as food products or feedstuffs; and (e) aquaculture species. In the process of organic agricultural production, producers must comply with the following conditions: (a) use only healthy animals and plants; (b) production without the use of agrochemicals, pesticides, antibiotics, hormones; (c) exclusion of GMOs and products made from or with GMOs; (d) exclusion of hydroponic production methods; (e) ban on the use of ionizing radiation for the processing of organic food, feedstuffs or raw materials used in organic foodstuffs or feedstuffs; (f) ban on the use of chemical synthesized additives; (g) conservation and maintenance of soil fertility; (h) minimization of use of non-renewable natural resources and means of production; (i) recycling of wastes and by-products of plant and animal origin as a means of production in plant and animal production received under conditions of organic production; (j) preservation of ecological balance in organic agricultural production; (k) plant protection using biotechnologies (using plant varieties resistant to pests and diseases), biological means of control (using plant varieties resistant to pests and diseases), biological means of control (entomophages, biopreparations), as well as properly organized crop rotation; (l) application of mechanical and physical methods of protection of agricultural plants from pests; (m) preservation of animal health by stimulating natural immune protection of their organism, as well as by selecting appropriate breeds and methods of keeping animals; (m) selection of the breed of animals, taking into account their ability and degree of adaptation to local conditions, viability, resistance to diseases; (n) production of organic commodities of animal origin from animals whose keeping conditions meet the requirements of organic production; (o) use in animal breeding of feedstuffs consisting of agricultural ingredients derived from organic agricultural production, as well as from natural substances of non-agricultural origin; (p) preservation of biological diversity of natural water ecological systems, ensuring appropriate condition of surrounding water and terrestrial natural ecological systems in aquaculture production; and (q) creation of a buffer zone to protect against air and water pollution. Labelling of organic agricultural production shall be attested by a label of the established type on which there is a mark "organic production", the address of the manufacturer of organic agricultural commodities, the name of organic product, and also the name of the body which has issued the certificate, or logo thereof.

Policy: Ley Nº 6286 – Ley de defensa, restauración y promoción de la Agricultura Familiar Campesina.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley reconoce a las actividades productivas realizadas por la agricultura familiar campesina a los efectos de lograr la recuperación y consolidación de este sector productivo. Se atribuye al Estado la responsabilidad en tema de reparación, preservación y dinamización de la economía, como así también la protección social y el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida del campesinado y de los pueblos indígenas. La Ley concibe a la agricultura familiar campesina como un actor clave para la preservación de la seguridad y soberanía alimentaria de la población. Los agricultores familiares y los pueblos indígenas podrán registrarse en forma individual, asociativa y familiar en el Registro Nacional de la Agricultura Familiar (RENAF), instrumento técnico y de política pública que identifica y caracteriza a una unidad productiva de la agricultura familiar. Por otro lado, la Ley dispone la creación del Consejo Interinstitucional de la Agricultura Familiar Campesina con la finalidad de representar a las organizaciones campesinas e indígenas, asociaciones y cooperativas de este sector en la toma de decisiones para la definición, implementación y evaluación de las políticas sectoriales en forma centralizada y descentralizada con los gobiernos locales y departamentales. Objetivo último de la Ley es además contribuir a la práctica y promoción de sistemas de vida y producción que preserven la biodiversidad y procesos sostenibles de diversificación de la producción y transformación de los sistemas productivos, de modo a hacerlos sustentables y pertinentes, para la eficaz contribución a la economía nacional, preservando los valores culturales, ecosistémicos e históricos de las comunidades rurales. La Ley promueve el modelo de la economía solidaria, y en particular el intercambio de semillas, bienes y servicios sin intermediación; la comercialización asociativa de la producción y administración autogestionaria a través de organizaciones solidarias que se constituyan en empresas solidarias.

Policy: Regulation on the Agriculture Council.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down rules for the establishment, structure, functioning and duties of the Agricultural Council. The Agricultural Council shall be the leading consulting institution for the development of strategies and studies in the fields of plant production; animal production; development of aquaculture; food production, safety and security; rural development; sustainable use and conservation of soil, water resources and biodiversity; capacity building and organization of farmers; planning of plant and animal production; efficient management of agricultural subsidies; agricultural market regulation; forest management and pastoralism; and the protection of environment. The Agricultural Council shall be comprised of the senior ministry officials, and the members of the universities, civil society organizations, trade association, and the private sector. The decisions taken by the Council shall be delivered to the relevant persons and institutions. The implementation of these decisions shall be monitored by the General Directorate of the Agricultural Council.

Policy: Irrigation Act, 2019 (S.S. 2019, c. I-14.2).
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Act is to promote the development of a profitable and sustainable irrigation sector in Saskatchewan. The text consists of 38 sections divided into 3 Parts. Part 1 contains preliminary matters such as definitions, purposes and Minister's powers; Part 2 regulates Irrigation Districts; and Part 3 defines Irrigations Services regime.  “irrigation district” means an irrigation district established pursuant to section 2‑2 and includes an irrigation district continued pursuant to section 7‑2; while “irrigation services” includes water supply, water disposal and educational services respecting irrigation, but does not include disposal of effluents. Under Part 2 it is defined the functioning on irrigation districts, including composition and members; powers and mandate. The main purposes of the irrigation districts are to: offer irrigation services to its district consumers in the irrigation district; promote irrigation services and the public utilization of irrigation works in the irrigation district; cooperate with other irrigation districts, the minister and ICDC in promoting sustainable irrigation in Saskatchewan;use the facilities, equipment and expertise of the irrigation district to maintain and promote the economic viability of the irrigation district; and to own, construct, acquire, establish, maintain, operate, replace and decommission irrigation works.

Policy: Law No. 11/19 on Public-Private Partnerships.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 24 articles divided into five Chapters, approves the Legal Framework regulating Public-Private Partnerships. It aims at defining the general bases applicable to the privatization, designing, launching, modification, supervision and global monitoring of public-private partnerships and regulates the scope of application, including the setting up of special purpose companies, governance, risk sharing, etc.  This Law applies to the Direct and the Indirect Administration of the State, so that they can be public partners. In addition, it applies to all partnerships in which the non-public partner equivalent is a private company, a cooperative or a private non-profit institution. The essential supporting bodies responsible for the State's decision-making process on Public-Private Partnership contracts concluded under this Law are determined by the Executive Power Holder.

Policy: Decree No. 9.791 approving the National Plan on Tourism 2018-2022.
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the National Plan on Tourism 2018-2022 with the purpose of regulating governmental actions and guiding the State's actions and the use of public resources for the development of national tourism. This Plan will be implemented under the cooperation between the Union, the States, the Federal District and the Municipalities. The Ministry of Tourism will stimulate the elaboration of state, district, regional and municipal tourism development plans, in accordance with this National Tourism Plan, in order to strengthen decentralized management. The global goals of this National Plan aim: to increase the annual number of international visitors to the country; increase the revenue generated by international visitors in the country; increase the number of trips of Brazilian tourists by the country; and increase the number of job vacancies in the tourism sector. The guidelines of the National Plan aim at: strengthening the decentralization of tourism; improving quality and competitiveness in the tourism sector; promoting the innovation and the sustainability.

Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica parcialmente la Ley Orgánica del Ambiente, en aspectos relacionados con el Contenido de la denuncia ambiental (Artículo Nº 107); al Procedimiento del Tribunal (Artículo Nº 108), estableciendo que al recibir la denuncia, el Tribunal Ambiental Administrativo identificará al denunciante y siempre oirá a la persona a quien pueda afectar el resultado de la denuncia, salvo si la gravedad del hecho denunciado amerita tomar medidas inmediatas. También podrá solicitar informes, colaboración y asesoramiento de órganos y dependencias del Ministerio de Ambiente y Energía (MINAE).

Policy: Regulation on the unlicensed electricity generation.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down rules for the electricity generation without the obligation of establishing a company and licensing, in order to promote small-scale producers to ensure supply security, reduce energy losses, and promote the utilization and increase the efficiency of renewable energy resources. This Regulation shall apply to the electricity generation facilities which are owned by real and legal persons and do not have license. Policy: National Strategy for Achieving and Maintaining Over 10% Tree Cover By 2022 (2019-2022).
Policy_Content: The overall goal of the strategy is to accelerate actions towards the achievement of maintaining 10% national tree cover, for environmental integrity and social economic development. Ten strategic objectives are set out, namely : 1) to produce 1.8 billion quality tree seedlings by 2022 needed to increase tree cover to 10%; 2) to implement national policies , legislation and rules that require increased tree planting by 2022; 3) to strengthen institutional capacity of Kenya Forest Service to implement its mandate, including fire management and law enforcement and compliance strengthened; 4) to enhance conservation and protection of natural forests on public, community and private lands and rehabilitation of degraded areas; 5) to strengthen coordination and collaboration in the governance of the forest sector; 6) to establish commercial forest plantation on public, private and community lands to provide adequate and sustainable timber, poles and fuelwood for industrial and domestic consumption; 7) to implement innovative restoration programmes; 8) to enhance national tree planting campaigns through national and county tree planting events, public education and awareness; 9)  to adopt use of alternative energy sources and efficient wood conversion and utilization technologies by institutions, industry and households; 10) to strengthen forest resources assessment, monitoring and reporting capabilities of forest sector institutions.

Policy: Kingdom of Eswatini Strategic Roadmap; 2019 -2022
Policy_Content: This policy targets to solve the economic challenges facing the Kingdom of Eswatini. It identifies the following problems; a widening fiscal deficit, declining economic growth rate and a decline in the ease of doing business index. The policy further identified key areas of improvement that need to be addressed in the course of repositioning the country towards growth to include improving the culture of implementation, human capital and diversity to tackle issues regarding the inclusion of gender, youths, the disabled, etc, improving the state of ICT in the country, etc. While its mission is establish a policy framework that will ensure sustainable economic development, financial stability & growth, improving the quality of life of the citizenry, the vision of the policy is to get the country to attain first world status by 2022. The policy identified certain strategic goals, including; to create an enabling environment in which Emaswati, investors & strategic partners can thrive; to create an adaptable & progressive legislative environment that promotes peace, stability & prosperity, to create the space & regulation required for the Private Sector to thrive, and to be an efficient, dependable & modern Government service provider. Further identified, are five sectors of the economy, regarded as key growth sectors based on their ability to deliver high impact on GDP growth, job creation and revenue mobilization, these sectors include education/ICT, agriculture, manufacturing/agroprocessing, tourism and mining/energy.

Policy: NAEB Strategic Plan 2019-2024
Policy_Content: NAEB is a public commercial institution created in 2011 by merging Rwanda’s coffee, tea, and horticulture development authorities, to combine efforts and resources to increase agricultural exports. The National Agricultural Export Board (NAEB’s) is established as a public commercial institution through Law № 13/2017, under the tutelage of the Ministry of Agriculture and Animal resources with the Board of Directors undertaking strategic oversight and fiduciary responsibility. The NAEB has the mandate to drive the country’s agri-exports revenues growth through supporting the exports sector actors across production, value addition, marketing and policy interventions. It has played a vital role in expanding Rwanda agricultural exports quality and revenue, contributing to Rwanda’s development. The strategic objectives of the Plan include to; support an increase in productivity and quality of prioritized agri-export value chains- this will result in reduced post-harvest losses, continuous supply of Rwanda agri-export to the market and increased demand for our products and hence gain trust from buyers of respective products ; support increased value addition and market penetration of Rwanda agri-exports- this will lead to increased contribution of agri-exports to the country’s balance of payments and good visibility of prioritized Rwanda agri-export brands on international markets; and enhance sector coordination and the enabling environment for sustainable growth of agri-exports- this will lead to effective personnel and institutional coordination mechanisms in production, value addition and marketing services to grow the prioritized agri-exports. The Plan identifies six main programming areas including, productivity and quality management, global operator attraction, business incubation, logistics and infrastructure coordination, market linkage, and branding. The Plan tasks NAEB to use a market-led approach to transform and grow Rwanda’s producers from supply-driven exporters to market-led and knowledge-intensive exporters. This it does through strengthening its marketing capacity, adopting initiatives that will attract both international and domestic investors in agri-export emerging opportunities, increase production, and support agri-export stakeholders to enhance productivity and meet  international markets food safety requirements, conduct business incubation to increase the size of private sector in emerging sectors, etc. A national level coordination by NAEB of technical partners and sector platforms is required for the implementation of the Plan. This involves associating with partners in and outside of government to lead, co-lead or support execution of specific programs. It is projected that the implementation of the Plan over the course of five years will portend far-reaching economic and social impact on Rwanda, including catalyzing private sector investments worth 1 billion USD, creating over 3131, 000 jobs and supporting 525, 000 farmers.

Policy: Law No. ZRU-537 “On public-private partnership”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be to regulate public-private partnership relations. It shall not be applicable to production sharing agreements and to the sphere of public procurement. Public-Private Partnership shall be intended cooperation between a public partner and a private partner, based on the unification of their resources for the implementation of a public-private partnership project, which is legally formalized for a certain period of time. The main principles of public-private partnership shall be as follows: (a) equality before the law of the public partner and private partner; (b) transparency of rules and procedures in the implementation of public-private partnership; (c) competitiveness and objectivity in the selection of a private partner; (d) non-discrimination; and (e) inadmissibility of corruption. The main directions of the state policy in the field of public-private partnership shall be as follows: (a) stimulating economic growth and ensuring sustainable development of the Republic of Uzbekistan; (b) development, approval and implementation of state programs in the field of public-private partnership; (c) assistance in formation, restoration, operation, maintenance of existing public infrastructure; (d) improving the quality of operation and maintenance of public infrastructure; (e) improving the quality of public services and expanding access to them; (f) creation of conditions ensuring attraction of financial resources from the private sector, including foreign investments; and (g) state support for scientific research, introduction of modern methods and technologies to develop and improve the institutional and legal framework of public-private partnership. This Law contains X Chapters divided into 44 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards state regulation in the field of public-private partnership. Chapter III determines parties to public-private partnership and establishes their rights and duties. Chapter IV regards initiation and preparation of a public-private partnership project. Chapter V regards the procedure of selection of private partner. Chapter VI regards public-private agreements. Chapter VII regards protection of the interests of private partner and creditor. Chapter VIII regards monitoring and accountability in the field of implementation of public-private partnership. Chapter IX establishes the mechanisms of financial support of public-private partnership. Chapter X lays down final provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Norm SEMAS No. 6 providing for procedures of environmental licensing aimed at the implementation of rural electricity distribution networks - RDR, with voltages of up to 34.5 kV or exemption.
Policy_Content: This Norm, consisting of four Chapters divided into 16 articles and one Annex, provides for the procedures for environmental licensing aimed at the implementation of rural electricity distribution networks - RDR, with voltages of up to 34.5 kV or exemption, when applicable, within the State of Pará. The entrepreneur in the preparation of the project and/or execution shall adopt the following measures: prioritize route alternatives minimizing interference with the vegetation of the primary Amazon Forest or in stages of medium and advanced succession; evaluate the possibility of adopting measures aiming to reduce the width of the servitude area of the electric network, in order to minimize impacts on vegetation; avoid interferences in the areas of influence of natural caves, according to current legislation. The Norm is divided as follows: Preliminary provisions (Chap. I); Environmental Licensing (Chap. II); Compensatory and Recovery Measures (Chap. III); Final provisions (Chap. IV).

Policy: DA Administrative Order No. 05, Series of 2019 institutionalizing the Participation of Farmer's and Fisherfolk's Organizations or Associations in the Procurement of Goods and Civil Works pertaining to the Needs of the Farmers and Fisherfolks.
Policy_Content: This Administrative Order applies to the Central Office, Bureau, Regional Field Offices, and Attached Agencies under this Department in the procurement of Goods and Civil Works pertaining to the needs of the farmers and fisherfolks. The Department adopts a participatory process of project planning through farmer's and/or fisherfolk's participation with the following procedural requirements: The End-User/Implementing Unit shall identify project proposals in line with the procuring entity's strategic plan, key results areas, and major final outputs that will be procured with the participation of target farmer and/or fisherfolk beneficiary(ies); The End-User/Implementing Unit shall prepare the objectives, requirements, estimated budget, outputs and target farmer and/or fisherfolk beneficiary(ies) of the selected project; The proposed projects that were found to be acceptable by the target farmer and/or fisherfolk beneficiary(ies) shall be included in the end user unit's PPMP and the procuring entity's approved APP. Accordingly, the End-User Implementing Unit concerned shall conduct the said consultation meeting or discussion with the target farmer and/or fisherfolk beneficiary(ies) for purposes of drawing up the farmer's and fisherfolk's needs related to Specifications, Scope of Work, and/or Terms of Reference of the proposed bidding project.

Policy: Regional Law No. 365-OZ “On state support of gardening and horticulture for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of state support of gardening and horticulture conducted by natural persons for individual personal needs. Its delimits powers of the Regional Assembly, Regional Government and authorized regional executive body in the field of state support of gardening and horticulture for individual personal need in the aforesaid field. State support of gardening and horticulture shall be performed in the following forms: (a) adoption of state programs of support of gardening and horticulture, including investment programs; (b) public awareness campaign with a view of popularization of gardening and horticulture; and (c) allocation of subsidies on competitive basis. Policy: Punjab Local Government Act, 2019 (Act XIII of 2019).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 320 sections divided into 31 Chapters (eight Parts) and completed by 16 Schedules, establishes the reconstitution of local governments in the Punjab. It establishes that every local government shall function within the framework of the province and adhere to all applicable federal and provincial laws. No local government shall do anything or act in a manner that impedes or is otherwise prejudicial to the exercise of executive authority of the Government. The Government may direct a local government to take any measure (section 5) and the local government shall comply with them. The Government shall: a) divide all areas comprising the Punjab, except the areas excluded under sub-section (2) of section 1, into urban and rural local areas; b) identify the limits of each local area; c) having regards to the provisions of section 9 of this Act, classify each urban local area; and d) name each local area. All areas comprising a Tehsil, excluding areas notified as cantonments and urban local areas, shall be the local area of that Tehsil. As far as may be, each local area shall be compact, contiguous and constitute a territorial unity. Each local area shall constitute territorial jurisdiction of the respective local government.

Policy: Decree No. 34/2019 approving the Regulation for the Inspection Activity on Mineral and Energy Resources.

The Regulation, consisting of 52 articles divided into six Chapters, a glossary and eight Annexes, establishes specific rules, principles and procedures governing the exercise of the Inspection Activity to be carried out on Mineral and Energy Resources. This Regulation shall apply throughout the national territory where are implemented the following activities: mining, petroleum operations, energy infrastructures, production, reception, storage, handling, distribution, marketing, transportation, export and re-export of petroleum products. Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 302 - Ley del Sistema Integrado de Salud.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley del Sistema Integrado de Salud tiene por objeto establecer los principios y normas generales para la organización y funcionamiento del Sistema Nacional Integrado de Salud, mediante un proceso progresivo hacia el acceso universal a la salud y cobertura universal en forma equitativa, oportuna y de calidad para la población en los diferentes niveles de atención. Se crea el Sistema Nacional Integrado de Salud, que estará constituido por las instituciones públicas y privadas que de manera directa e indirecta se relacionan con la salud, y se lo entenderá como la totalidad de elementos o componentes del sistema público y privado que se relacionan en forma directa o indirecta con la salud, por lo que debe existir una integración clara y progresiva de funciones e instituciones del sistema en lo relativo a rectoría, regulación, atención, gestión, administración, financiamiento y provisión de los servicios. Siendo la salud un Derecho Humano fundamental, la finalidad del Sistema es la persona humana, la satisfacción de sus derechos y la solución de sus necesidades en este ámbito, con el objeto de alcanzar su desarrollo digno e integral. El Sistema fundamentará su actuación en los principios de Universalidad, Integralidad, Accesibilidad, Solidaridad, Subsidiaridad, Equidad, Intersectorialidad, Participación Social y Calidad.

Policy: Decision on the adoption of the Guarantee Programme "PLUS".
Policy_Content: This Decision, based on the provisions of the Croatian Law on small business encouragement, adopts the "PLUS" Guarantee Programme. The Croatian Agency for Small Business, Innovation and Investment within this Guarantee Programme "PLUS" issues guarantees to cover part of the principal of loans or leasing to small businesses that operate successfully. Policy: Green State Development Strategy: Vision 2040.
Policy_Content: The Green State Development Strategy: Vision 2040 is Guyana’s twenty-year, national development policy that reflects the guiding vision and principles of the ‘green agenda. The central objective is development that provides a better quality of life for all Guyanese derived from the country’s natural wealth – its diversity of people and abundant natural resources (land, water, forests, mineral and aggregates, biodiversity). The vision of the ‘green agenda’ is centred on principles of a green economy defined by sustainable, low-carbon and resilient development that uses its resources efficiently, and sustained over generations. The development philosophy emphasises the importance of a more cohesive society based on principles of equity and tolerance between ethnic groups – recognising that diversity of culture and heritage is the underlying strength of the country’s human capital. Development objectives therefore seek to improve the health, education and overall well-being of Guyanese citizens, to lift people out of poverty through an economy that generates decent jobs and that provides opportunities for sustaining livelihoods over the long term.

Policy: Protected Areas Law No.130 of 2019.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 23 articles aims at providing for the natural areas in Lebanon, through their prevention and protection, considered an essential pillar of rural development policy and ecotourism. The Law establishes the following objectives (i) protection of the components of biological diversity, especially those that are threatened, poor, rare, inclined or unique; (ii) reconstruction of the natural biodiversity landscape; (iii) ecosystems preservation; (iv) protection of birds, as well as both sedentary and migratory species; (v) preservation of landscapes and distinctive natural features. Protected areas are divided into four main categories (1) nature reserve; (2) natural park; (3) natural landmark sites; and (4) Hima (sites including a natural ecosystem and may incorporate another sustainable modified part, i.e., through the sustainable use of natural resources). The Law also distinguishes between (i) Nature reserves located on public property, established by a law defining the geographical scope of the reserve and the surrounding belt zone, in addition to the special rules for protection and (ii) Natural reserves located on private property, established after the written consent of all owners to the project, according to a contract between the Lebanese state represented by the person of the Minister of Environment and the owners, for a period of no less than twenty years renewable, in which is defined the geographical scope of the reserve and the surrounding belt zone and their management. A volunteer committee is established for each natural reserve, supervising the good management of the natural reserve and setting and implementing its annual financial budget. Each committee, in coordination with the working group, proposes a protected management plan for a period determined according to its characteristics. The plan is issued according to a decision issued by the Minister of Environment. Exceptionally, and without prejudice to the objectives of environmental protection, some activities in the natural reserve that are implemented within the framework of the concept of sustainable use can be permitted by a decision of the Minister of Environment based on the proposal of the reserve committee and in line with the management plan, based on an Environmental Impact Assessment or Initial Environmental Examination, wherever the Ministry of the Environment deems it necessary. The Ministry of Environment allocates a budget dedicated to the nature reserves. The various persons of public and private law, as well as local, regional and international associations, bodies and institutions, can contribute to financing natural reserves through donations, after the approval of the Council of Ministers.

Policy: Law No.131 of 2019 regarding the protection of the Beirut Forest.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 6 articles aims at establishing a legal protection for part of the real estate of the farm area known as “Harj Beirut” which guarantees the preservation of this forest and the protection of the environmental heritage within the capital, especially the pine forests and the green plains that surround them. The objective is to reduce pollution and create a healthy and clean environment as well as contribute to the economic level, especially in terms of tourism promotion. Art. 1 defines the area delimited by the provisions of the Law. Art. 2 prohibits construction in the area including buildings of various types, regardless of the building material, and whatever its location. Art. 3 declares the buildings in the area temporary construction in violation of the Law and require removal. Art. 4 fosters the organization of environmental, educational, orientation, and other activities to encourage eco-tourism and artisan-friendly production that serves the environment and its sustainability. Art. 5 states that the municipality of Beirut shall undertake the necessary development, rehabilitation, maintenance, afforestation and planting activities.

Policy: Public Enterprises Governance Act, 2019 (No. 1 of 2019).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for the declaration, governance and control of public enterprises in Namibia and related matters. The Minister responsible for public enterprises may, in consultation with Cabinet, declare - any board, corporation, council, fund, trust or other body established as a body corporate by or under an Act of Parliament for performing functions prescribed by that Act or any other law; any unincorporated business in which the State owns half or more of the interest; and any state-owned company, to be a public enterprise. A public enterprise may be non-commercial. The Minister may declare that the provisions of this Act apply to any board, committee, fund, trust or any other institution that has received public money. The Minister shall, among other things, establish generally accepted common principles of corporate governance and good practice governing public enterprises. The relevant Minister must enter into a written governance agreement with the board of a public enterprise. public enterprise must develop an integrated strategic business plan for a period of five years and submit it to the relevant Minister. The Minister may direct that a special investigation be conducted in relation to any matter concerning the business, trade, dealings, affairs, assets or liabilities of a public enterprise. The Act also concerns restructuring of public enterprises.

Para su ingreso a la RMG, todas las embarcaciones deberán realizar una inspección de verificación de cumplimiento de estándares ambientales.

Policy: Emission Allowances Ordinance 2021-2030
Policy_Content: The Emission Allowances Ordinance 2013-2020 transposes Directive (EU) 2018/410 of the European Parliament and Council of 14 March 2018 amending Directive 2003/87/ EC to support cost-efficient emission reductions, promote low-carbon investments and to implement EU Decision 2015/1814 (OJ L 76, 19.3.2018, p. 3). This ordinance is within the scope of the Greenhouse Gas Emissions Trading Act (Treibhausgas-Emissionshandelsgesetzes). It serves to substantiate the requirements of §§ 5, 6, 8, 9, 21, 22 and 24 of the Greenhouse Gas Emissions Trading Act and the implementation of a System for privileging small emitters for the Trading period 2021 to 2030 (Umsetzung eines Systems zur Privilegierung von Kleinemittenten für die Handelsperiode 2021 bis 2030). The ordinance is divided into 10 chapters: General provisions, reporting on emissions, monitoring, auctioning of emittance, allocation of emittance, certification of inspection bodies, fees and expenses for official acts of the admissions Board, procedures for identification of uniform facilities, small emitters, and final provisions. The ordinance entered into force on 30th April 2019.

Policy: Resolution No. 6 of the State Committee on Forestry validating the Regulation on genetic (variety) and seed control, laboratory testing and expertise of forest seeds.
Policy_Content: This Regulation shall be applicable to forest seeds. It establishes seed control procedure, involving the following processes: (a) collecting or importing seeds for planting; (b) performance of laboratory analysis; (c) storage before sowing; (d) planting; and (e) maintenance of forestry crops during the growing season.  Variety of seeds of forestry plants shall be verified by means of testing and laboratory tests. Control of the process of seed collection shall be performed by general agrotechnical methods, without mixture of varieties. Control of seed purity shall be performed through qualitative organization of technological processes. The technical equipment must have operating instructions.  Storage, packaging and labelling of seeds shall be performed under control. Packaging  shall be performed so as to prevent damage to seeds. The following information shall be indicated on labels: (a) the name of seed-producing entity for carrying out the variety tests in the laboratory; (b) type; (c) form; (d) grade; (e) reproduction; (f) degree of purity; (g) planting procedure; (h) harvest year; (i) batch number; (j) purity of the variety; and (k) reference data of the document, time of issue. Expertise and seed control shall be performed in the authorized laboratories, which must be selected and accredited in accordance with acting legislation. The quality of forest seeds shall be assessed through analysis of compliance with technical regulations.

Policy: Marine Spatial Planning Act, 2018 (No. 16 of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for marine spatial planning in South African waters (defined by this Act to include the internal waters, territorial sea, EEZ and the Continental Shelf). The Act sets out the principles and criteria for marine spatial planning and describes the marine spatial planning system. It requires the National Working Group, established by this Act, to develop marine spatial planning framework and the marine area or sector plans in accordance with this Act (involving stakeholders). The Act also establishes a Directors-General Committee on Marine Spatial Planning and a Ministerial Committee on Marine Spatial Planning. The Ministerial Committee comprises the Ministers responsible for defence, energy, environmental affairs, fisheries, mineral resources, planning monitoring and evaluation, public enterprises, science and technology, telecommunications, tourism, transport, rural development and land affairs.

Policy: Conservation and Management Measure on Fishing Gear and Marine Plastic Pollution in the SPRFMO Convention Area (CMM 17-2019).
Policy_Content: This Measure of the Commission of the South Pacific Regional Fisheries Management Organisation (SPRFMO), in particular to protect the marine ecosystem, particularly ecosystems with long recovery times following disturbance, from significant adverse impact of unregulated and unmanaged fishing practices, introduces obligations for Member and CNCPs to ensure that its fishing vessels shall make all reasonable efforts to combat, minimise and eliminate abandoned, lost or otherwise discarded fishing gear (ALDFG). The vessels shall, where possible have on board to equipment for the retrieving of ALDFG. The CMM introduces various notification duties in relation with lost or abandoned gear. Members states and CNCPs shall prohibit their vessels to dump plastics into marine waters. Members and CNCPs are also encouraged to, among other things, ensure that fishing vessels flying their flag and operating within the SPRFMO Convention Area inform their flag State of ports in countries that are Party to the annexes of MARPOL which do not have adequate port reception facilities for MARPOL wastes.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea
Keyword: Marine pollution,Marine fisheries,Fishing gear/fishing method,Equipment,Fishing vessel,International relations/cooperation,Fishery management and conservation,Waste disposal,Ecosystem preservation

Policy: Decree No. 31/2019 creating the General Inspection of Mineral Resources and Energy (IGREME).
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 23 articles divided into four Chapters, creates the General Inspection of Mineral Resources and Energy (IGREME). IGREME carries out its activities throughout the national territory and has its headquarters in the City of Maputo. IGREME can create delegations at the provincial and district level, with the authorization of the Minister of ​​mineral resources and energy. The following are attributions of the General Inspection of Mineral Resources and Energy: a) Inspection and inspection of compliance with the Laws, Regulations and other guidelines approved by the Government in the scope of rational and sustainable exploitation of mineral, petroleum and energy resources; b) Conduct of inspections, investigations, inquiries and administrative audits to the organic units, subordinate and supervised institutions of the Ministry of Mineral Resources and Energy; c) Inspection and inspection of compliance with technical safety, hygiene and health and environmental protection standards as established by law, international conventions and good practices concerning the mineral resources and energy sector; d) Inspection of facilities for the production, transportation, storage, handling, distribution and commercialization of mineral resources, electric energy, hydrocarbons and fuel; e) Coordination with other institutions to protect, combat smuggling, illegal marketing, falsification, adulteration of mineral, oil and energy resources and vandalism of the respective infrastructures; (f) monitoring compliance with the standards for oil and gas spills in coordination with other institutions; g) Survey of news reports for contravention of mining, oil and energy legislation; etc.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Decree No. 357 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on the procedure for determining fertility and gross harvest of grain crops grown by agricultural enterprises.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Cabinet of Ministers establishes the procedure for determining fertility and gross harvest of grain crops grown by agricultural enterprises and destined for public procurement. Public contractor for the purchase of crops and cereals from agricultural enterprises shall be "Uzdonmahsulot" joint-stock company, which shall regulate the aforesaid transactions on contractual basis. Productivity and yield assessment shall be calculated per one hectare of cultivated area. Annex 1 contains scheme of determination of productivity and gross yield. Annex 3 contains harvesting schedule. Annex 4 establishes the procedure for calculating gross harvest

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 307/2019 - Regula la concesión directa de diversas subvenciones en materia agroalimentaria y pesquera.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto regular la concesión de subvenciones directas de carácter singular a favor, entre otras, de las siguientes entidades destinatarias: 1) Comisión Gestora de la extinta Confederación Nacional de Cámaras Agrarias, para realizar la liquidación de los derechos y obligaciones patrimoniales; 2) Asociación de Sociedades Organizadoras de Carreras de Caballos, para subvencionar carreras nacionales de caballos españoles premios y otras actividades relacionadas con las carreras; 3) Federación Española de Asociaciones de Ganado Selecto (FEAGAS), para el funcionamiento de esta entidad, y actividades de promoción, conservación y mejora de las razas puras, y para las actividades de gestión de los programas de cría de las razas puras de carácter nacional; 4) Federación Española de Razas Autóctonas en peligro de extinción (FEDERAPES), para el funcionamiento de esa entidad, y actividades de promoción, conservación y mejora de las razas puras; 5) Fundación Dieta Mediterránea, para promocionar las características de la «dieta mediterránea» y los productos que la componen; 6) Centro Nacional de Tecnología y Seguridad Alimentaria, para la captación de conocimiento y transferencia de tecnología a través de proyectos de I+D+i, servicios tecnológicos y formación; 7) Federación Española de Industrias de la Alimentación y Bebidas (FIAB), para la ejecución de actuaciones de fomento, innovación y fortalecimiento del sector industrial agroalimentario; 8) Federación Nacional de Comunidad de Regantes de España (FENACORE), para gastos de formación, asesoramiento y apoyo a las Comunidades de Regantes de España; 9) Red Estatal de Desarrollo Rural, para acciones de promoción del desarrollo rural integral y sostenible; 10) Red Española de Desarrollo Rural, para acciones de promoción del desarrollo rural integral y sostenible; 11) Fundación Biodiversidad, para el mantenimiento de las actividades del Observatorio Español de Acuicultura (OESA); 12) Fundación AZTI para el desarrollo de actividades de investigación en áreas relacionadas con la alimentación, la pesca y la oceanografía; 13) Centro de Estudios e Investigación para la Gestión de Riesgos Agrarios y Medioambientales (CEIGRAM) de la Universidad Politécnica de Madrid, para atender gastos que aseguren y den continuidad a su funcionamiento con el objetivo de desarrollar su actividad investigadora, de formación y divulgación en materia de riesgos agrarios y medioambientales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Fisheries

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 316/2019 - Real Decreto Nº 616/2017, que regula la concesión directa de subvenciones a proyectos singulares de entidades locales que favorezcan el paso a una economía baja en carbono en el marco del Programa operativo FEDER de crecimiento sostenible 2014-2020.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto, dada la buena acogida del programa por parte de las entidades locales y su adecuada contribución al cumplimiento de los objetivos programados, dada también la dotación presupuestaria que el Programa Operativo FEDER Plurirregional de España 2014-2020 (POPE) destina a entidades locales y que aún no ha sido objeto de convocatoria, se considera muy adecuada la nueva modificación del Real Decreto que tiene por objeto la regulación del procedimiento para la concesión directa de subvenciones a proyectos singulares que faciliten el paso a una economía baja en carbono en el ámbito de las Entidades locales españolas, ampliando el presupuesto, dando cabida a municipios de ámbito mayor al de 20.000 habitantes y adecuando los límites económicos de inversión para las actuaciones subvencionables a la capacidad financiera de las entidades locales de ámbito mayor.

Policy: Décision n°209/D/MINFOF/CAB du 26 avril 2019 portant classification des produits Forestiers Spéciaux et des Produits Forestiers Non Ligneux
Policy_Content: La présente décision classe les produits forestiers spéciaux et les produits forestiers non ligneux, et fixe la liste de ceux présentant un intérêt particulier sur l’étendue du territoire national. Les produits forestiers spéciaux et les produits forestiers non ligneux visés sont ceux d’origine végétale. Les produits spéciaux sont les produits forestiers ligneux et non ligneux présentant un intérêt particulier. Les produits forestiers non ligneux sont les produits forestiers d’origine végétale autre que le bois. La classification des produits forestiers spéciaux et des produits forestiers non ligneux se fait, sur la base de leur valeur économique, de leur importance socioculturelle et de leur durabilité écologique.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic

Policy: Ley Nº 3.651 - Protección de los recursos naturales de Santa Cruz.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley reconoce a los recursos naturales provinciales como patrimonio inalienable e imprescriptible del territorio santacruceño, en cuanto corresponde a las provincias el dominio originario de los recursos naturales existentes en su territorio, en el marco del artículo 124 de la Constitución nacional. Por este motivo, queda establecido que los recursos naturales del territorio de la provincia de Santa Cruz como son los yacimientos hidrocarburíferos, líquidos y gaseosos, fósiles y minerales como el carbón u otros, incluyendo los turísticos e hídricos, más los correspondientes por plataforma marítima continental, no pueden ser considerados como toma de garantías de bienes de cambio en las operaciones financieras que lleve adelante el Gobierno Nacional con organismos y entidades, en las formas de toma de empréstitos, deuda, emisión de bonos del tesoro nacional u otros afines de intereses foráneos y extranjeros.

Policy: Décret n°2019/208 du 25 avril 2019 portant transformation, en société à capital public, de la Mission d'Aménagement et d'Equipement des Terrains Urbains et Ruraux (MATEUR).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret transforme, en société à capital public, la Mission d'Aménagement et d'Equipement des Terrains Urbains et Ruraux. La MAETUR a pour objet de réaliser ou de faire réaliser sous sa responsabilité, des opérations d'aménagement et d'équipement de terrains, de restructuration et de rénovation des quartiers, en vue de la promotion immobilière et de l'habitat, de promouvoir à la demande et pour le compte de l'Etat, des Collectivités Territoriales Décentralisées, des organismes publics, privés et des particuliers, ainsi que pour son propre compte, les études et la réalisation des opérations d'aménagement ou d'équipements des terrains. A ce titre, elle est notamment chargée de: réaliser les études d'urbanisme et techniques des infrastructures d'assainissement, de drainage, des voiries et réseaux divers, ainsi que des équipements collectifs des terrains à aménager ou à équiper; réaliser des expertises et évaluations foncières et immobilières; conduire la réalisation ou le contrôle de la réalisation des lotissements, des opérations d'aménagement de terrains, de restructuration et de rénovation des quartiers existants et de tous les projets rattachés; assurer, en liaison avec les administrations concernées, le contrôle de la conformité des projets selon les dispositifs d'aménagement prévus dans chaque zone aménagée; réaliser l'entretien de certains équipements et infrastructures; acquérir les terrains à aménager pour son propre compte; procéder au suivi des formalités d'acquisition et de sécurisation des terrains; commercialiser les terrains aménagés et les prestations de services réalisées; constituer une base de données des terrains aménagés ou commercialisés; développer des partenariats avec tout organisme concourant à la réalisation de son objet social; et assurer toutes autres missions a elle confiées par l'Etat.
Subject: Land & soil, Water

Policy: Regional Law No. 1606/409-VI-OZ “On regulation of some issues related to subsidiary gardening and horticulture by natural persons”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of state support of gardening and horticulture conducted by natural persons for individual personal needs. Regional state bodies, with a view of granting state support to subsidiary gardening and horticulture by natural persons. Shall have the following powers: (a) to create units within its structure to ensure implementation of the regional policy to support horticulture and gardening; (b) to implement state programs to support horticulture and gardening, including investment programs; (c) to conduct public awareness campaign with a view of  promoting  horticulture and gardening; (d) to organize within the area of horticulture and gardening supply of thermal and electrical energy, water, gas, sewage, fuel supply within the limits of authority as defined by the legislation of the  Russian Federation; (d) to finance the implementation of complex cadastre works in relation to the cadastral quarters within the boundaries of horticulture and gardening areas; (e) at the request of the horticulture and gardening  associations or holders of shares in common ownership located within the boundaries of horticulture and gardening areas, to  purchase without compensation for the regional property (ownership) common property (highways, power grid facilities, water supply, communications and other facilities) in the event that such property in accordance with federal legislation may be in state ownership.

Policy: Orden TEC/544/2019 - Constituye y regula el registro unificado sobre certificados y centros de formación de gases fluorados.
Policy_Content: La presente Orden tiene por objeto la constitución y regulación del Registro unificado sobre certificados y centros de formación de gases fluorados, en cumplimiento de lo dispuesto en el Real Decreto Nº 115/2017, así como la certificación de los profesionales que los utilizan y por el que se establecen los requisitos técnicos para las instalaciones que desarrollen actividades que emitan gases fluorados. El Registro unificado sobre certificados y centros de formación de gases fluorados es un registro oficial de carácter administrativo, declarativo, informativo y público; que quedará adscrito a la Oficina Española de Cambio Climático del Ministerio para la Transición Ecológica, a la que se encomienda su gestión, conservación y mantenimiento. Dentro de la sección de certificados expedidos, se recoge una subsección destinada a las empresas certificadas para la manipulación de gases fluorados de efecto invernadero, con la información que, voluntariamente, faciliten las comunidades autónomas.

Policy: Ley Nº 1171 – Ley de uso y manejo racional de quemas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene como objeto: a) definir los lineamientos de la política de manejo integral del fuego en el territorio nacional; b) establecer el régimen de sanciones administrativas por quemas sin autorización; c) establecer con carácter excepcional un período de regularización en el pago de deudas y multas por quemas sin autorización. La Ley designa al Ministerio de Medio Ambiente y Agua como responsable del sector, está a cargo de la elaboración de la política de manejo integral del fuego, debiendo tomar en cuenta las siguientes líneas de acción: promover el buen uso y manejo integral de fuego a través de la quema planificada y controlada; rehabilitación de ecosistemas afectados por incendios forestales; prevención y atención de incendios forestales; sustitución gradual del uso del fuego; monitoreo y seguimiento; promover la participación, el control social y la corresponsabilidad de los actores individuales y colectivos en la regulación del fuego.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil

Policy: Décret n°2019/205 du 24 avril 2019 portant transformation, en société à capital public, de la Mission d'Aménagement et de Gestion des Zones industrielles.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret transforme la Mission d'Aménagement et de Gestion des Zones industrielles (MAGZI) en une Société à Capital Public ayant l'Etat comme unique actionnaire. La MAGZI a pour objet l’aménagement et la gestion des zones industrielles sur toute l'étendue du territoire national, en liaison avec les autres administrations et structures concernées. Ace titre, elle est notamment chargée de: l’acquisition des terrains a vocation industrielle; l'aménagement, l'équipement et la gestion des lots pour les promoteurs des projets dans les zones dédiées aux activités industrielles, notamment dans les secteurs des industries manufacturières, des services et des petits métiers; la construction des bâtiments à usage industriel, destinés à la location et éventuellement à la vente de ceux-ci; la location aux promoteurs industriels des terrains qui lui sont concédés ou affectes en jouissance par l'Etat; la location ou la vente des terrains lui appartenant et/ou concédés aux promoteurs immobiliers pour les besoins des activités industrielles, des services et des petits métiers ou aux collectivités territoriales décentralisées; l’élaboration des programmes d'aménagement des zones dédiées aux activités industrielles; la réalisation des études d'aménagement des zones dédiées aux activités industrielles, des zones spécialisées, des zones des services et des zones des petits métiers; la réalisation des études et l'aménagement des sites des projets industriels inities par l'Etat et/ou les Collectivités Territoriales Décentralisées; respect des normes environnementales par les entreprises implantées dans ses zones en liaison avec les administrations concernées; l'appui à l'Etat pour la réalisation d'investissements stratégiques en vue d'une réelle éclosion d'initiatives industrielles et de toutes autres interventions et prestations qui lui sont confiées; l’élaboration des bases de données et informations statistiques et économiques se rapportant aux entreprises installées dans ses zones, en liaison avec les administrations et organismes concernes; de toutes autres opérations, a elle confiées par le Gouvernement, se rattachant directement ou indirectement aux activités définies ci-dessus ou de nature à favoriser leur développement. La gestion de la MAGZI est assurée par trois organes: une Assemblée Générale; un Conseil d'Administration; et une Direction Générale.

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2019-362 du 24 avril 2019 relative à la coopération agricole.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance est prise en application de la loi du 30 octobre 2018 pour l’équilibre des relations commerciales dans le secteur agricole et alimentaire et une alimentation saine, durable et accessible à tous. Elle prévoit que: la lisibilité des informations des associés-coopérateurs sur leur rémunération et sur la gouvernance de leur coopérative est améliorée; la responsabilité d’une coopérative peut être engagée dans le cas où la rémunération des apports des associés-coopérateurs est anormalement basse; les conditions de signature d’un nouveau contrat d’apport entre l’associé-coopérateur et sa coopérative sont revues afin de définir une date de fin d’engagement unique.

Policy: Ley Orgánica de la Defensoría del Pueblo.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley Orgánica de la Defensoría del Pueblo, tiene como objeto establecer a la Defensoría del Pueblo como la Institución Nacional de Protección y Promoción de los Derechos Humanos y la Naturaleza, desarrollar sus principios, enfoques y competencias, definir su estructura principal, y asegurar su independencia, autonomía y representación plural. Policy: Regional Law No. 45-OZ “On delimitation of powers in the field of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law has as its purpose prevention of the outbreak and propagation of natural and technological disasters, reduction of losses caused thereby and mitigation of the consequences thereof, and delimitation of plenary powers of state bodies in the aforesaid sphere. Regional Government shall exercise the following powers: (a) adoption of legislative acts in the field of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters; (b) decision-making on evacuation arrangements in case of inter-municipal and regional emergencies, and implementation thereof; (c) builds up financial and material reserves for mitigation of the consequences of natural and technological disasters; (d) performs collection and exchange of information related to natural and technological disasters, early warning of the population and information of the population of the disaster risks; and (e) organizes and conducts emergency rescue and recovery operations and other immediate response operations in case of inter-municipal and regional emergencies.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 015-2019-VIVIENDA ─ Modifica el Decreto Supremo Nº 002-2016-VIVIENDA, que reglamenta parcialmente la Ley Nº 30327, Ley de Promoción de las Inversiones para el Crecimiento Económico y el Desarrollo Sostenible.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo modifica el que reglamenta parcialmente la Ley que tiene por finalidad promocionar las inversiones para el crecimiento económico y el desarrollo sostenible respecto a la simplificación e integración de permisos y procedimientos para la constitución de servidumbre sobre terrenos eriazos de propiedad estatal para proyectos de inversión, en aspectos relacionados con el ámbito de aplicación y los procedimientos para constituir el derecho de servidumbre sobre terrenos eriazos de dominio privado o dominio público estatal, para lo cual se requiere contar con la opinión técnica previa favorable vinculante de la entidad pública competente sobre el referido bien de dominio público. Respecto de los bienes de dominio público hidráulico, la opinión técnica requerida es emitida por la Autoridad Nacional de Agua (ANA), pronunciándose si dichos bienes se encuentran o no dentro de las exclusiones establecidas. En el caso de los terrenos eriazos que recaen sobre áreas identificadas como zonas de amortiguamiento de las áreas naturales protegidas, puede otorgarse el derecho de servidumbre siempre que se cuente con la opinión técnica previa favorable vinculante del Servicio Nacional de Áreas Naturales Protegidas por el Estado (SERNANP).

Policy: Ley Nº 30937 - Modifica la Ley Nº 27972, Ley Orgánica de Municipalidades.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica la Ley Orgánica de Municipalidades, en aspectos relacionados con los requisitos y procedimiento para la creación de municipalidades de centros poblados, como órganos de administración de las funciones y los servicios públicos locales que les son delegados y que se rigen por las disposiciones de la presente Ley. Las municipalidades son creadas por ordenanza de la municipalidad provincial, con el voto favorable de los dos tercios del número legal de regidores. La ordenanza de creación precisa: 1) El centro poblado de referencia y su ámbito geográfico de responsabilidad; 2) El régimen de organización interna; 3) Las funciones y la prestación de servicios públicos locales que se le delegan; 4) Los recursos que se le asignan para el cumplimiento de las funciones y de la prestación de servicios públicos locales delegados. No se pueden emitir ordenanzas de creación en zonas en las que exista conflicto demarcatorio ni tampoco durante el último año del periodo de gestión municipal.
