Policy: Control of Disposable Plastics Act No.11 of 2019.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down rules to prohibit the import, distribution, sale and utilization of single use plastic containers, cutlery, straws as well as prohibit the import, manufacture, distribution, sale and use of plastic bags made with a petroleum based resin. The list of exceptions includes bags for garbage, medical use, preservation of food, and a few other uses. This Act allows the import, sale or use of single use plastic containers or cutlery that is labeled and sold as “environmentally sustainable” after obtaining a license from the relevant Minister. In addition, this Act sets out penalties for false or misleading claims related to the environmental sustainability of a product. The provisions of this Act shall not apply to any plastic beverage container referred to in the Returnable Containers Act, Cap. 395A. A Committee will be established to address, monitor and develop plastic pollution prevention programmes; and formulate and implement strategies and programmes to raise public awareness on the pollution created by plastics.

Policy: Act on a permit requirement for certain property acquisitions (2019/470).
Policy_Content: This Act provides rules for the acquisition of real property by foreign legal entities registered in the EU or EEA and physical persons as listed in section 1. These persons may acquire property in Finland only if the Ministry of Defence grants a permit for the acquisition. Detailed rules on the content of the application for a permit may be issued by decree of the Government. Permits for the acquisition of a property may be granted if the acquisition is not deemed to make the organization of the country's defence, supervision and safeguarding of the territorial integrity or security of the border guard, border security or emergency preparedness difficult. The Ministry of Defence shall request a statement on the application by the authority within whose area of responsibility the data can be affected by the property acquisition, unless it is obviously unnecessary to request a statement. If a permit for the acquisition of a property is not granted, the acquirer shall transfer the property within one year.

Policy: Act on restriction of cultivation of genetically modified organisms (2019/445).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the national arrangements required for the implementation of Directive 2015/412 of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Directive 2001/18 / EC as regards the possibility for Member States to restrict or prohibit the cultivation of genetically modified organisms in their territories, and on the supervision in connection with this. The Act applies to genetically modified organisms for which cultivation permits have been granted in accordance with Part C of Directive 2001/18/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the deliberate release of genetically modified organisms into the environment or Chapter II or III of Regulation (EC) No 1829/2003 of the European Parliament and of the Council on genetically modified food and feed, hereinafter the Regulation on genetically modified food and feed. The Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry controls and supervises compliance with this law and the regulations issued under it. The Act defines duties of various authorities in respect of cultivation permits. The Ministry may prohibit or restrict cultivation, but limitations or prohibitions must be compatible with EU law, justified, proportionate and non-discriminatory and based on compelling circumstances (examples are given).

Policy: European Union (Environmental Impact Assessment) (Petroleum Exploration) (Amendment) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 124 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations apply Directive 2014/52/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on the assessment of the effects of certain public and private projects on the environment to activities related to petroleum exploration. Where an application is made under paragraph (1) of regulation 3, the applicant - (a) shall, having taken account of available results, where relevant, of other assessments of the effects on the environment carried out pursuant to European Union legislation (other than the Directive), provide the Minister with the information on the characteristics of the activity and its likely effect on the environment specified in Annex IIA, and (b) may also provide the Minister with a description of the features of the proposed activities and the measures, if any, envisaged to avoid or prevent what might otherwise have been significant adverse effects on the environment. Where an application is made to the Minister, the Unit shall make a determination, having taken account of the matters specified by these Regulations, as to whether the activities the subject of the application would, or would not, be likely to have significant effects on the environment by virtue, inter alia, of their nature, size and location.

Policy: Convenio de Coordinación para el Desarrollo Rural Sustentable 2019-2024, que celebran la Secretaría de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural y el Estado de Yucatán.
Policy_Content: El presente Convenio tiene por objeto establecer las bases de coordinación entre las Partes, con el fin de llevar a cabo proyectos, estrategias y acciones conjuntas para el desarrollo rural sustentable en general, así como, las demás iniciativas que en materia de desarrollo agroalimentario se presenten en lo particular, para impulsar a dicho sector en el Estado de Yucatán. Más específicamente las Partes se comprometen a conjuntar apoyos e inversiones en las actividades siguientes: a) propiciar la planeación del desarrollo rural sustentable, con la participación de los municipios, los sectores social y privado, a través de sus organizaciones sociales y económicas legalmente reconocidas, sistemas producto y demás formas de participación que emanen de los diversos agentes de la sociedad rural; b) concurrir de acuerdo a la disponibilidad presupuestal con apoyos adicionales, que en cada caso requieran los productores, para el debido cumplimiento de los proyectos o programas de fomento, especiales o de riesgos, con objeto de corregir faltantes de los productos básicos destinados a satisfacer necesidades nacionales, estatales y municipales, así como lo concerniente a la sanidad vegetal, animal, acuícola y a la inocuidad agroalimentaria; c) fomentar la productividad en regiones con limitantes naturales para la producción, pero con ventajas comparativas que justifiquen la producción bajo condiciones controladas; promoviendo la diversificación productiva y favoreciendo las prácticas sustentables de las culturas tradicionales, aunado a las actividades relacionadas con Organismos Genéticamente Modificados; d) promover las condiciones para la integración y difusión de información económica, agroalimentaria y de desarrollo rural sustentable que apoye la toma de decisiones, facilitando el acceso y la participación de los productores en su generación; e) promover y coordinar acciones para vigilar el cumplimiento de las medidas adoptadas en materia de sanidad vegetal, animal y acuícola, así como en la movilización nacional e internacional de mercancías reguladas y en los sistemas de reducción de riesgos de contaminación en la producción primaria de origen vegetal, pecuario, acuícola y pesquero.

Entre los varios compromisos, las Partes buscan propiciar la planeación del desarrollo rural sustentable, con la participación de los municipios, los sectores social y privado, a través de sus organizaciones sociales y económicas legalmente reconocidas, sistemas producto y demás formas de participación que emanen de los diversos agentes de la sociedad rural. El instrumento contempla específicamente las materias relacionadas con la salud animal; sanidad vegetal; inocuidad agroalimentaria; inspección de la movilización nacional; pesca y acuacultura sustentables; producción, certificación y comercio de semillas y material vegetativo; bioseguridad; productos orgánicos; atención a desastres naturales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Sustainable development,Agricultural development,Sub-national agreement,Public participation,Animal health,Pests/diseases,Plant protection,Biosecurity

Las Partes se comprometen a trabajar de manera coordinada para alcanzar los siguientes objetivos, entre otros : a) Propiciar la planeación del desarrollo rural sustentable, con la participación de los municipios, los sectores social y privado, a través de sus organizaciones sociales y económicas legalmente reconocidas, sistemas producto y demás formas de participación que emanen de los diversos agentes de la sociedad rural ; b) Fomentar la productividad en regiones con limitantes naturales para la producción, pero con ventajas comparativas que justifiquen la producción bajo condiciones controladas; promoviendo la diversificación productiva y favoreciendo las prácticas sustentables de las culturas tradicionales; aunado a las actividades relacionadas con Organismos Genéticamente Modificados; c) promover y coordinar acciones para vigilar el cumplimiento de las medidas adoptadas en materia de sanidad vegetal, animal y acuícola, así como en la movilización nacional e internacional de mercancías reguladas y en los sistemas de reducción de riesgos de contaminación en la producción primaria de origen vegetal, pecuario, acuícola y pesquero; d) vincular, de manera prioritaria, la investigación científica y desarrollo tecnológico con los programas de reconversión productiva de las unidades económicas y las regiones, para aumentar sus ventajas competitivas y mejorar los ingresos de las familias rurales; e) participar en acciones tanto de capacitación, asistencia técnica y extensionismo como de acreditación de éstas, que fortalezcan el crecimiento y desarrollo de capacidades; la organización de las personas que viven en el sector rural; mejoren el desempeño de sus actividades agropecuarias, acuícolas, pesqueras, de desarrollo rural sustentable y la vigilancia en el cumplimiento de la normatividad en materia ambiental y de bioseguridad, con el apoyo de municipios, organismos auxiliares, instituciones educativas y demás particulares.

Policy: Regional Law No. 409 “On development of horticulture and vegetable gardening”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law, proceeding from particular social significance of gardening and horticulture, with a view of creating favorable conditions for the development of gardening and horticulture, defines main goals and objectives of the development of horticulture and gardening in the region, establishes powers of the regional state authorities and local government bodies of the municipalities in the field of gardening and horticulture and sets legal grounds for support by state bodies of horticulture and gardening. The main objectives of the development of horticulture and gardening in the region shall be as follows: (a) increase in the number of citizens engaged in horticulture and gardening; (b) development of self-employment of the population in the region through incentives for horticulture or gardening; (c) promotion of cultivation by citizens in orchards or vegetable gardens of agricultural crops; (d) improving the efficiency of use land plots allotted for orchards and vegetable gardens; and (e) promotion of horticultural and gardening non-profit associations by protection, infrastructure development, transport support accessibility and fire safety on areas allotted for horticulture and gardening.

Policy: Décret n° 2019-265 du 27 mars 2019 fixant la procédure de consolidation des droits des concessionnaires provisoires de terres du domaine foncier rural.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe la procédure de consolidation des droits des concessionnaires provisoires de terres du domaine foncier rural. Les concessionnaires à titre provisoire de terres du domaine foncier rural sont tenus, sauf à y renoncer, de consolider leurs droits ainsi qu'il est précisé par ce texte. Ce texte prévoit notamment les concessions provisoires sous réserve des droits des tiers ; et les cas des concessions provisoires pures et simples. Les dispositions du présent décret s'appliquent à tous les cas d'occupation du domaine foncier rural, notamment lorsque les terres concernées font l’objet d'arrêtés de concession provisoire ; autorisations d'occuper; permis d'occuper; lettres de mise à disposition ; contrats d'occupation précaire ; lettres d'attribution ; titres fonciers indigènes.

Policy: National Vision for the Modern Yemeni State.
Policy_Content: This National Vision is a strategy that lays down the foundations for the future of Yemen and represents strategic guidelines for the various State institutions under the slogan “A hand for protection and a hand for building”. Yemeni citizens are the core of the document which aims to achieve the prosperity of Yemen and to link its present with its future by setting out long-term pathways to achieving 25 main objectives to be pursued by 2030. The National Vision will be effective through the implementation of national development strategies in three phases (2-5-5 years respectively) through which appropriate guidance will be available for short, medium, and long-term plans. The main objective of the National Vision is to serve the Yemeni people together with achieving change and independence from any economic or political submissiveness, achieving a decent life for the population, and eventually reaching self-sufficiency and food security in the food sector so that to realize the Vision of a modern, democratic, stable and unified Yemen which rests on having strong institutions, the realization of justice, the pursuit of development and dignified life and standard of living for Yemeni citizens, the protection of the independence of the nation and seeking world peace and appropriate equal cooperation with the other countries of the world.

Policy: Tourism Corporation Act (No. 2 of 2019).
Policy_Content: The overall objectives of this Act are (I) establishment of a legal and administrative framework to promote tourism development; (II) establishment and empowerment of the Corporation to carry out and promote the sustainable development of tourism through effective planning and promotion; and (III) public participation in the development of tourism policies and the resolution of issues arising as a result of tourism development. This Act lays down provisions on the establishment, duties and authorities of the Nauru Tourism Corporation; directions of the Minister to the Corporation; structure of the Board of Directors; qualifications, responsibilities and duties of directors; account keeping and reporting; funds and audit of the Corporation; and the appointment and responsibilities of the Chief Executive Officer. This Act stresses on the provision of sustainable socio-economic benefit of all stakeholders; conservation and management of natural, social and cultural resources, biodiversity and the environment; and international or regional commitments in particular relating to ecotourism and Blue Ocean Strategy. The Cabinet may make regulations prescribing all matters necessary or convenient to be prescribed for giving effect to this Act.

Policy: Decree No. 241 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on the Agency for implementation of projects in the field of agro-industrial complex and food supply.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Cabinet of Ministers determines the status, main tasks, functions, rights and responsibilities, organization of the activities of the Agency for implementation of projects in the field of agro-industrial complex and food supply on implementation of projects in the field of agro-industrial complex and food supply, as well as functional responsibilities of its managers. The Agency is an authorized state body responsible for assistance in the development and implementation of major projects, including investment projects, in the field of agro-industrial complex and food supply for the purpose of active development and support of entrepreneurship. The main objectives of the Agency shall be as follows: (a) assistance in the development and formation of projects, including investment projects, in the field of agro-industrial complex and food supply, taking into account the priorities of development and support of entrepreneurship; (b) attraction of foreign investments, loans, grants and technical assistance of international financial institutions and international governmental financial organizations with a view of implementation of  projects, including investment projects, in the field of agro-industrial complex and food supply; (c) implementation of projects for aimed at further modernization and technical and technological innovation of the infrastructure of agro-industrial complex and food supply; (d) monitoring of the status of projects and subprojects, identification of problems hindering their effective implementation, as well as providing practical assistance in their resolution;  (e) cooperation with initiators of startup projects, introduction of innovative ideas and technologies, assistance in organization of implementation of highly efficient and energy-saving project solutions, creation of laboratories and design bureaus in the field of agro-industrial complex and food supply in line with international quality management standards; and (f) assistance to state and economic management bodies, local government bodies and other organizations within the framework of implementation of projects, including investment projects in the field of agro-industrial complex and food supply.

Policy: Law No. 7 of 2019 on mineral activities on the continental shelf (Seabed Mineral Law).
Policy_Content: This Law provides rule for activities related to the exploration and exploitation of mineral deposits on the seabed and its substrata in waters under the jurisdiction of Norway, including the Continental Shelf (The Law applies to mineral deposits in Norway's inland waters, Norway's maritime territory and on the Norwegian continental shelf). The King may issue Regulations on the application of the Law to marine species, plants and genetic material that are included as part of those activities. Resources shall be governed exclusively by the Norwegian state in accordance with this Law. Areas of the Continental shelf may be opened to mining by decision of the Cabinet of Ministers after an impact assessment is carried out. Mineral activities must not unnecessarily or unduly impede or hinder shipping, fishing, aviation or any other activity or cause damage or danger of damage to pipelines, cables or other subsea facilities. All reasonable measures shall be taken to avoid damage to the natural diversity of the sea or cultural heritage on the seabed and to avoid pollution and litter. Fishing may be carried out in safety zones based on a Rule of the Ministry. The Law also concerns compensation to Norwegian fishermen for loss of fishing opportunities or due to pollution (as defined by the Pollution Law) or other activities related to mining.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Mineral resources, Sea
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 274 - Modifica el Decreto Legislativo Nº 74, que crea el Fondo para el Desarrollo Económico y Social de los Municipios.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Legislativo modifica el que crea el Fondo para el Desarrollo Económico y Social de los Municipios (FODES), sustituyendo el Artículo 1 de la siguiente manera: “Art. 1.- Créase el Fondo para el Desarrollo Económico y Social de los Municipios de El Salvador (FODES), el cual estará constituido por un aporte anual del Estado igual al 10% de los ingresos corrientes netos del Presupuesto del Estado... Los cuales podrán financiarse con: a) Los subsidios y aportes que le otorgue el Estado; b) Aportes y donaciones; c) Préstamos externos e internos; d) Bonos u otros ingresos que por cualquier concepto reciba. Del equivalente al 8% de los ingresos corrientes netos del Estado que los Municipios reciban se utilizará el 25% para gastos de funcionamiento,  y de este mismo 8% el equivalente a su 75% para gastos de inversión... Los proyectos financiados con recursos del FODES deberán cumplir con requisitos de transparencia y buena gestión, entre ellos: i) los proyectos serán aprobados en sesiones de Concejo Municipal con invitación pública a los ciudadanos, quienes podrán manifestar su anuencia a la selección de los proyectos; ii) publicar información sobre el proceso de adjudicación de proyectos en sitios WEB, con un contenido mínimo de listado de participantes, criterios técnicos y económicos para la selección; y iii) impacto esperado y la forma de evaluar los beneficios sociales y económicos.”

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 84/19 approving the allocation of the Fuel Subsidy for agriculture and fisheries activities.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree, consisting of 8 articles, regulates the allocation of the Fuel Subsidy for agriculture and fisheries production. This Fuel Subsidy applies to agro-pastoral and fishing activities, eligible under the terms of article 3 of this Presidential Decree, which depend on the use of machinery and equipment, with fuel expenditures, in the national territory. This subsidy corresponds to the value attributed by the State, through the National Treasury, the Agricultural Development Fund and the Support Fund for the Development of Fishing Industry and Aquaculture, according to article 2 of this Diploma, to receive public aid for the cost of fuel expenses for agricultural and fisheries activities. The granting of this subsidy implies the actual payment of fuel expenses and the restricted use of said fuel by the beneficiary in the production process. Industrial production taxpayers who principally carry out agricultural or fishing activity and satisfy specific requirements, may benefit from the said fuel subsidy.

Policy: Décret n°2019/147 du 21 mars 2019 portant réorganisation du laboratoire National de Génie Civil.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret a trait à la réorganisation du laboratoire National de Génie Civil (LABOGENIE). Le Labogénie a pour missions de: apporter aux administrations publiques, un appui pour les contrôles périodiques auprès des laboratoires prives de génie civil agrées, en vue du respect des prescriptions techniques; mener, en liaison avec les Ministres et organismes concernés, les études géotechniques et environnementales des sites, dans le cadre de la prévention des sinistres, catastrophes ou calamités naturelles, en vue de la détermination de leur niveau de risque; réaliser, en relation avec les structures techniques concernées, tous les travaux de recherche dans le domaine des matériaux et techniques de construction; conduire, pour les Ministères et organismes concernes, les études et les recherches en vue de l’adaptation des infrastructures aux écosystèmes locaux; mener toutes études normatives en matière d'infrastructures de génie civil; contribuer, en liaison avec les Ministères et organismes concernées à l’élaboration et à la fixation des normes en matière de construction d'infrastructures de génie civil; contribuer à l'élaboration des normes nationales pour les instruments de mesure et de contrôle de la qualité des produits de construction locaux importés, et assurer le suivi de leur respect; contribuer à l’élaboration et à la fixation des normes et prescriptions techniques en matière d'assainissement et de drainage, en relation avec le Ministère en charge de l’urbanisme et les collectivités territoriales décentralisées; mener, pour les Ministères et organismes concernés, toutes actions relatives au respect de l’application des normes et prescriptions techniques en matière de construction et d'entretien des ouvrages; définir, programmer et réguler les prestations géotechniques de tous les travaux d'infrastructures publiques, en relation avec les Ministères et organismes concernés; certifier et d'agréer la qualité et la conformité de la mise en œuvre des matériaux de construction, la qualité des équipements et des ouvrages de génie civil; assurer la formation continue ou en alternance en géotechnique, en liaison avec les Ministres et organismes concernes; émettre, à la demande de l’administration concernée, un avis sur toutes études ou mesures relatives au développement technologique des matériaux de construction ou produits manufactures utilisables dans les travaux publics et la construction, et d'assurer régulièrement le contrôle de leur mise en œuvre; mener les expertises géotechniques ou géophysiques des assises des ouvrages de génie civil, ainsi que la caractérisation et l'optimisation qualitative des matériaux de constructions et de leur mise en œuvre; procéder aux activités de recherche et de captage des nappes hydrauliques souterraines; et plus généralement, de procéder à toutes opérations d’études et de recherche se rattachant directement ou indirectement à son objet social, ou encore susceptibles d'en faciliter la réalisation ou le développement.

Policy: Siaya County Health Services Act, 2019 (No. 2 of 2019).
Policy_Content: The Act is created for the purpose of providing for a legal framework for health for development, promote the utilization of health, nutrition and responsive caregiving services, facilitate realization of consumer health rights and facilitate health systems strengthening. The Act entrenches the following principles; adoption of a primary health care approach where services are available, accessible, equitable and of good standard; upholding the health rights of individuals, among others. The Act lists the functions of the Department responsible for County Health Services to include, coordinating the implementation of national health policies and laws, coordinating the provision of preventive, rehabilitative and palliative health services, develop County health policies, regulations and programs, ensure compliance with norms and standards for health facilities and health services, facilitate capacity building and professional development for health services personnel, promote public private partnership, licence and control undertakings that sell food to the public, etc. The Act establishes the Office of the County Director of Public Health and Sanitation, whose duties, among other things includes the administration of the Act and coordination of waste management. Essentially, the Act provides for the establishment of health facilities at the County, sub County and Ward levels. Additionally, there are provisions on disease management, prevention and control and strategies and interventions being undertaken by the county government at the various levels of care in order to reduce disease burden or risk.

Policy: Act on the Prohibition of Energy Extraction from Coal (2019/416).
Policy_Content: This Act prohibits, from 1 May 2029, to use coal as fuel in the production of electricity or heat. This Act applies to power plants and heat plants that produce electricity or heat with solid, gaseous or liquid fuels, and to the carbon dioxide emissions that shall be treated within the application sphere of the Emissions Trading Act (311/2011). Only in case of a energy emergency (serious disturbance in supply) the ban on the use of coal can be temporarily lifted. This shall be based on a decision of the Cabinet. Some exemption from the ban may be granted for a very limited period to producers of energy for heating purposes. Emission reporting rules are contained in Commission Regulation (EU) No 601/2012 on the monitoring and reporting of greenhouse gas emissions pursuant to Directive 2003/87/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 81/19 approving the governance model for the reviewing process of the Long-Term National Development Strategy, Angola-2025.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the governing Model for the reviewing process of the Long-Term National Development Strategy (ELP Angola-2025). This Model, consisting of 12 articles divided into three Chapters and two Annexes, creates the Technical Support Unit for the Review of ELP Angola 2025 and its extension until 2050 (UTA-ELP), as an ad hoc technical support body to the Ministry of Economy and Planning, establishing new composition, duties and responsibilities of related entities. Considering that the Strategy Angola 2025 is a long-term planning instrument, containing the global vision for Angola, its role at international level and its priorities for development and the need to define the process of revision and extension of the National Long-Term Development Strategy, with the executive coordination of the Ministry of Economy and Planning, and involving all the member bodies, under the terms of Law No. 1/11 of 14 January 2011. The process of revising the ANGOLA-2025 Strategy aims to extend the Strategy up to 2050.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-4246 “On measures for further development of horticulture and greenhouse economy in the Republic of Uzbekistan.”
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree, with a view of further development of horticulture and greenhouse economy and introduction of efficient mechanisms of state support of horticulture and greenhouse economy, and also for increasing of production output of high quality, competitive and export-oriented agricultural commodities, sets up the Agency for the development of horticulture and greenhouse economy. The Agency shall perform the following main tasks: (a) development and implementation of comprehensive target programs aimed at ensuring sustainable development of horticulture and greenhouse facilities; (b) taking measures to increase the area of intensive gardens and greenhouses with the use of modern resource-saving technologies, including, including drip and rainwater irrigation, taking into account the analysis of market conditions; (c) large-scale application of advanced scientific developments and intensive agro-technologies in horticulture and greenhouse economy with the consideration of soil and climatic conditions of the regions; (d) assistance to horticultural enterprises and greenhouses in implementation of international certification standards jointly with "Uzstandard" Agency; (e) implementation of measures on development of cooperation system and organization of cluster form, including the whole chain of production, harvesting, sorting, calibration, packaging and trade of fruits; (f) rendering assistance in attraction of investments, including direct foreign investments, with a view of production of competitive commodities, organization of their trade, increase of export potential by performing marketing researches of a conjuncture of the markets; (g) elaboration of recommendations on the placement and cultivation of the most popular varieties of fruits on foreign markets; (h) cooperation with domestic and foreign educational and research institutions, specialized foreign organizations and manufacturers on training, professional development, development and implementation of innovations in the field of horticulture and greenhouse facilities; and (i) keeping, together with the State Committee of the Republic of Uzbekistan on Land Resources, Geodesy, Cartography and State Cadastre, electronic register of the areas of gardens and greenhouses.

Policy: Forest Reproductive Material (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2019 (S.R. No. 50 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend The Forest Reproductive Material Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2002 to set out the revised requirements which apply in Northern Ireland in relation to forest reproductive material produced in countries outside the European Union. They also implement in relation to Northern Ireland Council Decision 2008/971/EC on the equivalence of forest reproductive material produced in third countries, as amended by Decision No. 1104/2012/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council. No person shall market forest reproductive material in Northern Ireland unless conditions specified in these regulations are met. The Department may authorise a registered supplier by licence to  import or market forest reproductive material in Northern Ireland which would otherwise be prohibited.  No person may import forest reproductive material into Northern Ireland from a third country for the purpose of marketing it unless— (a) it has been produced in an EU-approved third country or a permitted third country; (b) it is permitted material; and (c) the requirements set out in Schedule 13 are met on entry (OECD Certificate of Provenance).

Policy: Décret n° 2019-033/PR du 20/03/19 portant création et organisation du guichet foncier unique.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée et organise le Guichet foncier unique (GFU) en application des dispositions de l’article 220 de la loi n° 2018-005 du 14 juin 2018 portant code foncier et domanial. Le GFU a pour mission de faciliter, simplifier et accélérer les formalités et procédures foncières et domaniales prévues à l’article 4 du présent décret en permettant aux usagers d’effectuer en un même lieu les opérations y afférentes. A ce titre, il est chargé, notamment de: accueillir et informer toute personne sur les textes législatifs et réglementaires en matière foncière et domaniale; informer et sensibiliser le public sur les procédures de transfert de propriété en collaboration avec les services techniques compétents; communiquer la liste des pièces à fournir selon la nature de l’opération ou de l’acte à délivrer; recevoir toute demande ou tout dossier lié au foncier et s’assurer de sa recevabilité; liquider et percevoir les droits et taxes afférents auxdites formalités; assurer le traitement de toute demande en liaison avec les différentes administrations concernées;  veiller au respect des délais légaux de traitement des dossiers et d’exécution des formalités requises avec les administrations concernées; produire périodiquement et publier ses statistiques. Le GFU traite, notamment des demandes relatives aux opérations et actes suivants: attribution, affectation, rétrocession de parcelles de terrain; attestation d’attribution de parcelle; extrait de lotissement; permis d’exploiter; titre foncier; mutations totales; inscription de droits réels immobiliers et autres opérations post-immatriculation; constat de mise en valeur; évaluation des investissements ; bornage de terrain; état des droits réels; levés topographiques; expertises foncières.

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2019/452 establishing a framework for the screening of foreign direct investments into the Union.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down rules for establishing the screening mechanisms of foreign direct investments into the Union by Member States and strengthening the cooperation among Member States themselves and with the Commission, with the aims of enhancing its competitiveness, creating jobs and economies of scale, bringing in capital, technologies, innovation, expertise, and opening new markets for the Union's exports. Member States and the Commission may consider the potential effects of a foreign direct investment on supply of critical inputs, including energy or raw materials, as well as food security, while determining whether a foreign direct investment is likely to affect security or public order. The Commission shall be responsible for the evaluation of the functioning and effectiveness of this Regulation and reporting to the European Parliament and to the Council.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Keyword: Business/industry/corporations,Energy conservation/energy production,Internal trade,International trade,Food security
Entry into force notes: This Regulation shall enter into force on the twentieth day following that of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Union and shall apply from 11 October 2020.

Policy: Radiation Safety and Nuclear Security (Appeal) Regulations 2019 (G.N. No. 51 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations make provision with respect to appeals under the Radiation Safety and Nuclear Security Act 2018. Any person aggrieved by any decision of the Authority under this Act may, within 14 days of the date of the decision, appeal to the Minister by lodging with the Director a written notice of appeal together with the grounds of appeal. The Minister may, on receipt of a notice set up an ad hoc Appeal Committee to advise him on the subject matter of the appeal. These Regulation provide rules regarding notifications, proceedings of the Appeals Committee and subsequent action by the Minister.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Décret n° 2019-142 du 18 mars 2019 portant réorganisation de la Mission de Développement Intégré des Monts Mandara.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret porte réorganisation de la Mission de Développement Intégré des Monts Mandara (MIDIMA). La Mission a pour objet l’initiation, la coordination et la réalisation de toutes les actions d'aménagement et de développement de la Région concernée. A ce titre, elle est chargée de: l’identification, la définition et l’étude générale des projets de développement dans la région ainsi que la mise en cohérence avec le schéma d'aménagement et de développement durable de la Région; de la réalisation de toutes les actions d'aménagement et de développement de la Région; l’élaboration et de l’actualisation des Systèmes d'informations Géographiques (SIG) relatifs à l’aménagement du territoire; la coordination des actions de développement; l’appui conseil aux Collectivités Territoriales Décentralisées; l’élaboration et de l’actualisation des programmes d'investissement pour le développement; la planification, de la programmation et du suivi-évaluation des projets; suivi de la gestion du patrimoine issu des infrastructures d’aménagement; la recherche des financements pour la réalisation des actions de développement; la contribution aux opérations de zonage et du plan d'occupation des espaces; la formation et du recyclage des acteurs de développement locaux. La mission est administrée par deux (02) organes: le Conseil d'Administration; et la Direction Générale. Ce texte abroge toutes dispositions antérieures contraires, notamment le décret n° 82/556 du 5 novembre 1982 portant création de la Mission de Développement Intégré des Monts Mandara, modifie par le décret n° 86/1288 du 1er novembre 1986.

Policy: Orden TEC/351/2019 - Aprueba el Índice Nacional de Calidad del Aire.
Policy_Content: La presente Orden tiene por objeto aprobar el Índice Nacional de Calidad del Aire basándose en los siguientes contaminantes: a) Partículas en suspensión PM10; b) Partículas en suspensión PM2.5; c) Ozono troposférico (O3); d) Dióxido de nitrógeno (NO2); e) Dióxido de azufre (SO2). El Índice Nacional de Calidad del Aire, establecido de acuerdo con las instrucciones dictadas por la Agencia Europea de Medio Ambiente, informará sobre el estado de la calidad del aire en cada una de las estaciones distribuidas por todo el territorio nacional, en base a una escala de colores de fácil identificación para el ciudadano, de conformidad con el Anexo que establece la metodología para su cálculo. El Índice Nacional de Calidad del Aire, se aplicará a todo el territorio nacional, por lo que servirá de referencia para todas comunidades autónomas y entes locales con competencias sobre la gestión de la calidad del aire en su ámbito territorial.

Policy: Ley Nº 3/2019 - Modifica la Ley Nº 5/2006, Ley de Ordenación del Territorio y Urbanismo de La Rioja.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica la que tiene por objeto la regulación de la ordenación del territorio y de la actividad urbanística en la Comunidad Autónoma de La Rioja, en aspectos relacionados con las competencias en materia de protección de la legalidad urbanística, régimen sancionador e inspección urbanística, que podrán ser ejercidas por un Consorcio para la Protección de la Legalidad Urbanística de La Rioja. Al respecto, se autoriza la creación de un Consorcio para la Protección de la Legalidad Urbanística de La Rioja, como un ente público de naturaleza consorcial, dotado de personalidad jurídica propia y sujeto al régimen de presupuestos, contabilidad, control económico-financiero y patrimonial de la Administración Pública a la que quede adscrito. Serán actividades propias del Consorcio el ejercicio en común, por la Administración autonómica y los municipios que en él se integren, de las competencias que en materia de protección de la legalidad urbanística, régimen sancionador e inspección urbanística relativo a la disciplina urbanística, así como el desempeño de cuantas otras funciones le asignen sus Estatutos para el ejercicio de las atribuciones que le hayan sido otorgadas.

Policy: Resolución Nº 90-2019 ─ Dicta medidas sobre la colocación por medio de cualquier método de anuncios y/o propagandas en los árboles y palmas.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución prohíbe la colocación, por medio de cualquier método, de anuncios y/o propagandas en los árboles y palmas, que afecten o menoscaben su función y condición, así como, se ponga en riesgo y/o se cause daños a dichos recursos naturales. Se concede un término de quince días calendarios, contados a partir de su promulgación en Gaceta Oficial, para que los propios anunciantes remuevan los anuncios y propagandas que estén colocados en árboles y palmas.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-4243 “On measures for further development and support of livestock breeding”.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree, with a view of all-round support of  entrepreneurial initiatives of the population related to the development of livestock breeding, widespread adoption of scientific approaches and advanced modern technologies in this sector of economy, further stimulation of production and processing of import-substituting and export-oriented livestock products and ultimately increasing welfare and income of the population, to approve the proposals of the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Karakalpakstan, local government, State Committee on Land Resources, Geodesy, Cartography and the State Cadastre, as well as the Ministry of Agriculture on the allocation to livestock farms and other agricultural enterprises of rainfed and pasture land plots located in the reserve of local government with obligations of growing fodder crops, the introduction of drip and sprinkler irrigation systems in accordance with Annex No. 1. It establishes he following procedure of state support for producers of fodder crops for the introduction of drip and sprinkler irrigation technology on rainfed and pasture land plots allocated in accordance with Annex No. 1: (a) fodder crop producers shall be granted a subsidy of 100 thousand soums for each meter of deepening; (b) subsidy costs shall be covered by the Public Works Fund under the Ministry of Employment and Labour Relations in 2019 to support farms, dekhkan (peasant) farms and owners of homestead lands under the Council of Farmers' and Dekhkan Farms and homestead Landowners' Lands of Uzbekistan, and from 2020 to be covered by the State budget, loans (credits) and grants from international financial institutions, foreign government organizations and other donors; and (c) interest expense on loans to manufacturers of fodder crops for construction and reconstruction of drip and sprinkler irrigation systems and acquisition of their components at the expense of the State Fund for Support of Entrepreneurship Development under the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan for the period up to 5 years in part of the cost not exceeding the equivalent of 20 million soums per hectare, regardless of the type of currency, shall be covered by commercial banks in the amount of 50 percent of the established interest rate, but not more than 10 percentage points of the credit rate.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock

Policy: Decree No. 226 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on gas industry safety rules.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Cabinet of Ministers establishes safety requirements for gas pipelines located in settlements, industrial enterprises, agricultural enterprises and public utilities with a view of preventing disasters and accidents. Project documentation related to construction and installation of gas supply system in residential areas must comply with land-use planning documentation and applicable technical regulations. Accidents at gas facilities shall be promptly reported to the competent authority. Gas equipment and gas pipelines of industrial and agricultural enterprises shall be subject to annual maintenance and preventive maintenance three times in a year. The owner of the facility shall be responsible for construction, installation and repair of furnaces, as well as inspection, cleaning, ventilation, and repair of the ventilation systems.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.

Policy: Decree No. 224 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on the procedure for management of subsoil plots for the extraction of precious metals.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Cabinet of Ministers establishes the procedure for management of subsoil plots for the extraction of precious metals, in particular exploration of gold deposits, by natural and legal persons. License for exploration and mining of precious metals shall be issued to applicants for fee and shall include allotment of plots of subsoil containing gold deposits with area not exceeding 1 hectare. Transfer of license or subsoil management by several persons shall be prohibited. License holder must comply with licensing terms and conditions. The period of validity of license, issued in accordance with the outcome of auction on e-commerce platform "E-Performance", shall be 3 years. State Geological Committee shall be issuing authority of exploration and mining licenses. Mining shall be authorized without the use of explosives to the total maximum depth up to 6 meters. Upon completion of exploration and mining works, license holders shall perform land reclamation, with a view of restoration of fertile soil layer, at their own expense.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-4241 “On measures for the organization of activity of the Inspectorate for Control over the Agro-Industrial Complex under the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan.”
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree sets up Development Fund of the Inspectorate for Control over the Agro-Industrial Complex under the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan and State Unitary Enterprise "Center for Services in the Agro-Industrial Complex" at the Inspectorate for Control over Agro-Industrial Complex under the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan. Inspectorate shall perform the following tasks: (a) to control the status of compliance with the requirements of the legislation in the field of agriculture and water management; (b) compliance with the requirements of separate processing and grain crops; (c) state-owned storage of seeds; (d) procurement and storage of cotton seeds; (e) formation of the stocks of agricultural commodities and food products in the volumes in accordance with the systematic implementation of the state order; (f) implementation of the state policy in the field of genetic purity of varieties and quality of seeds of agricultural crop and quality control of seeds and planting material; (g) mandatory state inspection of the quality of cereals, raw cotton, seeds of agricultural crops and products of their processing during export-import and in-country transportation; (h) implementation of a set of measures to identify violations and take measures to eliminate the causes and conditions that contribute to them; and (i) conducting proceedings in cases of administrative violations in the manner prescribed by law.

Policy: Coastal Waters Discharge Permit Regulations, 2019 (No. R. 382 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under the  Integrated Coastal Management Act, 2008, concern application for and determination of a permit contemplated in section 69(1) of the Act (“coastal waters discharge permit”). An application for a coastal waters discharge permit must be made to the Minister on the application form obtained from the Department of Environmental Affairs. The Regulations set out the minimum information required for assessment of applications. a discharge permit shall be granted or renewed by the Minister. An application for a coastal waters discharge permit to discharge effluent into an estuary may only be granted in exceptional circumstances, and only where it is demonstrated that— (a) such inflows are required to improve or will maintain any applicable resource quality objectives; (b) such inflows will improve the general ecological state of the estuarine system; (c) such inflows will not deteriorate the ecological state of the estuarine system; or (d) the ecological functioning of the estuary has been irreversibly modified in an adverse manner, and the discharge will not lead to a further deterioration of the water quality in the estuary.

Policy: Disaster risk assessment in the Republic of Serbia.
Policy_Content: This text, as in accordance with the provisions of the Serbian Law on disaster risk reduction and emergency situation management, contains the Disaster risk assessment, aimed at: improving knowledge about risks, upgrading knowledge using good practices and international standards for the needs of practical procedures in planning, investing, insurance, etc; risk assessment at all levels and by all entities at a standardized level and in manner that ensures the comparability of the results obtained; formation of a database in one reference document that will serve as the basis for future assessments and planning of public policies aimed at management of possible natural and other disaster risks. Risk assessment and mapping contribute to ensuring the priority of policy decisions, in order to offer the most appropriate prevention measures and according to the most serious risks and readiness. This Assessment contains specific issues as regards earthquakes, erosion and land sliding, floods, extreme weather event, lack of potable or drinking water, human disease epidemic and pandemic, plant diseases, animal diseases, explosions and fires, technological accidents (also nuclear and radiological), and terror attacks.

Policy: Petroleum Act, 2019.
Policy_Content: This Act applies to all upstream, midstream and downstream petroleum operations being carried out in Kenya and is created to be the prevailing legislation in matters regarding upstream, midstream and downstream petroleum operations. The Law provides that the Cabinet Secretary shall develop and publish a national policy on petroleum operations which are to be reviewed at least once in every five years. The Law tasks the national government to create a conducive environment for investments in petroleum operations and infrastructure development; this includes facilitating access to land for exploration activities. The Law further provides certain functions of the Cabinet Secretary, with respect to fostering its mandate, including to review an application made under this Act for a license or permit before entering into negotiations with an applicant in relation to a petroleum agreement and, where necessary and on the recommendation of the advisory Committee, reject an application made under this Act in the national interest; to negotiate, enter into or revoke a petroleum agreement or appoint an authorized representative to enter into or revoke a petroleum, generally oversee upstream petroleum operations carried out under the terms and conditions of a petroleum agreement; among others. It establishes the National Upstream Petroleum Advisory Committee to generally advise the Cabinet Secretary on upstream petroleum operations, the suspension, revocation or termination of a petroleum agreement; assist the Cabinet Secretary to develop criteria for the negotiation of petroleum agreements between the Cabinet Secretary and a contractor, among other duties. The Law also mandates strict compliance to environmental, health and safety standards, by placing an obligation on contractors to take all reasonable steps to secure the safety, health and welfare of persons engaged in all its operations around the contract area, deploying the best available technology for this purpose, amongst others. Annexed to this, it provides that waste management is conducted in accordance with all the applicable environmental, health, safety and maritime laws and best petroleum industry practices.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-4239 “On measures for the development of agricultural cooperation in the fruit and vegetable processing industry.”
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree, in order to stimulate the creation of value chains in the fruit and vegetable processing industry, to ensure the sustainability of production and export of quality fruit and vegetable products, to expand the financial capabilities of producers of these products, as well as to increase the competitiveness of production,  to agree with the proposals of the Ministry of Agriculture, the Ministry of Economy and Industry, the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Uzbekistan, the Council of Farmers and Dekhkan Farms and owners of homestead lands of Uzbekistan related to creation and large-scale application of cooperation association of independent and interrelated agricultural enterprises, farms, dekhkan (peasant) farms and owners of homestead lands on the basis of the principles of voluntariness and share participation in the established agricultural associations. Agricultural cooperative associations shall perform the following tasks: (a) marketing analysis of internal and external fruit and vegetable markets; (b) implementation of coordinated measures on fruit and vegetable production, including by types and varieties of products, regulated by contracts with members of agricultural associations; (c) organization of joint use by members of agricultural associations of property complexes, machinery, equipment, vehicles necessary for growing fruits and vegetables, including through joint rent of storages and processing of raw materials on a tolling basis; (d) supply of agricultural machinery, fuel and lubricants, fertilizers, seeds, seedlings and seedlings to members of agricultural associations on contractual terms; (e) organization of procurement, transportation, storage, processing and trade of products on the basis of contracting or commission agreements; (f) involvement of exporters in cooperation with agricultural associations in order to ensure guaranteed trade of fruit and vegetable products that meet international standards; and (g) provision of agrotechnical, accounting, consulting, commission and other services to members of agricultural associations.

Policy: Programme for women's empowerment in the field of information and communication technologies for the period 2019-2020.
Policy_Content: This publication, as in accordance with the Law on planning system of the Republic of Serbia, provides for the Programme for women's empowerment in the field of information and communication technologies for the period 2019-2020. The Constitution of the Republic of Serbia provides the legal basis for the introduction and regulation of gender equality in Serbia and establishes gender equality as a basic constitutional principle. The Constitution establishes the obligation of the state to guarantee equality between women and men and to develop a policy of equal opportunities (Article 15), as well as the principle of non-discrimination on the grounds of sex. The specific goals of improving women's participation in the ICT sector are determined, as well as program measures and activities whose implementation should contribute to reducing the gender gap in the digital sector, as well as social and economic empowerment of women and regional representation of women in this area.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Loi n°1/08 du 13 mars 2019 portant révision de la loi n° 1/26 du 15 septembre 2014 portant création, organisation, composition, fonctionnement et compétence de la Cour Spéciale des Terres et autres Biens ainsi que la procédure suivie devant elle.
Policy_Content: La présente loi crée la Cour spéciale des terres et autres biens, et fixe sa mission, son organisation, sa composition, son fonctionnement, sa compétence, la durée ainsi que la procédure suivie. La Cour spéciale des terres et autres biens a pour mission de connaitre en dernière instance les recours contre les décisions prises par la Commission nationale des terres et autres biens. Elle statue également en premier et en dernier ressort sur les faits infractionnels ayant un impact direct sur le fond de l’affaire soulevés au cours de l’instruction juridictionnelle. Par ailleurs, ce texte fixe l’organisation et le fonctionnement; la compétence; les procédures suivie devant la cour; les voies de recours; l'exécution des arrêts; et des dispositions transitoires et finales.

Policy: Loi n°1/07 du 13 mars 2019 portant révision de la loi n° 1/31 du 31 décembre 2013 portant missions, composition, organisation et fonctionnement de la Commission Nationale des Terres et autres Biens.
Policy_Content: La présente loi crée la Commission Nationale des Terres et autres Biens, et fixe ses missions, sa composition, son organisation et son fonctionnement. Le mandat de la commission est de de connaitre des litiges relatifs aux terres et autres biens opposant les sinistrés entre eux, les sinistrés à des tiers ou les sinistrés aux services publics ou privés. La Commission est particulièrement chargée de: connaitre de toutes les affaires lui soumises par les sinistres en vue de la restitution de leur patrimoine; fournir une assistance technique et matérielle pour aider les sinistres à rentrer dans leurs droits; aider les rapatries dans d'autres domaines tels que les services médicaux, le soutien psycho-social, la sécurité sociale et la retraite, l'éducation des enfants et l'équivalence des diplômes obtenus à l’extérieur du Burundi; aider les rapatries à régler les litiges dans leurs pays d'asile portant notamment sur les biens immobiliers, les comptes en banque et la sécurité sociale; étudier les modalités d'indemnisation et de compensation des rapatries pour les biens laisses dans le pays d'asile qu'ils ne peuvent ni emporter ni vendre ou dont ils ne peuvent tirer aucun profit; proposer à l’autorité compétente, l'attribution de nouvelles terres aux sinistres qui n’en ont pas; connaitre des litiges relatifs aux décisions prises par les Commissions antérieures et qui n'auraient pas été règles; connaitre de l'interprétation et de l’exécution de toutes les décisions prises par elle-même et la rectification des erreurs matérielles y relatives; étudier les possibilités et les modalités de compensation pour les sinistres qui n'ont pas recouvre leurs terres ou autres biens, ou pour d'autres victimes dont les biens ont été détruits, y compris les requérants qui s 'estiment insatisfaits par les décisions des commissions antérieures; sensibiliser les possesseurs et les acquéreurs illégitimes à la restitution volontaire et au respect des terres et autres biens des sinistres; sensibiliser et informer la population sur les délais dont les personnes intéressées disposent pour saisir la CNTB; récupérer au terme d’une décision de la Commission et remettre à l 'Etat toutes les terres et les biens irrégulièrement acquis par les tiers. Par ailleurs, cette loi fixe la composition ; l’organisation ; et le fonctionnement.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Ministerial Decree No.98 of 2019 on using Refuse Derived Fuel (RDF) produced from waste treatment procedures in cement plants.
Policy_Content: This Decree consisting of 9 articles applies to all coal-fired cement plants in their energy production operations, providing for (i) the use of alternative fuels from municipal solid waste treatment processes as an alternative to energy production; (ii) supporting industries and initiatives aimed at addressing the municipal solid waste generated in the country and exploiting it to obtain products that are in line with the national economy; and (iii) developing environmental protection, human health and sustainable development. These plants are (i) committed to using a minimum of 10% (if available in the country) of their total energy needs from alternative fuels produced by municipal solid waste treatment plants in the country starting from 2020, and monitoring air quality around them; and (ii) cannot import any alternative fuels resulting from waste treatment operations.

Policy: Regional Law No. 237-ZO “On municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: Municipal land control shall be intended activity of local government over compliance of state bodies, municipalities, legal persons, individual entrepreneurs and natural persons of the land-related provisions of the federal and regional legislation envisaging administrative and other liability for the infringement thereof. The main tasks of municipal land control shall be as follows: (a) prevention (prophylaxis), detection and suppression of the violations of mandatory requirements; (b) interaction with state land supervision with a view of bringing to responsibility of persons guilty of violation of land legislation; (c) supervision over elimination of detected infringements; (d) formation of reliable information on land use on the territory of municipalities for the purpose of cadastre valuation; and (e) detection of unauthorized construction and abandoned immovable property located on municipal land plots.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Convention environnementale [C − 2019/13570] relative aux huiles usagées en Région de Bruxelles-Capitale.
Policy_Content: L’objet de la présente convention est de fixer les modalités d’exécution de la responsabilité élargie des producteurs d’huiles usagées conformément à l’Arrêté du Gouvernement de la Région de Bruxelles-Capitale du 1er décembre 2016 relatif à la gestion des déchets. La convention a pour but de stimuler la prévention ainsi que d’améliorer la gestion des huiles usagées par la collecte sélective et le traitement adéquat des huiles usagées en tenant compte des contraintes organisationnelles, techniques, économiques et écologiques. La convention a également pour objectif d’harmoniser autant que possible les modalités relatives à l’exécution de l’obligation de reprise entre les trois Régions. La convention environnementale lie les parties signataires ainsi que les membres et adhérents. La liste des membres et des adhérents est mise à disposition de Bruxelles Environnement dans le mois suivant l’entrée en vigueur de la convention. Elle est ensuite tenue à jour et mise à disposition de Bruxelles Environnement au plus tard le 31 mars de chaque année.

Policy: Ballast Water Management Act No. 2 of 2019.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down rules for the prevention of the introduction of harmful aquatic organisms and sediments to protect the environment, human health, biodiversity, and natural resources. This Act shall apply to Jamaican ships and foreign ships operating in Jamaican waters. This Act sets forth provisions on the control and management of ships’ ballast and sediments; duties and responsibilities of the owner or master of the ship; additional measures to prevent, reduce or eliminate the transfer of harmful aquatic organisms and pathogens; standards for ballast water exchange; warnings concerning ballast water uptake in certain areas; sediment management; designation of ports for reception of sediments; survey of ships and survey certificates; inspection of foreign ships; reporting of accidents and defects; detection of violations; notification of control actions; maintenance requirements; undue detention or delay of a ship; and offences and penalties. The Minister may make regulations for giving effect to the purposes and provisions of this Act and in particular for prescribing the criteria for determining the adequacy and accessibility of reception facilities.

Policy: Law No. 11.304 creating the certification of origin for "Quilombola" products, from areas already recognized or in the process of recognition, within the State of Paraíba.
Policy_Content: This Law creates the certification of origin for "Quilombola" products, from areas already recognized or in the process of recognition, within the State of Paraíba. The Proclamation shall be applicable to: a) Organizations operating in two or more regional states; b) Foreign Organizations; c) Organizations established in Ethiopia to work on International, Regional or Sub Regional issues or not operate abroad; d) Organizations operating in the City Administration of Addis Ababa or Dire Dawa; and, e) Charitable Organizations established by religious Institutions. It also establishes the Agency for Civil Societies Organizations. The Agency shall register and supervise organizations and be instrumental in their development. Policy: Decree No.  8 “On collection of wild growing berries.”
Policy_Content: This Decree sets out requirements applicable to methods and devices for collection of wild growing berries in forests. It shall be applicable to land of forest fund with the consideration of prohibition and restrictions in force under Article 19 of Forest Code. Berries shall be picked in their state of maturity by hand and/or with the use of devices in the authorized periods of collection. Manual picking of berries shall be performed by bottom-up movements. When picking blackberries and blueberries, the appliance is directed at an angle to the top. Teeth of the of the appliance must avoid catching thick bottom of the shoot. When collecting cranberries, the appliance moves on the surface of the moss and shoots. Wild berry picking device consists of teeth, a container, holder (handles) and meets the following requirements: (a) tooth spacing is at least 0.5 cm; (b)  device body and teeth are made of plastic, metal, wood, rubber or a combination thereof; and (c) there are no cutting edges in the berry tearing place.

Policy: Ley Orgánica del Eficiencia Energética.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley Orgánica de Eficiencia Energética, tiene por objeto establecer el marco legal y régimen de funcionamiento del Sistema Nacional de Eficiencia Energética (SNEE), y promover el uso eficiente, racional y sostenible de la energía en todas sus formas, a fin de incrementar la seguridad energética del país; al ser más eficiente, aumentar la productividad energética, fomentar la competitividad de la economía nacional, construir una cultura de sustentabilidad ambiental y eficiencia energética, aportar a la mitigación del cambio climático y garantizar los derechos de las personas a vivir en un ambiente sano y a tomar decisiones informadas. El ámbito de esta Ley se circunscribe a todas las actividades de carácter público o privado, institucional o particular, para las que se efectúe una  transformación y/o consumo de energía de cualquier forma y para todo fin.

Policy: Decreto Nº 7 – Aprueba el Reglamento sobre notificación de enfermedades transmisibles de declaración obligatoria y su vigilancia.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba en su artículo primero el Reglamento sobre notificación de enfermedades transmisibles de declaración obligatoria, el cual establece un sistema de supervigilancia de enfermedades transmisibles basado en el concepto de Una Salud. El Reglamento establece la nómina de enfermedades transmisibles de declaración obligatoria, estableciendo las respectivas responsabilidades y periodicidad de notificación. Se incluyen los Brotes de Enfermedades Transmitidas por Alimentos (ETA) dentro de los eventos de notificación inmediata. La obligación de notificar recae en todo médico cirujano, prestadores institucionales, laboratorios clínicos, laboratorios en matrices ambientales (agua, alimentos, productos farmacéuticos, artículos para la atención en salud u otros), laboratorios públicos y privados de sanidad animal, ambientales, y centros de investigación.

Policy_Content: El objetivo general de la NDC para el Ecuador es implementar políticas, acciones y esfuerzos que promuevan la reducción de gases de efecto invernadero y el aumento de la resiliencia y disminución de la vulnerabilidad a los efectos adversos del cambio climático en los sectores priorizados en la Estrategia Nacional de Cambio Climático. los objetivos específicos del Acuerdo de París relacionados a: a) limitar el aumento de temperatura global muy por debajo de los 2 grados centígrados por encima de niveles preindustriales; b) aumentar la habilidad de adaptarse a los impactos adversos del cambio climático y aumentar la resiliencia alimentaria de una forma que no amenace la producción alimenticia; y c) hacer que los flujos financieros sean consistentes con un desarrollo bajo en emisiones y resiliente al clima.

Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo expide el Manual Operativo del Proyecto Agenda de Transformación Productiva Amazónica - Reconversión Agroproductiva Sostenible en la Amazonia Ecuatoriana (ATPA-RAPS), que tiene por objeto actualizar y Oficializar las herramientas del Proyecto ATPA-RAPS, cuyo principal instrumento es el Plan de Manejo Integral de Finca (PMTF), las cuales sustentan la entrega de subvenciones o asignaciones a favor de productores (personas naturales o jurídicas sin fines de lucro), y promueven la reconversión agroproductiva Sostenible en la Circunscripción Territorial Especial Amazónica (CTEA) mediante asistencia técnica y capacitación a los productores, enfocados en los siguientes objetivos específicos: 1) Desarrollar mecanismos de información y gestión de la tenencia y el uso de la tierra rural, que permitan realizar planes de manejo integral de las fincas (PMIF) para una productividad sistémica bajo el enfoque de reconversión agroproductiva sostenible y así cumplir con la función social y ambiental de la tierra; 2) Impulsar el desarrollo agroproductivo sostenible de los pobladores rurales de la región Amazónica mediante la entrega de incentivos, apoyo para acceso a créditos productivos, asistencia técnica y extensión rural participativa, enmarcados en la planificación integral productiva de cada finca; 3) Fortalecer los encadenamientos productivos mediante la generación de actividades que promuevan la competitividad sistémica y faciliten el comercio equitativo.

Policy: Order No. 11n of the Ministry of Science and Higher Education validating the Regulation on the state natural reserve "Karadag".
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature reserve "Karadag" with a view of performing the following tasks: (a) protection of natural areas for the purpose of conservation of biological diversity and conservation in the natural state of protected natural complexes and objects; (b) organization and conduct of scientific research; (c) performance of state environmental monitoring; (d) ecological education and promotion of cognitive tourism; and (e) assistance in training of scientific research staff and environmental protection personnel. Any activity contrasting the statute of the reserve shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve, including: (a) landing and stay without authorization issued by the administration of state nature reserve; (b) movement and parking of motor vehicles not related to the functioning of state nature reserve, outside roads and outside authorized places; (c) flight of aircraft and helicopters below 2000 meters above the territory of the reserve and breaking the sound barrier; (d) navigation and stay of vessels; (e) walking domestic animals; (f) construction and placement of agricultural and industrial enterprises, residential and warehouse premises, tourist centers, holiday homes, sanatoria, summer cottages, campgrounds, tent camps and other facilities, not related to the fulfillment of the tasks assigned to the Reserve and not constituting its infrastructure;  (g) commercial, amateurish and sport hunting; (h) industrial, recreational and sport fisheries; (i) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, hunting gear, as well as with wildlife products, except for authorized officials; (j) ploughing up, except for forest fire prevention measures; (k) haymaking, except as fire prevention measures; (l) construction, reconstruction, repair and operation of capital construction facilities, including line structures, not related to the fulfilment of tasks and the functioning of the reserve; (m) explosive works; (n) introduction of wild fauna and wild flora species for acclimatization purposes; (o) application of pesticides, mineral fertilizers and chemical plant protection products and growth stimulants, the use of toxic chemicals for the protection of forests, including for scientific purposes; (s) waste disposal; (t) destruction and damaging of noticeboards, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs and equipped ecological paths and recreation areas; (u) disturbance of wild animal species and feeding thereof by visitors; and (v) all types of photo and video filming (including amateur) without permission of the administration of the Reserve, except for photography and video filming except for photo and video filming as a work order.

Policy: National Action Plan on Combating Antimicrobial Resistance.
Policy_Content: This National Action Plan on Combating Antimicrobial Resistance is a 5-year nationwide multi-sectoral document, based on a 'One-step' approach, developed in line with the Global Action Plan (GAP) on AMR adopted by the World Health Assembly in 2015. The purpose of the Plan is the fight against AMR, considered a national duty and priority not only for professionals working in the field but also for every individual in the Lebanese community. The core objectives and activities to be executed in the NAP consist of the following 5 Axis (i) awareness of AMR; (ii) surveillance of AMR; (iii) infection prevention and control (IPC); (iv) antibiotics (ABX) use; and (v) budget planning and fund attraction.

Policy: National Action Plan on Antimicrobial Resistance
Policy_Content: This National Action Plan on Antimicrobial Resistance is a 5-year nationwide sectoral document aiming at combating the threat posed by antimicrobial resistance (AMR) to public health as well as global health security, as reiterated by the World Health Assembly (WHA) that in May of 2015 urged Member States to align their National Action Plan on AMR with the Global Action Plan on Antimicrobial Resistance (GAP-AMR) which was endorsed at that time. The Strategic Objectives of NAP-MR of Bahrain are aligned with the Global Action Plan and based on the following national needs and priorities (i) improving awareness and understanding of AMR through effective communication, education, and training; (ii) strengthen knowledge and evidence through surveillance of AMR; (iii) reduce the incidence of infection through an effective control in healthcare settings, in animals and food products, and the community and environment; (iv) optimize the use of antimicrobial agents in health care, and in animals and food through strengthening regulations and ensuring access and surveillance of antimicrobial use; (v) promote investments for AMR activities, including research and innovations through new medicines and diagnostics, alternative approaches to manage infectious diseases.

Policy: National Strategy and Action Plan for Combating Antimicrobial Resistance (NAP-AMR).
Policy_Content: This National Strategy and Action Plan for Combating Antimicrobial Resistance is a 5 -year national document for response to AMR in the human health, and food, animal, and environment sectors. It provides strategies and planned activities for the concerned governmental entities, healthcare providers, and facilities, under the “One Health” approach, in line with international guidelines and evidence-based practices. The objectives of the NAP will be achieved by implementing the following strategic activities (i) improving awareness of AMR and promoting behavioral change at the public and professional levels under the “One Health” approach; (ii) performing epidemiologically representative AMR surveillance in humans, animals, agriculture and environment; (iii) optimizing IPC programs implementation in different settings as well as strengthening IPC education; (iv) organizing antimicrobial use in humans, animals, and agriculture, as well as ensuring the adequate quality of antimicrobials used; (v) enhancing academic research in the direction of proving the importance of the actions that are to be taken in the plan, to motivate higher authorities to support it and provide the necessary budget.

Policy: Decision of the Minister of Local Government Plenipotentiary No.28 of 2019 regarding the Public Hygiene Regulation.
Policy_Content: This Regulation consisting of 31 articles aims at regulating the collection of waste produced by population and urban gatherings and the related social, economic and developmental activities, including (i) municipal waste (consisting of solid, semi-solid and liquid waste; and (ii) construction waste and building debris. It establishes that the Municipality undertakes general cleaning work and combats rodents and insects on its own, or it can entrust the work to other companies licensed to practice the activity. It is also prohibited to transport wastes, whatever their source, except by companies and establishments licensed and classified for this purpose. The Regulation provides rules for (i) determining the gathering locations; (ii) determining the places of final disposal; (iii) daily, weekly, agricultural, and animal markets; (iv) hotels, residential, commercial and investment complexes; (v) owners of restaurants and cafes; and (vi) places intended for housing raising of animals or poultry. Art.6 lists prohibited actions such as discharge the waste on the sidewalks, and destroy crops, plants and trees, and picking flowers and fruits in the streets. Art.12 states that it is prohibited to transport water from sewage streams and ponds other than cars licensed for this purpose, and the drivers of these cars must take the necessary precautions to prevent water leakage during its withdrawal or transfer. Requirements for waste transportation are provided for at art.26. Finally, art.30 establishes that the Municipality determines one or more places to collect dead animals and dispose of them appropriately under the supervision of the Environmental Sanitation Office.
