Policy: Acuerdo por el que se emiten los Lineamientos de Operación del Programa de Agromercados Sociales y Sustentables para el ejercicio fiscal 2019.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo establece los Lineamientos que estarán vigentes en el Ejercicio Fiscal 2019, para la ejecución del Programa Agromercados Sociales y Sustentables (AMSYS). Dicho programa busca contribuir a la regulación y equilibrio entre la oferta y la demanda de los productos elegibles a través de la aplicación de incentivos a la comercialización, inversión en infraestructura de almacenamiento y organización de los pequeños y medianos productores de las regiones y entidades federativas con problemas de comercialización, coadyuvando con la Secretaría al uso eficiente y racional de los recursos suelo, agua y la promoción de prácticas agrícolas sustentables, para abastecer los requerimientos de la demanda nacional de alimentos. Más precisamente, el objetivo general del programa AMSYS es mejorar las condiciones de comercialización de los pequeños y medianos productores de cosechas nacionales, mediante el otorgamiento de incentivos que les permitan enfrentar con mayor eficiencia el proceso comercial y mejorar su ingreso. Constituyen objetivos específicos: a) otorgar incentivos a los pequeños y medianos productores para la comercialización mediante instrumentos de administración de riesgos de precios, complemento al ingreso objetivo de los productores; incentivos para atender problemas emergentes de comercialización, procesos para la certificación de calidad, capacitación y asistencia técnica para la competitividad agrícola; b) asignar recursos para la inversión en infraestructura de almacenamiento de pequeños productores en el centro y sur-sureste del país, para la construcción y rehabilitación de sistemas de almacenamiento de granos y oleaginosas, y el desarrollo de las capacidades organizativas, administrativas, empresariales, comerciales, operativas y financieras, para garantizar el almacenamiento, la conservación y calidad del grano, que facilite el acceso al sistema financiero y a mercados con productos de calidad.

Policy: Resolución Nº 59-2019 ─ Aprueba la utilización de un sello de seguridad durante el transporte en contenedores cerrados de madera proveniente de plantaciones comerciales para la exportación a nivel nacional.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la utilización de un sello de seguridad durante el transporte en contenedores cerrados de madera proveniente de plantaciones comerciales para la exportación a nivel nacional y establece el procedimiento especial para su utilización. La Asociación Panameña de Reforestadores y Afines de Panamá (ANARAP), suministrará los sellos de seguridad a sus asociados y no asociados que estén ejecutando aprovechamiento forestal en las áreas plantadas, y reportará semanalmente a las Direcciones Regionales del Ministerio de Ambiente la numeración de los sellos de seguridad entregados y los nombres de las respectivas personas naturales o jurídicas que lo adquieren. Una vez que se adquiera el sello de seguridad, el contenedor cargado se dirigirá a las oficinas o puestos de Ministerio de Ambiente donde se le entregará la guía de transporte terrestre correspondiente y una vez verificada la carga, se procederá a la colocación de éste. En la guía de trasporte terrestre se deberá colocar el número de sello de seguridad, que no se podrá retirar hasta tanto el contenedor llegue al punto de fumigación.

Policy: Law No. 1.304 providing for forestry reforestation within the State of Roraima.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 14 articles, provides for the mandatory forestry reforestation within the State of Roraima. This Law establishes the obligation of forestry reforestation for natural or legal persons who exploit, use or transform forestry raw material or have authorization to suppress natural vegetation for alternative use of the soil, by planting suitable, exotic and/or native species. In particular, it establishes that anyone who exploits or suppresses native vegetation on public lands, as well as private forestry area under any regime, without authorization or in disagreement with said authorization, shall comply with the forest restoration. The holder of an authorization to suppress natural vegetation for alternative use of the soil, is exempted from complying with forest reforestation. Any forestry entities must license their activities in the competent environmental agency. Forest reforestation can be carried out by any of the following modalities: Planting in degraded areas, in their own lands or third parties, to meet the needs of the enterprise, through technical projects approved by the competent environmental agency of the National Environmental System (SISNAMA); Collecting the value corresponding to the replacement debt on behalf of the State Fund for the Environment and Water Resources (FEMARH), for environmental projects that seek to promote forest plantations; Purchase of replacement credit of an individual or legal entity accredited by the competent environmental agency and derived from a project, pursuant to the present and federal regulations.

Policy: Genetically Modified Organisms (Deliberate Release etc.) (Miscellaneous Amendments) (Scotland) Regulations 2019 (S.S.I. No. 86 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Genetically Modified Organisms (Deliberate Release) (Scotland) Regulations 2002 to make fresh and supplementary provision to transpose and implement for Scotland, Directive (EU) 2015/412 as regards the possibility for the member States to restrict or prohibit the cultivation of genetically modified organisms (GMOs) in their territory. Two new regulations (26A and 26B) permit the Scottish Ministers to demand of an applicant that all or part of Scotland is excluded from an application made to them, to a competent authority of another part of the UK or to another member State for consent to place on the market a GMO under Part C (placing on the market of GMOs as or in products) of the Deliberate Release Directive (2001/18/EC) or for an authorisation to market genetically modified food or feed under Council Regulation (EC) 1829/2003 on genetically modified food and feed and allow the Scottish Ministers to request reintegration of all or part of Scotland into a consent, renewed consent or authorisation. Other new provisions (29A and 29B) provide the Scottish Ministers with the power to restrict consent (including a renewed consent) granted by them or otherwise under the Deliberate Release Directive or authorisation granted by a competent authority under Council Regulation (EC) 1829/2003 where a demand in terms of regulation 26A has not been sought or where an applicant has refused to agree with a demand made under that regulation within 30 days, and where there is a compelling ground to do so.

Policy: Law No. 122-VI “On environmental audit”.
Policy_Content: This Law determines the legal and organizational basis for conducting environmental audits and is aimed at improving the environmental substantiation and effectiveness of economic entities. The scope of environmental audit shall be to improve the activities in the field of environmental protection and environmental security, as well as to prevent and reduce the environmental impact of economic and other activities. The objectives of the environmental audit shall be as follows: (a) analysis and assessment of compliance with environmental protection and environmental security requirements in the course of economic and other activities; (b) assessment of efficiency, completeness and validity of environmental protection and environmental safety measures carried out by the customer; and (c) identification and determination of environmental problems at the objects of environmental audit. Environmental audit is based on the following principles: (a) mandatory consideration of requirements of environmental protection and ecological security in the process of environmental audit; (b) consideration of natural and social and economic peculiarities of the territory, present and future state of the environment; (c) objectivity of environmental audit, reliability of the results of environmental audit and conclusions of environmental audit related thereto; (f) independence of environmental auditor and environmental audit organization from the customer of environmental audit, state bodies and other entities concerned; (g) competence of the environmental auditor and environmental audit organization in the field of environmental protection and environmental security, confirmed by qualification certification of environmental audit; (h) provision of the customer's environmental audit with the necessary conditions and resources to conduct environmental audit, confidentiality and non-disclosure of information obtained in the process of environmental audit; (i) reliability and completeness of information in the field of environmental impact as a result of economic and other activities of the customer's environmental audit; (j) responsibility of the environmental auditor or environmental audit organization for the results of the environmental audit within the limits established by the legislation of Turkmenistan; (k) prevention of any form of influence on environmental auditors or environmental audit organizations in order to prevent the environmental audit; (l) performance of environmental audit by the customer of reasonable proposals and recommendations received as a result of the environmental audit; and (m) mandatory qualification certification of environmental auditors and environmental audit organizations. Objects of environmental audit are enterprises and business entities, regardless of the forms of ownership, or certain types of their activities.

Constituyen objetivos específicos del programa: a) promover, a través de los extensionistas, mejoras en los procesos productivos de las Unidades de Producción Familiar asociadas; b) impulsar la incorporación de Unidades de Producción Familiar asociadas, a proyectos de inversión para el establecimiento de empresas cuyo objeto social sea desempeñar funciones económicas de las cadenas productivas, entre ellas compras y ventas de productos e insumos; c) incentivar a Unidades de Producción Familiar asociadas, para que mediante proyectos de inversión accedan a activos fijos para mejorar su capacidad productiva y realizar un aprovechamiento sustentable de los recursos naturales; d) articular la investigación con el extensionismo para promover la aplicación de componentes tecnológicos, así como atender problemas estructurales del medio rural o de las cadenas productivas.El programa está integrado por los siguientes componentes: 1) Desarrollo de Capacidades, Extensión y Asesoría Rural; 2) Integración Económica de las Cadenas Productivas; 3) Fortalecimiento de las Unidades de Producción Familiar; 4) Investigación y Transferencia de Tecnología.

Policy: Regulation containing instructions for the Coast Guard (2019:84).
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Ministry pf Justice  defines the tasks and duties of the Coast Guard of Sweden and provides for some related matters such as international cooperation. The main task of the Coast Guard is maritime surveillance. The Coast Guard shall also be responsible for environmental rescue services at sea in order to limit consequences of accidents and pollution also for purposes of Antarctic Convention and other specified marine pollution treaties. As to monitoring of fishing, the Coast Guard shall conduct such monitoring of the fishery as the Swedish authority pursuant to some bilateral fisheries agreements and Regulation (EU) No 1380/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 December 2013 on common fisheries policy. The Coast Guard may appoint competent officials to be inspectors for European Union purposes. The Coast Guard shall also be responsible for Sweden's part of the control measures that European the Union is implementing at sea within the area governed by the North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAFC).

Policy: Ley Nº 5/2019 - Ley de estructuras agrarias de la Comunitat Valenciana.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de estructuras agrarias de la Comunitat Valenciana, tiene por objeto establecer un marco general que impulse la mejora de las estructuras agrarias en la Comunitat Valenciana con el fin de garantizar la viabilidad y sostenibilidad del sector agrario, así como de alcanzar los objetivos generales de desarrollo. Los objetivos de esta Ley son los siguientes: 1) Mejorar las estructuras agrarias de la Comunitat Valenciana, con el fin de garantizar la viabilidad económica, social y ambiental de las explotaciones agrarias y la obtención de rentas agrarias suficientes que aseguren unas óptimas condiciones de vida a sus titulares; 2) Consolidar la agricultura y la ganadería como actividades económicas de referencia, con el fomento, cuando corresponda, de otras actividades con carácter complementario, haciéndolas compatibles con el respeto a los valores naturales, la conservación del patrimonio artístico-histórico de interés agrario y la integridad del entorno; 3) Establecer y desarrollar medidas de reordenación, agrupación, redimensionamiento de las explotaciones agrarias, mejora estructural y de infraestructuras agrarias y reestructuración de la propiedad en aquellas zonas con especiales dificultades o con excesiva fragmentación con el fin de asegurar la viabilidad y rentabilidad de las explotaciones agrarias, luchar contra el abandono de la actividad y de las parcelas agrarias y fomentar el acceso a la tierra —en particular, de mujeres y personas jóvenes— para crear nuevas explotaciones o ampliar las ya existentes, prestando especial atención al apoyo a la constitución de iniciativas de gestión en común de la tierra, con cuantas medidas favorezcan su desarrollo; 4) Mitigar los efectos del cambio climático mediante el establecimiento de medidas adecuadas y contribuir a la sostenibilidad de la actividad agraria y del desarrollo rural con actuaciones de adaptación a sus efectos; 5) Facilitar la resiliencia territorial de áreas con elevados valores medioambientales, agrológicos o paisajísticos, especialmente en aquellas zonas de la comunidad vulnerables debido a cualquier razón, en particular a la presión derivada del cambio de uso del suelo, o bien con la presencia de algún elevado riesgo ambiental, de tal manera que se potencie la conservación y permanencia de dichos valores o se reduzca la vulnerabilidad frente al riesgo, a través de la reorganización espacial y funcional de la estructura territorial existente. Así mismo se favorecerán medidas de conservación del suelo agrario y de conservación de cultivos tradicionales e infraestructuras asociadas en zonas forestales que conformen mosaicos agroforestales para la prevención y extinción de incendios; 6) Apoyar las explotaciones agrarias mediante la aplicación de incentivos fiscales a la adquisición de explotaciones agrarias y elementos afectos y de fincas rústicas; 7) Favorecer el mantenimiento de la población vinculada a la actividad agraria, reconociendo el papel de la mujer en el mundo rural, promoviendo la participación e incorporación de las mujeres en la actividad agraria en condiciones de igualdad así como la incorporación de las personas jóvenes para facilitar el relevo generacional en las explotaciones agrarias; 8) Promover la viabilidad, adaptación y mejora de los regadíos y medidas que fomenten el uso sostenible del agua en la agricultura, singularmente en lo que se refiere a la eficiencia energética e hidráulica en los regadíos, el aprovechamiento para riego de las aguas regeneradas, la recuperación y conservación de los recursos hídricos y el buen estado de las masas de agua y ecosistemas asociados, así como la prevención de la contaminación difusa de las masas de agua; 9) Promover el desarrollo y la implantación de las energías renovables, y en especial el impulso de la producción de energía a partir de la utilización de la biomasa de origen agrícola o silvícola y de otras fuentes alternativas de energía sostenibles como instrumento de mejora de las explotaciones agrarias y de las condiciones de vida de la población rural, a través del fomento de la autosuficiencia energética y la sostenibilidad económica y ambiental, un mejor aprovechamiento de los recursos y subproductos de la actividad agraria y la aplicación de un enfoque circular en la gestión de las explotaciones; 10) Mejorar las infraestructuras agrarias que permitan una mejora de la viabilidad y sostenibilidad de las explotaciones agrarias y de las condiciones de vida y desarrollo integral de la población rural; 11) Conservar el patrimonio natural, genético y cultural asociado a la actividad agraria tradicional de la Comunitat Valenciana.

Policy: Décret n° 2019-029/PR du 27/02/19 précisant les modalités de la mise en valeur des terres rurales agricoles autres que celles appartenant à l’Etat et aux collectivités territoriales
Policy_Content: Le présent décret, pris en application des dispositions de la loi n° 2018-005 du 14 juin 2018 portant code foncier et domanial, précise les modalités de mise en valeur des terres rurales agricoles. Les modalités de mise en valeur tiennent aux conditions, à la procédure et au cadre institutionnel du règlement des charges d’exploitation des terres rurales concernées, ainsi qu’il résulte des dispositions des articles 655 à 663 du code foncier et domanial précisées et complétées par le présent décret. Le bail prévu à l’article 662 du code foncier et domanial est un contrat d’affermage. Sans préjudice des dispositions de l’article 163 du code foncier et domanial, ce contrat d’affermage est conclu devant la section villageoise de gestion foncière, sous l’égide de la commission de gestion foncière de la commune, selon une procédure d’entente directe et aux coûts d’affermage pratiqués dans la localité. Le contrat d’affermage est contresigné par les présidents de la commission de gestion foncière de la commune et de la section villageoise de gestion foncière concernée. Il est obligatoirement certifié par le maire. Lorsque les parties ne parviennent pas à s’entendre sur les conditions de jouissance et le prix d’affermage, le président de la commission de gestion foncière de la commune saisit le maire pour un règlement amiable. En cas d’échec des négociations, le tribunal compétent est saisi par la partie la plus diligente.

Policy: Decree of 27 February 2019 approving the Regulation for the realization of works modifying the current state of the land.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 13 articles and six Annexes, regulates the realization of works modifying the current state of the land. It establishes requirements and actions subject to the urban planning licensing for major works that involve works or activities that modify the current state of the land. Likewise, they are subject to the requirements of this Regulation actions of public administrations whose scope is equivalent to the characteristics of a major work. The protection of public and private interests, and the environment, are channeled through environmental impact assessment studies, restoration and environmental monitoring plans, as well as geological, geotechnical and other documentation that this regulation provides. The general rules of procedure establish that it is not possible to start any of the mentioned activities without the corresponding urban planning licence, according to the general, special or simplified procedure provided for in Regulation of construction based on the license to obtain, etc. The Annexes establish the following: Contents of the environmental impact assessment (Annex I); Content of the environmental restoration plan (Annex II); Content of the environmental monitoring plan (Annex III); Affidavit (Annex IV); Other technical studies: documentation to be submitted (Annex V); Specific studies: documentation to be submitted (Annex VI).

Policy_Content: Con fecha 1 de septiembre de 2017 entró en vigor la Ley 4/2017, de 13 de julio, del Suelo y de los Espacios Naturales Protegidos de Canarias, cuyo artículo 12.5 contiene un mandato a la Administración autonómica dirigido a crear, en la Consejería competente en materia de ordenación del territorio, un órgano colegiado encargado de emitir el Informe Único en la tramitación de los instrumentos de ordenación establecidos por dicha Ley, así como para actuar como órgano ambiental autonómico en los procedimientos de evaluación ambiental estratégica de planes y de evaluación de impacto ambiental de proyectos. En virtud de esto se crea mediante el presente decreto el Órgano Colegiado de Evaluación Ambiental e Informe Único de Canarias y se aprueba su Reglamento de Organización y Funcionamiento, que figura como anexo.

Policy: Decreto-ley Nº 2/2019 - Modifica la Ley Nº 4/2017, Ley del Suelo y de los Espacios Naturales Protegidos de Canarias.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto-ley modifica la Ley del Suelo y de los Espacios Naturales Protegidos de Canarias, en aspectos relacionados con el Protector del medio territorial de Canarias. Se dispone que las personas físicas y jurídicas que se comprometan a aportar recursos de todo tipo y a colaborar con las administraciones competentes en actuaciones y proyectos de naturaleza territorial y ambiental, y que se inscriban voluntariamente en el Registro de colaboradores con el medio ambiente y la sostenibilidad territorial, podrán tener la condición de protector del medio territorial de Canarias. La condición de protector del medio territorial de Canarias otorgará preferencia para la obtención de ayudas públicas y subvenciones a otorgar por la consejería competente en materia de ordenación del territorio y del medio ambiente con el fin de poner en práctica medidas de protección del medio ambiente que se deseen implantar por las personas interesadas. La condición de protector del medio territorial de Canarias deberá ser considerada en la adjudicación de los contratos celebrados por las administraciones y entidades del sector público y en el otorgamiento de los títulos administrativos habilitantes.

Policy: Decree No. 4382-R regulating the Programme for Integrated Management of Waters and Natural Landscape.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 12 articles, provides for regulating the Programme for Integrated Management of Waters and Natural Landscape. This Programme aims to promote the sustainable management of the water resources of the State of Espírito Santo. The Program's activities cover strategic urban and rural areas, with investments planned for the protection and recovery of water sources involving the expansion of basic sanitation services, actions aimed at strengthening water management, reforestation support and sustainable land management practices and from water. The Programme covers actions for the following investment sectors: Integrated Water Resource Management and Disaster Risk Management; Expansion of Sanitary Sewage Coverage and Improvement of the Efficiency of Basic Sanitation Services; Restoration of Forestry Coverage and Water Supply Management; Institutional Strengthening of Programme Management.

Policy: Ordinance No. 3-dp of the Ministry of Agriculture, Food Industry and Land Reclamation validating the Methodology for adjustment of soil survey materials.
Policy_Content: Methodology for adjustment of soil survey materials has as its scope making corrections to the materials of the previously conducted soil surveys, addenda to the content, rectification of the boundaries of the contours of the soil on the map or re-compilation of cartographic annexes, i.e. to bring the materials of large-scale studies of the past years in accordance with the requirements of the assessment of the current state; systematization of data on the qualitative characteristics of land and soil fertility (scores of index of quality and yield of soil) of their economic assessment, the environmental condition of the territories with the analysis of the development of the processes that have a negative impact on the land; and development of recommendations on prevention of negative processes and liquidation of their consequences, effective use of agricultural lands; state land accounting and provision of state authorities at all levels, individuals and legal entities with information on quality of agricultural land. The material of large-scale soil surveys should contain recommendations on the following issues arising from soil cover studies: (a) land transformation; (b) soil protection from water and wind erosion; (c) irrigation, drainage, soil improvement; (d) chemical soil improvement (plastering, etc.); (e) correct placement of crop rotations; (f) composition of crops; (g) features of agricultural machinery and fertilizer application depending on soil conditions; (h) improvement of hayfields and pastures; and (i) economic assessment of soil.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 87 validating the Regulation on the procedure for determining index of quality and yield of soil.
Policy_Content: Regulation on the procedure for determining index of quality and yield of soil has as its purpose to ensure the reliability of land-cadastral data, identification and display in the planning and cartographic materials of the changes in the quality composition of soil, regulation of legal relations concerning performance of index of quality and yield of soil in accordance with unified technology, ensuring comparability of the results at the national level. The scope of determining index of quality and yield of soil is a comparative assessment of its quality and natural productive capacity in points at an average level of agricultural technique for growing crops. Index of quality and yield of soil refers to the main type of accounting (inventory) of land quality, and is the basis for the subsequent cost evaluation of agricultural land, land survey, promotion of rational and effective use of land and identification of reserves for agricultural production. All agricultural lands shall be subject to determination of index of quality and yield of soil regardless of departmental affiliation and right of use thereof. Works for determining index of quality and yield of soil shall be technically combined with soil survey, correction or other cadastral surveys.

Policy: National Environment Act, 2019.
Policy_Content: This Act provides generally for the protection of the environment in Uganda and makes changes to environmental law so as to address emerging environmental issues including climate change, the management of hazardous chemicals, the environmental concerns arising out of petroleum activities and the management of plastics. It also establishes a specialised unit, the Environmental Protection Force, to handle enforcement. The Act consists of 182 sections divided into 17 Parts: Preliminary (I); Institutional Arrangements (II); Funds of the Authority and the National Environment Fund (III); Environmental Planning (IV); Management of the Green Environment (V); Sound Management of Chemicals and Product Control (VI); Control of Pollution and Environmental Emergency Preparedness (VII); Management of Waste (VIII); Establishment of Environmental Standards (IX); Environmental and Social Assessment (X); Environmental Easements (XI); Environmental Compliance and Enforcement (XII); Judicial Proceedings (XIII); Environmental  Information and Literacy (XIV); International Obligations (XV); Offences, Penalties, Fees, Fines and other Charges (XVI); General Provisions (XVII). The Act is completed by nine Schedules.

Policy: Ley Nº 30918 - Ley que fortalece los mecanismos para el tratamiento de las acciones de demarcación territorial.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto fortalecer los mecanismos para el tratamiento de las acciones de demarcación territorial a fin de contribuir con la adecuada gestión y administración del territorio. A tal propósito, se modifican los Criterios Técnicos para la Demarcación Territorial, en base a los siguientes criterios: 1) Las acciones de demarcación territorial se sustentan en los principios de unidad, contigüidad, continuidad e integración y en criterios técnicos de orden poblacional, geográfico, socioeconómico y cultural mínimos, según lo establezca el reglamento de la presente Ley; 2) En caso de que en el tratamiento de una acción de demarcación territorial se evidencie alguna incompatibilidad entre distintas leyes de naturaleza demarcatoria, se aplica la más reciente, en la materia que es incompatible.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 6-2019-MINAE ─ Programa Nacional de Etiquetado Ambiental y de Eficiencia Energética.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo oficializa el Programa Nacional de Etiquetado Ambiental y de Eficiencia Energética y establece las condiciones de gestión de las etiquetas ambientales y energéticas de Costa Rica. Policy: Order No. 26-NK of the Chairman of the Committee for Construction and Housing and Public Utilities of the Ministry of Industry and Infrastructure Development “On approval of the normative document on maintaining the state urban planning inventory”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the procedure for keeping the state urban land-use planning inventory and it shall be mandatory for the state body authorized for keeping and updating of the aforesaid inventory. This normative document defines the technical aspects of the management of state urban planning inventory and its automated information system, structure and main content of databases of the state urban planning inventory, the procedure for updating the data, the general requirements for hardware and software, basic principles of information interaction with other databases and information systems. It also envisages the modalities of issuance of land-use planning inventory certificates and release of information related to the state of territory (landscape, construction, transport and engineering infrastructure, and provision of public services and utilities). This Order also establishes the procedure for mapping of the territory. The organizational aspect of keeping state land-use planning inventory shall be the development of a technical and economic substantiation of the automated information system of the state urban planning inventory and coordination with the authorized body in the field of information systems, preparation of terms of reference for automated information system of the state urban planning inventory and preparation of the work plan for the maintenance of the state urban planning inventory.

Policy: Pharmacy and Medicines Regulatory Authority Act, 2019
Policy_Content: This Act establishes an Authority known as the Pharmacy and Medicines Regulatory Authority. The Authority shall grant pharmaceutical licences and marketing authorizations; inspect any premises used for the purpose of manufacturing, distribution, sale, importation or exportation of medicines or allied substances or for any other purposes regulated under this Act; regulate and control the manufacture, importation, exportation, distribution and sale of medicines and allied substances and veterinary products; regulate and control the advertising and promotion of medicines and allied substances; register and regulate pharmacy practice premises and personnel and their training; in consultation with the relevant professional bodies, establish, maintain and develop standards for the operation of pharmacy practice premises and the pharmacy profession in general; serve and protect the public interest in all matters relating to the sale of medicines and allied substances; issue clinical trial licences; monitor the conduct of clinical trials; establish, maintain and enforce standards relating to the manufacture, importation, exportation, distribution and sale of medicines and allied substances; approve the use of unregistered and unauthorized medical products for trial or for compassionate use; establish a functional system for pre- and post-marketing surveillance of safety, quality, efficacy and effectiveness of medical products and to optimize the risk-benefit balance; establish, maintain and enforce standards for medicine quality control laboratories; formulate, disseminate, and advise the Minister on, policies relating to the regulation and control of medicines and allied substances; collaborate with corresponding medicines regulatory authorities in other countries; continuously review rules, regulations, guidelines and procedures pertaining to the implementation of this Act and make amendments where necessary in order to keep pace with changing times and pharmaceutical industry demands; in consultation with relevant research institutions, determine national priorities in pharmaceutical research; share data on pharmacy practice or medicine with other countries; and perform all such things as are connected with, or incidental to, the functions of the Authority under this Act. The Authority also may, upon application by a person, issue veterinary shop licence to the person to sell a prescribed list of veterinary medicinal products, under the control and management of such persons as the Authority may authorize. According to the Act, “medicine”, among others, means a substance or a mixture of substances used or purported to be suitable for use or manufactured or sold for use in the diagnosis, treatment, mitigation, modification or prevention of a disease, abnormal physical or mental state, or the symptoms thereof, in humans or in animals. The Act also provides for registration and regulation of pharmacists, pharmacy technologists, pharmacy assistants and medical representatives; registration and regulation of pharmacy practice premises; licences, import and export permits; regulation and registration of medicines and allied substances; regulation of clinical trials; the national medicines quality control laboratory; inspections; offences and penalties; and harmonization of regulation of medical products and international cooperation.

Policy: Resolution No. 9/19 approving the Convention on Nuclear Safety.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Convention on Nuclear Safety, adopted in Vienna on 17 June 1994 and approved for accession by the Republic of Angola. The objectives of this Convention, consisting of 35 articles divided into four Chapters, are: achieve and maintain a high level of nuclear safety throughout the world by strengthening national measures and international cooperation, including, where appropriate, safety-related technical cooperation; establish and maintain effective protection at nuclear facilities against potential radiological hazards in order to protect individuals, society and the environment from the harmful effects of ionizing radiation of such facilities; prevent accidents with radiological consequences and mitigate these consequences in the case they occur. The Convention is divided as follows: Purpose, Definition and Scope of the Application (Chap. I); Obligations and General Provisions (Chap. II); Meetings of Signatories (Chap. III); Final Clauses and Other Provisions(Chap. IV).

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 337-2019 ─ Guía de Buenas Prácticas Ambientales para emplazamientos de telefonía móvil.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo aprueba la Guía de Buenas Prácticas Ambientales para emplazamientos de telefonía móvil, como instrumentos de gestión empresarial que orientan a los inversionistas sobre la adopción de medidas y recomendaciones efectivas para brindar sostenibilidad a su actividad y reducir el impacto negativo en el medio ambiente. Las Buenas Prácticas Ambientales consisten en una serie de medidas o recomendaciones orientadas a prevenir, mitigar, corregir o compensar los principales impactos ambientales generados por un emplazamiento de telefonía móvil durante cada etapa del ciclo de vida del proyecto, es decir, las etapas de Factibilidad, Construcción, Operación, Cierre y Post-Clausura.

Policy: Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Regulations 2019.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, consisting of 275 sections divided into 18 Parts and completed by six Schedules, prescribe all matters required or permitted by the Act to be prescribed or necessary or convenient to be prescribed for carrying out or giving effect to the Act. The Regulations regulate use of the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park (Marine Park) providing for the following: give effect to, and enforcing the observance of, the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Zoning Plan 2003 (the Zoning Plan) and Plans of Management, which are made pursuant to the Act; grant permissions in the Marine Park, imposing conditions which permissions may be subject to, charging fees by the Authority in respect of permissions, keeping records relating to permissions and a regime for modification, revocation and suspension of permissions; accreditation of Traditional use of Marine Resources Agreements (TUMRAs) entered into between Traditional Owners in respect of the Marine Park; regulate discharge of sewage in the Marine Park; regulate property and things in the Marine Park; report by the Authority on the condition of the Region through the Outlook Report; regulate interactions with cetaceans in the Marine Park; regulate vessel activity in the Marine Park; and collect Environmental Management Charge (EMC) by commercial operators in the Marine Park.

Policy: Heritage Conservation Act (2019)
Policy_Content: This Act regulates heritage conservation. The objective of this Act is the preservation and diversity of cultural heritage, which is ensured with the following activities: preservation and protection of cultural monuments, heritage conservation areas and the environments of cultural value surrounding thereof; protection of archaeological finds and protected archaeological sites; and safeguarding of intangible cultural heritage. The provisions of the Building Code and Land Improvement Act shall be applied to building on monuments, heritage conservation areas and the buffer zones thereof, taking account of the specifications provided for in this Act. If possible, the notification or permit procedure provided for in this Act shall be combined with the notification or permit procedure prescribed for in the Building Code or Land Improvement Act. This Act shall be applied to the designation of monuments, heritage conservation areas and protected archaeological sites and organising the protection and preservation of monuments, heritage conservation areas, protected archaeological sites and archaeological finds. This Act also applies within an exclusive economic zone for the purposes of the Exclusive Economic Zone Act.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Action Plan for 2019 implementing Poverty reduction strategy.
Policy_Content: Action Plan for 2019 implementing Poverty reduction strategy is nationwide cross-sectoral policy document aimed at restructuring the system of state support of employment and complete or partial state subsidizing for creation of new jobs.  Action Plan envisages performance of the following arrangements: (a) improving the effectiveness of vocational training for registered unemployed and vulnerable workers with low qualifications; (b) medium-term forecasting of labor demand by region, economic activity and occupation; (c) assistance in setting up one’s own business entities and provision of extension services; (d) promotion of employment of rural population by farmers and promotion of flexible employment of rural youth; (e) introduction of effective incentives for employment of rural population as a result of creation of flexible training network on small business, introduction of state support for family business development in rural areas (financial, legal, administrative-consulting, etc.); (f) minimizing the risks of social exclusion of the rural population; (g) attraction of investments for development of farms, private peasant farms and agricultural cooperatives; (h) restoration, conservation and sustainable use of ecosystems, in particular as a result of the introduction of a mechanism of economic incentives for land use and protection and soil fertility improvement; and (i) increasing the coverage of the poor population with social support, providing targeted assistance and improving the effectiveness of social support programs.

Policy: Ley Nº 6/2019 - Ley del Estatuto de las personas consumidoras de Extremadura.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley del Estatuto de los Consumidores de Extremadura, tiene por objeto garantizar la defensa, promoción y protección de los derechos y legítimos intereses de las personas consumidoras en el ámbito territorial de Extremadura, en cumplimiento del mandato establecido en los apartados 1 y 2 del Artículo 51 de la Constitución española y en el ejercicio de la competencia exclusiva que el Estatuto de Autonomía confiere a la Comunidad Autónoma de Extremadura. Esta Ley será de aplicación a las relaciones entre personas consumidoras y empresas. La renuncia previa a los derechos que esta norma reconoce a las personas consumidoras es nula, siendo, asimismo, nulos los actos realizados en fraude de ley de acuerdo con lo establecido en el Código Civil. Asimismo, se consideran nulas aquellas cláusulas contractuales que eximen de responsabilidad a la empresa por cualquier tipo de daño y perjuicio que pudiera causar a la persona consumidora.

Policy: Décret nº2019-138 fixant les attributions du Ministre de l’Environnement et du Développement Durable ainsi que l’Organisation Générale de son Ministère.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les attributions du Ministre de l’Environnement et du Développement Durable (MEDD) ainsi que l’organisation générale de son Ministère. Sur la base des principes et des dispositions de la Charte de l’Environnement et des Conventions Internationales relatives à la protection de l’Environnement, ratifiées par Madagascar, le Ministre de l’Environnement et du Développement Durable est chargé de la conception, de la coordination, de la mise en oeuvre et du suivi-évaluation de la politique de l’Etat en matière d’environnement et de Développement Durable. Le Ministre de l’Environnement et du Développement Durable s’assigne comme mission « La Sauvegarde et la valorisation de notre environnement et de nos ressources naturelles uniques pour le bien-être de la population Malagasy ainsi que le développement durable du pays ».

Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objet de fixer les attributions du Ministre de l’Agriculture, de l’Elevage et de la Pêche ainsi que l’organisation générale de son Ministère. Le Ministère de l’Agriculture, de l’Elevage et de la Pêche a pour mission de concevoir, mettre en oeuvre et coordonner les stratégies nécessaires aux réalisations des objectifs énoncés dans la Politique Générale de l’Etat (PGE) dans le domaine de l’Agriculture, de l’Elevage et de la Pêche ainsi qu’en matière de recherche agricole. Policy: Law No. 10.840 creating the Incentive Programme for the Production of Regional Fruit Pulps by small farmers within the State of Mato Grosso.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 10 articles, creates the Incentive Programme for the Production of Regional Fruit Pulps by small farmers within the State of Mato Grosso. This Law considers as a rural family establishment for the production of fruit pulp located in the rural areas which is under the responsibility of family farmers or family entrepreneurs and that meets the criteria set in Federal Law 11.326 of 24 July 2006. The State may work in partnership with unions, cooperatives and associations of rural producers to implement the programme with small farmers. Unions, Cooperatives and Associations of Rural Producers must keep up with their certificates. For the purpose of labelling and registration, the name of the products may be increased by one of the following expressions: I - "artisanal"; II - "homemade"; or III - "colonial". The labelling on the package containing the fruit pulp produced in a rural family establishment shall state the following standards: name of the product; name of the family farmer and the address of the rural property where it was produced; and other needed information.

Policy: Arrêté n° 3041 du 20 février 2019 portant création et attributions du laboratoire de physico chimie de l’environnement de l’institut national de recherche en sciences exactes et naturelles.

Le laboratoire de physico-chimie de l’environnement est chargé, notamment, de: soutenir toute recherche environnementale; réaliser des analyses physico-chimiques de l’environnement au profit de tiers et en particulier des agents polluants; participer à la prise de décisions en matière de recherche et développement durable; contribuer à la formation à la recherche et par la recherche.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 74 validating the Regulation on use of revenues from compensation of losses of forestry production for protection, afforestation, increasing productivity of forests and reproduction of particularly valuable forest tree species in Kyrgyz Republic.
Policy_Content: Regulation on use of revenues from compensation of losses of forestry production for protection, afforestation, increasing productivity of forests and reproduction of particularly valuable forest tree species in Kyrgyz Republic establishes the procedure for the use by the national executive authority in the field of environmental protection of revenues for protection, afforestation, increasing productivity of forests and reproduction of particularly valuable forest tree species. Reproduction of particularly valuable forest species shall be performed: (a) on land of the state forest fund - by the authorized state body; (b) outside the land of the state forest fund - by local self-government together with the authorized state body. Reproduction of particularly precious forest species shall not be applicable in case of removal thereof for the following purposes: (a) mitigation of the consequences of natural emergency situations and cataclysms; (b) control of mass outbreaks of pests and forest diseases; and (c) felling of artificial plantations of particularly precious tree species. Funds received as compensation of losses of forestry production shall be used for reproduction of particularly valuable forest tree species in order to prevent water and wind erosion of soil, to improve tree composition and planting of protective forests.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 73 validating the Regulation on the Department of organic agriculture subordinated to the Ministry of Agriculture, Food Industry and Land Reclamation of Kyrgyz Republic.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes that Department of organic agriculture subordinated to the Ministry of Agriculture, Food Industry and Land Reclamation of Kyrgyz Republic shall be authorized state institution promoting organic agriculture with a view of increasing ecological production of agricultural commodities and promoting introduction of advanced technologies in the field of organic agriculture in Kyrgyz Republic. The scope of the Department shall be to increase export of organic agricultural production. The objectives of the Department shall be implementation of state policy in the field of organic agriculture and performance of interdepartmental coordination in the field of agricultural production. The Department shall perform the following functions: (a) establishment, jointly with scientific research institutions, of priority directions of scientific research in the field of organic agriculture and agricultural biotechnologies; (b) development of innovative agricultural biotechnologies for organic agriculture; (c) elaboration of national standards for organic agriculture; (d) elaboration of certification system for organic agriculture; (e) development and application of biofertilizers; (f) development of rules and regulations for packaging, labelling, import and export of organic agricultural commodities; and (g) registration of organic agricultural land and producers of organic agricultural commodities.

Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto erradicar el comercio ilícito de mercancías, tipificando los delitos de comercio ilícito, el contrabando y la falsificación de productos regulados y estableciendo sus sanciones administrativas y penales. Policy: Decree of 20 February 2019 approving the Regulation for drug residues waste management.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation is to deal with drug residues waste management, whether they are generated domestically or generated by the activity of pharmacies, to ensure their correct and efficient management. The Regulation applies to domestic medication and drugs waste, not eligible for commercialization, collection, and procurement in pharmacies. The Regulation does not apply to the residues of cytotoxic medications, group IV waste and residues of waste medications, group V waste, generated in health centres along with other types of sanitary waste. These residues are regulated by the Regulation on the management of sanitary waste of 17 January 2007. Pharmacies are authorized to voluntarily implant in their establishments waste collection points for domestic medicines, by installing containers in view or by receiving them directly by the pharmacy staff. Pick-up points must be enabled with containers that guarantee that there is no spill or impact on people and the environment. They must be sized and designed depending on the quantity and nature of the waste to be collected and must be duly marked and located always within the pharmacy office premises.

Policy: Resolución N° 13-2019 ─ Requisitos, procedimientos, criterios, normativas técnicas y administrativas para el aprovechamiento de árboles sumergidos en ríos, lagunas lagos y otros cuerpos de agua.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución, considerando que el aprovechamiento de la madera sumergida en los lechos de los ríos, lagos, lagunas y otros cuerpos de agua permite, además de la limpieza del ecosistema acuático, la disminución de las emisiones de metano, mejorar la calidad del agua, mejorar la calidad de vida de las comunidades creando empleos directos e indirectos en la extracción del recurso forestal (madera sumergida) a nivel nacional, aprueba los requisitos, procedimientos, criterios, normativas técnicas y administrativas para el aprovechamiento de árboles sumergidos en ríos, lagunas lagos y otros cuerpos de agua. El aprovechamiento de madera sumergida puede realizarse por personas naturales o jurídicas que cuenten con título de dominio o cesión de derecho para el aprovechamiento de la madera que se encuentre sumergida, en ríos, lagunas, lagos, embalses, entre otros cuerpos de agua, de conformidad con la Ley de conservación, fomento y desarrollo sostenible del sector forestal. Para el aprovechamiento de madera sumergida sea ésta proveniente de bosques latifoliados o coníferas, se realizará a través de un plan general de manejo forestal con enfoque y perspectiva de rehabilitación del medio ambiente acuático de acuerdo a la guía metodológica autorizada por el Instituto Nacional Forestal (INAFOR) para este fin.

Policy: Administrative Order No. 16 Expediting the Rehabilitation and Restoration of the Coastal and Marine Ecosystem of the Manila Bay and Creating the Manila Bay Task Force.
Policy_Content: This Administrative Order provides for the rehabilitation and restoration of the Coastal and Marine Ecosystem of the Manila Bay and creates the Manila Bay Task Force. The Task Force shall have the following powers and functions: enforce relevant provisions of Presidential Decree (PD) No. 856 or the "Code on Sanitation of the Philippines," as amended, RA No. 9275, and RA No. 9003 to ensure the complete rehabilitation, restoration and conservation of the Manila Bay; in accordance with PD No. 198 or the "Provincial Water Utilities Act," as amended, to improve sewerage systems or sewerage treatment plants (STPs), or to construct individual STPs, as well as to impose fines, penalties and other administrative sanctions; undertake remedial measures using engineering and technological interventions to improve the water quality of the Manila Bay, such as sustained and targeted reduction in the coliform level in all major river systems and tributaries with in the Manila Bay Region; collaborate with the National Anti-Poverty Commission, Presidential Commission for the Urban Poor, National Housing Authority (NHA) and affected LGUs, and within 60 days from the issuance of this Order, implement a plan for massive relocation of Informal Settler Families (ISFs), especially in the priority areas of the NCR along the Manila Bay Region; prepare a comprehensive plan for expediting the local sanitation program of LGUs within the Manila Bay Region by 2026; ensure that the concerned agencies and LGUs undertake appropriate measures relative to violation of environmental laws such as: demolition, cessation of business and/or filing of administrative action against erring persons or establishments; improve resource management of the Manila Bay, etc.

Policy: Ley Nº 28/2019 - Ley de de residuos y suelos contaminados de las Illes Balears.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de residuos y suelos contaminados de las Illes Balears, tiene por objeto la ordenación del régimen de prevención en la producción y la gestión de los residuos y la regulación de los suelos contaminados en el ámbito territorial de las Illes Balears, en el marco de la legislación básica estatal y de la legislación comunitaria. Policy: Order No. 106 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on state nature reserve "Magadansky".
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature reserve "Magadansky" shall be constituted in Magadan region with a view of performing the following tasks: (a) protection of natural areas for the purpose of conservation of biological diversity and conservation in the natural state of protected natural complexes and objects; (b) organization and conduct of scientific research; (c) performance of state environmental monitoring; (d) ecological education and promotion of cognitive tourism; and (e) assistance in training of scientific research staff and environmental protection personnel. Any activity contrasting the statute of the reserve shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve, including: (a) commercial, amateurish and sport hunting; (b) industrial and sport fisheries; (c) recreational fishing, except for cases envisaged by this Regulation; (d) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, hunting gear, as well as with wildlife products, except for authorized officials; (e) exploration and mining; (f) soil disturbance; (g) modification of hydrological regime of soil; (h) procurement of soft resin, clear cutting, procurement of non-timber forest resources and medicinal plants, except for cases envisaged by this Regulation; (i) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (j) placement of hives and apiaries; (j) ploughing up, except for forest fire prevention measures; (k) haymaking, except as fire prevention measures; (l) construction, reconstruction, repair and operation of capital construction facilities, including line structures, not related to the fulfilment of tasks and the functioning of the reserve; (m) explosive works; (n) burning of vegetation; (o) logging along watercourses and waterbodies; (p) allotment of land plots for housing construction, gardening and horticulture; (q) introduction of wild fauna and wild flora species for acclimatization purposes; (r) application of pesticides, mineral fertilizers and chemical plant protection products and growth stimulants, the use of toxic chemicals for the protection of forests, including for scientific purposes; (s) waste disposal; (t) passage and parking of motor vehicles outside common access roads, navigation of vessels outside watercourses of common access; (u) collection of zoological, botanical and mineralogical specimens; (v) stay with dogs, except for service dogs, keeping unleashed dogs and training of dogs; (w) flight of aircraft and helicopters below 2000 meters above the territory of the reserve; (x) destruction and damaging of noticeboards, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs and equipped ecological paths and recreation areas; and (y) disturbance of wild animal species and feeding thereof by visitors.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy_Content: The object of this Direction is to give guidance to the Future Fund Board of Guardians established by section 34 of the Future Fund Act 2006 (the Board) in relation to its investment strategy for the Fund. Policy: Carbon Capture Readiness (Electricity Generating Stations) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2019 (W.S.I. No. 294 (W. 72) of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Carbon Capture Readiness (Electricity Generating Stations) Regulations 2013 as a result of the devolution, by the Wales Act 2017, of energy consenting functions in relation to electricity generating stations in Wales which have or will have a capacity not exceeding 350 megawatts (Welsh Ministers’ new functions under Schedule 6 to the Planning Act 2008). A new Regulation 6A requires before granting of a planning permission that the Welsh Ministers or local planning authority (as applicable) determine whether certain conditions are met relating to the feasibility of carbon capture and storage. If the conditions are met, the planning permission must include conditions for suitable space to be set aside for equipment necessary to capture and compress all the carbon dioxide that would otherwise be emitted from the plant.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 52/19 approving the General Strategy for the Allocation of Oil Concessions for the period 2019-2025.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the General Strategy for the Allocation of Oil Concessions for the period 2019-2025. This Strategy, consisting of eight sections and one Map (specifying the related allocations by year), aims to support the achievement of macro and long-term objectives: Its general objectives are: promote the knowledge on national geological oil potential; ensure the continuous increase in oil resources; foster competition in the Oil Industry and risk investment, ensuring adjustment of remuneration; promote Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in the National Oil Industry, disseminating universally accepted knowledge, technological innovation and governance practices; promote the exploitation of natural gas, through the inclusion of programmes dedicated to this resource in the general scope of the Oil Bidding. Its specific objectives are: ensure the replacement of reserves, promoting the exploitation activity in a rational and adequate manner; trigger appropriate measures to confirm the country's oil potential; provide sufficient crude oil to meet the domestic refining capacity by weighing the economic viability of the export versus import.

Policy_Content: This Decree creates the "Brasil Mais" Programme and provides for the related Strategic Orientation Committee designed to raise the levels of productivity and efficiency in Brazilian companies through extension works. Extension works aim at promoting and disseminating knowledge, techniques and productive practices that generate good practices, through the provision of services, the indication of managerial improvements and continuous improvement of the management of production processes. Policy: Ordinance No. 1 of the State Environmental Protection and Forestry Agency validating the Regulation of State Forest Service and Forest Fire Safety Regulation.
Policy_Content: Regulation of State Forest Service is authorized state institution in the field of environmental protection and forest management, ensuring protection of forests pertaining to state forest fund, protected areas through State Forest Service. State Forest Service shall perform the following tasks: (a) protection of forests; (b) control over state, management, protection, reproduction of forests and organization of forest fund management; and (c) ensuring protection of unused natural resources (minerals etc.) located on the territory of state forest fund. State Forest Service shall carry out the following measures: (a) to prevent and suppress offences; (b) to undertake legal actions related to forest offences; (c) to administrate the law and keep order on the territory of forest fund; (d) to issue instructions for elimination of revealed violations; and (e) to make decisions on restriction or suspension of business activity. Forest Fire Safety Regulation sets the requirements for firefighting measures and fire safety in forests in the process of protection, reproduction and management thereof that are mandatory for all legal entities and natural persons. The basic forms and methods of ensuring fire safety in forests shall be: (a) forest fire prevention; and (b) in-process inspection.

Policy: Decree No. 132 of the Cabinet of Ministers “On measures for acceleration of planting of protective forests “Yashil Koplamlar” in the dry areas of the Aral Sea basin.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Cabinet of Ministers, with a view of reduction of negative impact of sand, salt and dust particles rising from the dried Aral seabed, and effective organization of the "green cover" of desert vegetation in these areas and mitigating the effects of global climate change and the Aral Sea on agricultural development and livelihoods, decides to plant protection forest on the dried Aral seabed. State Committee for Land Resources, Geodesy, Cartography and State Cadastre of the Republic of Uzbekistan, Council of Ministers of the Republic of Karakalpakstan and State Committee of Forestry shall conduct inventory of the land under which "green cover" area must be created and shall allocate it with the right of permanent ownership for forestry. The State Forestry Committee shall ensure the establishment of green areas within the boundaries of the forestry facilities, to ensure the timeliness and quality of protection of shelter forests in the areas where green areas must be planted. State Unitary Enterprise "Ormonloyiha" identify forestland suitable for forestry and development of a plan for establishment of protective forests and shall develop accurate estimation of the methods of afforestation according to the plan.

Policy_Content: This Decree of the Cabinet of Ministers, with a view of further ensuring effective organization of manufacturing and processing of licorice and other medicinal plants, increasing the attractiveness of the industry for business entities, as well as increasing the volume of production of finished export-oriented products with high added value, assigns the following tasks to the Association of organizations for production and processing of licorice and other medicinal plants: (a) participation in the formation and coordination of programs for integrated development of production and processing of licorice and other medicinal plants, assistance in carrying out the unified scientific research and development, technological, investment and export policy in this area; (b) continuous increase in the production of licorice and other medicinal plants by creating specialized plantations in areas that are conducive to their growth, including the introduction of intensive cultivation technologies and rational use of natural growing grounds; (с) assistance in the efficient organization of cooperation between business entities and public administration for the creation of plantations, deep industrial processing and production of export oriented produce with high added value; and (d) participation in drafting regulatory legislative acts related to growing and processing of licorice and other medicinal plants, and performance of public environmental audit.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-4193 “On measures for further comprehensive development of the national system of provision of public services.”
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree establishes the list of public services subject to optimization related to the following fields: (a) provision of the population and business entities with the opportunity to verify  existence of use restrictions on their real estate; (b) introduction of registration of data on compliance of edifices and constructions with sanitary and fire safety requirements; (c) improvement of the functioning of state bodies dealing with commodities requiring compliance certificate; and (d) submission of proposals for the implementation of services for the issuance of licenses for the right to use a subsoil plot and other public services in the field of subsoil management through public service centers.

Policy: Resolution No. 89 of 2019 of Georgian Government on Rules for Transporting Dangerous Goods
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the rules for transporting dangerous goods. It consists of 13 articles: General provisions (1); Purpose of regulation (2); Definitions (3); Exceptions where the provisions of the European Agreement on Transport of Dangerous Goods on Road (ADR) and this regulation are not used (4); Classification of dangerous goods (5); Processing, loading (unloading) and placing of dangerous goods (6); Selecting and getting an agreement on a route (7); Transporting dangerous goods (8); Rights and duties of crew members and other participants of transportation process (9); Common requirements imposed on transport and its equipment (10); Requirements on preparing transport crews (11); Requirements imposed on the construct of transport vehicles in order to be permitted to transport certain dangerous goods (12); and Terms and timeline for issuing a certificate of permission to transport certain dangerous goods (13).

Policy: Executive Order No. 75, s. 2019 Directing All Departments, Bureaus, Offices and Instrumentalities of the Government to Identify Lands Owned by the Government Devoted to or Suitable for Agriculture For Distribution to Qualified Beneficiaries.
Policy_Content: Subject to the limitations and conditions provided under applicable laws, rules and issuances, the DAR shall acquire all lands devoted to or suitable for agriculture, which are owned by the departments, bureaus, offices and instrumentalities of the Government, and which are no longer actually, directly and exclusively used or necessary for the purpose for which they have been reserved or acquired, for the purpose of eventual distribution to qualified beneficiaries.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Merchant Shipping (Oil Pollution Preparedness, Response and Co-operation Convention) Regulations 2019 (B.R. No. 13 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Minister responsible for Maritime Administration, in exercise of the power conferred by section 122 of the Merchant Shipping Act 2002, provide for the control of oil at oil handling facilities and harbours as specified. They shall apply to offshore facilities and pipelines. Harbour authorities and operators of facilities shall have an oil pollution emergency plan in accordance with these Regulations. Such plan shall be approved by the Minister. A plan must be altered if not conform to the National Contingency Plan or if not appropriate for dealing with oil pollution incidents.  Only activities regrading oil may be undertaken if they are subject of an oil pollution emergency plan. Every operator of an oil handling facility that— is a pipeline; or would be an offshore installation were it in offshore waters, must ensure that no activities that present a risk of an oil pollution incident are undertaken, unless those activities are the subject of an oil pollution emergency plan approved by the Minister, under this Regulation. The Regulations also require operators or masters of ships to report to the Minister on the discharge of oil in marine waters, provide for inspection of installations, and define offences.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Americas, Atlantic Ocean Islands, European Union Countries, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Merchant Shipping (Port State Control) Regulations 2019 (B.R. No. 14 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Minister responsible for Maritime Administration, in exercise of the power conferred by sections 3, 93 and 94 of the Merchant Shipping Act 2002, provide for the control by port authorities of Bermuda of foreign ships and their activities as covered by various specified Conventions. They implement IMO Resolution A. 1119(30) on port state control. The list of Conventions includes, among other things, MARPOL, the International Convention on Civil Liability for Oil Pollution Damage, 1992 and SOLAS. The Regulations shall not apply to fishing vessels. Bermuda will in each calendar year ensure the carrying out of inspections on 15 per cent of the definitive number of vessels visiting Bermuda which are subject to these Regulations. An inspection may be an initial inspection, a more detailed inspection, or an expanded inspection. A record of inspections conducted in Bermuda will be maintained by the Bermuda Shipping and Maritime Authority.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Americas, Atlantic Ocean Islands, European Union Countries, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Merchant Shipping (International Safety Management (ISM) Code) Regulations 2019 (B.R. No. 12 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Minister responsible for Maritime Administration, in exercise of the power conferred by section 122 of the Merchant Shipping Act 2002, provide for certification of ships for purposes of the ISM Code and SOLAS. An ISM company must not operate a ship to which these Regulations apply  unless the requirements in these Regulations are complied with in relation to that ship. An ISM company is either the owner of a ship or a person that has assumed responsibility for the operation of the ship and has agreed with the owner to take over all the duties and responsibilities imposed by the ISM Code. A designated person shall, among other things, monitor the safe and efficient operation of that ship, with particular regard to safety and pollution prevention aspects.  A Certifying Authority may suspend or cancel any relevant document issued these Regulations on, among other things, pollution prevention considerations.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea
Geographical_area: Americas, Atlantic Ocean Islands, European Union Countries, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Merchant Shipping (Anti-Fouling Systems) Regulations 2019 (B.R. No. 10 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Minister responsible for Maritime Administration, in exercise of the power conferred by section 122 of the Merchant Shipping Act 2002, implement for Bermuda the International Convention on the control of Harmful Anti-Fouling Systems on Ships, 2001, and provide for survey and certification of ships for purposes of the Convention (Annex 4). Ships that are not conform certification may be detained  until a surveyor of ships is satisfied that it can proceed to sea without presenting an unreasonable threat of harm to the marine environment.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea

Policy: Merchant Shipping (Prevention of Oil Pollution) Amendment Regulations 2019 (BR 16/2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Merchant Shipping (Prevention of Oil Pollution) Regulations 2010 regarding the exceptions for damage to a ship or its equipment in internal or territorial waters from rules regarding discharge of oil if the discharge was caused by damage to the ship and it was not the result of intentional, negligent or reckless behaviour and all reasonable precautions were taken after the damage, or discovery of the discharge, to prevent or minimise the discharge. These Regulations also insert a new regulation (35A) on powers of harbour masters on the detainment of ships and a regulation (36A) on penalties for offences.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Merchant Shipping (Ship-to-Ship Transfers) Regulations 2019 (BR 20/2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Minister responsible for Maritime Administration, in exercise of the powers conferred by section 254(5) of the Merchant Shipping Act 2002, prohibit oil cargo transfer or bunkering operation in Bermuda waters unless the ships carrying out the transfer are within— harbour authority waters; or the permitted area, and a permit has been obtained from the Minister, in accordance with the procedure set out in a Merchant Shipping Notice. A cargo transfer must not be carried out in harbour authority waters, except in accordance with an authorisation of the harbour authority, which regulates or manages the waters in which the cargo transfer is carried out. A cargo transfer to or from a ship with a gross tonnage of 150 tons or more must not be carried out in Bermuda waters or in the Pollution Control Zone unless a ship-to-ship transfer operations plan has been approved by the ship’s flag State.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Americas, Atlantic Ocean Islands, European Union Countries, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Merchant Shipping (Accident Reporting and Investigation) Regulations 2019 (B.R. No. 9 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Minister responsible for Maritime Administration, in exercise of the power conferred by section 228 of the Merchant Shipping Act 2002, concern the reporting on death related to ships or pollution, or the potential for such pollution to the environment caused by damage to a ship or ships and other accidents as specified. They apply to Bermudan ships wherever they are (with some exceptions) and to foreign ships within Bermuda or Bermuda waters (with some exceptions). When an accident occurs, the following persons associated with the ship shall notify the Authority and the Chief Marine Surveyor, as soon as is practicable following the accident and by the quickest means available— the master or, if the master has not survived, the senior surviving officer; and the ship’s owner, unless they have ascertained to their satisfaction that the master or senior surviving officer has reported the accident, in accordance with sub-paragraph (a). the Regulations provide with respect to investigations regarding accidents and related matters such as co-operation with other States.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea

Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Minister responsible for Maritime Administration, in exercise of the power conferred by sections 93 and 94 of the Merchant Shipping Act 2002, provide for the control of exposure of workers on Bermuda ships to noise as defined in these Regulations. They also require employers to eliminate or control exposure to noise in the workplace as much as possible and provide for health surveillance of workers in relation to noise exposure.

Policy: Royal Decree No. 19/2019 promulgating the Mineral Wealth Law.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 70 articles aims at (i) providing a framework for the mining sector intended to provide more incentives and transparency; (ii) strengthening the role of the Public Authority for Mining (PAM) and clearly outlining its competencies; (iii) protecting the interests of local communities, giving priority to the local employment; (iv) protecting the environment; and (v) enforcing the investment commitments. The Law stipulates that all mineral resources, quarry materials and other related mineral wealth within Omani territorial limits, including Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) and continental shelf areas, are the property of the State, and recognizes the PAM as the competent mining authority.

Policy: Regional Law No. 2 “On some issues of allotment of public land plots, property of the state or local government, on condition of free of charge tenancy.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the categories of specialties employed by local municipal units (local government) which gives the right to receive land plots owned by the state or municipality for free use. Upon expiration of five years from the date of gratuitous use of a land plot allotted to a citizen, the land plot owned by the state or municipality will be transferred to a citizen free of charge in ownership provided that this citizen used such a land plot in the specified period of the previous five years in accordance with the established permitted use and was employed in the municipality and in one of the specialties listed by this Regional Law. The list of specialties granting the right to a benefit includes agriculture, forestry and fisheries, veterinary medicine and zootechnicians. The formation and allotment of land plots for free use or ownership to the abovementioned categories of citizens shall be performed free of charge without holding auctions. However, in this case, cadastral works for the purpose of formation of the land plot shall be carried out at the expense of the citizen concerned.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 149 validating the Regulation on the development, setting and revision of environmental quality standards for chemical and physical indicators of the environment, as well as on the approval of regulatory documents in the field of environmental protection, setting technological indicators of the best available technologies.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for the development, setting and revision of environmental quality standards for chemical and physical indicators of the environment, as well as on the approval of regulatory documents in the field of environmental protection, setting technological indicators of the best available technologies. Quality standards are established to assess the state of the environment in order to ensure favorable conditions for human activity, rational use of natural resources, preservation of natural ecological systems, genetic fund of plants, animals and other organisms. When establishing quality standards, the indicators are used, which are controlled through the use of appropriate measurement methods (methods), indication methods and (or) testing approved in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation. Quality standards are developed and established for certain components of the natural environment: (a) atmospheric air; (b) water of surface water bodies; (c) water of underground water bodies - sources of potable and domestic water supply, as well as groundwater resources determined as reserve sources of potable and domestic water supply for the provision of drinking water to citizens in case of the outbreak of natural disasters; and (d) soil (land). Quality standards are developed and established at the maximum permissible level of values obtained on the basis of laboratory test results, or for territories and water areas at the level of values (in the range of permissible deviation from values) of natural background indicators, formed under the influence of natural factors, typical for a particular territory, water area.
