Policy_Content: The Binga Rural District Council (Communal and Resettlement Land) (Land Use and Conservation) By-laws, made under the terms of Section 90 (4) of the Rural District Councils Act, shall apply to communal and resettlement land within the Binga Rural District Council area. Policy: Kenya Youth Development Policy 2019.
Policy_Content: The Kenya Youth Development Policy (KYDP) 2019 has the goal to promote the holistic empowerment and participation of the youth in socio-economic and political spheres for national development. The Policy objectives are (i) Realize a healthy and productive youth population; (ii) Build qualified and competent youth workforce for sustained development; (iii) Create opportunities for youth to earn decent and sustainable livelihoods; (iv) Develop youth talent, creativity and innovation for wealth creation; (v) Nurture value driven, morally upright, ethical generation of patriotic youth for transformative leadership; (vi) Effective civic participation and representation among the youth; (vii) Promote a crime free, secure, peaceful and united Kenya where no young Kenyan is left behind; (viii) Support youth engagement in environmental management for sustainable development; (ix) Promote and develop of entrepreneurial culture among the youth through access to subsidized loans, training, mentorship, internships, attachments, business incubation and partnerships and, (x) Support the development of a wide range of ICT-based programmes in local languages, as appropriate, with content relevant to different groups of youth.

Policy: National Strategic Plan on Antimicrobial Resistance in Lao PDR 2019 – 2023.
Policy_Content: This National Strategic Plan on Antimicrobial Resistance (AMR) in Lao PDR 2019 – 2023 describes the vision to reduce AMR-related human and animal morbidity and mortality and economic impact. Five goals have been set, including: (1) reduce by 30% the number of infections caused by antimicrobial-resistant pathogens, (2) sales of antibiotics on prescription by doctors or veterinarians at 30%, (3) reduce by 20% the consumption of antimicrobials in both the human and animal sectors, (4) doctors and veterinarians to educate 80% of consumers on AMR and increase awareness of AMR and appropriate use of antimicrobials to more than 20%, and (5) ensure the country does not score less than 3 in the AMR-related indicators in the Joint External Evaluation of the implementation of the International Health Regulations (IHR).

Policy_Content: Regulation on the Ministry of Energy defines the main tasks, functions, rights, responsibility, organization and accounting procedures of the Ministry, as well as functional duties and responsibilities of its managers. The Ministry is a public administration body in the field of energy. The main tasks of the Ministry shall be set forth as follows: (a) development and implementation of unified state policy in fuel and energy industry, aimed at ensuring security of the Republic of Uzbekistan, sustainable supply of economic sectors and the country's population with fuel and energy resources, large-scale promotion and development of renewable energy sources; (b) state regulation of generation, transmission, distribution and consumption of electricity, heat energy and coal, as well as extraction, processing, transportation, distribution, trade and use of oil, gas and petroleum products; (c) implementation of unified regulatory and technical regulation of the energy sector in the country; (d) creation and development of a balanced system of strategic planning and development of the fuel and energy complex, increase and diversification of energy resources, development of interconnected short-, medium- and long-term forecasts of production, delivery and consumption of all types of energy resources, as well as target programs of complex  development of the energy industry; (e) increase of the investment attractiveness of the fuel and energy sector through the development of public-private partnerships, improvement of tariff policy that stimulates the formation of a favorable competitive and the business environment in the energy market; (f) coordination of the implementation of investment projects in the fuel and energy sector, active involvement of private capital in the processes of production of energy resources, establishment of cooperation with international financial institutions, donor countries, companies, banks and other structures; (g) promotion of the introduction of modern methods of corporate governance in energy sector, advanced information and communication technologies and automated management, accounting and control systems, improving management efficiency and reducing production costs, transparency of financial and economic activities of energy sector organizations; (h) increase of energy efficiency and energy saving thro introduction of innovation technologies; and (i) development of the use of nuclear energy by construction of nuclear power plants.

Policy: Ley Nº 7/2019 - Ley para la sostenibilidad medioambiental y económica de la Isla de Formentera.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley dispone que las administraciones públicas velarán por la sostenibilidad medioambiental y socioeconómica de la isla de Formentera mediante medidas específicas que de manera preferente eviten o reduzcan, principalmente en los períodos vacacionales, los riesgos derivados de la excesiva afluencia turística y de la saturación de los espacios públicos que la misma comporta. A tal fin, las administraciones públicas orientarán sus políticas, en este territorio y en el ámbito de sus competencias, a los objetivos de mejora del entorno natural y el medio ambiente, de ordenación de la afluencia turística, de eliminación de la congestión de las vías públicas y de la saturación del parque de vehículos a motor, de mantenimiento de la calidad de vida de la población y de preservación de la buena imagen turística de Formentera.

Policy: Decreto Nº 41561-MP-MINAE ─ Plan de Descarbonización Compromiso del Gobierno del Bicentenario 2018-2050.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto declara de interés público y nacional todas las acciones, actividades e iniciativas desarrolladas en el marco del "Plan de Descarbonización Compromiso del Gobierno del Bicentenario 2018-2050", y comprende todas las actividades preparatorias relacionadas con el apoyo, promoción, impulso y ejecución dicho Plan. Mediante el Plan de Descarbonización Costa Rica aspira a tener una economía verde, sin emisiones, resiliente y equitativa, para lo cual la economía costarricense y la política pública han creado un patrón de emisiones que refleja nuevos retos. La planificación de la descarbonización tiene como meta ir más allá de una agenda ambiental: transformar la economía. La descarbonización y resiliencia se conciben como un medio para transformar el modelo de desarrollo a uno basado en la bioeconomía, el crecimiento verde, la inclusión y la mejora de la calidad de vida de la ciudadanía. Orientada a la transformación para una agricultura altamente productiva por unidad de producción, baja en carbono, resiliente y que contribuya a la bioeconomía costarricense.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 015-2019-PCM ─ Plan Multisectorial ante Heladas y Friaje 2019-2021.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Plan Multisectorial ante Heladas y Friaje 2019-2021, cuya finalidad es la de contribuir a la construcción de la resiliencia de las poblaciones, así como de sus actividades económicas y medios de vida, a los efectos adversos de las heladas y friaje, en todas las etapas de la vida y en los ámbitos territoriales priorizados, para que logren beneficiarse del progreso económico y social, y se conviertan en agentes de su propio desarrollo, garantizando su calidad de vida. El Plan tiene como Objetivo general reducir la vulnerabilidad de las personas frente a la exposición a los fenómenos de heladas y friaje por medio del accionar articulado del Estado y el diseño e implementación de estrategias para la reducción del riesgo y la preparación, en territorios priorizados, que coadyuven a proteger la vida e integridad física de la población, así como de sus medios de vida. Constituyen Objetivos específicos del Plan: 1) Reducir las afectaciones en la salud de la población expuesta a un riesgo alto o muy alto ante los efectos de las heladas y friaje; 2) Reducir las afectaciones en los medios de vida de la población expuesta a un riesgo alto o muy alto ante los efectos de las heladas y friaje; 3) Promover una gestión articulada orientada a resultados con enfoque territorial a nivel intersectorial, intergubernamental e interinstitucional para hacer frente a los efectos de las heladas y friaje.

Policy: Law No. 7/2019 of 7 February on the conservation of the natural environment, biodiversity and landscape.
Policy_Content: The Law, consisting of 61 articles divided into eight Titles, establishes the legal system for the protection, conservation, improvement, restoration and sustainable use of the natural environment, biodiversity and landscape of the Principality of Andorra, both for current and future generations, and in particular habitats to ensure that native fauna and flora are preserved in a favourable state, to ensure the rational use of land and all natural resources, as established in the article 31 of the Constitution. In particular, Title I defines general principles that must guide the actions of the administrations in the matter of conservation of the natural environment, biodiversity and landscape. Title II establishes the National Strategy for Biodiversity of Andorra, to plan and coordinate in the field of conservation of the natural environment and biodiversity. It also creates the Commission for the Coordination and Development of the National Strategy for Biodiversity in Andorra as an advisory and coordination body between the Government, the communes and the civil society. Title III establishes the principles for the conservation of biodiversity, both in the genetic field and in the priority habitats. Measures are introduced to preserve the health of people and the environment, such as the possibility of reducing or prohibiting harmful chemicals.

Policy: Ley Nº 9.143 - Plan de Manejo Sustentable de Neumáticos Fuera de Uso.
Policy_Content: Por esta Ley se crea el Plan de Manejo Sustentable de Neumáticos Fuera de Uso, de aplicación en todo el territorio de la Provincia de Mendoza. Sus objetivos son: a) prevenir y minimizar los riesgos, impactos negativos significativos y daños al ambiente o la salud humana durante todas las actividades que se desarrollen en su ciclo de vida; b) evitar la contaminación atmosférica que genera la quema de neumáticos; c) reducir la disposición final de los neumáticos en desuso; d) fomentar la reutilización, reciclaje, valorización energética y toda forma existente de valorización de los neumáticos en desuso; e) procurar un manejo de los neumáticos de forma técnica, con el menor riesgo posible al medio ambiente y que sea beneficiosa económica y socialmente; f) asignar de la carga de la gestión ambiental a los productores, a lo largo de todo el ciclo de vida del producto incluida la etapa post-consumo, generando así una responsabilidad extendida del productor.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 49/19 creating the National Agency for Oil, Gas and Biofuel (ANPG).

In particular, ANPG has the following attributions: implement the necessary actions for managing oil and natural gas contracts; implement the State's public policy in the field of the Oil Industry, in accordance with best international practices; monitor technical and technological development for the purpose of legislative adjustment of the Sector; promote investments in the Oil, Gas and Biofuels Sector, disseminating technical data that are not reserved, in accordance with the enforced legislation; ensure the promotion of specialized training for staff, in close collaboration with public and private services. In addition, the Statute regulates economic, financial, services, regime and staff management, which together with SONANGOL-E.P. aims to promote the survey of the human resources and assets held by SONANGOL for a correct allocation.

Policy: Decree No. 95 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating regulatory legal acts in the field of waste management.
Policy_Content: This Decree validates the Regulation on collection and removal of domestic liquid and solid waste, envisaging the procedure for rendering services of collection, transportation and disposal of domestic liquid and solid waste by specialized organizations. It sets forth the requirements for collection, storage and transportation of domestic waste, the modalities of calculation of fees charged to natural persons for collection, transportation, storage and disposal of domestic waste, administration of electronic accounting system for registration of payers or fees for collection, transportation, storage and disposal of domestic waste, and establishes the rights and the duties of consumers and service companies. This Regulation shall not be applicable to radioactive and biological waste, waste of medical institutions, emissions of hazardous substances to the atmospheric air and waste discharge to waterbodies. The following waste shall be removed by service company for a separate fee at contractual prices: (a) liquid domestic waste; (b) large-size domestic waste; (c) livestock waste; (d) construction waste and soil; (e) waste generated during cutting and agrotechnical processing of wood and shrubbery (branches, branches, branches and shrubs, cutting residues, leaves, etc.) and sweepings. However, the removal of domestic waste referred to in this paragraph may be carried out by the service organization outside of its zone of service. Consumers of mercury-containing lamps, which use them for lighting, shall accumulate spent mercury-containing lamps separately from other types of waste in a specially designated location. Burning of fallen leaves shall be categorically forbidden, they shall be removed together with residential sweepings from specially designated locations. Volume of solid domestic waste subject to removal shall be calculated in accordance with standard rates of solid waste generation. Periodicity of removal of solid domestic waste shall be established by local government. Minimum periodicity of waste removal from waste collection points shall be once a day, while minimum periodicity of waste removal in private residential areas by house-by-house solid domestic waste collection shall be once in three days. Consumers shall have the right to receive solid waste collection services in accordance with contracts concluded with service organization ensuring quality of service and safety for human life and health. Consumers shall have the duty to pay timely for collection, removal, storage, transportation and disposal of solid domestic waste, not to dispose waste in unauthorized places and sites and not to burn waste.

Policy: Decree No. 103 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on the procedure for covering the costs associated with the introduction of drip irrigation for raw cotton producers.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for covering the costs associated with the introduction of drip irrigation for raw cotton producers with a view of improving productivity and yield of agricultural crops through introduction of water-saving technologies, in particular in cotton sector. Budgetary subsidies shall be allocated to the agricultural enterprises cultivating cotton for state needs on low-yield land. The total sum allocated for reimbursement of expenses of the producers of raw cotton related to the introduction of drip irrigation technology shall not exceed 8 million soms per hectare regardless of the total cost associated with the introduction of drip irrigation technology. The subsidy from the state budget will be used to cover the costs of producers of raw cotton related to the introduction of drip irrigation technology, including repayment of loans. In order to access to reimbursement and subsidies the applicant must submit to the competent authority the following documentation: (a) draft irrigation project and business plan copy; (b) loan agreement with a commercial bank on the implementation of drip irrigation technology and a copy of the loan approval documents; (c) copy of the contract with the contracting agencies for the purchase and construction of drip irrigation technology components (other relevant documents will be provided if the drip irrigation technology was built by a cotton mill producer); (d) copies of the documents confirming the incurred expenses; and (e) copy of the conclusion of Commission for Adoption of Completed Works on Introduction of Drip Irrigation Technology.

Policy: Décret n° 2019-008/PR du 06/02/19 fixant les conditions et les modalités d’occupation du domaine public de l’Etat, des collectivités territoriales et des établissements publics
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les conditions et les modalités d’occupation du domaine public de l’Etat, des collectivités territoriales et des établissements publics en application de la loi n° 2018-005 du 14 juin 2018 portant code foncier et domanial. Les biens immobiliers relevant du domaine public sont ceux visés aux articles 507 et 508 de la loi n° 2018-005 du 14 juin 2018 portant code foncier et domanial, que ces biens soient gérés par la personne publique propriétaire ou par toute personne morale de droit public ou privé ayant reçu mandat de la personne publique propriétaire à cet effet. Les biens du domaine public sont utilisés conformément à leur affectation. Le domaine public est constitué du domaine public naturel et du domaine public artificiel. Les biens du domaine public sont imprescriptibles, inaliénables et insaisissables. L’occupation ou l’utilisation par des personnes privées des dépendances immobilières de ce domaine ne confère pas à ces dernières de droits réels, sous réserve des autorisations expresses de la loi. Le domaine public de l’Etat, des collectivités territoriales et des établissements publics peuvent faire l’objet d’occupation et de jouissance à titre privatif par des personnes physiques et des personnes morales de droit privé suivant les conditions et les modalités prévues au présent décret. Les occupations du domaine public répondent à un besoin individuel ou collectif.

Policy: Law No. 19.811 creating the Paraná Partnerships Programme, regulating privatization and partnership agreements within the scope of the State Executive Public Administration and its entities, establishing the Infrastructure Development Projects Fund and amending Law No. 17.046.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 63 articles divided into eight Chapters, creates the Partnership Programme of Paraná (PAR), aimed at implementing privatization measures and partnerships with the private sector, with a view to rationalizing public assets, increasing efficiency and improving the quality of public enterprises, the state services and the attraction of investments for the development of the State of Paraná. The PAR will be integrated by a portfolio of privatization projects and partnerships contracts, implemented and developed through a management service and a deliberative body called the Partnership Programme Council of Paraná (CPAR). The objectives of PAR are: ensure the efficient development and privatization projects and partnerships in the State of Paraná; ensure transparent, efficient and accountable governance for privatization and partnership projects; provide a favourable institutional environment for attracting investments and concluding partnership contracts, guided by legal and regulatory stability and security and by minimal state intervention in public-private affairs; foster dialogue and public-private relations, with a view to expanding business opportunities and investments for the Public Administration and its entities, in order to improve state services and enable the development of relevant public enterprises; advise the State Government and sectoral regulatory agencies on the construction of long-term regulatory policies for the implementation and development of partnerships in regulated sectors.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-4161 “On organization of activities of the Agency for Development of Viticulture and Winemaking under the Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree establishes that the Agency for Development of Viticulture and Winemaking under the Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Uzbekistan shall be national body of state administration financed by the State budget and other legally authorized funds. It sets up Vineyard and Winemaker Support Fund without the status of legal entity, financed from the following sources: (a) annual subsidies from the national budget of Uzbekistan; (b) deductions from the wholesale trade in alcoholic beverages in the amount of five percent of the net proceeds; (b) contributions from the State Unitary Enterprise "Enological Laboratory" and the State Unitary Enterprise "Uzumchilik Ukuv Markazi" (Viticulture training center)  under the Agency's originating from net profit in accordance with the established procedure; (c) credits (loans) and grants of international financial institutions, foreign governmental organizations; and (d) other legally authorized sources.  Fund’s finances shall be used for: (a) effective implementation of the Agency's tasks related to the implementation of complex targeted programs aimed at ensuring the dynamic development of vineyards and winemaking industry, including the purchase of grape seedlings, breeding grape selection varieties and their planting; (b) irrigation activities on vineyards, including water supply, construction of artesian wells, wells and reservoirs, acquisition pumps and pipes for water supply, water storage tanks; (c) allocation of loans and credits  at an interest rate not exceeding 50 percent of refinancing rate of the Central Bank of the Republic of Uzbekistan to create grape plantations and the production of alcoholic beverages from grapes, fruits and berries.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 43 validating the Regulation on state registration of rights to mining and extraction of sand-gravel mixture and loams.
Policy_Content: Regulation on state registration of rights to mining and extraction of sand-gravel mixture and loams establishes the procedure for state registration of rights, that are not assigned through tenders and auction sale, extracted for construction purposes. Extraction of sand-gravel mixture and loams shall be performed by subsoil managers in accordance with registration of rights issued by local government in accordance with the form contained in the Annex 1. Issuance of certificate by the local government shall be performed according to the rule of "the first submitted application". Certificate shall be issued for one single land plot for the period of three years. Extraction of sand-gravel mixture and loams performed at depth of quarry not exceeding two meters from the natural surface relief shall be carried out without technical project.

Policy: Law No. 22 “On state subsidies for seed growing”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall to provide state support to agricultural producers in providing high-quality certified seed material for agricultural crops and to create favorable conditions for seed farms of the Kyrgyz Republic for the production and trade of high-quality certified varieties of seeds of priority agricultural crops through the introduction of the state subsidy mechanism. This Law regulates the legal framework for the introduction of the state subsidy mechanism in seed production in order to ensure the sustainable development of relations between public authorities and local governments, seed farms and agricultural producers. This Law applies to the production and trade of certified varieties and hybrids of priority agricultural crops included in the State Register of Plant Varieties and Hybrids Allowed for Use in the Kyrgyz Republic. The provisions of this Law shall apply throughout the territory of the Kyrgyz Republic to all seed farms having an official status for production, trade and use of seeds of one or more priority agricultural crops destined for sowing. This Law is based on the following principles: (a) equal access to state subsidies for seed farms producing seeds of priority agricultural crops and selling them to agricultural producers; (b) compliance of the quality of seeds produced with the standards adopted in the Kyrgyz Republic; (c) environmental and phytosanitary safety of seed farms; (d) interaction with research institutions and organizations engaged in activities in the field of breeding and seed production; (e) development of competitiveness of agricultural commodities; and (f) import substitution and export orientation. The main direction of introduction of the state subsidy mechanism in seed production shall be allocation of budget funds for reimbursement to seed farms of the Kyrgyz Republic of 30% of the cost of production of trade of seeds of super-elite, elite, first and second reproduction of varieties and hybrids of the first generation of priority crops. State subsidies shall be paid to seed farms, which have fully met all their obligations on the supply of certified seeds of priority agricultural crops to agricultural producers.

Policy: Loi n°2019‐03 du 1er février 2019 portant Code pétrolier.
Policy_Content: Le présent code qui comporte dix chapitres, fixe les règles relatives à la prospection, à l’exploration, au développement, à l’exploitation, au transport, au stockage des hydrocarbures ainsi qu’à la liquéfaction du gaz naturel sur l’ensemble du territoire national. Il définit certaines dispositions du régime fiscal de ces activités sur l’ensemble du territoire national. Toutefois, les dispositions du Code minier ne sont pas applicables aux opérations pétrolières telles que définies au présent Code. Outre les objectifs, les définitions, le chapitre premier relatif aux dispositions générales fixe le cadre institutionnel (ministère en charge des Hydrocarbures, la société pétrolière nationale), propriété des ressources et de la gestion des revenus pétroliers, l’éligibilité d’entreprendre des opérations pétrolières, différents types d’autorisations d’exercice d’opérations pétrolières (prospection ; exploration ; exploitation provisoire ; exclusive d’exploitation), l’exercice des opérations pétrolières par l’Etat, participation de la société pétrolière nationale, responsabilité des titulaires de titre minier d’hydrocarbures.

Policy: Loi 2019-04 relatif au contenu local dans le secteur des hydrocarbures.
Policy_Content: La présente loi s'applique à toutes les activités, sur le territoire de la République du Sénégal, directement ou indirectement, liées: à la prospection, l'exploration, le développement et l'exploitation des hydrocarbures; au transport et au stockage des hydrocarbures; à la transformation et à la valorisation des hydrocarbures ainsi qu'à la distribution des produits pétroliers et gaziers. Tout contractant, sous-traitant, prestataire de services et fournisseur, participant aux activités pétrolières et gazières, est soumis aux dispositions de la présente loi. La présente loi a pour objectif de promouvoir et de développer le contenu local, c'est-àdire: a) d'augmenter la valeur ajoutée locale et la création d'emplois locaux dans la chaîne de valeur des industries pétrolières et gazières grâce à l'utilisation de l'expertise ainsi que des biens et services locaux; b) de favoriser le développement d'une main-d'oeuvre locale qualifiée et compétitive; c) de développer les capacités nationales dans la chaîne de valeur de l'industrie pétrolière et gazière par l'éducation, la formation, le transfert de technologie et de savoir-faire et la recherche-développement; d) de favoriser le renforcement de la compétitivité nationale et internationale des entreprises sénégalaises; e) de mettre en place un mécanisme de suivi-évaluation, transparent et fiable des obligations liées au contenu local, en adéquation avec les politiques publiques nationales; f) de renforcer la participation des populations à la chaîne de valeur des industries pétrolières et gazières.

Policy: Plan de Mise à l’échelle des pratiques optimales de l’alimentation du nourrisson et du jeune enfant (ANJE) 2019-2021.
Policy_Content: Le Plan de Mise à l’Echelle ANJE (PME ANJE) est un plan de mise en oeuvre de la Stratégie Centrale de l’Alimentation du Nourrisson et du Jeune Enfant qui a été adoptée en Septembre 2017. Il est composé de sept (7) chapitres: analyse de la situation; but, objectifs et résultats attendus; mise en oeuvre du plan de mise à l’échelle ANJE; plan de communication; supervision, suivi & évaluation; et budget détaillé et Plan de financement et coordination. Le but du plan de passage à l’échelle de l’Alimentation du Nourrisson et du Jeune Enfant ou ANJE est de promouvoir, protéger et soutenir l’Alimentation du Nourrisson et du Jeune Enfant (ANJE). L’objectif général est de contribuer à la réduction d’au moins 5% du retard de croissance chez les enfants âgés de 0 – 59 mois d’ici 2021 et à la réduction de la mortalité infanto-juvénile au Tchad. En termes d’objectifs spécifiques, le plan de passage à la mise à l’échelle (PME) se propose d’assurer l’adoption de pratiques optimales de l’ANJE par les mères pour augmenter le taux d’initiation précoce à l’allaitement de 36,5% à 66,5 %; et le taux d’allaitement exclusif jusqu’à 6 mois de 17,7 % à 47,7% et le taux d’Alimentation Minimum Acceptable des enfants de 6-23 mois de 13,3 % à 43,3% d’ici l’an 2021.

Policy_Content: The Act is organized in 6 Parts and establishes the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Land and Sea Future Fund, which has the scope to enhance the Commonwealth’s ability to make payments to the Indigenous Land and Sea Corporation. The Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Land and Sea Future Fund consists of: (a) the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Land and Sea Future Fund Special Account; and (b) the investments of the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Land and Sea Future Fund. The Future Fund Board is also establishes and it is responsible for deciding how to invest the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Land and Sea Future Fund. In doing so, the Future Fund Board is bound by the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Land and Sea Future Fund Investment Mandate given to it by the responsible Ministers. The Act also establishes the Indigenous Land and Sea Corporation Funding Special Account.

Policy_Content: La presente Ley de de Microcooperativas de las Illes Balears, tiene por objeto regular las microcooperativas en el ámbito de las Illes Balears, entendiendo por microcooperativa,  aquella sociedad cooperativa de primer grado, perteneciente exclusivamente a la clase de las de trabajo asociado y a la de las de explotación comunitaria de la tierra, cuyo régimen jurídico se regula en virtud de la presente Ley como especialidad de la sociedad cooperativa. Las microcooperativas de trabajo asociado estarán integradas por un mínimo de dos y un máximo de diez personas socias trabajadoras incorporadas de forma indefinida, a jornada completa o a jornada parcial. Las microcooperativas de explotación comunitaria de la tierra estarán integradas por un mínimo de dos y un máximo de diez personas socias que cumplan las condiciones establecidas en la Ley de cooperativas de las Illes Balears.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree establishes that the Integrated Programme for Local Development and the Fight against Poverty is coordinated by the Minister of State for Economic and Social Development within the framework of the Committee of Social Policy of the Council of Ministers. Policy: Presidential Decree No. 35/19 approving the Technical Regulation on the Marketing of Rough Diamonds.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Technical Regulation on the Marketing of Rough Diamonds. This Regulation, consisting of 55 articles divided into six Chapters and one Annex, regulates Law No. 31/11 of 23 September approving the Mining Code, in relation to the sale of rough diamonds and in accordance with the provisions of Presidential Decree No. 175/18 of 27 July approving the Policy of Diamond Marketing. The Technical Regulation on the Marketing of Rough Diamonds, results from the evolution of the sale regimes of the national diamond production and represents a new phase in the process of gradual restructuring of the diamond industry, taking into account the interests of all stakeholders, namely the State, as the owner of the natural resources, the producers as the holders of the mining rights for industrial or artisanal exploitation, and the Public Organ of Commercialization and the Investors.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Resolución Nº 601 - Mediante la cual se establecen las Normas sobre diseño, emisión, utilización y canje de guías electrónicas de circulación de productos forestales, procedentes de aprovechamiento debidamente autorizados por este Ministerio.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución tiene por objeto establecer las normas sobre diseño, emisión, utilización y canje de guías electrónicas de circulación de productos forestales procedentes de aprovechamientos debidamente autorizados por el Ministerio del Poder Popular para el Ecosocialismo. Los tipos de guías de circulación de productos forestales son: 1) Guía de Aprovechamiento: expedida para amparar la circulación de productos forestales provenientes de las áreas de aprovechamiento hasta los centros de transformación o depósito; y 2) Guía de canje: expedida por el vencimiento de la guía de aprovechamiento y para amparar la circulación de productos forestales que fueron transformados, importados o adjudicados. La guía de circulación de productos forestales será emitida en función de las cantidades o volúmenes a transportar, para madera en rolas y aserrada por m3; para machihembrado por m2, para carbón vegetal y similares por Kg y para estantillos y similares por unidades, identificados por una codificación numérica signada por el Sistema de Guías Electrónicas de Productos Forestales (SIGEFOR). La guía de circulación de productos forestales indicará su vigencia al momento de su expedición, en ningún caso excederá los 30 días hábiles de vigencia.

Policy: Law No.7 of 2019 establishing the Abu Dhabi Agriculture and Food Safety Authority.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 20 articles aims at establishing the Abu Dhabi Agriculture and Food Safety Authority, the local body in charge of agriculture, food safety, food security and biosecurity in the Emirate. ADAFSA aims to the sustainable development of agriculture, food security, and preservation of plant and animal health in a way that upholds biosecurity and achieves food security. In addition, the Authority is responsible for preparing plans, programs and activities in the aforementioned fields. The Authority, in order to ensure the access of safe food to the community, is assigned to control and inspect the Emirate's (i) food and agriculture establishments, (ii) farms, (iii) agricultural inputs, (iv) imported, exported, and circulated in the Emirate food and agricultural items, and (v) food and agricultural items made in the country. ADAFSA also (i) supervises the establishment and management of emergency food reserves in cooperation with the competent authorities; (ii) is responsible for making partnerships and investments with investment funds, investors and the private sector in the areas of its work; and (iii) issues licenses and permits to undertake any agriculture or food activities according to legislation in force.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants

Amended articles establish the following: Grouped areas the set of buildings, occupied in total or in part by forest areas, subject to a single management and with a minimum area of ​​100 hectares, for collective investments whose purpose is forestry management and exploitation; Interventions with relevant territorial scale covering areas of at least 750 hectares, etc. Annexes deal with actions to be taken for: support for afforestation of agricultural and non-agricultural lands; Improving the resilience and environmental value of forests; Improving the economic value of forests.

Policy: Order No. 42-B/2019 amending Order No. 134/2015 on the regime of operation 8.1.3 "Forest Prevention against biotic and abiotic agents".
Policy_Content: This Order amends Order No. 134/2015 on the regime of operation 8.1.3 "Forest Prevention against biotic and abiotic agents". Amended articles deal with the regime for the implementation of operation 8.1.3, "Forest prevention against biotic and abiotic agents" and operation 8.1 .4 "Restoration of forest affected by biotic and abiotic agents or by catastrophic events", both of which are included in Action 8.1, "Sustainable Forestry" of Measure 8, "Protection and Rehabilitation of Forest Settlements", of the Continent Rural Development Programme (PDR 2020). Amendments provide for new supports programme under the Measure 8 'Protection and Rehabilitation of Forest Settlements' of the PDR 2020 which can be combined with others, provided that the following conditions are met: a) Eligible investment up to a limit of EUR 2 million per ZIF; b) Eligible investment up to a limit of 2 million euros, for public entities and collective forest management entities; c) Eligible investment up to a limit of EUR 1 million for the remaining beneficiaries.

Policy: Décret n° 2019-041 du 30 janvier 2019 portant approbation des statuts de l'Institut Géographique National.
Policy_Content: Le présent fixe les statuts de l’Institut Géographique National ont la mission la production, la conservation et la diffusion de l’information géographique de base.  A ce titre, il assure: la mise en place progressive, la conservation et la diffusion de l’infrastructure géographique de base sur le territoire national (le réseau géodésique national; le réseau de triangulation de tous ordres; le réseau général de nivellement de précision; les couvertures photographiques aériennes; la cartographie de base (cartes topographiques a petites, moyennes et grandes échelles); la cartographie urbaine a grandes échelles); l’établissement et la conservation des documents cartographiques de base nécessaires (registres fonciers urbains; Plans fonciers ruraux; Cadastre national); la matérialisation et la délimitation des frontières nationales et des limites territoriales et administratives du Benin; l'exécution de tous travaux topographiques, cartographiques, géodésiques, géomantiques et de levés d'études à la demande des organismes tant publics que prives et des tiers; la réalisation de la polygonation, du nivellement et de la mise en secteur des zones à lotir ainsi que la coordination et le contrôle des cabinets de géomètres experts chargés d’exécuter les opérations techniques-sur-le terrain; la coordination et le contrôle de toutes les activités de topographie et de cartographie, réalisées sur toute l'étendue du territoire national quel que soit l’organisme initiateur ou bénéficiaire ; l’Institut Géographique National est habilite a passer avec des tiers des contrats de réalisation des travaux géographiques ou de fourniture des prestations de sa compétence au Benin et à l’étranger.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo modifica el Reglamento de la Ley que crea el Sistema Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo de Desastres (SINAGERD), respecto a las entidades de primera respuesta, que son organizaciones especializadas para intervenir en casos de emergencias o desastres y que desarrollan acciones inmediatas necesarias en las zonas afectadas, en coordinación con la autoridad competente en los respectivos niveles de gobierno, según lo establecido en la Ley, el presente reglamento y los protocolos correspondientes. El plan contempla medidas de vacunación antibrucélica; diagnóstico del estatus sanitario mediante la Determinación Obligatoria del Estatus Sanitario ; el plan de saneamiento a aplicar en establecimientos con animales reaccionantes positivos a pruebas diagnósticas de brucelosis; el Certificado de Seronegatividad para el Movimiento de animales; la vigilancia epidemiológica. El artículo 25 se refiere específicamente a la agricultura familiar: el SENASA junto con los gobiernos provinciales u otros entes públicos o privados, podrá elaborar planes específicos que atiendan la agricultura familiar y las producciones de subsistencia.

Policy: Resolución 70/2019 – Declaración de alerta fitosanitaria.
Policy_Content: Por medio de esta Resolución se declara el alerta fitosanitaria en todo el territorio nacional con respecto a las plagas Halyomorpha halys y Bagrada hilaris. Se dispone adoptar y fortalecer acciones, procedimientos y medidas fitosanitarias tendientes a prevenir la introducción de dichas plagas. Por otro lado, se establece como denuncia obligatoria la detección, presencia o daño sospechoso de las mismas.

Policy: European Union (Ship Recycling) (Waste) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 13 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement elements of EU Regulation 1257/2013 on ship recycling relating to the authorisation of ship recycling facilities. These Regulations provide for any facilities located in Ireland to be authorised in accordance with the EU Regulation so that they may be added to the European list. The Environmental Protection Agency  is designated as the competent authority in the State for the purposes of Regulation 1257/2013. The Agency’s functions in relation to a permit for a ship recycling facility include ensuring compliance with Articles 13 and 14 of the Regulation. Articles 13 and 14 of the EU Regulation establish environmental and safety requirements for ship recycling facilities that recycle ships within its scope that will ensure the necessary controls are in place to protect the environment, the health and safety of workers and the population in the vicinity of the ship recycling facility caused by ship recycling activities.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Complementary Law No. 1.013 authorizing the Executive Branch to create the Land and Colonization Institute of Rondônia (INTERON).
Policy_Content: This Complementary Law, consisting of 33 articles divided into six Chapters, authorizes the Executive Branch to create the land agency to manage the agrarian reform and land policy of the State of Rondônia, named the Land and Colonization Institute of the State of Rondônia (INTERON). This autonomous entity is endowed with legal personality and administrative and financial autonomy, headquartered in the State Capital and jurisdiction in all its territory linked to the Government. INTERON will be invested with powers of representation to promote the collection of vacant lands, the normalization and respective titling of urban and rural areas, as well as colonization projects, on lands owned by the State and those administered by force of disciplined federal collaboration by contracts, agreements or management agreement. The State shall promote, through INTERON, under the terms of the Regulation, the recognition of property titles that, for any reason, have doubts regarding its dominance, form and size as: I - enormous plots called sesmarias, and rubber plantations; II - possessions registered; III - records from formal sharing; and IV - bonds issued by other units of the Federation which, by territorial limits, are currently in the perimeter of the State of Rondônia.

Policy: Directive Cantonale de Vaud sur la protection des sols sur les chantiers (DMP 863, 2019)
Policy_Content: La présente Directive Cantonale prévoit que sur tous les chantiers présentant un risque d’atteinte aux sols protégés selon le chiffre 3.1 de la présente Directive, des mesures spécifiques de protection doivent être prises. Elles concernent notamment la circulation sur les sols en place, la manipulation des matériaux terreux (décapage, stockage provisoire, reconstitution des sols), leur valorisation et la remise en culture. Dans le Canton de Vaud, l’autorité spécialisée en matière de protection des sols est la Direction générale de l'environnement, Direction des ressources et du patrimoine naturels, Division géologie, sols et déchets. Elle prend les mesures nécessaires à la protection des sols menacés ou dégradés en cas de dépassement des valeurs indicatives, des seuils d'investigation et des valeurs d'assainissement. Elle peut notamment ordonner, suite à une évaluation, l'élimination des polluants à la source, la restriction ou l'interdiction d'utiliser un sol ou la décontamination d'un sol. Elle peut mettre les frais des mesures qu’elle ordonne à la charge des personnes qui en sont responsables. La présente Directive prévoit également responsabilité du maître d'ouvrage ; suivi des chantiers par un spécialiste ; démarches en amont ; phase de chantier ; remise en culture ; valorisation des matériaux terreux non pollués ; rapport de suivi pédologique ; et sanctions.

Policy: Law No. 19 “On protection of whistle-blowers.”
Policy_Content: This Law is aimed at protecting the rights and freedoms of citizens, ensuring protection of persons, who reported corruption offenses, from persecution, establishes legal and organizational framework for the protection of these persons, and is also aimed at strengthening public confidence in the state and its structures. The bodies providing state protection are: (a) bodies making decisions on the implementation of state protection; and (b) bodies implementing security measures. The Principles for the protection of whistleblowers shall be as follows: (a) legality, respect for human and civil rights and freedoms; (b) creating conditions for the formation of an atmosphere of intolerance in society to manifestations of corruption; (c) providing guarantees against unlawful interference in professional (working) activities of persons, who reported corruption offenses, from official prosecution; (d) responsibility of the persons who disclosed information about the persons who reported facts of corruption offenses; and (e) warning of harmful consequences of corruption offenses. Information about the person, who reported the fact of corruption offenses, can only be classified after confirmation of information stated in the report. Classification must be carried out at the request of the protected person or with his consent.
Subject: General

Policy: Law on the protection against light pollution.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the protection against light pollution, which includes the persons liable for protection against light pollution, measures for protection against light pollution, the way of determining the maximum permitted values of illumination, restrictions and prohibition of illumination, conditions for planning, construction, maintenance and reconstruction of external lighting, measurement and monitoring methods, also aimed for environmental illumination and other issues in order to reduce the environmental pollution and harmful effects of light pollution. The purpose of this Law is to protect against light pollution caused by light emissions into the environment from artificial light sources exposed to humans, wildlife in the air and water, other natural resources, night skies and observatories, also by using energy-efficient lighting. Protection against light pollution shall ensure the protection of human health, the complete preservation of the quality of the environment, the conservation of biodiversity and landscape diversity, the preservation of ecological stability, the protection of flora and fauna, the rational use of natural resources and energy in the most favorable way for the environment, as a basic condition of public health and of foundation of the concept of sustainable development.

Policy: Order No. 33 of the Minister of Agriculture validating the Regulation on open tender for the determination of the registrar of grain receipts.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the procedure for holding open tender for the determination of the registrar of grain receipts. Grain receipt shall be intended a warehouse certificate in the form of a non-documentary receipt non-emission security confirming the right of ownership to a certain grain quantity. Potential providers of services as registrar of grain receipts must comply with the following requirements: (a) to have available web-site; (b) to use a free and open source database management system code; (c) to use a free and open source operating system; (d) to hold certificate of acceptance of the information system into commercial operation in in accordance with the legislation on informatization; (e) to be in possession of an act with a positive result of testing the information system for compliance with information security requirements in accordance with legislation on informatization; (f) to have expertise of technical documentation of the information system in in accordance with the legislation on informatization; (g) to have a certificate of compliance of the information system with the requirements information security in accordance with the legislation on of informatization; (h) to use blockchain-platform for storing information data of the grain receipt system; (i) to allow to perform operations with grain receipts in accordance with the Rules of electronic register of grain receipts’ holders; (j) to be integrated within the system of state electronic databases; and (k) to operate 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, except for technical breaks.

Policy: Mines and Minerals Act, No. 8 of 2018
Policy_Content: This Act is made with the objective to regulate the development of mineral resources in the country through adherence to sustainable development principles so as to benefit the economy and promote the economic growth of the country, protect and improve the welfare of the citizens, provide an attractive and conducive environment for investment in the mining sector, manage environmental impacts for the benefit of all present and future generations of Malawians, among others. The Act vests the ownership of minerals in the country on the State. The Act establishes and provides the constitution of the Mineral Resources Committee to examine the qualifications of persons applying for exploration licences, retention licences, medium-scale mining licences and large-scale mining licences and determine their eligibility to be granted the type of licence applied for. Other functions include; to recommend for granting, certain categories of licences; to recommend applications to expand the area of a medium-scale mining licence or a large-scale mining licence; determine whether any Geological Survey Reserve Area should be designated or revoked, among others. The Act also designates the office of the registrar of mineral tenements who shall provide secretariat services for the Mineral Resource Committee, and perform duties like receiving applications relating to mineral tenements, maintaining a chronological record of all applications received for mineral tenements, maintain the cadastre of mineral tenements, among others. According to the Act, a person shall on carry out the reconnaissance, prospecting, exploration or mining operations in accordance with a mineral tenement or an artisanal mining permit. The Act allows for a grant of a consolidated mining licence which is which consolidates the licences of a holder of two or more adjoining existing mining licences. A mineral tenement may be suspended or cancelled where the holder fails to use it in good faith, uses the land subject to the licence for any purpose other than the purpose for which the licence is granted, among others. the Act provides authorized officers with powers to enter a land for inspection, pursuant to the provisions of the Act, to arrest without a warrant, seize and sell minerals, among others.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Su objetivo específico es lograr que los sujetos agrarios con ingresos inferiores a la línea de bienestar rural, en localidades rurales, cuenten con ingresos suficientes para hacer productiva la tierra. Policy: Acuerdo No. 8538/2019 (GOC-2019-250-O17) - Otorga a la Empresa Geominera Camagüey una   oncesión de explotación del mineral oro en el área denominada Oro Big Golden Hill.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo otorga a la Empresa Geominera Camagüey una concesión de explotación del mineral oro en el área denominada Oro Big Golden Hill, con el objetivo de obtener doré. El área solicitada se ubica en el municipio de Jobabo, provincia de Las Tunas, y tiene una extensión de 19,96 ha, cuya ubicación en el terreno, en coordenadas Lambert, Sistema Cuba Sur, está especificada en la tabla anexa. El concesionario está obligado a: a) Solicitar la licencia ambiental a la Oficina de Regulación Ambiental y Seguridad Nuclear; b) iniciar la explotación del área cuando esté creado el sistema de drenaje y obras pertinentes que evite afectaciones por vertimientos de residuales a las aguas terrestres y de contaminantes al medio ambiente; c) realizar muestreo y evaluación sistemática de la calidad del agua a las fuentes cercanas a la concesión; d) depositar los desechos u otros materiales en zonas que no afecten el escurrimiento natural del terreno; e) depositar adecuadamente el material desbrozado sin afectaciones al escurrimiento natural y alejado de canales y drenajes, en una zona donde se pueda utilizar para la rehabilitación de las áreas afectadas; f) contactar con las autoridades de la Agricultura del municipio de Jobabo, con el fin de efectuar la debida indemnización, cuando proceda, y reparar los danos ocasionados si como consecuencia de su actividad minera en el área de la concesión se afectan intereses o derechos de terceros, sean personas naturales o jurídicas, según establece la legislación vigente; etc.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement wallon du 24 janvier 2019 relatif à l’octroi des aides aux zones soumises à des contraintes naturelles ou à des contraintes spécifiques
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté, organisé en VII chapitres, prévoit l'octroi d'une aide est pour les agriculteurs dont l'exploitation est située dans des zones soumises à des contraintes naturelles ou à des contraintes spécifiques. Il s'agit d'une indemnité compensatoire annuelle soumise à des conditions spécifiés par l'arrêté même. Le deuxième chapitre établit quelles sont les zones soumises à des contraintes naturelles ou à des contraintes spécifiques, alors que les troisième et quatrième chapitres définissent respectivement quelles sont les conditions d'admissibilité aux aides et la procédure de demande d'aide et répartition de l'aide. Le cinquième chapitre prévoit une aide transitoire pour les agriculteurs poursuivant une activité agricole dans une zone anciennement reprise dans les zones à contraintes naturelles et non reprise dans la nouvelle délimitation des zones à contraintes naturelles et spécifiques. Finalement, les dernier deux chapitres disposent au regard des procédures de contrôle, des pénalités et de cas de contournement et s'occupent des dispositions finales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Code of Practice for Agricultural Environmental Management  (BC Reg 8/2019).
Policy_Content: For the purpose of minimizing the introduction of waste into the environment and preventing adverse impacts to the environment and human health, this code requires persons to use environmentally responsible and sustainable agricultural practices when carrying out agricultural operations described in subsection (3). This code applies to an agricultural operation described in subsection (3) that is carried out in British Columbia (a) on (i) an agricultural land base that is owned, rented or leased, and managed, by the person who carries out the agricultural operation, and (ii) land that is not zoned for residential purposes, and (b) primarily for the purpose of distributing agricultural products to other persons, whether (i) directly or indirectly, (ii) with or without a fee, or (iii) on a commercial or non-commercial basis. The following are agricultural operations for the purposes of this code: (a) rearing and keeping livestock or poultry, and growing and harvesting agricultural products, for (i) consumption or use by humans, including as food, fibre or fuel, (ii) use as animal feed, (b) storing (i) nutrient sources and agricultural by-products, and (ii) the primary products of livestock, poultry, insects, plants and fungi; (c) carrying out agricultural composting processes; (d) applying nutrient sources to land; (e) washing, grading or packaging agricultural products, if carried out on the same agricultural land base as the livestock or poultry were reared or kept or the agricultural products were grown or harvested. A person who carries out an agricultural operation must ensure that emissions of air contaminants from forced air ventilation systems used in the agricultural operation do not enter a watercourse or cross a property boundary. A person who applies wastewater to land must ensure that the wastewater (a) contains no solid waste or visible tissue, (b) is applied only on the agricultural land base on which the wastewater was generated, and (c) is not applied to land used to grow crops for human consumption or to graze domestic ruminants.

Policy: Décret n°2019/030 du 23 janvier 2019 portant organisation du Ministère de l'Administration Territoriale.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret organise le Ministère de l'Administration Territoriale est responsable de l’élaboration et de la mise en œuvre de la politique du Gouvernement en matière d'administration du territoire, de protection civile et de suivi des questions électorales. Dans le domaine de l’administration du territoire, il est chargé, entre autres, de l’organisation et du fonctionnement des circonscriptions administratives et des services locaux de l’administration territoriale; l’organisation et du suivi des chefferies traditionnelles; la préparation et de l’application des lois et règlements relatifs aux libertés publiques ; maintien de l'ordre public, en rapport avec les forces spécialisées; suivi des activités des associations, organisations et mouvements à but non lucratif ; des questions relatives à la délimitation, à la démarcation, à la matérialisation, à la mise en valeur et à la sécurisation des frontières internationales, en liaison avec les administrations concernées. En ce qui concerne la protection civile, il est en charge de l’élaboration, de la mise en œuvre et du suivi de la réglementation et des normes en matière de prévention et de gestion des risques et calamites naturelles, en liaison avec les autres administrations concernées ; de la coordination des actions nationales et internationales en cas de catastrophe naturelle.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy_Content: En vue de l’application de l’article 3 de l’arrêté royal du 29 juin 2018 royal relatif à la réduction de l’intensité de gaz à effet de serre de l’énergie destinée au transport, cet arrêté établit les points suivants : le fournisseur de carburants destinés au transport et, le cas échéant, le fournisseur d’électricité destiné à des véhicules routiers utilise le modèle de rapport disponible auprès de l’autorité compétente; la quantité d’électricité mise à la consommation doit être démontrée au moyen d’une preuve univoque de la quantité d’électricité utilisée pour recharger ces véhicules; le fournisseur fait usage du modèle de preuve de transfert et de réception de REO (réductions d’émissions obtenues) et de RET (réductions d’émissions transférées) disponible auprès de l’autorité compétente; le fournisseur fait usage du modèle de preuve du transfert de RCEA disponible auprès de l’autorité compétente; et le fournisseur doit, au plus tard le 1er février 2021, introduire par lettre recommandée une demande d’attestation de la durabilité des RCEA auprès de l’autorité compétente.

Policy: Sea Ports Authority Law of 2019.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 23 articles divided in V Chapters aims at establishing the Sea Ports Authority with the following main tasks (i) organizing, renovating, and encouraging investments in the marine port and marine transport sector, by intervening both at the administrative and infrastructure levels, together with supervisory and control measures; (ii) establish criteria, conditions, and technical characteristics for the safety and protection of sea and dry ports, and marine transport; and (iii) organize marine transport and monitoring of commercial vessels. Article 7 lists in detail the Authority's competences for the performance of its functions, including (i) the identification and implementation of its general policy and development plans to implement it; (ii) issue of permits; (iii) environmental protection; and (iv) navigation contingency plans. Article 10 establishes the Ports Authority Board of Directors and the following articles provide for its functions, cConditions for Board membership, meetings, appointment of a General Manager, together with his powers and functions. The Law also deals with financial issues.

Policy: Acuerdo por el que se emiten los Lineamientos para la Operación del Programa Producción para el Bienestar para el ejercicio fiscal 2019.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo tiene por objeto dar a conocer los Lineamientos para la Operación del Programa Producción para el Bienestar para el Ejercicio Fiscal 2019, cuyo objetivo general es el de incrementar la producción nacional de granos para aumentar el grado de autosuficiencia alimentaria nacional. El objetivo específico del programa consiste en dotar de liquidez y vincular al acceso a servicios, para su inversión en actividades productivas con enfoque sustentable en los predios de los pequeños y medianos productores. La población objetivo contempla predios de pequeños y medianos productores con superficie de hasta 20 hectáreas elegibles inscritos en el Padrón del Programa Producción para el Bienestar que cultiven granos (maíz, frijol, trigo panificable, arroz, entre otros).

Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 15 articles, establishes the State Plan for Planted Forests, linked to the State Secretariat of Agriculture and Supply (SEAB). SEAB has the administrative duties, called Authority for Planted Forests, established by Law 11.054 of 11 January 1995. The Planted Forests Authority should exercise the duties of control, monitoring, promotion, as well as support activities and work in cooperation with the state agencies of agricultural research and rural extension, with the following main objectives: stimulate the production and development of the regional forestry sector; support to companies and forest-based industries with activities in the State; and support to municipalities. The Authority for Planted Forests will stimulate forest cultivation resulting from reforestation or cutting through development programmes of the sector and support the free exercise of this economic activity, respecting the current legislation, as well as the guarantee of its use.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 10/2019 amending Decree-Law No. 38/2013 on the scheme for greenhouse gas emission allowance trading from 2013 onward.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law amends Decree-Law No. 38/2013 on the scheme for greenhouse gas emission allowance trading from 2013 onward. Amended article 17 establishes: a) 60% of the auctioning allowances shall be used to promote renewable energy by offsetting part of the total over-cost of the special scheme production from renewable energy sources each year up to a limit of 100% of that extra cost, including the extra cost of renewable co-generation production in its renewable fraction. Policy: Law No. 1/2019 amending Law No. 13/2005 on Petroleum Activities.
Policy_Content: This Law amends Law No. 13/2005 on Petroleum Activities. Amendments deal with the participation of the State and other public corporations in Petroleum Operations. In particular, amendments establish that the decision on the participation of East Timor public corporations, including entities, in Petroleum Operations, must be approved by the Council of Ministers, which may delegate its power to the Prime Minister. The legislative amendment approved by this law is intended to make clear that the participation of the State, public corporations and any other legal persons wholly owned or controlled by them are not limited to a maximum participation of 20% when that participation is based on a commercial transaction. This law also introduces an exception to the system of prior supervision of the Chamber of Accounts of the Superior Administrative, Tax and Accounts Court, exempting from prior approval any contracts related to the acquisition of rights, for the State or for any another public corporate body to participate in oil operations.

Policy: Decreto Nº 355 - Reglamento para la comercialización de productos agropecuarios en las provincias de la Habana, Artemisa y Mayabeque.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento para la comercialización de productos agropecuarios en las provincias de la Habana, Artemisa y Mayabeque. Este Reglamento, que consta de 34 artículos divididos en seis Capítulos, tiene como objetivo establecer el procedimiento para la comercialización de productos agropecuarios en las provincias de La Habana, Artemisa y Mayabeque. Son sujetos de las presentes regulaciones: a) las empresas estatales que participan en la comercialización de productos agropecuarios; b) las unidades básicas de producción cooperativa; c) las cooperativas de producción agropecuaria; d) las cooperativas de créditos y servicios; e) las empresas y unidades presupuestadas con los excedentes de sus áreas para el  autoabastecimiento; f) las cooperativas no agropecuarias comercializadoras de productos agropecuarios; g) los agricultores pequeños; h) el vendedor mayorista de productos agropecuarios; i) el vendedor minorista de productos agropecuarios; y j) el carretillero o vendedor de productos agrícolas en forma ambulatoria. De los productos agropecuarios a comercializar se pueden vender productos agropecuarios frescos y elaborados con excepción de los siguientes: a) carne de ganado equino, vacuno y bufalino; b) leche fresca y sus derivados; c) café; d) miel de abejas, excepto de especies meliponas o de la tierra; e) tabaco en rama y torcido; f) cacao y sus derivados.

Policy: Law No. 4.780 on the State Policy to Encourage the Generation and Use of Solar Energy within the State of Amazonas.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the State Policy to Encourage the Generation and Use of Solar Energy within the State of Amazonas. The objectives of the State Policy are: stimulate investments for ecologically correct solar energy systems, including technological development and the production of photovoltaic and photothermal solar energy for self consumption in private and public enterprises; create employment and income alternatives; improve energy efficiency and reduce costs; mitigate negative impacts on the environment; universalize the public energy service; encourage the use of cleaner technologies; stimulate the use of renewable energy sources; encourage the production of equipment and components for the generation of solar energy in the State of Amazonas; foster training programmes to work at all stages of the production chain; stimulate the creation of companies providing service for solar panels; foster research and development programmes in state institutions to ensure photovoltaic solar energy technology; diversify the Amazonian energy matrix; reliability and security of supply.

Policy: Decree No. 5 of the Ministry of Agriculture and Food validating the Regulation on liming of acidic agricultural land.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for liming of acidic agricultural land and it shall be applicable to legal persons, the main activity of which is manufacturing, procurement, processing of agricultural commodities on the national territory, and provision of services in the field of crop production, land reclamation of general services. Liming of acidic agricultural land shall be intended application to the soil of calcium and magnesium as carbonate, oxide or hydroxide for neutralization of acidity. Quality of application of lime materials in the field or on land shall be determined in accordance with the following indicators: (a) compliance with the normative application dose; (b) uniformity of application; and (c) absence of spilled lime materials. Liming of acidic soils of agricultural lands is carried out during calendar year. Only lime materials that have passed state registration and included in the State register of plant protection means and fertilizers authorized for use on the national territory shall be authorized for liming of acidic soils of agricultural land.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil

Policy: Law No. 1.300 regulating the commercial exploitation of submerged wood in dammed waters in the state territory.
Policy_Content: This Law deals with the commercial exploitation of submerged wood in dammed waters within the state territory. The State Executive Branch is authorized, through the State Foundation for the Environment and Renewable Water Resources (FEMARH), to register companies aiming to exploit submerged woods in dammed state waters. Trees that are not removed before the closure of the floodgates and are still submerged may be cut and removed from the bottom of the water using specific techniques and the wood, when benefited, may be destined for marketing. The State Executive Branch, after hearing the competent state organs, shall issue a normative instrument regulating the present law, on the economic exploitation of the logging activity in the aquatic environment in which the trees are submerged.

Policy: Arrêté n° 542 du 17 janvier 2019 instituant un projet dénommé «suivi de la dynamique de la bande côtière à Pointe-Noire».
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée au sein du ministère de la recherche scientifique et de l’innovation technologique, le projet « suivi de la dynamique de la bande côtière à Pointe-Noire », placé la responsabilité de l’Institut national de recherche en sciences exactes et naturelles. Le projet a pour missions, notamment, de: comprendre la dynamique du système littoral de Pointe-Noire; obtenir et exploiter de longues séries de données météorologiques et hydrologiques de base de la zone côtière congolaise afin de déceler des signaux climatiques; réaliser des études des différentes masses d’eaux superficielles et sub-superficielles, de leurs mouvements et de leurs extensions en cours d’année, des structures engendrées par ces mouvements ainsi que des enrichissements en sels nutritifs et planctons qui y sont liés; réaliser des études sur la faune marine, la dynamique des populations des principales espèces pêchées et sur la productivité en vue de l’aménagement des pêcheries congolaises; contribuer à la promotion d’une gestion durable des zones marines et côtières en améliorant le processus de prise de décision par la mise à disposition d’informations environnementales supplémentaires pertinentes pour le suivi et l’évaluation; améliorer les capacités des décideurs congolais en matière de conception, de mise en œuvre et de suivi des politiques de planification de l’aménagement du littoral et de gestion de la pêche; renforcer les capacités infrastructurelles et économiques le long du littoral; renforcer les capacités des acteurs de terrain évoluant dans le secteur marin et côtier à partir des données scientifiques par des ateliers de formation; intégrer les scenarii des effets du changement climatique ainsi que les conséquences issues des analyses des informations de suivi de la dynamique de la zone côtière dans les textes réglementaires et les plans/programmes de gestion intégrée des côtes.

Policy: Political platform for the Norwegian Government, formed by the Conservative Party, the Progress Party, the Liberal Party and the Christian Democratic Party (the Granavolden-platform).
Policy_Content: The present document contains the Government's political platform for the period 2019-2021, setting goals and defining measures to achieve these goals. It describes the major challenges that Norway is facing as: creating a sustainable welfare society through rearrangement of the Norwegian economy, creating growth and more jobs, creating infrastructure throughout the country, and promoting the "green shift" as well as diversifying the economy; creating ecological sustainability through a strong climate policy; strengthening social sustainability through maintaining equality, trust among people and reduced poverty; and ensuring safety as a condition for freedom.

Policy: Decreto Nº 3-2019 ─ Reglamenta el procedimiento para la aprobación e implementación de los incentivos forestales.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto establecer los procedimientos para el acceso a los incentivos forestales, y será aplicable a las personas naturales o jurídicas de cualquier giro de negocio que deseen acogerse a los incentivos fiscales al sector forestal. El fomento y otorgamiento de incentivos, obedece a los objetivos siguientes: 1) El manejo del bosque natural cuyo conjunto de acciones y procedimientos tienen por objeto la conservación, cultivo, restauración y aprovechamiento de los recursos naturales manteniendo el ecosistema boscoso natural; 2) La ampliación de la cobertura forestal en tierras desprovistas de bosques a través del establecimiento y mantenimiento de plantaciones forestales, con el fin de asegurar un crecimiento sostenido del sector; 3) La protección y conservación de bosques cuyas medidas de prevención y control incluyen acciones silviculturales y administrativas por parte de las instituciones miembros del Sistema Nacional de Administración Forestal (SNAF), las cuales deben ser puestas en prácticas por los propietarios de iniciativas con incentivos forestales; 4) El incremento del valor agregado, que incluye inversiones dentro de la cadena productiva forestal de las empresas e industrias forestales de segunda y tercera transformación, para obtener productos más elaborados y de mejor calidad, con alta competitividad en los mercados nacionales e internacionales; 5) Mejorar la tecnología que permita el desarrollo eficaz y eficiente del sector con altos niveles de competitividad y desarrollo empresarial; 6) Fomentar la investigación para el desarrollo tecnológico de la cadena productiva forestal; 7) Fortalecer el sector forestal, con la atracción de inversiones, ampliación en la disponibilidad de materia prima, promoción de la reforestación, promoción para la creación de plantaciones, conservando y ampliando los bosques nicaragüenses.
Subject: Forestry

Policy_Content: En application des dispositions de l’article 92 de loi n° 2018-25 du 12 novembre 2018 portant code forestier, le présent décret apporte, les innovations suivantes : l’encadrement des défrichements, des feux de brousse ainsi que du pâturage par des règles strictes ; la responsabilité pénale des personnes morales ; la prise en compte des mesures relatives au commerce international des espèces de flore et de faune menacées d'extinction ; les sanctions liées au trafic international illicite de bois. Le présent décret comporte trois (03) titres : la gestion des forêts (Titre I) ; la protection des forêts (Titre II) ; et les dispositions finales (Titre III).

Policy: European Union (Environmental Impact Assessment) (Peat Extraction) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 4 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Environmental Protection Agency Act, 1992 by inserting a new section (82B) on the control of peat extraction, i.e. the extraction of peat that involves an area of 30 hectares or more. No person shall carry on peat extraction other than in accordance with a licence or revised licence issued under the Act. Some exceptions on this rule are specified. The Environmental Protection Agency shall carry out an  environmental impact assessment in respect of an application for a licence for peat extraction or a review of a licence or revised licence to carry on peat extraction, relating to a change or extension of the licensed activity, which is, in the opinion of the Agency, likely to have significant adverse effects on the environment. The Act of 1992, the Planning and Development Act 2000 and the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 are amended so as to provide for the proper procedures for obtaining a licence.

Port wine has an actual alcoholic volume of 19% vol. and 22% vol. Port wine with the traditional names of tawny, ruby, white or white and rosé not included in the special categories of Port wine may have a minimum of 18% vol. The slightly light white Port wine may have a minimum of 16,5% vol. Policy: Scottish Crown Estate Act 2019  (2019 Asp 1).
Policy_Content: The Act makes provision for changes in the management of the Scottish Crown Estate (meaning the property, rights and interests to which section 90B(5) of the Scotland Act 1998 applies) including the duties on management and charging for the assets. The Act both provides the mechanism to change the manager of an asset (or part of an asset) and sets out the regulatory framework within which all managers, irrespective of the size of the asset managed, must operate. Crown Estate Scotland (formerly Crown Estate Scotland (Interim Management)) shall in principle manage crown estate assets but these may be transferred by the Scottish Minister to other persons. "Land" shall include also land covered with water. A manager of a Scottish Crown Estate asset shall maintain and seek to enhance the value of the asset and the revenue arising from it. A manager must act in the way best calculated to further the achievement of sustainable development in Scotland and manage the asset in a way that is likely to contribute to the promotion or improvement in Scotland of wider socio-economic and environmental benefits. There are certain restrictions on the granting of rights on Crown estate also in respect of lease for aquaculture.
