Policy: Ministerial Decision No.21 of 2019 on the use of recycled materials from construction and demolition waste in road and infrastructure projects.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 13 articles aims at moving towards the green economy and creating a new economic space by (i) providing basic environmental conditions for the use of recycled materials from construction and demolition waste; (ii) developing the concept of transforming recycled materials into new, high-value products that can be marketed and increase the national economy; (iii) building build a community culture aimed at reducing waste production and developing the concept of waste reuse and optimization; and (iv) protecting the environment, public health together with the sustainable development. The provisions of this Resolution apply to all road and infrastructure projects of the governmental and private sectors. The waste to be used consists of cement components, metal mixture, brick, concrete, sand and gravel, asphalt, mixture of wood, and gypsum. The product quality measurement mechanism has to be conform to the approved UAE standards as well as LEED and BREEAM certifications. Responsible body for the implementation of this Resolution is the local waste management authority in each Emirate.

Policy: Law No. 17.677 creating the State Policy promoting Organic Products Fairs.
Policy_Content: This Law creates the State Policy promoting Organic Products Fairs. The State Policy has the following objectives: promote food and nutritional security and the right to adequate and healthy food; encourage the consumption of organic products; encourage entrepreneurship and cooperativism, with a view to growing the production of organic products; contribute to cooperativism and the solidarity economy in the State of Santa Catarina; and make the population aware of the benefits of healthy eating. Policy: Real Decreto-Ley Nº 1/2019 - Medidas urgentes para adecuar las competencias de la Comisión Nacional de los Mercados y la Competencia a las exigencias derivadas del derecho comunitario en relación a las Directivas 2009/72/CE y 2009/73/CE del Parlamento Europeo y del Consejo, de 13 de julio de 2009, sobre normas comunes para el mercado interior de la electricidad y del gas natural.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto-Ley establece medidas urgentes para adecuar las competencias de la Comisión Nacional de los Mercados y la Competencia a las exigencias derivadas del derecho comunitario, sobre normas comunes para el mercado interior de la electricidad y del gas natural. La Comisión Nacional de los Mercados y la Competencia, en el ámbito de sus competencias de regulación, deberá tener en consideración las prioridades estratégicas establecidas por el Gobierno, que se materializarán en unas orientaciones de política energética adoptadas por orden del titular del Ministerio para la Transición Ecológica previo acuerdo de la Comisión Delegada del Gobierno para Asuntos Económicos. Las orientaciones de política energética abarcarán aspectos tales como la seguridad de suministro, la seguridad pública, la sostenibilidad económica y financiera de los sistemas eléctrico y gasista, la independencia del suministro, la calidad del aire, la lucha contra el cambio climático y respeto al medio ambiente, la gestión óptima y el desarrollo de los recursos nacionales, la gestión de la demanda, la gestión de las elecciones tecnológicas futuras, la utilización racional de la energía, así como cualesquiera otros que guarden relación directa con las competencias del Gobierno en materia energética.

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 2/2019 - Modifican las bases reguladoras de la concesión de ayudas a la integración asociativa y la dinamización industrial establecidas en el Real Decreto Nº 1010/2015, el Real Decreto Nº 126/2016, el Real Decreto Nº 197/2016, el Real Decreto Nº 254/2016, y el Real Decreto Nº 312/2016, en el marco del Programa Nacional de Desarrollo Rural 2014-2020.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto modificar las bases reguladoras de la concesión de ayudas a la integración asociativa y la dinamización industrial, establecidas en diversos Reales Decretos, en el marco del Programa Nacional de Desarrollo Rural 2014-2020. Las presentes modificaciones se traducen en una mayor flexibilidad en la aplicación de las medidas y en una mejora de la gestión de las subvenciones para el administrado. Asimismo, son compatibles con el contenido del Programa Nacional de Desarrollo Rural 2014-2020, incorporando cambios, a modo de evolución, derivados de la aplicación de las subvenciones durante las convocatorias 2016, 2017 y 2018, e igualmente garantiza el principio de seguridad jurídica al eliminar imprecisiones en su articulado sin que ello suponga alteración en las obligaciones y derechos de los administrados. Por último en aplicación del principio de transparencia, se han desarrollado guías del solicitante de cada una de las medidas en aras de posibilitar un mejor acceso y más sencilla compresión a los potenciales beneficiarios que serán actualizadas convenientemente para incluir las modificaciones aquí introducidas. Finalmente, el principio de eficiencia se considera cumplido toda vez que no se imponen nuevas cargas administrativas frente a la regulación actual.

Policy: Fertilizers Law (No. XIII-1927).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the requirements for the fertilizers traded and supplied to the internal market of the Republic of Lithuania, the obligations of economic operators, users of fertilizing products, the requirements for the placing on the market and supply of fertilizing products, the inclusion of the traded and supplied fertilizers in the Identification List of Fertilizers and the requirements for cancellation of fertilizers from the Identification List of Fertilizers, the market surveillance procedure and the liability for violations of this Law. This Law applies to fertilizers traded and supplied to the market insofar as these products are not regulated by European Union legislation. Identification List of Fertilizers, the description of the inclusion of fertilizers therein and the procedure for its cancellation of fertilizers therefrom shall be approved by the Minister of Agriculture of the Republic of Lithuania. When the fertilizer is not included in the Identification List, the economic operator shall submit a request to the competent Authority to include the fertilizer in the Identification List and the documentation supporting the compliance of this fertilizer with the requirements set out in this paragraph, proving that: (a) the fertilizer complies with the general safety and quality requirements of the functional fertilizer products category assigned and approved by the Minister of Agriculture; (b) a positive effect of the fertilizer on plant nutrition, physical, chemical, biological and biological properties of the fertilizer has been demonstrated for at least three consecutive years without endangering human and animal life, public health or the environment under its intended use; and (c) fertilizer shall be cancelled from the Identification List if it is established that the fertilizer does not meet at least one of the requirements referred to in the aforesaid paragraph 2. Manufacturers must: (a) ensure that fertilizers in the Identification List meet the criteria set out in the Identification List; (b) perform assessment of the conformity of fertilizer products with the established requirements and prepare the technical documentation; in cases where there is no standard for an approved test method, the conformity of the fertilizer product may be based on the non-accredited laboratory test protocol; (c) keep the fertilizer technical documentation for five years after the product has been placed on the market for inspection by the approved body; (d)  ensure that fertilizers are labeled in accordance with the packaging and labeling requirements laid down by the Minister for the Economy and Innovation or, where the fertilizer is delivered without packaging, in a national language in a document accompanying the fertilizer; (e) when placing on the market or transiting through the territory of the Republic of Lithuania ammonium nitrate fertilizers with high nitrogen content (N (nitrogen)> 28 per cent), perform the tests specified in Paragraph 2 of Article 4 of this Law and follow the procedure and deadlines specified therein; and (f) upon request from the Authority, to provide the Authority with all the information and technical documentation necessary to assess the conformity of the fertilizer product with the requirements of Article 4 of this Law in the official language and to cooperate with the authorized body on any action taken by persons exposed to fertilizers, with a view of protecting human life and health, animal and plant life, and the environment. This Act consists of VIII Chapters divided into 20 Articles, Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II establishes the procedure for inclusion in and cancellation from the Identification List of Fertilizers. Chapter III establishes requirements for third products. Chapter IV establishes obligations of economic operators. Chapter V regards use of different products. Chapter VI regards maintenance of distribution markets. Chapter VII establishes liability. Chapter VIII lays down final provisions.

Policy: East African Community Food and Nutrition Security Action Plan 2019-2023.
Policy_Content: The East African Community Food and Nutrition Security Action Plan is a regional policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The timeframe of this policy is 5 years between 2019 and 2023. The overall purpose of the EAC Food and Nutrition Security Action Plan is to eliminate hunger, malnutrition, and extreme poverty in the East African region by 2023. The objectives of this policy are: (I) sustainable and inclusive agricultural production, productivity and trade of crops, animal and animal resources, fisheries, aquaculture, apiculture and forest products, (II) strengthened resilience among households, communities and livelihood systems through sustainable use of natural resources, environmental conservation and disaster risk reduction and management, and (III) improved access and utilization of nutritious, diverse and safe foods.

Policy: Décret n°2019-008 du 09 janvier 2019 portant approbation des statuts de l’Agence Nationale de Protection Sociale.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée en République du Bénin l’Agence Nationale de Protection Sociale dont la mission est de : assurer la gestion opérationnelle, la supervision générale de l’assurance pour le renforcement du capital Humain (ARCH) en s’appuyant sur ses directions techniques, ses antennes départementales et ses cellules communales; définir les prestations couvertes par l’Assurance pour le Renforcement du capital Humain à travers ses quatre (04) volets d’intervention ; définir et actualiser de manière participative, le panier standard de soins et les prix en collaboration avec les assureurs, les  représentants des structures de santé, les représentants des dispensateurs de produits pharmaceutiques et de ra société civile, de l'Autorité en charge de la régulation du secteur des assurances ; délivrer les agréments aux prestataires et partenaires stratégiques sur la base de critères spécifiques à chaque type de prestataires et partenaires ; immatriculer les assujettis et les bénéficiaires des prestations de l’Assurance pour le Renforcement du Capital Humain; collecter, vérifier, traiter et mettre à jour les informations relatives à l'immatriculation, au paiement des cotisations, à la mobilisation des ressources de toutes natures, à ra fourniture des prestations et au règlement des prestataires ; développer le cadre des interventions de contrôle et d’évaluation des organismes d’opérationnalisation des volets de l’assurance pour le renforcement du capital Humain; recruter des médecin-conseils pour réaliser l’expertise médicale ; mettre en place le réseau des structures chargées de la mise en œuvre de tous les volets de ARCH, assurer l'arbitrage en cas de litige entre les différents intervenants de l’Assurance pour le Renforcement du Capital Humain; assurer la gestion du système d'information de l'Assurance pour le Renforcement du Capital Humain ; mobiliser des ressources nécessaires à la mise en œuvre de l’assurance pour le renforcement du Capital Humain ; veiller à l’application des conventions passées avec les prestataires et les partenaires ; mettre en place une politique nationale de gestion des risques concernant les soins; définir le ticket modérateur et les conditions de remboursement, mettre en place le processus et la convention des tiers payant; définir les prestations couvertes au titre de la formation de l'assurance pour le renforcement du capital humain ; produire un rapport annuel sur la performance de l'Assurance pour le Renforcement du Capital Humain dans tous ses volets.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. UP-5618 “On the radical improvement of the system of legal awareness and legal culture in society.”
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree establishes basic arrangements for the radical improvement of the system of legal awareness and legal culture in society as follows: (a) raising legal awareness and legal culture in society; (b) formation of a system of consistent communication to the population of the essence and importance of socio-economic reforms implemented in the country, the adopted acts of legislation and state programs, strengthening in the minds of citizens the vital idea of "Establishing in the society the spirit of respect for the laws - the guarantee of building a democratic state based on the law"; (c) implementation of systematic and interrelated educational and pedagogical work, deep assertion of legal awareness and legal culture in all segments of the population, starting with the pre-school education system, wide promotion of the idea of maintaining the balance of personal and public interests; (d) a profound assertion in the minds of the younger generation of the concepts of rights and duties, honesty and integrity, ethical norms, teaching the important provisions of the Constitution from an early age; (e) organizing legal education activities among the population in order to develop a legal culture in harmony with the study of history, religion, and national values of our people, as well as strengthening each citizen's involvement in the fate of the country, patriotism through the formation of a sense of pride in state symbols; (f) raising legal awareness and legal culture of civil servants, promoting an intolerant attitude to corruption and other criminal offences; (g) strengthening of interaction between public authorities and management bodies, including law enforcement agencies, as well as civil society institutions in the implementation of targeted legal advocacy; (h) establishing, on a systematic basis, a broad and effective use of the principles of social partnership in the organization of measures to raise legal awareness and legal culture in society; (i) strengthening the role of mass media in providing legal information, wide use of innovative methods of legal advocacy, including increased use of modern information technologies; (j) improving legal education, as well as the development of a system of training, retraining and advanced training of legal personnel; and (k) in-depth study of the scientific basis for increasing legal awareness and legal culture in society.

Policy: Environmental Impact Assessment (Amendment) (Northern Ireland) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019 (S.R. No. 123 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made in order to address deficiencies in EU-derived domestic legislation in the field of Environmental Impact Assessments. The need for such amendments arises from the withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union and its basis is the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018. Reference to Community legislation in the amended instruments shall now be "retained EU law". Also, a new definition of "EU environmental assessment" is given. The Water Resources (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2017 are amended, among other things, in regulation 2(1) by inserting the definitions of "the Habitats Directive", the "Habitats Regulations" and Union legislation as relevant legislation.

Policy: Law No. 8.280 declaring of Relevant Environmental Interest the Conservation and Protection of Mountain Ecosystems within the Territory of the State of Rio de Janeiro.
Policy_Content: This Law declares of Relevant Environmental Interest the Conservation and Protection of Mountain Ecosystems within the Territory of the State of Rio de Janeiro. The objectives of this Law are as follows: ensure the conservation of the mountain biodiversity ecosystems and specially protected mountain areas; promote the equitable, efficient, shared and sustainable use of mountain resources and ecosystems, with a view to sustainable development, scientific and technological development and the maintenance and improvement of the quality and integrity of these ecosystems; monitor, prevent, mitigate and, exceptionally, compensate for negative socio-environmental impacts caused by anthropic activities in mountain ecosystems; encourage the economic, social and environmental sustainability of different activities in these areas; stimulate traditional knowledge and technologies with modern knowledge and technologies; integrate the sectoral public policies under the responsibility of different spheres of government; promote the development of state and municipal policies for the conservation and sustainable use of mountain ecosystems; integrate sport, cultural and religious activities with the characteristics of the ecosystem.

Policy: Decree No. 14 of the Cabinet of Ministers “On additional measures to optimize land plots of farms and other agricultural enterprises, as well as efficient use of sowing areas in agriculture.”
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Cabinet of Ministers, for the purpose of effective use of public land, transparency in allotment and cultivation of crops, large-scale introduction of modern and resource-saving technologies aimed and improvement of soil fertility, increase of agricultural production, improvement of financial and economic state of farms and agricultural enterprises, establishes to optimize land plots allotted to agricultural enterprises for their activities validating the requirements for optimization thereof in accordance with the Annex 4. As an experimental measure the following shall be decreed: (a) land plots for farms shall be allotted in accordance with the decision of the local government following the results of the open competition; (b) open tendering for allotment of land plots to farms should not exceed ten days with all procedures; (c) the main focus of the tender shall be availability of available funds free from obligations on the account of the legal and physical person of the applicant; availability of suitable agricultural machinery for the applicant or his family members; export oriented agricultural produce of the applicant; the number of new jobs created; and execution of the supply contracts for the last three years; and (d) district governor, without the competition, shall have the right to allot agricultural land plots in accordance with land lease agreement, on the terms of targeted use for the current year, and on the recommendation of the head of local government, if applicants and cluster enterprises directly invest $ 5,000 worth in the projects of vegetable and grain production, and horticulture. In the event that farms or other agricultural enterprises with allotted or consolidated land plots on the basis of these requirements do not fulfill their obligations stated in the business plan, the land lease agreement shall be unilaterally termination by the district governor. In the process of optimization of land plots of agricultural enterprises a long-term lease agreement with agricultural enterprises shall be terminated in the following cases: (a) infringement of the land parcel requirements set by the legislation, lease agreement and conditions of agricultural crops placement and non-targeted, effective and rational use of land plots; (b) failure to comply with the terms of lease of land plot and water use, failure to take measures to improve land reclamation, increase soil fertility, and not to provide funds for these purposes; (c) reduction of land plots to the size specified in the long-term lease agreement, unreasonable construction of buildings or other damage to irrigated areas; (d) untimely implementation of agrotechnical measures for the maintenance of agricultural crops or non-compliance with the established requirements and yields below the normative rate; (e) failure to comply with contractual agreements for the supply of agricultural products for public procurement in the past three years, ineffective or low-cost economic activities; and (f) untimely payment of taxes and other obligatory payments.

Policy: Acuerdo Gubernativo nº 8-2019 por el que se aprueba el Reglamento para el Manejo del Ecosistema Manglar.
Policy_Content: El presente Reglamento tiene por objeto regular la protección, conservación, restauración y el manejo sostenible del recurso forestal en el ecosistema manglar, siendo definido de interés nacional la protección, conservación, restauración y manejo sostenible de dicho recurso forestal. El presente Reglamento es de aplicación general y sus disposiciones rigen en todo el territorio de la República de Guatemala. Los objetivos del presente documento son, entre otros: regular el manejo sostenible del recurso forestal en el ecosistema manglar; promover la investigación para la conservación y protección del ecosistema; fomentar la restauración en áreas degradadas del ecosistema manglar que permita recuperar, aumentar y mantener los servicios ecosistémicos; impulsar el establecimiento de plantaciones forestales, preferentemente con especies nativas, que disminuyan la presión sobre el manglar; y promover la participación del estado, municipalidades y los habitantes de la república en relación al manejo sostenible del ecosistema manglar. El Reglamento contiene además normas relativas al consumo familiar y a la comercialización y transporte de productos forestales.

Policy: Regulation No. 35 of 2019 of Minister of the Environment of Estonia on Content of the River Basin Water Monitoring Program, Principles, Methods and Methodology for the Development of the Water Monitoring Program and Implementation Requirements
Policy_Content: This Regulation specifies the content of river basin water monitoring programs (hereinafter  water monitoring programs ), including requirements for the monitoring of surface water, groundwater and areas subject to protection specified in the Water Act. This Regulation applies to the water monitoring program for a river basin and the Estonian part of a transboundary river basin. Surface water monitoring within the meaning of this Regulation shall include monitoring of inland and open water bodies, coastal waters and chemical status in the territorial sea. The Regulation consists of four chapters: General provisions  (1); Monitoring of surface water bodies and the territorial sea (2); Monitoring of groundwater bodies (3); and Quality Assurance Requirements for River Basin Water Monitoring (4).

Policy: DENR Administrative Order No. 2019-03 on Revised Implementing Rules and Regulations of Executive Order No. 193, Series of 2015 Expanding and Enhancing the Coverage of the National Greening Programme.
Policy_Content: This Administrative Order, consisting of 21 sections, pursuant to Executive Order No. 193, series of 2015, known as Expanding the Coverage of the National Greening Programme (NGP) aims to harmonize all forestry development activities that will encourage and enhance the development of forestry plantations with greater participation from the private sector, local government units, and organized upland communities. The general objective of this Order is to implement the expansion of the coverage of NGP, extend the period of its implementation in accordance with the updated Philippine Master Plan for Climate Resilient Forestry Development and Philippine Devlopment Plan. Specifically, it aims to perform the following activities: a) Accelerate the rehabilitation and reforestation of unproductive, denuded, and degraded areas; b) Sustain rehabilitation and conservation of watershed areas; c) Enhance and encourage equal participation of members from the private sector, local government units, organized upland communities, and other relevant stakeholders in the sustainable management of developed plantations and protection of existing forests; d) Contribute to the development and enhancement of the socio-economic standards of local communities and provide opportunities to develop social enterprises to produce sustainable livelihood and optimize benefit through the implementation of the programme; e) Involve and enhance the participation and investment of the private sector in offsetting their carbon emissions with a view towards enabling them to achieve carbon neutrality, among others; and f) Provide appropriate management arrangements and incentives to participants to ensure sustainability of the programme. Consistent with the updated Philippine Master Plan for Climate-Resilient Forestry Development (PMPCRFD 2016-2028), this Order shall cover all the remaining unproductive, denuded, and degraded forestlands to be managed for production and protection purposes.

Policy: Política de formalización empresarial. Documento CONPES Nº 3956.
Policy_Content: La presente Política de formalización empresarial, considerando que Colombia presenta altos niveles de informalidad empresarial y que alrededor del 75% de las microempresas en el país no están registradas y los niveles de cumplimiento de contratación formal de trabajadores, el pago de prestaciones sociales, la implementación de una contabilidad formal y la declaración y pago de impuestos son bajos, establece un marco conceptual sobre la formalidad, la define como un proceso multidimensional, y aclara su relación con la productividad, tanto a nivel macroeconómico como a nivel de empresa. Además, reconoce la gran heterogeneidad que existe entre las empresas informales y sus incentivos para aumentar o reducir su nivel de formalidad. Esta política propone un plan de acción para mejorar la relación beneficio costo de una empresa para ser formal.

Policy: Environmental Permitting (England and Wales) (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 39 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Environmental Permitting (England and Wales) Regulations 2016. They address failures in the Regulations and retained EU legislation to operate effectively and other deficiencies arising from the withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union. Modification of the EU Directives is set out in the Annex. These include, amongst others, the Water Framework Directive, the Waste Framework Directive, the Mining Waste Directive, and the Landfill Directive. Amendments of the 2016 Regulations concern, among other things, environmental objectives for specified waters, groundwater, and protection of European Sites and habitats.

Policy: Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Environmental Impact Assessment) (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 25 of 2019).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made in order to address deficiencies in EU-derived domestic legislation regarding environmental impact assessments in the context of land drainage improvement works, forestry, water resources, agriculture and marine works. The need for such amendments arises from the withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union in accordance with the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018. Reference to Community legislation in the amended instruments shall now be "retained EU law". The amendments refer to environmental objectives set out in the  Water Environment (Water Framework Directive) (England and Wales) Regulations 2017. “EU environmental assessment” now means an assessment of the effect of anything on the environment carried out under retained EU law other than any law of any part of the United Kingdom that implemented the Directive.

Constituyen procedimientos prioritarios los actos y diligencias tramitados en las entidades públicas, conducentes a: 1) La transferencia de inmuebles de propiedad del Estado, necesarios para la implementación del Plan; 2) La adquisición y expropiación de inmuebles necesarios para la implementación del Plan; 3) El saneamiento físico-legal de inmuebles requeridos para el Plan, a través del procedimiento especial de saneamiento físico legal regulado en el Título III de la Ley Nº 30230, Ley que establece medidas tributarias, simplificación de procedimientos y permisos para la promoción y dinamización de la inversión en el país, y otras normas que facilitan el saneamiento físico legal de inmuebles estatales; 4) Los procedimientos relacionados con la ejecución del mecanismo de obras por impuestos; 5) La delimitación y/o monumentación de fajas marginales.

Policy: Ley Nº 1948 - Adopta criterios de política pública para la promoción de la movilidad social y se regula el funcionamiento del Programa Familias en Acción.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene como objeto apoyar la culminación del ciclo de educación básica y media, impulsar el tránsito de los jóvenes bachilleres promovidos del programa a instituciones y programas de educación superior, contribuir a la prevención del embarazo en la adolescencia, mejorar las competencias ciudadanas y comunitarias de los titulares del programa y beneficiarios del programa, priorizar la ampliación de la cobertura rural del Programa Familias en Acción y fomentar los factores de movilidad social de las familias beneficiarías en aras de estimular la superación de las condiciones de pobreza y pobreza extrema. El Programa Familias en Acción consiste en la entrega condicionada y periódica de una transferencia monetaria directa a las familias en condición de pobreza y pobreza extrema. El Programa es un complemento al ingreso monetario para la formación de capital humano, la generación de movilidad social, el acceso a programas de educación media y superior, la contribución a la superación de la pobreza y pobreza extrema y a la prevención del embarazo en la adolescencia. Se podrán incorporar las demás transferencias que el sistema de la promoción social genere en el tiempo para estas familias.

Policy: Resolución Conjunta 1/2019 – Aprueba el marco normativo para la producción, registro y aplicación de compost.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución tiene por objeto definir las posibles aplicaciones y establecer los requisitos necesarios que debe cumplir el compost elaborado a partir de residuos orgánicos separados en origen y recolectados de manera diferenciada, a efectos de su registro, asegurando una gestión sustentable y promoviendo su producción, uso y aplicación en las distintas jurisdicciones provinciales. Los compost comprendidos en las presentes disposiciones deberán: a) ser clasificados atendiendo el diagrama de flujo del Anexo II; b) confeccionarse con las materias primas detalladas en el Anexo III, separadas en origen y recolectadas de manera diferenciada. El Anexo IV establece los requisitos sanitarios y de estabilidad y madurez.

Policy: Resolución Nº 2-2019 ─ Requisitos, procedimientos, criterios, normativas técnicas y administrativas para la realización de subasta de productos forestales decomisados.
Policy_Content: La  presente Resolución establece los requisitos, procedimientos, criterios, normativas técnicas y administrativas para la realización de subasta de productos forestales decomisados. Una vez firme la Resolución que establece el decomiso de Recursos Forestales y/o Medios de Transporte decomisados, se fijará la fecha y hora para la venta al martillo en subasta pública, la que será publicada en tablas de aviso colocados en las respectivas Delegaciones y Alcaldías Municipales. Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 001-2019-EF ─ Reglamento del Decreto Legislativo Nº 1435, Decreto Legislativo que establece la implementación y funcionamiento del Fondo Invierte para el Desarrollo Territorial (FIDT).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Reglamento que tiene por objeto establecer las disposiciones reglamentarias para la implementación y funcionamiento del Fondo Invierte para el Desarrollo Territorial (FIDT), creado por el Decreto Legislativo N° 1435. El FIDT tiene por finalidad el financiamiento o cofinanciamiento de inversiones y estudios de preinversión de competencia de los Gobiernos Regionales y Gobiernos Locales en el marco del Sistema Nacional de Programación Multianual y Gestión de Inversiones, orientados a reducir las brechas en la provisión de servicios e infraestructura básicos, que tengan mayor impacto en la reducción de la pobreza y pobreza extrema en el país y que generen un aumento de la productividad con un enfoque territorial. Policy: Law No. 1567 “On quarantine and plant protection”.
Policy_Content: This Law defines the legal, organizational and economic bases of quarantine and plant protection, application of quarantine phytosanitary measures, handling plant protection products (agrochemicals, fertilizers, nutrients, and pesticides) and is aimed at preserving agricultural products, protecting human and animal, and ensuring environmental security. Plant quarantine is implemented on the basis of the adoption and application of regulatory legal acts and technical regulations in the field of plant quarantine, the implementation of quarantine phytosanitary measures and the implementation of state quarantine phytosanitary control. Plant protection shall be performed in compliance with the following requirements: (a) adoption and application of regulatory legal acts and technical regulatory acts, as well as other methodological documentation in the field of quarantine and plant protection; (b) determination of biological effectiveness and establishment of regulations for the use of pesticides and agrochemicals; (c) organization of manufacturing of pesticides and agrochemicals, implementation of plant protection measures; (d) creation and use of a reserve fund of pesticides and agrochemicals; and (e) formation and use of the state database on plant protection. The main objectives of the state policy in the field of quarantine and plant protection are: (a) development and implementation of the concept, program and plan of relevant activities; (b) legal and technical regulation in the field of quarantine and plant protection; (c) ensuring a favorable phytosanitary environment and food security; (d) ensuring the safety of people, livestock and the environment in the implementation of quarantine phytosanitary and plant protection measures; (e) quarantine phytosanitary monitoring; (f) state quarantine phytosanitary control and plant protection; and (g) implementation of other measures for quarantine and plant protection. Physical persons and legal entities that produce, store import and export, manage and trade material subject to quarantine inspection must: (a) comply with the requirements of regulatory legal acts and technical regulatory acts; (b) ensure unimpeded entry by officials of the authorized state body into regulated facilities and provide them with the necessary information and documents; (c) inform the authorized state body on the import of regulated material and the place of its storage; (d) ensure the neutralization or destruction of sources of quarantine pests in case of their detection; (e) follow quarantine regulations; and (f) use in the transportation of regulated materials means and methods that do not contribute to the focal spread of quarantine pests. Physical persons and legal entities operating in the field of plant protection, must: (a) comply with the requirements of regulatory legal acts and technical regulatory acts in the field of plant protection; (b) assist officials of the authorized state body in the performance of official duties in accordance with the requirements of this Law and other regulatory legal acts of the Republic of Tajikistan, ensure timely submission of information and documents necessary for state control; (c) follow the safety rules for handling pesticides and agrochemicals; (d) use pesticides and agrochemicals listed in the State Register; (e) store pesticides and agrochemicals in special storage facilities and dispose of pesticides that are prohibited from use, expired and (or) unsuitable for use, as well as containers from them, in a manner approved by an authorized state body; (f) make mandatory payments for the provision of plant quarantine or laboratory tests, inspections, quarantine material examination, phytosanitary certification, fumigation, degassing, issuance of permission for quarantine import of phytosanitary certification, pesticides, agrochemicals and other measures to be checked. This Law consists of 8 Chapters divided into 37 Articles. Chapter 1 lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 regards state management in the field of quarantine and plant protection. Chapter 3 regards the system for ensuring quarantine and plant protection. Chapter 4 regards management of pesticides and agrochemicals. Chapter 5 regards registration, accountability and scientific research in the field of quarantine and plant protection. Chapter 6 regards state supervision in the field of quarantine and plant protection. Chapter 7 regards international cooperation. Chapter 8 lays down final provisions.
Subject: Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 652 validating the Regulation on felling of particularly precious tree species.
Policy_Content: The rules for the felling of particularly valuable timber species in the Kyrgyz Republic define the felling procedure based on the conclusion of the state executive body, which ensures the implementation of a unified policy in the field of environmental protection. The applicant shall submit to the authorized state body an application for authorization for felling of especially valuable tree species. The application shall specify: (a) full name and address of the applicant (for legal entities), surname, name, patronymic and place of residence of the applicant (for natural persons); (b) contact details (phone, fax, e-mail); (c) administrative unit (region, district, local self-government), on the territory of which felling will be performed; (c) terms of the proposed felling of especially valuable tree species; (d) volumes of especially valuable tree species subject to felling. The following documents shall be attached to the application: (a) for legal entities - notarized copy of the document confirming the state registration by the judicial and tax authorities of the Kyrgyz Republic; (b) for individuals - notarized copy of the passport and the document confirming the registration by the state statistics authorities; (c) positive conclusion of the state environmental expertise of the authorized state body on the project documentation on the planned activities on the land plot with particularly valuable wood species, except for the cases indicated in paragraph 29 of these Rules; (d) the act of survey of a site in the form approved by the authorized state body; (e) registration list of plantations in the form approved by the authorized state body; (f) forest inventory project made with calculations of losses (including loss of profit) and losses of forestry production, if especially valuable tree species grow on the lands of the state forest fund and other categories of the land fund, except for the cases indicated in paragraph 29 of these Rules; and (g) forest inventory report prepared with calculations of losses (including lost profit) and losses of forestry production, if especially valuable tree species grow outside the territory of the state forest fund, except for the cases specified in paragraph 29 of these Regulations. Felling of especially valuable tree species associated with clearing of forest areas during construction and blasting works, laying of cables, pipelines, transport highways and other communications, scientific research, geological study and industrial development of subsurface resources, is carried out in the form of strips or blocks by means of clear cutting of forest in accordance with the rules of felling in the Kyrgyz Republic, approved by the authorized state body. After the completion of the felling of particularly valuable tree species, the inspection and assessment of the state of the felling site where the felling of forest stands is completed is carried out by the authorized state body to confirm the conformity of the felling performed to the issued conclusion. The resulting timber and cutting residues are used at the discretion of the applicant after harvesting of particularly valuable timber species. In the process of felling of especially valuable tree species the following shall be prohibited: (a) damage to forest plantations, vegetation and soil outside the allotted forest area and the relevant protective zone; (b) littering of the territory outside the allotted forest area with construction and domestic garbage, wood residues, other types of waste; (c) contamination of the felling area and the territory outside it with chemical and radioactive substances; and (d) passage of vehicles and other mechanisms along arbitrary, unidentified roads outside the allotted forest area in the places of growth of forest stand.

Policy: Decree No. 1062 of 31 December 2018 Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan On approval of the Regulation on Ugam-Chatkal State Biosphere Reserve.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that Ugam-Chatkal State Biosphere Reserve is a protected natural area, which includes land and water ecological systems designed to ensure the preservation of biological diversity in the mountains and foothills of the Tashkent Region in the areas of sustainable use of natural resources and socio-economic development, protection of cultural and natural values. Different types of regime of use and protection of natural objects and complexes shall be established on the territory of Ugam-Chatkal State Biosphere Reserve according to the zoning. In order to organize management of water use in the adjoining territories to protected area, on land plots of landowners, land users and lessees in shall be applicable servitude in order to ensure operation of irrigation canals. Biosphere reserve participates in global monitoring of the natural environment. The biosphere reserve has been created for the purpose of preservation and restoration of mountain and foothill forests and landscapes, representatives of flora and fauna of foothill and mountain ecosystems, including rare and endangered species, other natural objects and complexes characteristic for the territory of the biosphere reserve, improvement of the ecological environment, ensuring the sustainable use of natural resources and social welfare of the population, preservation of cultural and natural heritage, study of natural processes, promotion of various types of tourism, education, training and upbringing. The objectives of the biosphere reserve shall be as follows: (a) preservation of the natural and cultural heritage of the region; (b) preservation and restoration of biological diversity; (c) protection and restoration of landscapes; (d) creation of mechanisms for environmentally sustainable use of natural resources; (e) fundamental scientific research; (f) monitoring of the natural environment, economic and social development of the biosphere reserve area; (g) involvement of the local population, non-governmental non-profit organizations in different areas of biosphere reserve management; (h) environmental education and training; (i) raising environmental and ecological awareness of the population; and (j) organization and development of various types of tourism.

Policy: Notification on the import of products subject to the control of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry (Product Safety and Inspection: 2019/5).
Policy_Content: This Notification lays out rules for the import of products subject to the control of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry in terms of the protection of human health, plant health and animal health. This Notification shall apply to products listed in Annex-1/A, Annex-1/B, Annex-2, Annex-3, Annex-4, Annex-5, Annex-6 and Annex-7 and subject to release free for circulation, inward processing regime, outward processing regime, processing under customs control, and temporary admission, and planting materials for afforestation listed in Annex-12 and subject to release free for circulation, inward processing regime, processing under customs control, temporary admission, transit procedure and warehouse regime. This Notification sets forth provisions on compliance inspection, veterinary entry document, control certificate, duty of importers to give information, customs procedures, and sanctions. Moreover, the products listed in Annex-1/A, Annex-1/B and Annex-2 are subject to prior notification procedures in accordance with the provisions of the Regulation on pre-notification and veterinary controls in the entry of animal and their products and the Regulation on official controls of imported food and feed of plant origin.

Policy: Notification on the import control for chemicals in terms of environmental protection (Product Safety and Inspection: 2019/6).
Policy_Content: This Notification sets forth principles and procedures of inspection on imported chemicals and their products in terms of environmental standards. This Notification shall apply to the chemicals listed in Annex-I. The import of chemicals listed in Annex-I is prohibited within the scope of the release free for circulation, inward processing regime, processing under customs control and temporary admission. The chemicals listed in Paragraph 3 of Article 3 may be imported upon approval of the Ministry of Environment and Urbanization only for laboratory analysis and compulsory use. This Notification sets forth provisions on import procedures and certification, registration of importers, control certificate, duration and termination of control certificates, customs procedures and related measures.

Policy: Notification on quality control over the export and import of specific agricultural products (Product Safety and Inspection: 2019/21).
Policy_Content: This Notification lays out the procedures and principles of risk-based quality control over exported and imported agricultural products listed in Annex-I and Annex-II. This Notification shall apply to the exported products that are subject to export regime and inward processing regime as well as to the imported products that are subject to release free for circulation and inward processing regime. The company details shall be registered in a database by the Directorate General of Product Safety and Inspection. The quality control of the exported and imported agricultural products listed in Annex-I and Annex-II shall be carried out by the Inspectors in order to assess the compliance to the technical regulations. The criteria for risk analysis shall be established by the Risk Commission. This Notification sets forth provisions on application procedures, inspection, refusal of exported and imported products, secondary inspection, objection against inspection, customs procedures, obligations of the importer and exporter, sampling, analysis, labeling, certification, sanctions and authorities.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 345-2018-EF ─ Aprueba la Política Nacional de Competitividad y Productividad.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo, considerando que es necesario desarrollar las políticas de Estado en materia de competitividad alineadas al eje 3 de las Políticas Generales de Gobierno al 2021, aprueba la Política Nacional de Competitividad y Productividad, con la finalidad de orientar, a través de sus objetivos prioritarios y lineamientos generales, las medidas, acciones y estrategias del sector público en articulación con el sector privado que se prioricen a través de un Plan Nacional de Competitividad y Productividad. La Política Nacional de Competitividad y Productividad es de cumplimiento obligatorio para todas las entidades de los diferentes Poderes del Estado, Organismos Constitucionales Autónomos y de los diferentes niveles de gobierno; también es de obligatorio cumplimiento para el sector privado y la sociedad civil, en cuanto le sea aplicable.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo, considerando que el marco normativo relacionado con el funcionamiento del mercado secundario de gas natural en relación al Sub Sector Electricidad se encuentra en revisión, resulta razonable suspender la implementación de dichas disposiciones hasta que se cuente con una evaluación del marco normativo antes mencionado y de ser el caso se aprueben las normas correspondientes, por lo tanto se suspende hasta el 31 de diciembre de 2019 la implementación del Reglamento del mercado secundario de gas natural. Policy: Notification on the import of ozone-depleting substances (Import: 2019/14).
Policy_Content: This Notification sets forth principles and procedures of import of substances under the scope of this Notification and subject to release free for circulation, inward processing regime, outward processing regime, processing under customs control, and temporary admission. This Notification shall apply to the substances that are listed in Annex-I, II and III and identified by the customs tariff statistics position and definition. The Notification is drafted in accordance with the Vienna Convention for the Protection of Ozone Layer, 20 June 1990 and Montreal Protocol on Substances That Deplete the Ozone Layer, 19 December 1991 and in accordance with the amendments of London, Copenhagen, Montreal and Beijing. Import of any substances listed in the Annexes and any object containing those substances is restricted. Policy: Norm SEMAS No. 8 providing for the System of Fauna, Aquaculture and Fisheries of the State of Pará (SISFAP/PA), and establishing the procedures and criteria for the environmental licensing of trading activities and management of living aquatic resources with ornamental and aquarium purposes, within the the State Secretariat of Environment and Sustainability of Pará (SEMAS).
Policy_Content: This Norm, consisting of 54 articles divided into seven Chapters and four Annexes, provides for the System of Fauna, Aquaculture and Fisheries of the State of Pará (SISFAP/PA), and establishes the procedures and criteria for the environmental licensing of trading activities and management of living aquatic resources with ornamental purposes within the the State Secretariat of Environment and Sustainability of Pará (SEMAS). This System SISFAP/PA) is an electronic control system that aims to manage the stock of wildlife resources, as well as issuance of guides to transport these resources. The environmental agency shall require in the licensing process under the terms of the specific legislation: a) the granting of water resources, issued by the competent body; b) the Rural Environmental Registry (CAR), of the enterprises located in rural areas. SEMAS will require the environmental licensing, action plan to avoid fish mortality, including for transportation.

Policy: Norm SEMAS No. 9 provides for the Municipal Environmental Licensing System (SISLAM) within the State of Pará.
Policy_Content: This Norm, consisting of 12 articles divided into four Chapters, provides for the Municipal Environmental Licensing System (SISLAM) within the State of Pará. SISLAM is instituted for the electronic security reasons for the enterprises and activities of the municipalities located in the State of Pará. SISLAM includes several forms of environmental licensing (ordinary, simplified and declaratory) and the exception of licensing, up to the competent Municipal body to define the form to be used, in accordance with its current legislation. The system will be made available to the Municipality that is carrying out the environmental management, under Resolution No. 120 of 28 October 2015 of the State Council of Environment-COEMA. The Municipality interested in using the system must officially request the SEMAS. Users must register with SISLAM, supplying all requested documents. Requests for regularization will be submitted directly in the system, observing the documentation related to the activities and undertakings according to the desired modality of environmental regularization.

Policy: Law No. 8.497 providing for the Environmental Licensing Procedure within the State of Sergipe.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 66 articles divided into four Chapters and seven Annexes, regulates the administrative procedures for environmental licensing, criteria for classifying activities potentially causing environmental degradation, as well as for remunerating operational costs and analyzing administrative acts (such as: licences, authorizations, waiver certificate) by ADEMA, within the territory of the State of Sergipe, in the form of Annexes I, II, III, IV and V. The services provided by ADEMA and related to environmental licensing, supervision and monitoring activities, together with technical support for the maintenance of federal systems, are regulated in the form of Annexes VI and VII. The construction, installation, expansion, modification and operation of establishments, enterprises, works and activities that use environmental resources, considered as effective or potentially polluting, as well as those capable of causing environmental degradation, are subject to environmental licensing, as provided in Annex I. A List of Activities to be Licensed, classified according to the Degradation Polluting Potential (PPD), are established in specific regulations. The State Environmental Licensing shall be regulated by the State Environmental Council (CEMA) and by ADEMA.

Policy: Decree No. 54.459 regulating Law No. 15.222 on the State Policy to Support Urban and Peri-urban Agriculture within the Rio Grande do Sul State.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 18 articles, aims at regulating the State Policy for Urban and Peri-urban Agriculture in the State of Rio Grande do Sul with the purpose of promoting the sustainable production of food in the urban and peri-urban environment, for food and nutritional security, social and productive inclusion and the improvement of quality of life. The objectives of the State Policy on Urban and Peri-urban Agriculture are: promote the access to food and increase the availability of food for self-consumption; promote health and adequate nutritional status, contributing to the fight against malnutrition; carry out programmes for people experiencing food insecurity and social vulnerability; promote food and nutrition education; promote family, community, cooperative, associative and self-management; promote agroecology and organic food production; encourage the use of organic waste and waste water and rainfall; promote the implementation of home gardens.

Policy: Regional Law No. 4476-OZ “On particulars of allotment of the plots of land out of stock of re-distribution of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the following objectives: (a) involvement of agricultural land in turnover; (b) rational land-use planning and tenure of agricultural land; and (c) involvement of regional residents in agricultural production. Agricultural land out of stock of public and municipal land pertaining to public ownership or with undefined ownership can be allotted free of charge in ownership to citizens for agricultural activities, including smallholding (except for gardening). The categories of persons eligible for allotment of the aforesaid plots of agricultural land: (a) citizens of the Russian Federation who have reached the age of majority,  residing in the Russian Federation; and (b) legal persons registered on the territory of the Russian Federation manufacturing or processing agricultural commodities.

Policy: Regional Law No. 147-oz “On village chiefs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law is aimed at determination of powers, rights and guarantees ensuring the activities of village chiefs in rural areas, regulation of other issues of his status, some issues related to public participation in local government of rural municipal units, and also establishment of legal grounds for the functioning of public councils. Public council shall be intended one of the forms of public participation in local government in a part of the territory of a municipal unit. Village chief shall have the following powers: (a) assistance in the implementation of rights and legal interests of the residents of rural settlement by submittal of appeals, declarations and other documents to local government, state bodies, heads of enterprises, organizations and institutions on which depends the solution of issues concerning residents of rural settlement; (b) organization of socially useful works on voluntary basis; (c) assistance to local government bodies for identification of persons in need of social service; (d) assistance in holding meetings (conferences) of local residents for promotion of local initiatives; and (e)  assistance to local government in application of primary fire-prevention measures.

Policy: Loi n°039/2018 du 28 décembre 2018 fixant le régime du mécénat et du parrainage en République Gabonaise.
Policy_Content: La présente loi, prise en application des dispositions de l’article 47 de la Constitution, fixe le régime du mécénat et du parrainage en République Gabonaise. Est notamment soumis au bénéfice du régime du mécénat et du parrainage, tout soutien octroyé dans les domaines philanthropique, entrepreneurial, à la défense de l'environnement naturel. Dans le domaine du mécénat, donnent lieu au bénéfice d'avantages fiscaux spécifiques, les soutiens effectués auprès des organismes suivants : les établissements publics ou les organismes ayant pour objet la recherche ou l'innovation dans les domaines de la science, la santé, l’agriculture ou l'élevage ; les organismes agissant dans la valorisation, la promotion, la diffusion ou la protection du patrimoine culturel; les organismes dont l'objet exclusif est de favoriser de manière désintéressée le développement des Petites et Moyennes Entreprises, et plus généralement de l'entrepreneuriat.

Data collection and reporting shall be carried out by the national government agencies and relevant stakeholders, including non-governmental organizations. Policy: Federal Law No. 563-FZ amending Federal Law No. 260-FZ amending Federal Law No. 264-FZ on agricultural development.

It also introduces the period of application for state support in the sphere of agricultural insurance by agricultural producers that must be fixed in normative legal acts of the supreme executive bodies of the regional administrations. State support for agricultural producers are shall be granted in accordance with agricultural insurance contract that meets the following requirements and conditions: (a) insurance of agricultural insurance objects against the effects of the events provided for in Article 8 of this Federal law, or from the effects of one or more such events is subject to an agricultural insurance plan specified in article 6 of this Federal Law; (b) insurance of crops and perennial plantations if agricultural insurance contract is concluded: 1) in relation to one or several types of agricultural crops, perennial plantations on the entire area of land sites in a subject of the Russian Federation, in which agricultural producers grow such crops and perennial plants; 2) no later than fifteen calendar days after the end of sowing or planting crops, except for perennial plants, as well as perennial grasses of past years; 3) until the end of the growing season (transition to winter dormancy) of perennial plants; (c) in case of insurance of farm animals if insurance contract is concluded: 1) in relation to all available livestock of a farmer or several livestock species in a subject of the Russian Federation; 2) for a period of not less than one year; (d) when insuring one or several objects of commercial aquaculture (commercial fish farming) contract for agricultural insurance is concluded: 1) in relation to one or several types of objects of commercial aquaculture (commercial fish farming) of a fishfarmer; 2) agricultural insurance contract is concluded for a period of not less than one year; and (e) agricultural insurance contract entered into force and agricultural producers paid at least fifty percent of insurance premium accrued under this contract.

Policy: Federal Law No. 538-FZ amending Forest Code and Water Code related to forest management.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law, amending Forest Code, establishes that boundaries of forest fund shall be determined by the boundaries of forest districts. Forests located on forest fund land shall be classified into the following types: (a) protection forest; (b) commercial forest; and (c) reserve forest. The main territorial units of forest management related to conservation, protection, reproduction of forests shall be forest districts, as well as sectional forest districts, which may be constituted within forest district. Forest districts shall be constituted on lands of: (a) forest fund; (b) defense and security, where forests are located; (c) inhabited areas where forests are located; and (d) protected natural areas covered by forests. Management, conservation, protection of forests located within the boundaries of forest district shall be performed in accordance with forest management regulation and forestry plans. Protection forests shall be considered natural forests   of particular value and for which shall be applicable special legal regime of management, conservation, protection and reproduction. The following categories of forests shall be classified as protection forest: (a) forests located in protected areas; (b) forests located in water protection zones; (c) forests, performing the functions of protection of natural and other objects; (d) valuable forests; and (e) urban forests. Modification of purposeful (specific) use of protection forest plots shall be prohibited, except for cases envisaged by the federal legislation. The following activities shall be prohibited in forest parks: (a) use of toxic chemicals; (b) hunting; (c) agricultural activities; (d) exploration and mining; and (e) construction, except for construction of waterworks. Water Code shall be amended to add the following wording: “In the process of forest management shall be performed arrangements for the protection of waterbodies envisaged by Water Code”.

Policy: Law No. 23.203 establishing the State Plan to Fight Poverty in the Field.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 11 articles, establishes the State Plan to Fight Poverty in the Field. The guidelines of this State Plan are: integration of the organs and entities of the state public administration with the municipalities and civil society; promotion of social participation and empowerment of rural families; sustainable development; promotion of public policies directed to the peculiarity of the field. The objectives of the State Plan are: stimulate the structuring of the field; promote access to land; promote social and productive inclusion through the generation of work and income; develop policies and services aimed at the public. The the main actions to be carried out by the State Plan are: infrastructure actions for public energy, sanitation and transportation services; land access, land regularization and the demarcation of vacant lands for traditional peoples and communities; productive inclusion for technical assistance, rural extension, food and nutritional security, labour and income; access to public services, benefits and income transfer, such as social assistance, education and health; definition of public policies, construction of indicators and evaluation of the results, based on the use of the Register for Social Programmes of the Federal Government. The State Plan will be implemented in articulation with the programmes, projects and actions of the Plurianual Plan of Government Action (PPAG) and the Annual Budgetary Law (LOA).

Policy: Law No. 23.196 providing for the State Policy for Agriculture and Livestock Protection (Pedagro), and creating the State Council for Agriculture and Livestock Protection of Minas Gerais (Cedagro).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 15 articles divided into three Chapters and two Annexes,  provides for the State Policy for Agriculture and Livestock Protection (Pedagro), and creates the State Council for Agriculture and Livestock Protection of Minas Gerais (Cedagro). Pedagro will obey the provisions of this law, in accordance with the state policy of agricultural development, instituted by Law No. 11.405 of 28 January 1994. Agricultural and livestock protection is considered as a set of activities systematically developed with the objective to preserve animal and plant health, and ensure the hygienic-sanitary conditions of production as well as the preservation of public health. The agricultural protection activities will focus on all phases of the production process and the commercialization of agro-livestock and agro-industrial products, by-products, waste and inputs, and will involve epidemiological control of bacterial, viral and parasitic diseases in animals and plants. Pedagro objectives are: comply with sanitary and quality standards required in the country, or equivalent international standards for animals, plants, agricultural inputs and products of animal and plant origin; elimination of health risks or their reduction to acceptable levels; promote the participation of society in the formulation and execution of Pedagro; promote food security; socioeconomic development through the inclusion and formalization of agricultural and agroindustrial establishments; promote and support agricultural and agroindustrial activities developed by family farmers and indigenous peoples and communities, as well as by beneficiaries of the agrarian reform programmes.

Policy: Border Management and Trade Facilitation Act (No. 12 of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for border control of goods and the facilitation of transborder movement and clearance of goods. It establishes the National Committee on Trade Facilitation and lists, in the Schedule, legislation that relates to a one-stop border post and is the basis for border control operations by the institution specified in that legislation. The list includes, among other things, the Agriculture (Fertilizer and Feed) Act, the Animal Health Act, the Biosafety Act, the Environmental Management Act, the Fisheries Act, the Food and Drugs Act, the Forests Act, the Plant Pests and Diseases Act, the Plant Variety and Seeds Act, and the Zambia Wildlife Act. The Zambia Revenue Authority established under the Zambia Revenue Authority Act is the lead agency at ports of entry and is responsible for coordinating border operations. The National Committee on Trade Facilitation shall— (a) coordinate policy on border management controls and facilitation of trade; and (b) develop specific programmes for the establishment and implementation of one-stop border controls. The President may enter into a one-stop border agreement or a simplified border agreement with an adjoining State for purposes of trade facilitation and ensuring reciprocity in the application of border controls. The Minister may, in collaboration with an adjoining State, through a border agreement, establish and designate control zones at their common ports of entry.

Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes state support of agriculture in the following fields: (a) stockbreeding; (b) crop production; (c) commercial fishfarming; (d) agricultural commodities and foodstuffs; (e) technical equipment for agriculture; (f) horticulture and vegetable gardening; (g) insurance of agricultural risks; (h) anti-epizootic arrangements; (i) sustainable development of rural areas; (j) access to credits; and (k) manufacturing and purchase of agricultural commodities. Measures of state support shall be as follows: (a) preferential taxation; (b) subsidies; (c) subventions for agricultural consumer cooperatives and peasant farms; (d) creation of favorable climate for investments; and € international and inter-regional cooperation.

Policy: Décret n° 2018-484 du 26 décembre 2018 fixant les attributions, la composition et le fonctionnement de la commission nationale de reconnaissance des terres coutumières.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe, en application de l’article 9 de la loi n° 21-2018 du 13 juin 2018 fixant les règles d’occupation et d’acquisition des terres et terrains, les attributions, la composition et le fonctionnement de la commission nationale de reconnaissance des terres coutumières. La commission nationale de reconnaissance des terres coutumières est chargée notamment, de : procéder, à l’enquête publique de traçabilité des terres coutumières à reconnaitre en vue d’établir leur origine, de déterminer leurs détenteurs, leur superficie totale ainsi que leur lieu de situation ; approuver les plans cadastraux des terres coutumières à reconnaitre ; purger, par voie de conciliation, les contestations nées des conflits fonciers ; arrêter la liste nominative des détenteurs des terres coutumières à reconnaitre ; fournir aux détenteurs des terres coutumières à reconnaitre tous les renseignements techniques de nature à leur faciliter l’immatriculation des terres coutumières à reconnaitre; dresser un procès-verbal de reconnaissance des terres coutumières, exécutoire dès sa signature séance tenante par tous les membres de la commission ainsi que les détenteurs des terres coutumières à reconnaitre ; délivrer séance tenante, une copie du procès-verbal de reconnaissance des terres coutumières au mandataire général ; prononcer, s’il y a lieu, la non reconnaissance des terres coutumières et au besoin, renvoyer les parties en conflit à terminer leur litige devant le tribunal de grande instance territorialement compétent.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land commission,Land tenure,Traditional rights/customary rights,Vested rights/existing rights,Dispute settlement

Policy: Norm SEMAS No. 1 providing for the digital protocol, for registering and issuing the Environmental Licensing Waiver (DLA) and the Declaratory Environmental Licensing and Simplified Environmental Licensing within the State Secretariat of Environment and Sustainability (SEMAS/PA).
Policy_Content: This Norm, consisting of 36 articles divided into nine Chapters, provides for the digital protocol, for registering and issuing the Environmental Licensing Waiver (DLA) and the Declaratory Environmental Licensing and Simplified Environmental Licensing within the State Secretariat of Environment and Sustainability (SEMAS/PA). The digital protocol is the means for registration in the database for the individuals and legal entities responsible for the enterprises that are contemplated by COEMA Resolution 107, of March 8, 2013, as well as the COEMA Resolution 127 of November 18, 2016 and that aim at obtaining the Previous License (LP), Installation License (LI), Operation License (LO) and the Rural Environmental License (LAR), for activities of low potential polluter in the State of Pará. Access to the system will be through the electronic address www.semas.pa.gov.br, whose use must comply with the terms of this Norm.

Policy: Federal Law No. 491-FZ amending Federal Law No. 264-FZ on agricultural development.
Policy_Content: Article 10 shall be amended to add the following wording: “The National report on realization of state program shall be prepared by the federal executive body in the field of agro-industrial complex and shall be approved until July 15 by the Government of the Russian Federation. The national report must contain: (a) the results of the state program over the past year in general and in relation to individual events, in the case of its completion - for the entire period of its implementation; (b) the main indicators of agricultural development in accordance with the goals and objectives defined by the state program (indices of gross agricultural output and food industry, investment in agriculture, incomes of citizens, living in rural areas, indicators of consumption of major foodstuffs per person per year, the balance of income from foreign trade in food products, share indicators of the Russian foodstuffs in the consumer market, profitability of agricultural production, indices of technical equipment of agricultural organizations, price parity indicators, growth index of the volume of services in the social sphere for citizens living in rural areas), and other indicators, as well as information on the implementation of performance indicators of the main activities, subprograms of the state program and their financing; and (c) the forecast of agricultural development for the forthcoming year and, in case of necessity, proposals for the correction of state program.”

Policy_Content: This Act lays down rules for providing a clear and transparent framework for investment in Kiribati; strengthening inter-ministerial coordination on regulatory provisions and incentives and support mechanisms for investments; and enhancing the promotion, admission, treatment and management of investment. Policy: Ordonnance n° 2018-1128 du 12 décembre 2018 relative au relèvement du seuil de revente à perte et à l’encadrement des promotions pour les denrées et certains produits alimentaires.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance met en place deux mesures qui ont pour objectif de contribuer à l’amélioration du revenu des agriculteurs, en complément d’autres mesures de la loi du 30 octobre 2018 pour l’équilibre des relations commerciales dans le secteur agricole et alimentaire et une alimentation saine, durable et accessible à tous. Elle correspond à un engagement des états généraux de l’alimentation pour permettre une meilleure rémunération des agriculteurs. L’ordonnance prévoit, pour deux ans et à titre expérimental: la majoration de 10% du seuil de revente à perte sur les produits alimentaires, qui entrera en vigueur à une date qui sera fixée par décret et au plus tard le 1er juin 2019; à compter du 1er janvier 2019, les promotions sur les produits alimentaires ne pourront plus excéder 34% du prix de vente au consommateur (cela revient à interdire les offres du type "deux produits pour le prix d’un". En revanche, il sera possible de proposer un 3e produit gratuit pour l’achat de deux produits).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Resolución Nº 553-2018 ─ Requisitos para solicitar la unificación del proceso de supervisión, control y fiscalización ambiental de instrumentos de gestión ambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Requisitos para solicitar la unificación del proceso de supervisión, control y fiscalización ambiental de instrumentos de gestión ambiental vigentes a nombre del promotor con una misma razón social. Para optar por la unificación del proceso de supervisión, control y fiscalización ambiental de instrumentos de gestión ambiental, el promotor solicitante deberá cumplir con las siguientes condiciones: 1) Contar con más de un instrumento de gestión ambiental aprobado, ya sean Estudios de Impacto Ambiental o Programas de Adecuación y Manejo Ambiental (PAMA's), o la combinación de herramientas de gestión; 2) Los proyectos, obras o actividades con instrumento de gestión ambiental, deberán ubicarse en el mismo polígono o polígono adyacentes, contar con la misma razón social el promotor o empresa, contar con resoluciones de las herramientas de gestión ambiental aprobadas y vigentes, y además estar en operación; 3) En aquellos casos que la unificación involucre actividades, obras o proyecto con Programas de Adecuación y Manejo Ambiental (PAMA's), el promotor deberá haber entregado ante el Ministerio de Ambiente el informe final de cumplimiento correspondiente; 4) Los proyectos, obras o actividades con instrumento de gestión ambiental, no deberán tener orden de paralización emitida por una autoridad competente al momento de presentar la solicitud.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regional Law No. 425-KZ “On gardening and horticulture for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the relations arising in connection with the conduct of horticulture and horticulture by citizens for their own individual personal needs in the regional territory, and also defines the forms of state support for gardening and horticulture. Allotment of land plots owned by the state or municipality to gardening and horticultural non-commercial partnerships and members of partnerships shall be performed in accordance with the procedure established by the Land Code of the Russian Federation and the Federal Law No. 217-FZ “On gardening and horticulture for individual personal needs”. Land plots for gardening and vegetable growing pertaining to state and municipal property shall be allotted to citizens free of charge in case envisaged by federal and regional legislation. State support for the conduct of gardening and horticulture in the regional territory shall be performed in the following forms: (a) educational work in order to popularize performance gardening and horticulture; (b) information support of citizens in the field of organizing gardening and horticulture, as well as providing them with extension services; (c) provision of subsidies for reimbursement of the costs of partnerships for the land management of gardening or horticulture; (d) financing the implementation of integrated cadastral works in relation to cadastral boundaries, within which the territory of gardening or horticulture land plots is located; (e) provision of grants on a competitive basis in the form of subsidies to partnerships for the implementation of measures to develop the infrastructure of the territory of gardening or horticulture, including measures for the construction, reconstruction, repair of access roads, electric grid facilities, and water supply.
