Policy: Regional Law No. 115-kz “On some issues of state support of horticulture and vegetable gardening as a form of subsidiary smallholding”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues related to state support of horticulture and vegetable gardening as a form of subsidiary smallholding. It shall be applicable to natural persons, who are owners or tenants of agricultural land plots allotted for horticulture and vegetable gardening, non-commercial horticultural and gardening associations registered on the regional territory and individuals performing horticulture and vegetable gardening without constitution of associations. The objectives of state support of horticulture and vegetable gardening shall be as follows: (a) creation of favorable conditions for horticulture and vegetable gardening; (b) promotion of horticulture and vegetable gardening as a form of subsidiary smallholding; and (c) raising efficiency of horticulture and vegetable gardening. State support for horticulture and vegetable gardening shall be based on the following principles: (a) targeting of state support and targeted use of state support funds; (b) equal availability of state support measures for all persons engaged in horticulture and vegetable gardening; and 2) equality of rights to public support for horticulture and vegetable gardening; and (c) combination of financial and other measures of state support for horticulture and vegetable gardening.

Policy: Regional Law No. 116-Z “On the procedure for procurement and collection of non-timber forest products, alimentary forest resources and medicinal plants by natural persons for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law sets the procedure for procurement and collection of non-timber forest products, alimentary forest resources and medicinal plants by natural persons for individual personal needs. It establishes that citizens shall have the right of free stay in forests for the purpose of procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (wild growing fruits, berries, mushrooms, seeds, wood juices etc.) and medicinal plants free of charge for individual personal needs without re-sale. Collection and procurement of non-timber edible forest resources and , in particular, mushrooms and wild growing plants, recorded in the Red Book of protected plant species, and also procurement of non-timber resources on the territory of protected areas, shall be prohibited. Stay of citizens on forests for procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest products can be restricted or prohibited in accordance with Forest Code.

Policy: Regional Law No. 112-Z “On establishment of the procedure and rates of procurement of timber by natural persons for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the procedure and rates of procurement of timber by natural persons for individual personal needs by regional residents for housing construction, re-construction, repairs and heating of residential facilities. Timber extraction shall be carried out in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species. Volume of timber to be harvested in accordance with purchase and sale contract shall be determined within the established norms based upon required volume of timber with the consideration of the amount of timber extraction, including species composition and assortment set for logging site. Timber purchase and sale contracts shall be subject to mandatory registration by Forest Management Service. Non-specified and non-purposeful use of extracted timber by citizens shall be prohibited.

Policy: Constituency Development Fund Act, 2018 (No. 11 of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the management of Constituency Development Fund at a national and local level. It defines the duties of the Minister and establishes a Constituency Development Fund Committee in each constituency. The committees shall receive proposals from the ward development committee within the constituency or proposals for joint projects with other constituencies and forward a list of such proposals to the Minister. The Minister shall ensure that the projects on the proposed project list comply with the provisions of this Act. A project under this Act shall be community-based for the benefit of a broad cross section of the community of a particular area. A local authority shall disburse funds from the constituency account based on projects approved by the Minister. A project under this Act shall be implemented by the council, and where necessary with the assistance of a relevant department of the Government in the district in which the constituency is located. The Provincial Local Government Officer shall monitor the implementation of projects at the provincial level.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 88-B-2018 ─ Reglamento Especial para minería artesanal y la pequeña minería.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo aprueba el Reglamento Especial para minería artesanal y la pequeña minería, que tiene como objeto establecer la normativa necesaria para la aplicación de la Ley General de Minería, en el ejercicio de los derechos soberanos del Estado de Honduras, para administrar, regular, controlar y gestionar el sector minero en todo el Territorio Nacional, de conformidad con los principios de legalidad, transparencia, certeza, simplicidad, publicidad, uniformidad, eficiencia, participación ciudadana, simultaneidad, sostenibilidad, equidad y prevención, para la Minería Artesanal y Pequeña Minería metálica, no metálica y de gemas o piedras preciosas. Las actividades de Pequeña Minería, están orientadas a promover procesos de desarrollo sostenible, constituyen alternativas para generar oportunidades laborales en áreas afectadas por la pobreza, capaces de generar encadenamientos productivos a partir de la activación de las economías locales en los sectores en los que se realiza, como medio para acceder al buen vivir. Para los fines de este Reglamento, se entiende por Pequeña Minería las actividades mineras en las que se utilicen medios mecánicos sencillos que en razón del área, medios de explotación y cantidad de explotación de la sustancia de interés, establecidas en los Artículos 86 y 87 de la Ley General de Minería.

Policy: Law No. 10.986 creating the State Policy for Agroecology and Organic Production of Maranhão (Peapoma).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 12 articles creates the State Policy for Agroecology and Organic Production of Maranhão (Peapoma). Policy: Law No. 10.984 creating the State Policy Supporting the Family Farming Cooperatives.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 28 articles creates the State Policy Supporting the Family Farming Cooperatives. This State Policy aims at implementing the Direct and Indirect Administrations activities and the private sector that will directly and indirectly benefit the cooperative sector in the promotion of social, economic and cultural development, according to Law No. 11.326 of 24 July 2006. Policy: Ley Nº 30877 - Ley General de Bodegueros.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley General de Bodegueros, reconoce el valor social de la actividad del bodeguero, a través del expendio o venta de productos de primera necesidad, como micro o pequeñas empresas generadoras de empleo directo e indirecto, constituyéndose en una unidad económica básica y esencial para el desarrollo de las comunidades. Para fines de la presente Ley, la bodega en el Perú se refiere al negocio que se dedica a la venta al por menor de productos de primera necesidad, predominantemente alimentos y bebidas, destinados preferentemente a satisfacer los requerimientos diarios de los hogares.

Policy: Ley N° 19717 – Declaración de interés general y creación de una Comisión Honoraria Nacional y Plan Nacional para el Fomento de la Producción con Bases Agroecológicas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley declara de interés general la promoción y el desarrollo de sistemas de producción, distribución y consumo de productos de base agroecológica, tanto en estado natural como elaborado, para fortalecer la soberanía y la seguridad alimentaria, contribuir con el cuidado del ambiente y generar beneficios que mejoren la calidad de vida de los habitantes de la República. El texto legislativo describe a los productores familiares y los sistemas de producción agrícola urbana y suburbana como los sujetos principales de los sistemas de producción con bases agroecológicas. La Comisión Honoraria elaborará una propuesta de Plan Nacional de Producción con Bases Agroecológicas y promoverá el diálogo en los ámbitos públicos y en la sociedad civil, además de evaluar la ejecución de los programas y acciones. La Comisión será presidida por el delegado del Ministerio de Ganadería, Agricultura y Pesca, asistido por una secretaría técnica y administrativa para el cumplimiento de sus tareas, cuyos recursos materiales y humanos serán brindados por la Dirección General de Desarrollo Rural.

Policy: Ley Nº 11/2018 - Ley de ordenación territorial y urbanística sostenible de Extremadura.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto la ordenación territorial y urbanística de la utilización del suelo para su aprovechamiento racional, de acuerdo con su función social, en el ámbito de la comunidad autónoma de Extremadura. Los Principios generales en los que debe basarse toda actuación en relación con la ordenación territorial y urbanística son: 1) El desarrollo sostenible social, ambiental y económico de los municipios de Extremadura, con el objetivo último de mantener y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus habitantes; 2) El desarrollo racional y equilibrado de usos y actividades en el territorio, que garantice su diversidad y asegure el máximo aprovechamiento del suelo como recurso natural no renovable, así como la protección del medio ambiente y el patrimonio cultural; 3) La cohesión social de Extremadura, considerando el predominio del mundo rural, los condicionantes históricos de su desarrollo socioeconómico y la baja población y dispersión; 4) La igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres, sin que pueda prevalecer desde el plano de la ordenación territorial discriminación de las personas con discapacidad o por razón alguna o circunstancia personal o social, entendiendo que la función pública y el interés general en una sociedad diversa se fundamentan en la atención específica de las necesidades diferenciadas; 5) La garantía de que la actividad de ordenación territorial y urbanística se desarrolle conforme a las necesidades de la sociedad promoviendo una amplia y efectiva participación ciudadana y garantizando los derechos de información e iniciativa de las personas y de las entidades constituidas para la defensa de sus intereses; 6) Evitar la especulación del suelo y garantizar la disponibilidad del mismo para usos urbanísticos, una previsión de dotaciones y equipamientos urbanos adecuada y el acceso a una vivienda digna, un domicilio libre de inmisiones contaminantes y en un entorno seguro, saludable y universalmente accesible. Asimismo, favorecerá la cohesión social, mediante la regulación del uso del suelo, de forma que se fomente la convivencia equilibrada de grupos sociales, usos y actividades.

Policy: Regional Law No. 2307-OZ “On some issues of state support of horticulture and vegetable gardening as a form of subsidiary smallholding”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues of state support of horticulture and vegetable gardening as a form of subsidiary smallholding by delimiting powers of regional state bodies in the aforesaid sphere. Regional Assembly shall have the following powers: (a) to adopt laws regulating horticulture and vegetable gardening as a form of subsidiary smallholding; (b) to supervise compliance with the regional legislation regulating horticulture and vegetable gardening as a form of subsidiary smallholding; and (c) to exercise other powers envisaged by the federal and regional legislation. Regional Government shall have the following powers: (a) decision-making related to state support of horticulture and vegetable gardening; (b) appointment of regional executive body for implementation of the regional policy in the field of horticulture and vegetable gardening; (c) establishment of the procedure for state support of horticulture and vegetable gardening; and (d) exercises other powers in the field of horticulture and vegetable gardening established by federal and regional legislation.

Policy: Regional Law No. 81-ZRH “On village chiefs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues of the activities of village chiefs as a form of public participation of the population in local government. Village chief is appointed by the representative body of the rural settlement, of which it is a part, in conformity with the proposal by meeting of rural residents, from among the persons residing on the territory of the given municipality of rural area and having active voting rights. The period in office of village chief shall be no less than two years and no more than five years. Village chief can be vested with the following powers: (a) assistance to local government, municipal institutions and other organizations in addressing the  issues of local significance in rural settlement; (b) interaction with the population by participating at meetings, gatherings, conferences of citizens, submittal, by the outcome thereof, of appeals and proposals, including those arranged in form of draft municipal legal acts subject to mandatory consideration by the local government; (c) informs the villagers on issues related to the organization and implementation of local government, and brings information received from the authorities of local government to their attention; and (d) assists local self-government bodies in organizing and holding public hearings and public discussions, public disclosure of their results in the rural community.

Policy: Regional Law No. 104-GD “On organization and functioning of timber collection and processing sites”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and functioning of collection and shipping point for timber, and establishes the requirements for acceptance, registration and transportation of timber. Incoming, processing and shipping timber shall be subject to compulsory registration and shall be recorded in registration log. Accounting documents at timber collection and processing points shall be: (a) acceptance certificates; (b) acts of acceptance of autonomously extracted timber; (c) book of records of acceptance and delivery certificates; (d) book of accounting for acts of acceptance of autonomously extracted timber; (e) book of account of received timber; and (f) book of registration of supplied timber and (or) products of timber processing. Acceptance of timber at timber collection and processing sites shall be performed in batches with the indication of volume, species composition ad assortment of timber.

Policy: Kakamega County Environmental Management Act, 2019 (No. 2 of 2019).
Policy_Content: This Act is enacted for the purpose of providing regulation and control of air pollution, noise pollution, water pollution, public nuisances, waste management and land pollution. The Act establishes a County Environmental Technical Committee and provides for the composition of the Committee. The Committee is charged with the proper management of the devolved environmental functions; and developing a county strategic environmental report every five years, in conjunction with the environmental department. Essentially, the Act prohibits, in a detailed manner, acts which cause air pollution and provides penal sanctions for its contravention. Similarly, it prohibits noise which annoys, disturbs or endangers the comfort of other persons and environment and establishes permissible noise levels. The Law describes certain acts as public nuisance including, public defecation/urination, spitting saliva indiscriminately, discarding waste materials in unauthorized public places etc. and creates penal sanctions for the contravention of these provisions. The Act charges the environmental department and waste generators with the duty to ensure effective management of solid waste through collection, storage, transportation, recycling and disposal of wastes in an environmentally sound manner. The Act places criminal liability with stringent penal terms on any person generating, managing or disposing waste in a manner that pollutes water systems or land.

Policy: Kakamega County Agricultural Produce Cess Act, 2019 (No. 4 of 2019).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for a produce cess imposed and payable to the county government. It provides that the County government shall collect cess on agricultural products within the County. The proceeds of the cess collected are to be administered in the infrastructural development of the area where it is collected. The Act provides for the mode of collection of the cess on agricultural products and makes provisions for the officers in charge of making the collection. It also contains penal provisions. Schedules affixed at the end of the Act detail the agricultural products in which cess is to be collected, including banana, sugarcane, beans, etc. It also contains the rate of cess to be collected for the particular produce.

Policy: Kakamega County Youth Service and Women Empowerment Act, 2019 (No. 5 of 2019).
Policy_Content: The purpose of the Act is to ensure that youths and women have access to relevant education and training, employment opportunities, participate in political, social and economic spheres of life, and be protected from exploitation and harmful cultural practices. It also aims to promote the participation of youths and women in development and empowerment programs, and provide necessary training to facilitate increased employment and self-reliance of the youth and women. The Act establishes the Kakamega County Youth and Women Empowerment Service to train youths and women and involve them in tasks which serve the County. It provides extensively for the composition of the Service, its membership and how it interacts with youths and women groups.

Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the terms regarding the special environmental fee that has to be paid in case of verified non-placing on the market of biofuel, aimed as penalty measure for the non-reduction of greenhouse gas emissions. This kind of penalty or special environmental fee is aimed for authorized sectoral operator that has failed to place on the market the prescribed quantity of biofuel and so he failed to reduce the emission of greenhouse gases. The above mentioned prescribed quantity of biofuel is the minimum share of biofuels in the total amount of fuel that was placed on the market in the current calendar year.

Policy: Act (2018:2088) on tobacco and similar products.
Policy_Content: The present Act aims at limiting the health risks and consequences arising from the use of tobacco and similar products, as well as from exposure to smoke from tobacco and emissions from similar products. It contains provisions on tobacco, electronic cigarettes and refill pods, herbal products for smoking, and the use of stimulating substances which in terms of use correspond to smoking but which do not contain tobacco. It does not apply to substances classified as drugs in accordance with the Narcotics Penal Code (1968:64) or to dangerous goods in accordance with the Act (1999:42) on the prohibition of certain dangerous goods, nor does it apply to medicinal products or medical devices covered by the Pharmaceuticals Act (2015: 315) or the Act (1993: 584) on medical devices. It contains the following chapters: 1. Introductory provisions; 2. Product requirements and reporting obligations; 3. Labelling and packaging; 4. Marketing and advertising; 5. Trade; 6. Non-smoking environments; 7. Supervision; 8. Fees; 9. Appeal; 10. Offenses and confiscation; 11. Authorizations.

Policy: Arrêté n° 0898 du 20 Décembre 2018 portant organisation des délégations régionales du Ministère du Développement Rural.
Policy_Content: Avec cet arrêté il est institué au niveau de chaque Wilaya une Délégation Régionale du Développement Rural qui constitue une représentation régionale du Ministère. L'arrêté définit la mission de la Délégation, la suivie de l'exécution de ses programmes ainsi que ses responsabilités. Il établit aussi les services dont la Délégation Régionale est composée, qui sont assimilés aux services de l’Administration centrale. L'article 6 s'occupe du service d'inspection qui est créé au niveau de chaque Moughataa et les articles suivants définissent les activités des inspecteurs et les bureaux que l'Inspection de la Moughataa comprend. Des postes vétérinaires peuvent aussi être créés au niveau des inspections, chargé des missions dévolues au bureau de Santé et Production Animales dans leur zone géographique. Une délégation régionale, avec un statut particulier, est créée pour couvrir les Wilayas de Nouakchott. Les services qu'elle comprend ainsi que son fonctionnament sont traités par les articles 11 et 12.

Policy: Décret n° 2018-381/PR/MDL du 20/12/2018 portant organisation et fonctionnement de l'Agence de Réhabilitation Urbaine et du Logement Social (ARULOS).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret définit l'organisation et le fonctionnement de l'Agence de Réhabilitation Urbaine et du Logement Social (ARULOS) créée par la Loi n°09/ AN/18/8ème L du 25 juin 2018. Dans le cadre de la politique définie par le Gouvernement, l'Agence de Réhabilitation Urbaine et du Logement Social a pour objet de: promouvoir la construction et le développement de logements sociaux sur l'ensemble du territoire,  élaborer et mettre en œuvre le programme national de résorption de l'habitat insalubre “Programme Zéro Bidonville”, favoriser l'accès à la propriété foncière en intensifiant la campagne de la Cession Amiable, promouvoir l'utilisation des crédits matériaux dans les opérations de construction de logements en auto-construction. L'Agence de Réhabilitation Urbaine et du Logement Social a pour principales missions de l’élaboration des études et la construction des logements sociaux sur financement des partenaires nationaux ou internationaux, la mise en œuvre des opérations de restructuration et de réhabilitation dans les quartiers d'habitat précaire, la régularisation foncière dans le cadre de la procédure de la cession amiable, l'octroi de prêts en matériaux pour accompagner les initiatives d'auto-construction, l'encadrement techniques et l'appui financier nécessaires au développement des coopératives d'habitat dans les programmes de logements sociaux.

Policy: Plan Ambiental Nacional para el Desarrollo Sostenible.
Policy_Content: El presente documento contiene el Plan Ambiental Nacional, un instrumento de planificación estratégica para el ordenamiento eficiente del accionar y la coordinación de todos los actores involucrados en una política ambiental nacional para el desarrollo sostenible. Se trata de un plan estratégico de mediano y largo plazo, flexible y adaptativo, que acompaña la dinámica de los cambios tecnológicos y sociales e incorpora visiones y acciones para promover las políticas públicas ambientales en el proceso integral del desarrollo sostenible del país. En esa línea, las metas del Plan integran las tres dimensiones de este modelo, lo ambiental, social y económico, que explicitan la necesidad de lograr un desarrollo a favor de todas las personas, a saber: 1) Un ambiente sano para una buena calidad de vida; 2) Actividades económicas y productivas sostenibles; 3) Gestión y ciudadanía ambiental.

Policy: Decision on the development of the Spatial Plan of Montenegro.
Policy_Content: This Decision, based on the provisions of the Law on spatial planning and construction of facilities, approaches the development of the Spatial Plan of Montenegro. The plan is made for the entire territory of Montenegro and represents the general basis of the organization and spatial planning of the national territory, including urban land, sea area and coastal zone.  Space, as one of the most important resources of Montenegro, is the basis for overall development, by strengthening the essential purposeful use of spatial potentials, as well as preservation of landscape diversity and biodiversity. Regional specifics are the basis for achieving local, regional and international identity of Montenegro. Montenegro 's strategic commitment is to rationally and sustainably use its natural and artificial resources and to develop as an ecological state, in accordance with the constitutional provision, through: application of the principles of sustainable development; continuation of transition reforms; inclusion of Montenegro in European integration flows and the European Union and more fully use of various forms of domestic and foreign institutional and expert assistance and advice; expansion of international economic and other exchanges; faster and sustainable economic growth; improving social development and social cohesion; development of various forms of social communication and interaction; preservation and development of cultural (ethnic, religious, gender, etc.) identity and diversity; timely drafting and adoption of missing strategic documents.
Subject: Land & soil, Sea
Keyword: Coastal zone management,Environmental planning,Land-use planning,Protection of environment,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Urban land,Policy/planning

Policy: Ley Nº 9647 - Modifica el Código de Minería.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica el Código de Minería, en en su artículo 36, que queda redactado así: "El Poder Ejecutivo podrá otorgar concesiones de explotación de materiales en cauces de dominio público por un plazo máximo de diez años, prorrogable de manera sucesiva por períodos hasta de cinco años, hasta completar un máximo de treinta años, plazo que incluye la etapa de cierre de la concesión. Lo anterior, siempre y cuando las condiciones del río lo permitan, según criterio de la Dirección de Geología y Minas (DGM) y que el concesionario haya cumplido con sus obligaciones durante el período de vigencia de la concesión. Para solicitar la prórroga, el concesionario deberá mantener al día la viabilidad ambiental. El procedimiento y los requisitos serán establecidos en el reglamento de esta ley. El plazo se computará a partir de la inscripción del título en el Registro Nacional Minero."

Policy: Regulation No. 2172 on subsidies for wildlife purposes.
Policy_Content: The Regulation concerns a grant scheme, which shall contribute to a management of wildlife that promotes a harvestable surplus of the game. Policy: Royal Decree No.43/2018 on introducing amendments to some provisions of the Law for the Regulation and Privatization of the Electricity and related Water Sector.
Policy_Content: This Decree consisting of 3 articles aims at amending some provisions of the Royal Decree that regulates the privatization of the electricity and related water sector. Main purpose of the majority of these amendments is (i) to transfer the electricity-related policy-setting competencies from the Public Authority for Electricity and Water (PAEW) to the Ministry of Oil and Gas (MOG); and (ii) to achieve better coordination and a more efficient allocation of the energy sources. Main objectives of the Authority to be achieved through the Regulations developed after coordination with the Ministry of Oil and Gas are (i) ensure regular supply of electricity; (ii) protect the public from the risk of injury resulting from works and installations related to the electricity and related water sector; (iii) encourage the optimal use of electrical energy taking into account the relevant controls and standards approved by the Ministry of Oil and Gas; and (iv) encourage the production and sale of electricity using renewable energy sources.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 123-2018-PCM ─ Reglamento del Sistema Administrativo de Modernización de la Gestión Pública.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Reglamento del Sistema Administrativo de Modernización de la Gestión Pública, que tiene por objeto desarrollar el Sistema Administrativo de Modernización de la Gestión Pública, estableciendo los principios, normas y procedimientos que aplican al proceso de modernización de la gestión pública, en concordancia con la Ley N° 27658. El presente Reglamento es de aplicación a toda entidad pública que forma parte de la Administración Pública, incluyendo aquellas que ejercen potestades administrativas, y por tanto su accionar se encuentra sujeto a normas de derecho público. En el caso de las empresas que conforman la actividad empresarial del Estado, su aplicación se da solo en aquello que le resulte aplicable. El Sistema Administrativo de Modernización de la Gestión Pública se rige, entre otros, bajo los principios de: a) Orientación al ciudadano: las intervenciones de las entidades públicas, según su naturaleza, se diseñan e implementan a partir de la identificación de las necesidades y expectativas de los ciudadanos; b) Orientación a resultados: las entidades realizan intervenciones públicas para resolver un problema público o de gestión interna y evalúan sus resultados para mejorar sus bienes, servicios o regulaciones; c) Simplicidad y armonización: las entidades públicas que establecen reglas para el funcionamiento y gestión de la administración pública, lo hacen buscando la simplicidad en las reglas y su operación armónica con las regulaciones emitidas por otras entidades rectoras de políticas y sistemas.

Policy: Resolución Nº 223-2018-PCM ─ Crea la Comisión Multisectorial de Naturaleza Temporal para la Sostenibilidad Ambiental de los Productos Agroexportables.

La Comisión, para el cumplimiento de su objeto, ejerce las funciones siguientes: 1) Emitir el informe técnico que desarrolle las propuestas metodológicas para el cálculo de la Huella Ambiental de los productos agroexportables y las normas técnicas que de ellas se deriven; así como propuestas metodológicas que aseguren un manejo ambiental adecuado; 2) Emitir el informe técnico que contenga la propuesta de adecuación de los programas existentes y los que estén por iniciar durante el periodo de vigencia de la Comisión, planes de monitoreo y estrategias de gestión a las metodologías que se elaborarán para contribuir al cumplimiento de estándares de sostenibilidad ambiental requeridos por los mercados internacionales; 3) Emitir los informes técnicos necesarios para elaborar las metodologías a ser aplicadas a nivel país para que los productos agroexportables cumplan con los estándares de sostenibilidad ambiental requeridos por el mercado internacional.

Policy: Personal Assistance Act.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates full conditions and procedure for provision and use of personal assistance in the Republic of Bulgaria. The Law shall aim at providing personal assistance to help users exercise fundamental rights, to have choice, independent living, active involvement and participation in society and access to services and activities. Personal assistance is a mechanism for support to full participation in society, for carrying out activities responsible of individual needs of a personal, domestic or social nature, and for overcoming the barriers of functional limitations. User of personal assistance is a person with a disability, which has led to limitations in his ability for self-service in everyday life and to dependence on foreign assistance, which will compensate the functional deficit and provide support for the exercise of his basic rights and full participation in society.

Policy: Public Private Partnership Regulations, No. 353 of 2018
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made in accordance with Section 40(1) of the Public Private Partnership Act, No. 4 of 2017. The Regulations provide that the Public Private Partnership (PPP) Committee shall be making reports to the Minister at the end of each quarter with regards to; particulars of all activities of the Committee during the quarter under review or any other information required by the Minister. The conduct of PPP project initiations are also regulated, with provisions requiring unsolicited proposals by public entities to be considered in line with the mandates of the public entity, the appointment of project officers and transaction advisors, among others.  The Regulations provide that the feasibility assessment of PPP projects shall include;  (a) market assessment to assess the need for and appropriate scope of the project, containing a needs analysis, options analysis and demand forecast; (b) technical feasibility and technical parameters based on the market analysis including specifications of required facilities and detailed project costing; (c) legal analysis to assess the impact of the applicable laws; (d) preliminary social and environmental feasibility, including the requirements for environmental and social impact assessments and for the associated mitigations; (e) project structuring in terms of the recommended public private partnership mode; (f) financial analysis incorporating a projected revenue structure, financial viability and affordability of the public private partnership project for the public entity and the end users and assessing any need for financial support from the public sector through the government budget or otherwise, among others. PPP project procurement is regulated and items like the development of the procurement plan, constitution of the procurement committee, form of communication in procurement documents, among others, are extensively provided for. The Regulations also provides for the conduct of bidding and the making of tenders with regards to PPP projects.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: Thüringen Climate Protection Act.
Policy_Content: This Act specifies the national goals in relation to climate protection and adaptation to the consequences of climate change  according to Article 31 of the Constitution of the Free State of Thüringen. The Act provides for general obligations regarding climate change and adaptation to its consequences. The obligations are addressed to every natural and legal persons, citizens, schools and educational institutions, municipal and state authorities. The Act describes the goals for reducing greenhouse gases to 95% by 2050 and to balance the energy demand and to acquire renewable energy from local resources in Thüringen. According to the Act, the state government supports the development and use of the potentials for renewables energies, such as wind energy, photovoltaics and solar thermal energy, bioenergy, hydro power and geothermal energy and the use of environmental heat. The Act further describes  use of environmentally friendly modes of transport, safe and environmental compatible  energy  supply for improving decrease of the greenhouse gas production. The Act provides for a legal framework for the development and implementation of monitoring measures. The state government decides on an integrated program of measures for implementation of goals of this Act.The Act consists of 5 Sections and 19 Articles. The Sections are (1) General provisions; (2) Climate protection; (3) Adaptation to the consequences of climate change; (4) Monitoring, responsibilities; (5) Final provisions.

Policy: Decree on strategic noise mapping.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Decree of the Ministry of Health is to protect human health from the adverse effects of noise. The present Decree, which is composed of eight paragraphs and four Annexes, lays down, in accordance with European Union legislation, noise emission limit values, their calculation for noise generated by road, rail and air traffic and noise originating from installations covered by the Integrated Prevention Act, requirements for the content of strategic noise maps and action plans, details on informing the public about strategic noise maps, the preparation and public participation in draft action plans. The strategic noise map contains a map, table and text part describing the existing noise situation, number of persons, houses, schools and bedside health facilities exposed to the values ​​of the noise indicators set out in Annex 2 to this Decree in the area for which a strategic noise map is required.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Resolución Nº 284-2018-MINAGRI-SERFOR-DE ─ Plan de Prevención y Reducción de Riesgos de Incendios Forestales, Período 2019 - 2022.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Plan de Prevención y Reducción de Riesgos de Incendios Forestales, Período 2019 - 2022. El Servicio Nacional Forestal y de Fauna Silvestre coordina con las instituciones que participan en la ejecución del Plan, las acciones necesarias para su implementación; y la Dirección General de Gestión Sostenible del Patrimonio Forestal y de Fauna Silvestre se encarga de su implementación, debiendo informar sobre los resultados de dicha gestión. El Objetivo General del Plan es disminuir la ocurrencia de incendios forestales para evitar la pérdida del patrimonio forestal y de la fauna silvestre de la Nación. Constituyen sus Objetivos Específicos: 1) Fortalecer capacidades de los actores involucrados en la prevención y reducción de riesgos de incendios; 2) Desarrollar la gestión de la información, monitoreo y alerta temprana estandarizada para la prevención y reducción de incendios; 3) Adecuar el marco legal acorde a las necesidades nacionales relacionadas con la prevención y reducción de riesgos de incendios forestales; 4) Promover la gestión del conocimiento sobre prevención y reducción de riesgos de incendios forestales.

Policy: Law No. 4.437 creating the State Policy on Climate Governance, the Environmental Services (PGSA) and the State System of Climate Governance and Environmental Services (SGSA), within the State of Rondônia.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 68 articles divided into nine Chapters, creates the State Policy on Climate Governance, the Environmental Services (PGSA) and the State System of Climate Governance and Environmental Services (SGSA), within the State of Rondônia. This Policy shall comply with the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and the subsequent international decisions to which Brazil is a signatory, as well as the relevant legislation, in particular Federal Law No. 12.187 of 29 December 2009 creating the National Policy on Climate Change (PNMC). The objective of the PGSA aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and to mitigate and adapt the effects of climate change, through the efforts carried out by the population, the multiple users of natural resources and the Public Power, ensuring food production, biodiversity preservation, rights of indigenous peoples and traditional communities, and promoting the economic sustainable development. The State Public Power will create the Climate Governance and Environmental Services Fund, linked to SEDAM, with the objective of receiving and applying resources destined to the final activities of the Climate Governance Policy and Environmental Services.

Policy: Law No. 11.249 creating the State Policy of Incentive to Agroindustry.
Policy_Content: This Law creates the State Policy for Incentive to Agroindustry, with the aim of promoting: the creation of new agroindustrial enterprises; the regularization of informal agroindustry; the agroindustrial competitiveness of the State. For the purposes of this Law, agroindustry is the segment of the production chain that transforms raw materials from agriculture, livestock, aquaculture or forestry into semi-processed or industrialized products. The principles and guidelines of the State Policy of Incentive to Agroindustry are: socio-economic, and environmental sustainability of the rural productive chains; reduction of regional disparities by encouraging the deployment of agroindustries in regions not suitable for large plants; generation of jobs and income at the local level; raising labour productivity; innovation, modernization and technological development; health and food safety; simplification of administrative procedures; etc. The State Policy will be implemented through specific plans and programmes, formulated according to the needs and particularities of the different types of food industries.

Policy: Regional Governor’s No. 123 validating the Regulation on the creation of a protective zone of protected natural area of regional significance and the approval of the Regulations on the protective zone of natural park of regional significance located on the territory of the urban district "Belgorod city" of the Belgorod region.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for the creation of protective zone within the boundaries of natural park of regional significance located on the territory of the urban district "Belgorod city" of the Belgorod region. The scope of protective zone shall be protection of natural park of regional significance located on the territory of the urban district "Belgorod city" of the Belgorod region against unfavourable anthropogenic impact. Constitution of protective zone shall not entail expropriation of land plots. The protective zone envisages creation of two functional zones with different special protection mode: (a) territory for recreational purposes; and (b) forest park. Recreational and other nature management causing negative (harmful) impact of natural complexes and landscapes, wild fauna and wild flora species, including any new construction, felling (except for intermediate felling), modification of landscape, grazing of farm animals, effluent waste water discharge, off-road vehicle traffic and parking off roads and specially equipped places with a hard surface, destruction or damage of special signs informing about the boundaries of the protective zone, prospecting, blasting and drilling works, mining, use of aviation in the localization and elimination of foci of harmful organisms without the consent of authorized body, application of toxic chemicals, fertilizers, plant protection means and waste disposal, shall be prohibited.

Policy: Act on the promotion of electrical energy from high-efficiency cogeneration.
Policy_Content: This Act sets out rules for providing support to electrical energy generated in high-efficiency cogeneration in cogeneration units and to issuing guarantees of origin for high-efficiency cogeneration. The present Act is composed of the following Sections: (1) General provisions; (2) Rules for participation in the support scheme for producers of electrical energy from high-efficiency cogeneration; (3) Rules for participation in the auction support scheme for producers of electrical energy from high-efficiency cogeneration; (4) Rules for participation in the support scheme in the form of guaranteed premium for producers of electrical energy from high-efficiency cogeneration; (5) Rules for participation in the support scheme for cogeneration units with an installed electrical capacity of not less than 50MW; (6) Principles of managing the demand for electrical energy from high-efficiency cogeneration and the method of calculating the amount of electrical energy from high-efficiency cogeneration; (7) Cogeneration fee; (8) Information obligations for producers of electrical energy from cogeneration benefiting from the support specified by this Act; (9) Guarantees of origin of electrical energy from cogeneration; (10) Penal fees; (11) Criminal provisions; (12) Changes in valid provisions.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Order No. KR DSM-40 of the Minister of Public Health validating Sanitary rules “Sanitary and epidemiological requirements for the organization and application of sanitary-antiepidemic, sanitary-preventive arrangements for the prevention of particularly dangerous infectious diseases”.
Policy_Content: Sanitary rules “Sanitary and epidemiological requirements for the organization and application of sanitary-antiepidemic, sanitary-preventive arrangements for the prevention of particularly dangerous infectious diseases” establish requirements for the organization and performance of sanitary and antiepidemic sanitary and preventive measures, aimed at preventing particularly dangerous infectious diseases. Organization and implementation of sanitary and epidemiological measures, sanitary and preventive measures to prevent anthrax in the rural inhabited areas and in territories under risk of anthrax outbreak by territorial units and organizations of the government agency in the field of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population shall include: (a) detection, registration and accounting of anthrax outbreaks, rural inhabited areas with registered anthrax cases, mapping of anthrax cases by the geographical coordinates; (b) control over inadmissibility of use of land in human activity areas located in the sanitary protection zone around anthrax focuses; (c) control over the implementation of antiepidemic measures in the focuses of anthrax; (d) control over preventive vaccination of people against anthrax; (e) organization of preventive, current and final disinfection in areas of epidemic outbreaks; (f) performance of sanitary and educational work with the population, as well as among persons professionally engaged in the procurement, collection, storage, transportation, processing and trade of raw materials of animal origin with indication of sources of infection, factors, modes of transmission and anthrax prevention measures. Requirements for the organization and conduct of sanitary-epidemic, sanitary and preventive measures to prevent the occurrence of and  еhe spread of tularemia shall be observation of the epizootic and epidemiological process, including monitoring of morbidity, study of the endemicity of the area, monitoring of the pathogen circulation, evaluation of situation, forecasting and monitoring of the effectiveness of measures taken.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Ley Nº 6.256 - Que prohíbe las actividades de transformación y conversión de superficies con cobertura de bosques en la región oriental.
Policy_Content: La presente ley tiene por objeto regular la protección, la recuperación y el mejoramiento del bosque nativo en la Región Oriental para que, en un marco de desarrollo sostenible, el bosque cumpla con sus funciones ambientales, sociales y económicas, contribuyendo al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de los habitantes del país y en cumplimiento de la Ley Nacional de Cambio Climático. Quedan prohibidas, por un período inicial de dos años, a partir de la promulgación de la presente Ley, la realización en la región oriental de actividades de transformación o conversión de superficies con cobertura de bosques; y la emisión de permisos, licencias, Declaración de Impacto Ambiental, autorizaciones y/o cualquier otra modalidad de documento jurídicamente válido, que ampare la transformación o conversión de superficies con cobertura de bosques nativos. Se ordena además al Ministerio del Ambiente y Desarrollo Sostenible y al Instituto Forestal Nacional (INFONA) actualizar reglamentariamente la estructura orgánica del Sistema Nacional de Monitoreo Forestal (SNMF).

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement wallon portant exécution de l’article 47 du Code forestier relatif à l’utilisation d’huile biodégradable en forêt.
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté établi l’utilisation d’huile biodégradable en forêt. Les huiles biodégradables considérées comme respectueuses de l’environnement, en application de l’article 47 du Code forestier, présentent un seuil de biodégradabilité intrinsèque; limité d'écotoxicité; limité de toxicité; l'absence de substances dangereuses; et une teneur minimale en matières premières renouvelables. Le Ministre de la Forêt détermine les valeurs des caractéristiques énoncées après consultation du pôle « Ruralité », section « Forêt-Filière Bois » et après les avoir notifiées à la Commission européenne en application de la Directive UE2015/1535 du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 9 septembre 2015 prévoyant une procédure d’information dans le domaine des réglementations techniques et des règles relatives aux services de la société de l’information. L’utilisation de scies à chaine équipées d’huiles de chaine non visées à l’article 2 est interdite dans l’ensemble des bois et forêts visés à l’article 2 du Code forestier. L’utilisation d’engins d’exploitation équipés d’huiles hydrauliques non visées à l’article 2 est interdite dans l’ensemble des bois et forêts visés à l’article 2 du Code forestier à l’exception des chemins et routes.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Ley Nº 10.664 - Creación de la Colonia Productiva Guardamonte.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Ley se crea la Colonia Productiva Guardamonte, en el territorio indicado, con el objetivo de: a) impulsar el desarrollo económico, productivo, social y educativo de la zona donde se encuentra ubicado el inmueble; b) propender al afincamiento definitivo en la zona de los vecinos del lugar, evitando la emigración a las mayores concentraciones urbanas; c) alentar la concreción e instalación de proyectos productivos y de investigación, social y ambientalmente sustentables y diversificados; d) facilitar el uso, aprovechamiento y explotación del universo de bienes que conforman el patrimonio estatal; e) revitalizar la especial trascendencia del Estado para intervenir en el impulso de políticas de fomento de actividades productivas, que generen trabajo genuino y propicien la igualdad de oportunidades. La Ley asimismo establece los principios para la selección de los proyectos de explotación del predio.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 122-2018-PCM ─ Aprueba la adscripción del Organismo de Supervisión de los Recursos Forestales y de Fauna Silvestre (OSINFOR) al Ministerio del Ambiente (MINAM).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba la adscripción del Organismo de Supervisión de los Recursos Forestales y de Fauna Silvestre (OSINFOR) al Ministerio del Ambiente (MINAM). La adscripción hace parte de una estrategia de modernización de la gestión pública que viene implementando el MINAM, que tiene como finalidad contribuir a detener la deforestación y contribuir con acciones frente al cambio climático; y siendo el OSINFOR un Organismo Público Ejecutor de la Presidencia de Consejo de Ministros, cuyo accionar se concentra en la supervisión y fiscalización del sector forestal y de fauna silvestre, resulta conveniente su adscripción al MINAM, con el objetivo de mejorar la eficacia del Estado, a traves de una mejor coordinación, planificación y ejecución de la Política Nacional del Ambiente con una mirada de enfoque ecosistémico.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 168 - Dispone que AgroSeguro sea un sistema permanente de seguridad productiva subvencionado por el Estado.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo dispone que que AgroSeguro es un sistema permanente de seguridad productiva, subvencionado por el Estado en beneficio de los productores agrícolas, ganaderos y otros agentes productivos vinculados al agro ecuatoriano. El Proyecto AgroSeguro es parte del Ministerio de Agricultura Ganadería, no tiene personería jurídica, y su objeto es encargarse de diseñar e implementar políticas herramientas destinadas al aseguramiento de los sectores productivos agropecuarios. Se aprueba el Instructivo de Gestión de AgroSeguro, que regula la entrega del subsidio a los beneficiarios del Proyecto, para la adquisición de las pólizas de seguros agropecuarios, que es parte integrante del presente Acuerdo. Las actividades agropecuarias, cultivos, especies zootécnicas y forestales a asegurarse, se determinan en el Instructivo de Gestión del AgroSeguro, que consta como Anexo.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 15/2018 approving the Ministry of Petroleum and Mining (MPM).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 20 articles divided into four Chapters and one Annex, approves the Ministry of Petroleum and Minerals (MPM) as a government department. It establishes the composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Ministry, entitled to perform the following activities: designing and implementing energy policy and managing mineral resources, including petroleum and other minerals; licensing and regulating mining sector, including petrochemical and refining activities. The functions of MPM are: elaborate and propose the policy and projects of legislation of the sector; establish the system of administration and sectorial management and regulate the activities of the sector; ensure Timor maximum participation in the activities of the oil and mineral resources through appropriate legal, administrative and technical instruments; promote national opportunities in the sector, in order to attract and fix the external investment established therein; monitor the implementation of the Treaties and relevant instruments; conduct the negotiation process regarding the development model of the Greater Sunrise field or other matters related to the exercise of jurisdiction in the Timor Sea, etc.

Policy: Plan de Acción Nacional de Pueblos Indígenas (PLANPIES).
Policy_Content: El  Plan de Acción Nacional de Pueblos Indígenas de El Salvador (PLANPIES) fue elaborado con el fin de procurar la orientación de la ejecución de las operaciones del Estado salvadoreño acordadas con las estructuras organizativas indígenas, con el propósito de tener políticas interculturales de crecimiento y desarrollo para el disfrute pleno de los derechos indígenas. Se persiguen los siguientes objetivos específicos: promover marcos normativos que permitan desarrollar el reconocimiento legal y político, y la autonomía de los pueblos indígenas; participación activa de los pueblos indígenas en las decisiones y las acciones de apoyo a la protección, conservación, uso colectivo y sostenible de tierras, territorios y recursos en mejora de los sistemas productivos propios; mejorar las condiciones de vida de los pueblos indígenas, prestando especial atención a la niñez, juventud y mujeres indígenas; fortalecer la cultura y la identidad indígena y del patrimonio cultural (tangible e intangible), y su relación equilibrada y sostenible con su entorno natural.

Policy: USDA Forest Service Tribal Relations Strategic Plan FY 2019-2022
Policy_Content: The USDA Forest Service Tribal Relations Strategic Plan FY 2019-2022 is a national sectoral plan of the United States of America. Its main goals and objectives are (1) to sustain sovereignty through shared stewardship - build, strengthen, and uphold nation-to-nation relationships that sustain tribal sovereignty and help meet the agency’s trust responsibility and treaty obligations; and engage in shared stewardship of our nation’s lands, including tribal and forest service lands and resources, to support healthy and resilient forests and grasslands that benefit tribal communities and help the forest service better accomplish its mission; (2) to deliver benefits to tribal communities and the public - facilitate delivery of benefits to tribal communities and the public; strengthen availability, access, use, and resilience of tribally important resources and places; and leverage partners’ capabilities; (3) to apply knowledge inclusively -facilitate the appropriate and ethical gathering and exchange of knowledge and perspectives that lead to beneficial actions on forests and grasslands across boundaries; and promote diversity and inclusion within the agency in support of the forest service strategic plan management objective “recruit a diverse workforce”; and (4) to excel in tribal relations leadership - showcase outstanding examples of collaboration with tribes, promoting positive agency engagement to enhance tribal relations; continuously improve how the forest service creates, maintains, and improves tribal relations; and enhance the forest service’s ability to maintain an accountable process for its consultation and other interactions with tribes.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Law No. 10.951 creating the State Policy for Agroecology and Organic Production (PEAPO).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 11 articles creates the State Policy for Agroecological and Organic Production (PEAPO) with the objective of integrating, articulating and adapting policies, programmes and actions that lead to the agroecological transition and organic and agroecological production, contributing to the sustainable development and quality of life of people through the sustainable use of natural resources and consumption of healthy foodstuff. The State Secretariat for Agriculture, Supply, Aquaculture and Fisheries (SEAG) may establish additional criteria to access credit lines for family farmers, in order to take into account their peculiarities. The State Commission for Agroecological and Organic Production (CEAPO) is responsible for: promote the participation of society in the preparation and follow-up of PEAPO and the State Plan for Agroecological Production and Organic Agriculture (PLEAPO); establish thematic subcommittees that will bring together government and civil society sectors to propose and support decision-making on specific issues within the framework of PEAPO; propose to the Executive Power the guidelines, objectives and priorities of PLEAPO; and promote a dialogue between governmental and non-governmental bodies related to agroecology and organic production, at all levels, for the implementation of PEAPO and PLEAPO.

Policy: Kisumu County Emergency Fund Act, 2018 (No. 4 of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Kisumu Emergency Fund for the purpose of enabling payments to be made in respect of a County when an urgent and unforeseen need for expenditure arises for which there is no specific legislative authority. The Fund consists of monies appropriated from the County Assembly and grants and donations made into the Fund. Additionally, the Fund is administered where it is for public interest, an event has caused a damage, loss, hardship or suffering to residents of the County or threatens to damage the environment, among others. The Act defines unforeseen events as one which threatens human life or welfare and threatens damage to the environment.

Policy: Plan de Igualdad de Oportunidades y Derechos (PIOD) 2018-2020.
Policy_Content: El Plan de Igualdad de Oportunidades y Derechos (PIOD) 2018-2020, elaborado por el Instituto Nacional de las Mujeres (INAM), cuyo Objetivo general es generar las condiciones para que todas las personas tengan las mismas posibilidades de acceder y ejercer sus derechos y desarrollar su proyecto de vida libremente. Los Objetivos estratégicos del PIOD son: 1) Promover el aumento y la calidad de la participación de las mujeres en los ámbitos cultural, político, económico y social; 2) Prevenir, atender, sancionar y erradicar la violencia contra las niñas y mujeres, garantizándoles acceso a una justicia efectiva; 3) Alcanzar para la población el nivel más elevado de salud en todas sus dimensiones, incluidos los derechos sexuales y los derechos reproductivos; 4) Mejorar la igualdad de oportunidades de las mujeres y población LGBTIQ en el acceso, permanencia y condiciones de trabajo en el mercado laboral remunerado y formal; 5) Facilitar la conciliación y corresponsabilidad de la vida personal, familiar y laboral; 6) Promover la transformación de valores culturales que naturalizan las desigualdades entre los géneros; 7) Promover los espacios de intercambios y construcción de sujetos sociales comprometidos en la producción de procesos de inclusión y cohesión social con igualdad de oportunidades y libres de violencia.

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2018/1999 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the Governance of the Energy Union and Climate Action.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes a governance mechanism to: (a) implement strategies and measures designed to meet the objectives and targets of the Energy Union and the longterm European Union greenhouse gas emissions commitments consistent with the Paris Agreement, and for the first ten-year period, from 2021 to 2030, in particular the Union's 2030 targets for energy and climate; (b) stimulate cooperation between Member States, including, where appropriate, at regional level, designed to achieve the objectives and targets of the Energy Union; (c) ensure the timeliness, transparency, accuracy, consistency, comparability and completeness of reporting by the Union and its Member States to the UNFCCC and Paris Agreement Secretariat.

Policy: Directive (EU) 2018/2001 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources.
Policy_Content: This Directive establishes a common framework for the promotion of energy from renewable sources. It sets a binding European Union target for the overall share of energy from renewable sources in the Union's gross final consumption of energy in 2030: Member States shall collectively ensure that the share of energy from renewable sources in the Union's gross final consumption of energy in 2030 is at least 32 %. Support schemes for energy from renewable sources shall be adopted by Member States. Provisions on joint projects between Member States and between Member States and third countries are laid down too.

Policy: Decree on the landfill of waste and storage of waste mercury.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Environment, which is composed of 17 articles and seven Annexes, lays down requirements for the landfill of waste and for storage of waste mercury. When selecting a site for the landfill of waste the following criteria must be taken into account: (1) safe distance from residential or recreational areas, watercourses, water reservoirs and water resources; (2) geological, hydrological, hydrogeological and engineering-geological conditions of the area; (3) protection of the nature and countryside and protection of cultural heritage of the area; (4) possible extreme meteorological effects and their consequences; (5) final opinion of the environmental impact assessment; (6) land-use planning documentation. Building and technical requirements for the construction of the landfill of waste are specified in art. 3.

Policy: Australian Modern Slavery Act 2018 (Act No. 153 of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Act requires entities based, or operating, in Australia, which have an annual consolidated revenue of more than $100 million, to report annually through a so called “modern slavery statement” on the risks of modern slavery in their operations and supply chains, and actions to address those risks. Other entities based, or operating, in Australia may report voluntarily. The Commonwealth also is required to report on behalf of non‑corporate Commonwealth entities, and the reporting requirements also apply to Commonwealth corporate entities and companies with an annual consolidated revenue of more than $100 million. This Act extends to every external Territory and extends to acts, omissions, matters and things outside Australia.

Policy: Decree No. 54.369 creating the Early Warning System for Prevention, Alert and Fighting incidents and hydrological and ecological disasters listed in Law No. 11.520.
Policy_Content: This Decree creates the Early Warning System for Prevention, Alert and Fighting incidents and hydrological and ecological disasters within the State of Rio Grande do Sul (SPPAC) as specified in art. 127 of Law No. 11.520. The Secretariat for the Environment and Sustainable Development (SEMA) is responsible for monitoring climate conditions, predicting climate trends and alerting to hydrological and meteorological events. In addition, the State Foundation for Environmental Protection (FEPAM) is responsible for monitoring environmental quality, as well as environmental accidents and emergencies. SEMA and FEPAM aim to support the Civil Protection actions carried out by other State organs within the National System of Protection and Civil Defense (SINPEC). SEMA works in cooperation with other Secretariats and organs of the State to optimize possible structures for monitoring and predicting existing climatic conditions, in order to share the results of these services.

Policy: Ley Nº 57/18 - Ley Sectorial Forestal de la República Dominicana.
Policy_Content: El objeto de esta Ley Sectorial Forestal, que consta de 76 artículos divididos en trece Capítulos, es regular y fomentar el manejo forestal sostenible de los bosques, procurando su conservación, aprovechamiento, producción, industrialización y comercialización, así como la protección de otros recursos naturales que formen parte de sus ecosistemas, manteniendo su biodiversidad y capacidad de regeneración. Los fundamentos de la presente ley son: 1) Establecer los mecanismos legales que garanticen la sostenibilidad en el uso de los recursos forestales; 2) Asegurar el ordenamiento, conservación y el manejo sostenible de los bosques para la obtención de los múltiples bienes y servicios que proporcionan dichos ecosistemas, incluyendo la regulación del régimen hídrico, protección de la biodiversidad, conservación de suelos, la adaptación y secuestro de carbono, producción de energía, entre otros; 3) Fomentar la reforestación de áreas forestales actualmente sin bosque, para proveer los productos y servicios forestales que se requieran; 4) Garantizar la protección de los ecosistemas forestales frente a incendios, talas indiscriminadas, pérdida de diversidad biológica, degradación genética, enfermedades y plagas; 5) Valorar y compensar los servicios ambientales que prestan los bosques y las plantaciones forestales, como incentivo para su conservación y mejoramiento; 6) Fomentar y fortalecer el desarrollo de la industria forestal en todas las etapas de la cadena productiva, bajo los criterios de competitividad, eficiencia y racionalidad; 7) Promover la participación social en la gestión forestal.

Policy: Loi n. 2018-74 du 10 décembre 2018 relative à la protection et à l'assistance aux personnes déplacées internes.
Policy_Content: La présente loi se compose de dix chapitres et 42 articles. Le premier chapitre, parmi les dispositions générales, définit l'objecte de la loi, c'est à dire la protection et l'assistance aux personnes déplacées internes au Niger. Le chapitre définit ensuite ces personnes ainsi que les autres concepts utiles à la compréhension de la loi. Le deuxième chapitre s'occupe de mesures de prévention des déplacements internes et le troisième de la protection des personnes déplacées internes soit du point de vue du droit des citoyens d'être protégés contre les déplacements arbitraires soit de celui de l'obligation de l'Etat d'assurer la protection des personnes déplacées internes. Le chapitre suivant s'occupe de l'assistance aux personnes déplacées internes comme obligation de l'Etat et le cinquième décrit des solutions durables que l'Etat doit offrir aux personnes déplacées internes, comme le retour chez leur résidence habituelle, la réinstallation et la réintégration dans leur lieux d'origine, accompagnées par des garanties telles que la sûreté et la sécurité à long terme, l'accès à l'emploi, la réunification familiale etc. Le sixième chapitre est dédié à la description des structures mise en place par l'Etat et qui constituent le cadre constitutionnel dans lesquel l'assistance aux personnes déplacées interne est assurée. Le septième chapitre envisage les infractions - et les pénalités relatives - commises à l'encontre des personnes déplacées internes et le chapitre suivant envisage les infractions - et les pénalités - relatives au personnel humanitaire dans l'exercice de ses activités d'aide, de protection et d'assistance. Le chapitre neuf énumère les dispositions communes à toutes les infractions (punition du complice, procédure de constatationdes infractions, application des dispositions pénales). Le dixième chapitre est dédié aux dispositions diverses et finales.

Policy: Fluorinated Greenhouse Gases (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2018 (S.R. No. 206 of 2018).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Fluorinated Greenhouse Gases Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 so as to update those Regulations on existing EU legislation on Fluorinated Greenhouse Gases and to   make provision for offshore installations. They contains new requirements for businesses on labelling of equipment containing F-gases, the inclusion of work with refrigeration units of refrigerated trucks and trailers in several F-gas offences, and a new requirement for businesses transferring F-gas work to another organisation and contain a new certification requirement for work with F-gases in stationary refrigeration, air conditioning, heat pumps and the refrigeration units of trucks and trailers. The competent authority shall be the Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs.

Policy: Order No. 650 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on the Chikoy National Park.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that Chikoy National Park shall be constituted in Transbaikal territory with a view of performing the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) preservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) creating conditions for regulated tourism and recreation; (e) scientific research in the field of nature protection and development of recreational potential of the Russian Federation; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) exploration and mining; (b) modification of hydrogeological regime and soil disturbance; (c) allotment of land plots for horticulture and peri-urban agriculture; (d) construction of main roads, pipelines, power lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for objects of the tourist industry, museums and information centers, objects associated with the functioning of the national park and residential areas located within the boundaries of the national park; (e) timber extraction; (f) procurement of soft resin; (g) commercial hunting; (h) industrial and coastal fisheries; (i) procurement of edible and non-edible non-timber forest resources; (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora; (k) collection of zoological, botanical and mineralogical specimens except for scientific research purposes envisaged by schedules; (l) introduction of live organisms for acclimatization purposes; (m) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (n) logging along watercourses and waterbodies; (o) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and fires outside specially reserved areas; (p) unauthorized archaeological excavations, collection and export objects of historical and cultural heritage; (q) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, hunting gear, as well as with wildlife products, except for authorized officials; (r) explosive works; (s) burning of vegetation; (t) clear cutting; (u) waste disposal; (v) washing, movement and parking of motor vehicles outside common access roads; (w) destruction and damaging of noticeboards, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs and equipped ecological paths and recreation areas; (x) ploughing up, application of toxic chemicals, plant protection means, fertilizers and growth stimulators; (y) landing of aircraft, except for cases related to the functioning of the national park, emergency, rescue operations and fire prevention measures; flight of aircraft below 500 meters over the territory national park without the approval of the administration of national park; and (z) haymaking and stay with dogs (except for service dogs), keeping unleashed dogs and training of dogs.

Policy: Radiation Protection Order, 2018 (No. S 67).
Policy_Content: This Order, consisting of 44 sections divided into ten Parts, completed by one Schedule, and under the article 83(3) of the Constitution, aims at controlling and regulating the import, export, manufacture, sale, disposal, transport, storage, possession, and use of radioactive waste materials and controlled apparatus, providing for the non-proliferation of nuclear weapons, and establishing a system for the imposition and maintenance of nuclear safeguards. Part 2 establishes the competent Administration of Order and appointment of authorised officers. Part 3 establishes Control of import, export etc. of radioactive materials and controlled apparatus, specifying that: no person shall, except under and in accordance with a licence: a) import into, or export out of, Brunei Darussalam any radioactive material; b) keep, have in his possession or under his control, or use any radioactive material; c) manufacture, sell or otherwise deal in any radioactive material; or d) transport any radioactive material. Part 4 defines the application requirements for the grant or renewal of a licence which shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

Policy: Orden PCI/1319/2018 - Modifica el Real Decreto Nº 1513/2005, sobre evaluación y gestión del ruido ambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Orden modifica el Anexo II del Real Decreto Nº 1513/2005, por el que se desarrolla la Ley Nº 37/2003, Ley del ruido, en lo referente a la evaluación del ruido ambiental. Mediante esta Orden se incorpora al Derecho español la Directiva 2015/996 de la Comisión, de 19 de mayo de 2015, por la que se establecen métodos comunes de evaluación del ruido en virtud de la Directiva 2002/49/CE del Parlamento Europeo y del Consejo. Policy: Australian Radiation Protection and Nuclear Safety Regulations 2018.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, consisting of 87 sections divided into eight Parts and completed by two Schedules, regulate the Australian Radiation Protection and Nuclear Safety. The purpose of these Regulations would be to remake and improve the Australian Radiation Protection and Nuclear Safety Regulations 1999 (the ARPANS Regulations) which are due to sunset on 1 April 2019. No change to the substantive meaning or operation of the provisions of the ARPANS Regulations are being proposed, however, various changes would be made to: (1) remake the instrument in accordance with current Office of Parliamentary Counsel drafting principles; (2) make language and formatting changes to reflect contextual changes and align with current drafting practices, such as referring to ‘sections’ rather than ‘regulations’ (3) repeal redundant provisions, such as those that relate to dates which have passed and now have no effect; (4) renumber the Regulations; and (5) improve clarity and readability.

Policy: Ley Nº 9/2018 - Modifica la Ley Nº 21/2013, Ley de Evaluación Ambiental, y parcialmente otras disposiciones.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley, que incorpora al Derecho español la Directiva 2014/52/UE del Parlamento Europeo y del Consejo, de 16 de abril de 2014, por la que se modifica la Directiva 2011/92/UE, relativa a la evaluación de las repercusiones de determinados proyectos públicos y privados sobre el medio ambiente, modifica la Ley de Evaluación Ambiental, que establece las bases que deben regir la evaluación ambiental de los planes, programas y proyectos que puedan tener efectos significativos sobre el medio ambiente, garantizando en todo el territorio del Estado un elevado nivel de protección ambiental, con el fin de promover un desarrollo sostenible. La incorporación de la nueva Directiva sobre evaluación de impacto ambiental, supone un refuerzo del actual enfoque de la evaluación de impacto ambiental como instrumento preventivo, que contempla las amenazas y desafíos ambientales que han surgido desde que entró en vigor la primera Directiva sobre evaluación de impacto ambiental de proyectos, hace ya más de 25 años. Esto significa prestar más atención a determinadas áreas, como la eficiencia de los recursos, el cambio climático y la prevención de riesgos que, con la nueva regulación, están ahora mejor reflejados en el proceso de evaluación.

Policy: Carbon Accounting (Wales) Regulations 2018 (W.S.I. No. 1301 (W. 255) of 2018).
Policy_Content: These Regulations make provision about carbon accounting and carbon units for the purposes of calculating the net Welsh emissions account under Part 2 of the Environment (Wales) Act 2016, which requires the Welsh Ministers to meet targets for reducing emissions of greenhouse gases from Wales. The Regulations define which carbon units may be included in the net Welsh emissions account and set out how carbon units may be credited to the net Welsh emissions account. They also enable the Welsh Ministers to open “the Welsh credit account” and provide that any carbon unit that is to be credited to the net Welsh emissions account must be held in that account. The Welsh Ministers shall maintain a register containing details of the carbon units credited to and debited from the net Welsh emissions account and the details of carbon units cancelled.

Policy: Ley Nº 9635 - Ley de fortalecimiento de las finanzas públicas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de fortalecimiento de las finanzas públicas dispone en el Artículo 11, Tarifa Reducida del Impuesto sobre el Valor Agregado (IVA) del uno por ciento (1%) para los siguientes bienes o servicios: 1) Las ventas, así como las importaciones o internaciones, de los bienes agropecuarios incluidos en la canasta básica, incluyendo las transacciones de semovientes vivos, la maquinaria, el equipo, las materias primas, los servicios e insumos necesarios, en toda la cadena de producción, y hasta su puesta a disposición del consumidor final; 2) Las ventas, así como las importaciones o internaciones, de los artículos definidos en la canasta básica establecida mediante decreto ejecutivo emitido por el Ministerio de Hacienda y el Ministerio de Economía, Industria y Comercio (MEIC), y que será revisada y actualizada cada vez que se publiquen los resultados de una nueva encuesta nacional de ingresos y gastos de los hogares. Esta canasta se definirá con base en el consumo efectivo de bienes y servicios de primera necesidad de los hogares que se encuentren en los dos primeros deciles de ingresos, de acuerdo con los estudios efectuados por el Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Censos (INEC); 3) La importación o la compra local de las siguientes materias primas e insumos: i) Trigo, así como sus derivados para producir alimentos para animales; ii) Frijol de soya, así como sus derivados para producir alimentos para animales; iii) Sorgo; iv) Fruta y almendra de palma aceitera, así como sus derivados para producir alimento para animales; v) Maíz, así como sus derivados para producir alimentos para animales; 4) Los productos veterinarios y los insumos agropecuarios y de pesca, a excepción de los de pesca deportiva, que definan, de común acuerdo, el Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería (MAG) y el Ministerio de Hacienda.
