Policy: Law on state survey and real estate cadastre.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates state survey, real estate cadastre, infrastructure cadastre, register of buildings, register of spatial units, register of geographical names, jurisdiction over state survey, real estate cadastre, infrastructure cadastre, building register, register of spatial units, register of geographical names and performing these activities, activities of the State Geodetic Administration, storage and use of data and supervision of related activities. The provisions of this Law shall also apply to the performance of activities and other geodetic operations if they are performed within the framework of hydrographic surveys, land consolidation and other similar procedures. The cadastral area at sea includes internal sea waters, the territorial sea, the continental shelf of the Republic of Croatia and the part of the land which is also in the regime of maritime domain. The types of land use may be the following: farmland or agricultural land; forest land; inland waters; sea surface; natural barren land; land brought to use. The register of geographical names contains data on the following geographical names: geographical units, relief forms, land and sea waters, islands and peninsulas, buildings and other structures, areas, settlements, roads and general names.

Policy: Social Protection Sector Strategic Plan (SP-SSP) 2018/19 – 2023/24.
Policy_Content: The National Protection Policy is intended to support the realization of Rwanda’s Vision 2050 as well as a range of regional and international medium-term commitments relating to poverty, hunger and social protection system development. The overall objective of this policy is to strengthen the national social protection system with a view to ensuring that all Rwandan citizens have a dignified standard of living. The specific objectives of this Policy for the 2018-2024 period are: 1. to increase access to social security and income support programmes, particularly among vulnerable older people, people with disabilities, households with low labour capacity and other poor families; 2. to enhance social protection sector’s contribution to reducing malnutrition; 3. to strengthen support for households and communities affected by disasters and shocks; 4. to strengthen the provision of social care services for the protection and inclusion of the most vulnerable; 5. to strengthen linkages between social protection and complementary programmes that support sustainable graduation from extreme poverty; 6. to promote values of self-reliance, respect for rights and community-based support for the vulnerable; and 7. to strengthen institutional capacity for evidence-based policy development and social protection service delivery.

Policy: Independent Commissioner Against Corruption Act 2017.
Policy_Content: The object of this Act is to address wrongdoing in, or connected with, public administration by (a) preventing or minimising the occurrence of improper conduct; (b) improving public confidence that improper conduct will be detected and dealt with appropriately; (c) providing incentives and  reducing disincentives to persons to assist in the detection, reporting, investigation, prosecution and prevention of improper conduct; and (d) protecting persons who put themselves at risk of harm by exposing or reporting improper conduct; and augmenting the Territory's existing framework for responding  to improper conduct by establishing an Independent Commissioner Against Corruption (ICAC). The Commission is intended to investigate the most serious, systemic and sensitive improper conduct, to ensure that other improper conduct is dealt with, either by an appropriate existing entity or by the ICAC and coordinate a response and facilitate prosecution.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand portant modification de l’arrêté relatif à l’énergie du 19 novembre 2010, en ce qui concerne une adaptation du régime d’appel pour le soutien de la chaleur verte, de la chaleur résiduelle et du biométhane.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté du Gouvernement flamand modifie l'arrêté relatif à l'Energie du 19 novembre 2010, en ce qui concerne l'adaptation du régime d’appel pour le soutien de la chaleur verte, de la chaleur résiduelle et du biométhane. En particulier, les modifications suivantes sont apportées : seuls les investissements dans des installations situées en Région flamande qui répondent à une demande économique et pour lesquelles aucun certificat vert ou certificat de cogénération n’a été ou ne peut être accordé sont éligibles à l’aide; Sont éligibles comme installations de chaleur verte utile pour l’application du présent chapitre : 1° les installations qui produisent de la chaleur verte utile à partir d’une substance organique-biologique ou d’une des substances organiques-biologiques, ayant une puissance thermique brute supérieure à 300 kWth ; les installations qui extraient de la chaleur verte utile en provenance du sous-sol profond, ayant une puissance thermique brute supérieure à 1 MWth etle cas échéant, d’un Cycle de Rankine organique raccordé pour la production d’électricité. Le Cycle de Rankine organique raccordé n’est éligible que si la puissance électrique brute est d’au moins 300 kWe, s’il n’y a pas de potentiel de prélèvement de chaleur et s’il est complémentaire à la production de chaleur verte utile pour une demande de chaleur économiquement justifiable. Aucune aide ne peut être octroyée aux forages pour l’exploitation de chaleur géothermique. Sur la proposition de l’Agence flamande de l’Énergie, le Ministre peut déterminer par appel quelles autres technologies pour une installation de chaleur verte utile sont éligibles à une aide.

Policy: Act for the Promotion of Use of Marine Areas for Development of Marine Renewable Energy Generation Facilities (Act No. 89).
Policy_Content: This Act aims to introduce a new national framework for offshore wind projects in Japan. The Act outlines a process for offshore Marine Renewable Energy Power Generation Facilities development in Japan's national waters. Specifically, it addresses development of offshore wind facilities in high seas and other areas which are outside of Japan's ports. Offshore wind development within ports and harbours is already covered under the Ports and Harbours Act. The Act provides a much needed framework for industry participation by: setting out the process by which designated marine areas where offshore wind development can be undertaken, known as "Promotion Zones", will be established; establishing guidelines on the public tender process for projects within such Promotion Zones; and indicating the process by which tenderers will be able to compete to secure occupancy rights for offshore wind projects. Based on the basic policy, competent authorities shall designate certain areas of Japan's territorial and inland waters that meet the specific criteria as Development Promotion Areas for Marine Renewable Energy Power Generation Facility.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 561 “On licensing of subsoil management”.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree regulates the organization of the licensing system, including the issuance of licenses for the right to use subsoil resources, suspension and termination of subsoil use rights, changes in licenses and licensing agreements, as well as the transformation and reissuance of licenses. The right to use subsoil resources is not granted in cases when such use of subsoil resources will be carried out in channels or on the banks of border rivers and other waterbodies. The right to use subsurface resources in the areas adjacent to the State border of the Kyrgyz Republic and in the border zone shall be exercised on the basis of the permit issued by the authorized state body in the sphere of protection of the state border. All types of subsoil management for all types of minerals, including freshwater resources, mineral and thermal underground waters, shall be subject to licensing, with the exception of concession of subsoil management rights under the concession agreement and production sharing agreement. The license is granted by the results of the tender, auction and consideration of applications according to the rule "of the first submitted application". Granting of the right subsoil resources management under the rule "of the first application" for the purpose of geological prospecting, exploration and development shall be made in accordance with the following procedure: (a) for subsoil areas, except for areas of subsoil resources allotted through a tender or auction; and (b) for areas of subsoil resources not related to the geological study of subsurface resources and development of mineral deposits. The exploration license grants the exclusive right to conduct exploration works for the declared types of minerals within the licensed area.

Policy: Law No. № LP277/2018 “On chemical substances.”
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the obligations of physical and legal persons who manufacture or place on the market chemical substances or mixtures, bans and restrictions on production, placing on the market, import, export and use of hazardous chemicals or mixtures, classification conditions, labelling and packaging of chemicals and mixtures, creation and maintenance of a register of chemical products, reporting procedure for chemical products, procedure for authorization of hazardous chemical products, reporting responsibilities, control and other aspects related to chemicals and mixtures. The provisions of this Law apply to microorganisms and to viruses, such as active substances in plant protection products and biocidal products. The purpose of this Law is to protect human life and health, the environment and property from the harmful effects of chemicals and mixtures. The provisions of this law apply to manufacturers, importers, exporters, traders and users of chemicals and mixtures. This Law is based on the following principles: (a) precautionary principle in the management of hazardous chemical substances and mixtures, aimed at preventing harmful effects on human health, environment and property; (b) the principle of transparency to ensure that consumers have access to information about the adverse effects that hazardous chemicals can generate substances and mixtures; (c) the safety principle of operations for the management of hazardous chemical substances and mixtures; and (d) green chemistry, also called “sustainable chemistry”, aimed at stimulating the design of products and processes, which lead to a reduction or cessation of use and formation of hazardous substances. Manufacturers and importers of chemical substances and mixtures are required to: (a) identify and evaluate the hazardous properties of the supplied chemical products and the possible risks associated with them to humans and the environment; (b) access to information about identification, hazardous properties of the chemical products they supply and the possible risks associated with them; (c) provision of users and others performing manipulation of a chemical product, with information on the results of the assessment and other accessible and relevant information on the hazardous properties of a chemical product, associated risks and security measures; and (d) keeping up to date the available information on chemical products. This Law consists of XV Sections divided into 47 Articles. Section I lays down general provisions. Section II establishes competences and powers of the central executive body. Section III establishes main responsibilities and liability of the operators of supply chain. Section IV regards prohibitions and restrictions. Section V regards export and import of hazardous chemical substances. Section VI establishes principles of good laboratory practice. Section VII regards registration and authorization. Section VIII regards authorization for trade, distribution and other types of transfer of hazardous chemical substances. Section IX regards reporting on chemical substances. Section X regards storage and retail trade of chemicals. Section XI regards programs and action plans of sustainable management of chemicals. Section XII regards confidentiality. Section XIII  regards state control and supervision. Section XIV establishes liability for the infringement of the legislation on chemicals. Section XV establishes transitional and final provisions.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Nuclear Waste Management Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The Ordinance implements EU regulation regarding basic safety standards for protection against exposure to radiation dangers. The Ordinance provides for declaration of information on estimated periods of activity with radioactive waste, warehouse and accumulated radioactive waste to the competent authorities. Procedures and requirements for packaging shall be notified by the responsible authority. The Ordinance provides for requirements for the delivery and receipt of radioactive waste by both parties and the information that should be electronically recorded and receipts to be taken. Interim storage of radioactive waste before safekeeping and final storage is possible. The Ordinance consists of 11 Articles as follows: Accrual and remaining (1); Duty to record (2); Treatment and packaging (3); Obligations for delivery and receipt (4); Obligation to deliver (5); Exceptions to the delivery obligations (6); Interim storage (7); Prohibition of bypass (8); Radiation Protection Regulations (9); Administrative offences (10); Transitional provisions (11). Five tables are attached to the Ordinance that provide information on categorisation, bookkeeping and transport notification of radioactive waste with negligible heat generation and data to be provided about irradiated fuel elements and radioactive waste from reprocessing.

Policy: Ley del Instituto Nacional de los Pueblos Indígenas.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Ley se crea el Instituto Nacional de los Pueblos Indígenas, que es la autoridad del Poder Ejecutivo Federal competente en los asuntos relacionados con los pueblos indígenas y afromexicano, y cuyo objeto es definir, normar, diseñar, establecer, ejecutar, orientar, coordinar, promover, dar seguimiento y evaluar las políticas, programas, proyectos, estrategias y acciones públicas, para garantizar el ejercicio y la implementación de los derechos de los pueblos indígenas y afromexicano, así como su desarrollo integral y sostenible y el fortalecimiento de sus culturas e identidades. Entre las funciones del Instituto se contemplan las siguientes: a) garantizar, promover e instrumentar las medidas y acciones para el reconocimiento, respeto y ejercicio de los derechos y el desarrollo integral de las mujeres indígenas y afromexicanas, así como fortalecer su participación en todos los ámbitos, reconociendo sus aportes e incorporando sus propias visiones y propuestas; b) promover las medidas necesarias para el reconocimiento y respeto de los derechos de la población indígena y afromexicana migrante, tanto a nivel nacional como en el extranjero, con especial énfasis de la población jornalera agrícola; c) apoyar los procesos de reconocimiento, protección, defensa y conservación de las tierras, territorios, bienes y recursos naturales de los pueblos indígenas, de conformidad con la normatividad aplicable; d) promover e instrumentar las medidas pertinentes, en coordinación con las instancias competentes, los pueblos indígenas y afromexicano, para la conservación y protección de la integridad de la biodiversidad y el medio ambiente de dichos pueblos, a fin de generar y mantener modos de vida sostenibles y hacer frente a las consecuencias adversas del cambio climático; e) coadyuvar, mediar y orientar, en coordinación con las instancias competentes, en la atención y resolución de los conflictos territoriales, agrarios, sociales, políticos y de otra índole, en las regiones indígenas y afromexicanas del país; f) apoyar e impulsar los sistemas agrícolas tradicionales y los cultivos básicos (en especial el sistema de la milpa) para lograr la seguridad, autosuficiencia y soberanía alimentaria. Se prevé un Mecanismo para la Implementación y Protección de los Derechos de los Pueblos Indígenas, que es la instancia de formulación y coordinación de las políticas públicas transversales para la implementación de los derechos de los pueblos indígenas, así como de su desarrollo integral, intercultural y sostenible. Tendrá por objeto proponer, definir y supervisar las políticas públicas, planes, programas, proyectos y acciones institucionales e interinstitucionales, con pertinencia social, económica, cultural y lingüística.

Policy: ORDER № 3745/5 of the Ministry of Justice validating the Methodology and methods of monitoring the implementation of the National Strategy in the field of human rights until 2020 and the action plan for its implementation.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes a series of rules and procedure for the performance of monitoring of the National Strategy in the field of human rights until 2020 and the action plan for its implementation. Monitoring is carried out in order to ensure timely and proper implementation of the Action Plan to achieve the Expected Result and Strategic goals. The tasks of the Monitoring are: (a) determining the status of implementation of the Action Plan in accordance with the achievement indicators; (b) establishing permanent interaction between the Contractors and the Coordinating body; and (c) informing the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine about the state of implementation of the Action Plan. The principles of Monitoring are: (a) reliability principle - use for monitoring purposes of exceptionally reliable and accurate information; (b) the principle of good faith - the Coordinating Body and the Executors in good faith adhere to the provisions of this Methodology at all stages of monitoring and in the process of assessment; (c) the principle of conformity and relevance - for the purposes of Monitoring the Contractor provides the Coordinating Body with only relevant information on implementation of the Action Plan as of the relevant reporting period; and (d) the principle of mandatory consideration is that the results of Monitoring and Evaluation are taken into account by the Executors during the implementation of the National Strategy and Action Plan and the Coordinating Body - during the provision of methodological support and in in case of amendments to the National Strategy and Action Plan.

Policy: Federal Law No. 448-FZ amending Law No. 171-FZ "On state regulation of the production and circulation of ethyl alcohol and alcohol products".
Policy_Content: This Federal Law establishes that bioethanol (ethanol-blended fuel) shall be considered denatured ethyl alcohol (denatured alcohol), which is made from alimentary and (or) non-alimentary raw materials of vegetable origin whose denaturation is subject to requirements provided for by article 10 (1) of this Federal law, and which contains not more than 1 percent of water. Manufacturing of bioethanol (ethanol-blended fuel) by a separate production facility of an enterprise using the main technological equipment for the manufacturing of ethyl alcohol (except for manufacturing of ethyl alcohol from non-alimentary raw materials) shall be prohibited. Manufacturing of ethyl alcohol and bioethanol (ethanol-blended fuel) shall require issuance of separate licenses.

Policy: Administrative Regulation No. 6/2019 establishing the procedures relating to the public tender for land award.
Policy_Content: This Administrative Regulation, consisting of 53 articles divided into seven Chapters, establishes the procedures relating to the public tender for land award. The public tender covers the modality of proposal in a closed letter, by means of a simple or proposal with a plan of use of the land, being possible to proceed with the verbal bidding, when there are equal prices. The deadlines established in this administrative regulation are in accordance with article 74 of the Code of Administrative Procedure, approved by Decree-Law No. 57/99/M of 11 October. Competitors shall not be admitted to tender if: do not have the legitimacy to acquire land, in accordance with the provisions of article 37 of Law No. 10/2013; they are not in regularized situation regarding debts by contributions or taxes to the MSAR and to debts for social security contributions; they are in a state of bankruptcy or insolvency declared by judicial order, in liquidation, dissolution or cessation of activity or have pending proceedings; they have provided directly or indirectly, advisory or technical support in the preparation and elaboration of procedures.

Policy: Ley Nº 1.673 - Creación del "Sistema Provincial de Areas Naturales Protegidas de Formosa".
Policy_Content: Con el fin de promover la conservación de los ambientes naturales, la diversidad biológica y los recursos naturales provinciales, por medio de esta Ley se establece el Sistema de áreas Naturales de la Provincia de Formosa, cuyos principales objetivos son: a) proteger muestras representativas de la totalidad de los ambientes naturales para garantizar la tutela de poblaciones viables de especies de fauna y flora de la Provincia, preservando su diversidad, las funciones de regulación ambientales, los recursos hídricos y las relaciones entre ecosistemas, especies y recursos naturales, con el fin de mantener el equilibrio ecológico; b) contribuir a conservar "in situ" los recursos genéticos; c) propiciar la conservación "ex situ" de los recursos genéticos a través de bancos de germoplasma, viveros, centros de fauna o bajo cualquier otra modalidad o métodos que surja de los avances científicos y técnicos en materia de conservación; d) proteger ecosistemas ambientales, terrestres y acuáticos que alberguen especies silvestres autóctonas, migratorias, endémicas, raras, amenazadas o de uso comercial; e) participar en la protección de los ambientes que preservan el agua, tanto en sus nacientes, como en la infiltración, de modo de garantizar la sustentabilidad en la utilización del recurso y el ciclo hidrológico, en forma complementaria en el Código de Aguas y la legislación específica en materia hídrica; f) intervenir en la conservación de la diversidad biológica, genética y los procesos evolutivos naturales; g) contribuir en la conservación del patrimonio natural, cultural, paisajístico, arqueológico, paleontológico y antropológico de la Provincia; h) fomentar la realización de investigaciones tendientes a lograr el crecimiento económico, con inclusión social y sostenibilidad ambiental; i) contribuir a minimizar y controlar el proceso de erosión de los suelos; j) propiciar la conservación bajo manejo proteccionista o con fines de restauración, muestras de grandes ecosistemas terrestres, de ríos, arroyos o lacustre, paisajes y formas de relieve singulares, con el objetivo de preservar el material genético existente y la libre ocurrencia de los procesos dinámicos que se dan en la naturaleza, tales como la evolución biótica, edáfica y geomórfica, los flujos genéticos y las migraciones anuales; k) promover el turismo, así como las actividades educativas y recreativas, de manera compatible con la conservación y los planes de manejo; l) promover las acciones de restauración de hábitats naturales, reabasteciendo o reintroduciendo especies cuando fuera necesario, previo análisis técnico, propiciando que cesen las causas que provocaron las mismas.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 550 validating the Regulation on classification of emergency situations and assessment criteria thereof.
Policy_Content: This Classification defines organizational and legal norms of assessment of emergency situations by their severity and regulates relations arising in the course of activities of Civil Protection authorities. Emergency situations are classified according to the following criteria: (a) by the number of victims; (b) by the amount of economic damage; (c) by the number of population with disrupted life activities. Emergency situations are subdivided by the nature of their manifestation into: (a) natural emergencies (disasters); (b) technogenic emergencies (disasters); (c) ecological emergencies (disasters); (d) biological and social emergencies; and (e) conflict situations.

Policy: Decree No. 949 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on state environmental impact assessment.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the procedure for on state environmental impact assessment. State environmental expertise shall be intended a type of environmental expertise performed by specialized expert units with a view of  audit by units for the purpose of establishing compliance of the projected economic and other activities with ecological requirements and determination of feasibility of the object of environmental audit. Environmental audit shall be performed by state unitary enterprises “Centers of state environmental audit” that shall perform environmental impact assessment of technological processes causing negative impact on environment and public health; emissions to the atmospheric air and discharge of pollutants to waterbodies; and inspection of areas destined for protected areas and areas of natural disasters. Stages of environmental impact assessment must contain the following information: (a) draft declaration on EIA containing the description of the state of environment before the beginning of projected activities; (b) declaration on EIA containing assessment of ecological problems and technologies, and outcome of public hearing; (c) declaration on ecological consequences containing corrections of project decisions, location scheme of pollution sources and basic conclusions of feasibility of economic activities; and (d) draft declaration on EIA containing land-use planning scheme, quantity and composition of emissions, quantity and terms of waste storage, and environmental protection arrangements.

Policy: Sudan National Drought Plan.
Policy_Content: This National Drought Plan (NDP) is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at enhancing livelihoods capacities and strengthen resilience of communities at risk of drought, and emergency preparedness. To achieve this objective, the NDP is articulated around a number of major tasks as follows (i) clarify and improve monitoring and early warning systems; (ii) identify clear actions and responsibilities in responding to drought. It contains also cross-cutting issues primarily related to gender mainstreaming on planning and implementation of activities for managing disaster risk and climate change adaptation. The NDP actions of drought management and risk reduction focus on 3 pillars (1) implementation of drought monitoring and early warning systems; (2) assessment of drought vulnerability and risk; and (3) implementation of measures to limit impacts of drought and better respond to drought.

Policy: Arrêté n° 11422 du 19 novembre 2018 instituant un projet dénommé « appui à l’amélioration de la productivité des marantacées ».
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée, au sein du ministère de recherche scientifique et de l’innovation technologique, un projet dénommé productivité des marantacées », sous la responsabilité de l’institut national de recherche forestière.  Le projet a pour missions, notamment, de : domestiquer la culture du marantacée ; étudier les meilleures conditions de culture du marantacée ; identifier les zones agro-écologiques favorables à la production à grande échelle de la culture du marantacée ; faire l’étude des risques phytosanitaires ; faire des essais multi-locaux dans les zones agro-écologiques du Congo ; mettre en place des champs semenciers ; disposer des données techniques nécessaires à la réalisation de la culture du marantacée ; améliorer les techniques de production des marantacées pour mettre des produits de qualité sur les marchés ; doter chaque bassin de production agricole d’une zone de production et de récolte des marantacées de manière durable ; former les paysans à la technique de domestication des marantacées ; contribuer à l’amélioration durable du revenu des populations ; réduire la pression anthropique liée à la récolte sauvage des marantacées dans les forêts naturelles.

Policy: Arrêté n° 11424 du 19 novembre 2018 instituant un projet dénommé « appui à la domestication et au développement de la culture des bambous »
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée, au sein du ministère de la recherche scientifique et de l’innovation technologique, un projet dénommé « appui à la domestication et au développement de la culture des bambous », sous la responsabilité de l’institut national de recherche forestière. Le projet a pour missions, notamment, de : domestiquer la culture des bambous ; étudier les meilleures conditions de culture des bambous ; identifier les zones agro-écologiques favorables à la culture des bambous à grande échelle ; faire l’étude des risques phytosanitaires ; faire des essais multi-locaux dans les zones agro-écologiques du Congo ; disposer des données techniques nécessaires à la réalisation de la culture des bambous ; mettre en place des champs semenciers de bambous pour se préparer à lutter contre les érosions ; moderniser les procédés de fabrication des instruments de musique, notamment des flûtes, ainsi que la fabrication des récipients et des paniers en bambous ; améliorer la qualité des mobiliers en bambous et stimuler les artisans à une production à grande échelle pour un marché international ; pérenniser l’exploitation des produits des bambous par leur culture à grande échelle ; stimuler la création des activités économiques et des emplois à partir de l’exploitation des bambous ; aménager les forêts sauvages par le planting des bambous en vue de conserver la biodiversité.

Policy: Arrêté n° 11423 du 19 novembre 2018 instituant un projet dénommé « valorisation des palmiers raphias du Congo ».

Le projet a pour missions, notamment, de : domestiquer la culture du palmier raphia ; étudier les meilleures conditions de culture du palmier raphia ; identifier les zones agro-écologiques favorables à la production à grande échelle de la culture du palmier raphia ; faire l’étude des risques phytosanitaires ; faire des essais multi-locaux dans les zones agro-écologiques du Congo;  mettre en place des champs semenciers ; disposer des données techniques nécessaires à la réalisation de la culture du palmier raphia ; moderniser les procédés de fabrication de tissus en raphia et d’extraction des fibres et des huiles de raphia (« kolo, mbayaka ») utilisées dans l’alimentation ; améliorer les procédés de conditionnement et d’extraction des vins de palmiers raphias (« molengué, tsam-tsam ») ; améliorer la qualité des fibres de raphia en vue de leur utilisation dans l’industrie textile et les emballages ; pérenniser l’exploitation des produits des palmiers raphias par leur culture à grande échelle;  stimuler la création des activités économiques et des emplois à partir de l’exploitation des palmiers raphias ; aménager les forêts sauvages par le planting des palmiers raphias en vue de conserver la biodiversité.

Policy: Orden HAC/1293/2018 - Aprueba el modelo de declaración de alteraciones catastrales de los bienes inmuebles y se determina la información gráfica y alfanumérica necesaria para la tramitación de determinadas comunicaciones catastrales.
Policy_Content: La presente Orden aprueba el modelo de declaración catastral 900D, en el que se deberá formular la declaración de los siguientes hechos, actos o negocios que afecten a los bienes inmuebles urbanos, rústicos y de características especiales: 1) La adquisición de la propiedad y su consolidación, la constitución, modificación o adquisición de la titularidad de una concesión administrativa y de los derechos de usufructo y de superficie, así como las variaciones en la cuota de participación que corresponda a cada uno de los cónyuges en los bienes inmuebles comunes, o en la composición interna y en la cuota de participación de cada uno de los comuneros, miembros y partícipes en los supuestos de concurrencia de varios titulares catastrales por el mismo derecho sobre un mismo bien inmueble o de existencia de entidades sin personalidad jurídica; 2) La realización de nuevas construcciones, así como la ampliación, rehabilitación o reforma de las ya existentes, ya sea total o parcial; 3) La demolición o derribo total o parcial de construcciones; 4) La segregación, división, agregación y agrupación de inmuebles; 5) La constitución del régimen de división horizontal sobre los bienes inmuebles; 6) El cambio de clase de cultivo o aprovechamiento; 7) La modificación del uso o destino de inmuebles o locales que sean parte de edificaciones o instalaciones.

Policy: Climate Change Agreements (Amendment of Agreements) (EU Exit) Regulations 2018 (S.I. No. 1205 of 2018).
Policy_Content: These Regulations make amendments to agreements made pursuant to the Climate Change Agreement scheme established under Schedule 6 to the Finance Act 2000 (c.17), including in consequence of the withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union. These Regulations make amendments to both types of agreements that exist under the scheme, being umbrella agreements (which are agreements between the administrator of the scheme and the sector associations) and underlying agreements (which are between the administrator and operators). The amendments update references to the European Commission’s guidelines setting out the definition of an undertaking in difficulty to the latest version of those guidelines. The amendments also, in consequence of the withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union, correct deficiencies in cross-references to Directive 2003/87/EC.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Order No. A/445 of the Minister of Nature, Environment and Tourism validating the Regulation on establishment, operation and closure of centralized waste collection sites.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regulation shall be to provide a uniform method for establishing a centralized solid waste disposal site, operating and partial and full closure thereof. Establishment of centralized waste collection site shall be planned and location thereof shall be determined with the consideration of geographic position, population density, volume of waste generated, landscape, engineering geologic estimate and hydrogeological conditions in the area. Centralized waste collection site shall be located at a distance no less than 5 km from capital city, no less than 3 km from centralized municipality and no less than 5 km from river basins, forests and objects of historical and cultural heritage. Prior to establishment of centralized waste collection site shall be performed mandatory environmental impact assessment and feasibility study. A disaster risk reduction plan shall be developed. Waste collection, transportation and disposal shall be performed on a regular basis. Disposed waste shall be recorded and reported to the competent authority.

Policy: Decreto Nº 241 - Reglamenta la Ley Nº 80, Ley que crea el Centro Logístico Regional de Asistencia Humanitaria.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento de la Ley que crea el Centro Logístico Regional de Asistencia Humanitaria (CLRAH), adscrito al Ministerio de Gobierno, con la finalidad de establecer la organización del mismo además de sus funciones esenciales. El CLRAH trabaja como una instancia de facilitación abierta, segura, neutral y confiable para el tránsito pacífico de recurso humano, equipo e insumos de carácter humanitario, por medios marítimos, aéreos y terrestres de todas las naciones, en términos de entera igualdad; en ese sentido, será responsable de planificar, organizar, dirigir y ejecutar las acciones tendientes a la facilitación logística y cooperación humanitaria, mediante la gestión de procesos de alta eficiencia, para apoyar situaciones de crisis humanitaria a nivel nacional e internacional.

Policy: Resolución Nº ARCONEL-003/18 ─ Regulación para la Microgeneración fotovoltaica para autoabastecimiento de consumidores finales de energía eléctrica.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución emite la Regulación para la Microgeneración fotovoltaica para autoabastecimiento de consumidores finales de energía eléctrica, que establece las condiciones para el desarrollo, implementación y participación de consumidores que cuenten con sistemas de microgeneración fotovoltaica (MSFV) de hasta 100kW de capacidad nominal instalada, ubicados en techos, superficies de viviendas o en edificaciones para las categorías residencial y general determinados en el pliego tarifario en bajo o medio voltaje. Policy_Content: This Decree-Law approves the Statute of the National Emergency Fund (FNE), as an autonomous fund with administrative and financial autonomy, operating under the Finance government department. Policy: Radiation Safety and Nuclear Security Act 2018 (No. 16 of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for the control of ionizing radiation to ensure radiation safety and for this purpose establishes the Radiation Safety and Nuclear Security Authority, sets up a system of licensing for the handling of radioactive material and regulates the generating, management and disposal of radioactive waste. The Authority shall, among other things, regulate and control all radiation sources and practices for the adequate protection of people and the environment against the harmful effects of radiation and for the safety of practices and the security of radioactive sources. It shall cooperate with IAEA in the application of safeguards in accordance with an Agreement between the Republic of Mauritius and IAEA for the application of safeguards in connection with the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons, and establish a State system of accounting for, and control of, nuclear material. It shall also  establish and implement, in collaboration with the Mauritius Revenue Authority, a system of control for the import and export of nuclear material and other radioactive material, or any other controlled items. The Authority shall, in coordination with the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Centre and other relevant national agencies, develop and maintain a national emergency preparedness and response plan.

Policy: Decree No. 71/2018 approving the Regulation for the Management of Radioactive Waste, pursuant to Law No. 8/2017 of 21 July.
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Regulation for the Management of Radioactive Waste, pursuant to Law No. 8/2017 of 21 July. This Regulation, consisting of 47 articles divided into seven Chapter and one Annex, lays down rules for the safe management of radioactive waste for the protection of people, property and the environment against the exposure to ionizing radiation. This Regulation shall apply to the following matters: a) radioactive waste resulting from any related activities (including: discharge of effluents; management of waste containing radioactive materials; disused radioactive sources); b) decommissioning of nuclear facilities and activities. The Decree is divided as follows: Initial and Final Management of Radioactive Waste (Chap. II); Stages of Radioactive Waste Management (Chap. III); Construction and Operation of Management Facilities of Radioactive Waste (Chap. IV); Decommissioning of Facilities and Activities (Chap. V); Protection against Occupational Exposure (Chap. VI); Final and Transitional Provisions (Chap. VII). The Annex specifies Type of Infringements and Fines (The applicable fines must be paid within a maximum period of 15 working days).

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 265/18 approving the Regulation for the Transfer of Waste destined for Reuse, Recycling and its Valorization to the outside of the Country.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Regulation for the Transfer of Waste destined for Reuse, Recycling and its Valorization to the outside of the Country. This Regulation, consisting of 27 articles divided into four Chapters, establishes the norms and the procedures related to the operational and administrative control on the above mentioned waste. It applies to non-hazardous waste. The transfer of waste outside the country is subject to the principle of the hierarchy of waste management operations, namely re-use, recycling and other forms of waste valorization. The National Waste Agency is the Competent Authority for the issuance of such Certificates of Authorization for the Transfer of Residues Abroad. The Regulation in addition, defines its principles and regulates the administrative procedures of transfer, the methodological norms to be observed in the process of collection, handling and transfer of waste, mechanisms of control and inspection. Annexes deal with the List of Authorized Waste to be Transferred for Reuse, Recycling and Recovery; and the Request for Waste Transfer.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Circular No. 21/2018/TT-BNNPTNT regulating the recording, submission of reports and logbooks of aquatic resources; publication of designated fishing ports confirming the origin of fisheries from exploitation; list of illegal fishing vessels; certification of raw materials, certification of exploited aquatic resources issued by the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development.
Policy_Content: This Circular, consisting of 21 articles divided into six Chapters and seven Appendixes, prescribes the regulating the recording, submission of reports and logbooks of aquatic resources; publication of designated fishing ports confirming the origin of fisheries from exploitation; list of illegal fishing vessels; certification of raw materials, certification of exploited aquatic resources issued by the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development as well as processing and export to the market. Logs and reports on fishing operations for fishing vessels must contain the following information: aquatic resources caught by fishing vessels up to 12 meters, record the fishing log according to the Form No. 01 Appendix I; logbooks manually submit medical products for the fishing ports management organization within 24 hours after completion of the landing operations in the fishery port. Trawling vessels from 6 to 12 meters record fishing report under M03 Appendix I; submit the fishing exploitation report to the fishing port management organization periodically once a week. Chapter 3 specifies the Fisheries Port Indicators to Certify the Origin of Aquatic Seafood. Article 6 specifies a list of designated fishing ports with sufficient system to confirm the origin of aquatic products meeting the criteria of fishing port of class I or class II. Article 7 deals with the inspection of fishing vessels and monitoring of fishery production at fishing ports; Article 8 lists illegal fishing vessels.

Policy: Law on disaster risk reduction and emergency situation management.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the necessary rules aimed at disaster risk reduction, prevention and strengthening of the general resilience and preparedness of individuals and of community for responding to the consequences of disasters, including actions aimed at protecting and saving people, material, cultural and other goods. This text also sets out the rights and obligations of citizens, associations, legal entities, bodies of local self-government units, autonomous provinces and the Republic of Serbia, as regards the governance in emergency situations, including the functioning of civil protection, early warning, intelligence and alert systems, international cooperation, inspection and other issues relevant to the organization and functioning of the national risk reduction system for disasters and emergency situations management. The system of disaster risk reduction and emergency management is of particular interest to the Republic of Serbia and is part of the overall national security system.

Policy: Afghanistan Food Security and Nutrition Plan 2019 to 2023.
Policy_Content: This Food Security and Nutrition Plan (AFSeN) is a nationwide sectoral document built upon the AFSeN-Agenda (AFSeN-A) to achieve the overall goal of improving the food security and nutrition situation of Afghan people, so that they can become food-secure, well-nourished, healthy, and productive, as per the Vision. The consequent Mission is to implement and scale up evidence-based and innovative multi-sectoral food security and nutrition interventions. To achieve the aforementioned overall goal, the Plan sets out a number of Strategic Objectives, as follows (i) ensure adequate economic and physical access to food, especially for vulnerable and food-insecure population groups; (ii) ensure food and nutrition supplies over time and in emergency situations; (iii) improve the quality of nutritious diets, particularly among women, children, and vulnerable groups; (iv) increase access to nutrition-related quality health care services; (v) improve water, sanitation, and hygiene as well as education for better nutrition; (vi) improve rural infrastructure and strengthen nutrition-sensitive value chains; (vii) increase availability of nutrient-rich foods through domestic (local) food production; (viii) increase the nutritional and market value of foods; and (ix) strengthen food security and nutrition governance

Policy: Packaging Timber Control Ordinance.
Policy_Content: This Ordinance of the Federal Minister for Sustainability and Tourism on Plant Protection introduces measures with regard to packaging timber, and specified types of goods originating in certain third countries that shall be subject to control. These measures are supplementary to those of Commission Implementing Decision (EU) 2018/1137 on the supervision, plant health checks and measures to be taken on wood packaging material for the transport of commodities originating in certain third countries. Shipments are to be inspected in accordance with the provisions of section 4 of the Plant Protection Act 2011 if they contain good specified in the Annex to this ordinance originating in China or Belarus and during transport wood packaging material as specified in International Standards For Phytosanitary Measures  (ISPM) No. 15 is used. Duties of importers are defined in respect to the collaboration with customs authorities. If material is not conform ISPM No. 15, the customs authorities can take measures as specified in section 30 of the Plant Protection Act 2011.

Policy: National Adaptation Plan for the Agricultural Sector
Policy_Content: The National Adaptation Plan for the Agriculture Sector (NAP-Ag) contributes to the second National Development Plan (NDP II) priority of strengthening ecologically sound agricultural research and climate change resilient technologies and practices. Uganda has set the agricultural sector as a priority for the achievement of Uganda’s development targets as reflected in the National Vision 2040 and the global commitments in Agenda 2030 Sustainable Development Goals and the National Determined Contributions (NDCs) to the Paris Agreement. The overall goal of the NAP-Ag is to increase resilience of the Agricultural Sector to the impacts of climate change, through coordinated interventions that enhance sustainable agriculture, food and nutritional security, livelihood improvement and sustainable development. The plan covers national circumstances, climate change impacts and vulnerability analysis, policy and institutional framework, adaptation actions, coordination and implementation arrangements, monitoring, reporting and evaluation as well as financing and resource mobilization. The following objectives are hereby pursued:   1) Promote climate resilient cropping systems and value chains  2) Promote climate resilient livestock production systems and value chains  3) Promote climate resilient fisheries and integrated fisheries resource management   4) Strengthen climate information, early warning and disaster preparedness mechanism for a better informed agricultural planning and decision making   5) Promote sustainable natural resources management that enhances the resilience of agriculture and agrarian communities to a changing climate  6) Promote climate smart agricultural research and innovations   7) To enhance knowledge of good practices and partnerships to reduce vulnerability of the agricultural sector to the impacts of climate change   8) Promote a gendered climate smart agriculture programme to reduce the vulnerability of women, youth and other groups  This plan was prepared with the technical assistance of FAO and UNDP.

Policy: Law No. 144-Z “On production and circulation of organic products”.
Policy_Content: Objects of relations in the field of production and circulation of organic products are: (a) land plots, waterbodies and (or) parts thereof used for organic production; (b) products of plant, animal and microbiological origin; (c) alimentary (food) raw materials; (d) seeds; and (e) processes of production and circulation of organic products. The production of organic products shall be performed in compliance with the following principles: (a) voluntary choice of the type of organic production; (b) assistance in the formation of a healthy nutrition ethics; (c) use of land, waterbodies and (or) their parts with the application of processes, methods and technologies enabling organic production. President of the Republic of Belarus in the field of production and circulation of organic products has the following competence: (a) defines unified state policy; and (b) performs other powers in accordance with the Constitution of the Republic Belarus, this Law and other legislative acts. Organic production must be separated from products that are not organic, at all stages of its production. In the process of organic production, it is necessary: (a) to use of means, substances or combinations thereof, authorized for use in plant growing for organic production in accordance with the list of means, substances or combinations thereof, authorized for use in plant growing organic production, determined by the Ministry of Agriculture and Food of the Republic of Belarus; (b) to use as animal feedstuffs only those of organic production, of plant and animal origin, manufactured without the use of chemical solvents, as well as feed additives of mineral, microbiological origin, microelements, technological feed additives included in the list of feed additives of mineral, microbiological origin, microelements, technological feed additives authorized for feeding animals in the process of organic production determined by the Ministry of Agriculture and Food of the Republic of Belarus; (c) to use for the purpose of performance of veterinary activities a substance or combinations of several substances of plant, animal, microbiological origin with pharmacological or biological activity, in accordance with the list of authorized for use in the production of organic production, determined by the Ministry of Agriculture and Food of the Republic Belarus; (d) to ensure reproduction of animals in a natural way, as well perform their artificial insemination under the condition of non-admission of hormonal treatment or transplantation of embryos; (e) to use apiculture beehives made of environmentally friendly materials and other natural materials; (f) to place beehives in such a way that the main honey collection is carried out from the territory where production of organic products is under way; (g) to use seeds obtained from organic production; (h) to use in the processing of organic products food additives, flavors and technological means authorized for application in the process of organic production, determined by the Ministry of Healthcare of the Republic of Belarus. In the process of organic production it is prohibited: (a) to use land, waterbodies and (or) parts thereof subjected to pollution by wastes, chemical and radioactive substances; (b) to apply chemical fertilizers, chemical plant protection means, other synthesized chemical means; (c) to use genetically modified organisms, as well as other organisms, substances and components that include genetically modified organisms; (d) to use substances of synthetic origin with pharmacological or biological activity; (e) to apply ionizing radiation. Other requirements for organic production processes are established by technical normative legal acts, international agreements of the Republic of Belarus, as well as by international legal acts, constituting the legislation of the Eurasian Economic Union. This Law consists of V Chapters divided into 24 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II establishes state regulation in the field of organic production and circulation of organic products. Chapter III establishes requirements for organic production, circulation of organic products and parallel production. Chapter IV regards voluntary certification, labelling of organic products, financing, associations of organic producers and establishes liability for the infringement of legislation on organic production. Chapter V lays down final provisions.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1892-OZ “On apiculture”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the legal framework for breeding, keeping of honeybees, their use for pollination of agricultural entomophiles, manufacturing of apiculture products, honeybee protection, and ensuring protection of rights and interests of natural persons, individual entrepreneurs and legal persons performing apiculture on the regional territory. The scope of this Regional Law is to create conditions to meet the needs of the regional population in quality apiculture products, as well as ensuring rights and interests of citizens and legal entities in carrying out activities in the field of apiculture. This Regional Law addresses the following issues: (a) creation of conditions for breeding, keeping bees, their use for pollination of agricultural entomophile plants and fruit-bearing plants to increase their yields; and (b) promotion of the manufacturing of apiculture products. Apiarians shall have the following right: (a) to put stationary beehives on land plots pertaining to their property or under their tenancy; (b) to put mobile beehives on plots of agricultural and forest land plots or other plots of land upon written consent of the owners or tenants irrespectively of the place of registration of bee families; (c) to obtain state support, subsidies, incentives; and (d) to obtain state extension services. Apiarians shall have the following duties: (a) to register apiary at the competent state institution in place of location of the apiary; (b) to comply with veterinary, sanitary and zootechnical requirements for bee keeping; (c) to implement measures for bee protection; and (d) to be in possession of veterinary and sanitary certification of bees and apiculture products.

Authorized regional state body in the field of organization, protection and management of protected areas shall be as follows: (a) decision-making on setting up natural reserves of regional significance, establishment of tasks and protection regime thereof; (b) coordination decisions of the Government of the Russian Federation on reorganization of state nature reserves of federal significance into state nature reserves of regional significance; (c) declaration of proclamation of natural objects and complexes nature monuments of regional significance; (d) establishment of the procedure of regional state ecological supervision over regional protected areas; (e) decision-making related to modification of boundaries and protection regime of protected areas of regional significance; (f) decision-making on cancellation of protected areas of regional significance; and (g) appointment of the authorized regional executive body in the field of organization, protection and management of protected areas of regional significance.

Policy: Law No. 10.918 on the State Policy for Incentives to the Forest-Based Productive Chain of Espírito Santo.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the State Policy for Incentives to the Forest-Based Productive Chain of Espírito Santo aiming at the sustainable development in the expansion of areas with productive forests and environmental adaptation of agricultural properties, through partnerships based on a decentralized management model based on inter-institutional governance. The incentives are aimed to promote native and/or exotic forestry species, and to increase the supply of timber and non-timber forestry products. The Policy guidelines are: promotion of the socioeconomic and environmental adequacy of rural properties, seeking to promote a set of integrated actions aimed at the recovery of environmental liabilities and optimization and renovation of agricultural and forestry productive areas; planning and adoption of sustainable technologies and practices; adoption of good agricultural practices, aiming at the rational use of natural resources and the reduction of environmental impacts; promote the family farmers in the forest production chain in a sustainable way; preserve, recovery and protect springs; stimulation of partnerships, both with public and private sectors, so as to enable actions and financial resources to carry out programmes; improve research and development focused on the different uses and potentials of the wood of planted forests, etc.; structuring of technical assistance and forestry services; promotion of sustainable tropical agriculture as a means of diversifying and expanding timber and non-timber products; participation of interested social and economic stakeholders in all phases of planning and execution of the public policies.

Policy: Décret n°100/0159 du 05 novembre 2018 portant statuts de l’autorité de régulation des secteurs de l’eau potable et de l’énergie (AREEN).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les statuts de l’autorité de régulation des secteurs de l’eau potable et de l’énergie (AREEN). Les missions de l’autorité de régulation sont, en ce qui concerne le secteur de l’eau potable, assurer le contrôle, la régulation et le suivi des activités relatives à ce service public; veiller a son équilibre économiques et financier et a la préservation des conditions économiques nécessaires à sa viabilité; promouvoir la concurrence et la participation du secteur prive en matière de production, de transport, de distribution et de vente de l’eau potable dans des conditions objectives, transparentes et non discriminatoires; veiller au respect, par les operateurs, des conditions d'exécution des autorisations, des contrats de concession, des contrats de partenariat public- prive et leurs cahiers de charges et plans d'affaires; assurer la mise en œuvre, le suivi et l'application des tarifs dans le respect des principes de tarification fixes par voie réglementaire; assurer le règlement des différends entre acteurs; veiller aux intérêts des consommateurs et assurer la protection de leurs droits notamment en matière de la régularité de fourniture, de la qualité du service et du respect des tarifs; veiller au respect du principe d’égalité de traitement des usagers par tout operateur du secteur.

Policy: Regulation on the advanced agricultural research and application centre of the Konya Food and Agriculture University.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth provisions on the purpose, scope, management, functions and administration of the advanced agricultural research and application centre of the Konya Food and Agriculture University. The main functions of the advanced agricultural research and application centre are (I) to contribute to the transformation into digital agriculture at the national and international level and to the socio-economic development; (II) to carry out research studies in the fields of food security, agricultural mechanization and integration, sustainable management of natural resources, biotechnology, modern irrigation techniques, post-harvest treatment, fertilization and pest management; (III) to promote technology in food production and storage and to optimize waste management; (IV) to ensure food safety in the fields of production, storage, transportation, supply, handling, and processing of food with a farm to fork approach; (V) to ensure food security by achieving economic growth and sustainability through effective policies on food, water and environment; (VI) to establish agricultural business models for farmers, agricultural entrepreneurs, cooperatives and food industry and to carry out these models in coordination with their research studies; (VII) to organize training sessions to promote good agricultural practices in the agriculture, food and livestock sector; and (VIII) to promote the use of biotechnology and protection of genetic resources. The Centre shall provide consultancy, education and accreditation services to state institutions and organizations, the private sector, and civil society organizations.

Policy: Decreto Nº 80-2018-PCM ─ Política Nacional de Cooperación para el Desarrollo Sostenible.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba la Política Nacional de Cooperación para el Desarrollo Sostenible, cuyo objetivo general es asegurar la eficacia de la cooperación para el desarrollo sostenible e inclusivo de Honduras, con la participación de todos los actores y socios al desarrollo, públicos y privados, nacionales e internacionales. Los objetivos estratégicos de la Política Nacional de Cooperación para el Desarrollo Sostenible son: 1) Institucionalizar un Sistema Nacional de Cooperación para el Desarrollo Sostenible, estructurado, incluyente y en el que participen de forma activa y coordinada todos los socios de cooperación a través de sus roles específicos; 2) Alinear la cooperación para el desarrollo sostenible, a las prioridades nacionales reflejadas en los distintos instrumentos de planificación; 3) Ampliar la participación del país en los distintos ámbitos regionales e internacionales de la cooperación al desarrollo sostenible; 4) Lograr una ejecución, eficiente y eficaz, de los programas y proyectos financiados con fondos de la cooperación, a fin de elevar el impacto de los mismos en favor de la población beneficiaria; 5) Mejorar la transparencia y rendición de cuentas de la cooperación hacia los ciudadanos y ciudadanas de Honduras y de sus países socios; 6) Asegurar que todos los recursos de la Cooperación Externa no reembolsable se incorporen al presupuesto General de Ingresos y Egresos de la República al Sistema de Administración Financiera Integrada (SIAFI).

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 1365/2018 - Aprueba las estrategias marinas.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto aprobar las cinco estrategias marinas de España, conforme a lo establecido en la Ley Nº 41/2010, de protección del medio marino. El ámbito de aplicación son las cinco demarcaciones marinas españolas: Noratlántica, Sudatlántica, Estrecho y Alborán, Levantino-balear y Canaria. La estructura formal de las estrategias marinas que resultan aprobadas consta de los siguientes documentos: 1) Parte I. Marco general: características de la demarcación marina; 2) Parte II. Análisis de presiones e impactos; 3) Parte III. Análisis económico y social; 4) Parte IV. Descriptores del buen estado ambiental; 5) Parte V. Establecimiento de objetivos ambientales; 6) Parte VI. Programas de seguimiento; 7) Parte VII. Programas de medidas. Dicha estructura formal se completa con tres documentos comunes para las cinco demarcaciones marinas: a) Documento Marco: evaluación inicial, buen estado ambiental y objetivos ambientales; b) Grupo Aves: evaluación inicial y buen estado ambiental; c) Grupo Mamíferos Marinos: evaluación inicial y buen estado ambiental.

Policy: Regional Law No. 88-RZ “On some issues of the status of the head of village”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that head of village shall assist local government of the municipal unit and local population in implementing arrangements for the protection of the population and territory against emergency situations and natural and technogenic disasters, mitigation of the consequences thereof, and ensuring primary fire safety measures. Head of village, within his powers, shall contribute to the activity of local government in relation to electric power, heating, gas and water supply to the population, residential sewerage and public catering, and also domestic waste management, including separate waste collection and transportation of solid domestic waste.

Policy: Regional Law No. 95-RZ “On some issues in the field of horticulture and vegetable gardening by natural persons for subsidiary smallholding”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of state support of gardening and horticulture conducted by natural persons for individual personal needs. Plots of agricultural land for horticulture and vegetable gardening can be allotted to natural persons for subsidiary smallholding in ownership free of charge in cases establishes by Federal and Regional laws. Its delimits powers of the Regional Assembly, Regional Government and authorized regional executive body in the field of state support of gardening and horticulture for individual personal need in the aforesaid field. State support of gardening and horticulture shall be performed through public financing out of regional and municipal budgets.

Policy: Regulation No. 661 date 31.10.2018 on the expansion of the Lura National Park area and establishment of the National Park of 'Lure- Mali i Dejes.'
Policy_Content: Regulation 661 of 2018 expands the area of 'Lura' National Park and merges it with the 'Zall-Gjocaj' National Park to establish the 'Lure-Mali i Dejes' National Park with a total area of 20242,78 ha in accordance with the map and the borders presented in the addenda 1 and 2 of this Regulation. Further, a breakdown of forests, pasture, and plant areas in also submitted.  The 'Lure-Mali i Dejes' National Park is divided into three conservation and administration sub-zones as follows: a) Main Subzone that includes the main habitats of forests and shrubs that represent hight values for natural and biodiversity heritage. Scientific research and eco-tourist activities are the only activities allowed in this subzone; b) The Subzone of Traditional Usage and Sustainable Development that includes areas where traditional activities such as agriculture, grazing, medicinal plants collecting may take place. Activities that may impact the ecosystem natural state such as construction are not allowed. c) Recreational Subzone that includes the forestry and water habitats established by the dam. A third degree protection is allowed in this zone that permits only low-impact and controlled touristic activities.

Policy: Decree No. 38.774 establishing the Register for the Establishment of Rural Producer.
Policy_Content: This Decree, The Register of Establishment of Rural Producer may be instituted using the ICMS Taxpayers Registry (CCICMS). A Rural Producer Establishment is an area located in the rural area of the municipality used by a natural or legal person for the exploitation of the following activities: I - agriculture; II - livestock; III - extraction and exploitation of plants and animals; IV - exploitation of livestock activities, such as beekeeping, poultry, rabbits, swine, sericulture, fish farming and other animal crops; V - processing of products resulting from rural activity, without altering the natural composition and characteristics, made by the farmer or breeder, with equipment usually used in rural activities, using exclusively raw material produced in the rural area; VI - cultivation of forests destined to the logging for commercialization, consumption or industrialization; VII - sale of income herd, breeding stock or other.

Policy: Regional Law No. 79-ZS “On village chiefs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues of the activities of village chiefs as a form of public participation of the population in local government. Village chief can be appointed with a view of coordination between local government of the municipalities and the local population of rural areas for decision-making related to issues of local significance. Policy: Joint Order No. 460 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology and of the Federal Service on Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring validating the Regulation on the procedure for determination of the density of radioactive contamination of soils in populated areas as a result of the Chernobyl disaster.
Policy_Content: This Joint Order establishes the procedure for determination of the density of radioactive contamination of soils in populated areas as a result of the Chernobyl disaster. It shall be applicable to inhabited areas and territory and defines: (a) composition and sequence of actions in the implementation of the survey of radioactive contamination of soils in the territory of the settlement; (b) composition and sequence of actions during density calculation of radioactive contamination of soils in the territory of the settlement; and (c) additional measures to ensure the reliability of the data obtained for determination of the density of radioactive contamination of soils in the populated area and the cases of their application. Survey of radioactive contamination of soils in populated areas includes: (a) a set of measures to determine the capacity of the ambient equivalent of gamma radiation dose (dosimetric examination of the settlement); (b) soil sampling in the settlement and its area; (c) preparation of soil samples for gamma-spectrometric analysis; and (d) measurement of 137 Cesium activity in soil samples by gamma spectrometric method analysis. Dosimetric examination of the settlement is carried out on testing grounds.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 520 validating the Program of food security in the Republic of Tajikistan for the period of 2019-2023.
Policy_Content: Program of food security in the Republic of Tajikistan for the period of 2019-2023 is cross-sectoral policy document. Food security is an important part of the national and economic security of the country, and ensuring food security depends on the overall dynamics of the country's economic and social development. Food security is considered the State's guaranteed ability to meet food needs at a level that ensures a normal life for the population. The main objectives of the development of the Program shall be as follows: (a) abandoning the usual means of managing food security in the country; (b) expansion of targeted trends in food security aimed at improving the quality of food and the health of the population; (c) coordination of food security issues using the concept of food security based on four elements of global practice: availability, accessibility, utilization and sustainability of food. The Program has four main areas of focus: (a) the state of food supply in the country; (b) real access to foodstuffs; (c) ensuring the development of production, quality, assortment and nutrition of food products; and (d) ensuring checks and monitoring of food security.

Policy: Ley Nº 9/2018 - Ley de sociedades cooperativas de Extremadura.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de sociedades cooperativas de Extremadura, parte del concepto que la sociedad cooperativa es una sociedad de base mutualista, con personalidad jurídica propia, en la que los socios se unen de forma voluntaria para satisfacer sus necesidades mediante la realización de actividad cooperativizada, realizan aportaciones al capital social y administran democráticamente la empresa, ostentando el derecho esencial a participar en la gestión de los asuntos sociales. La presente Ley será de aplicación a las sociedades cooperativas con domicilio social en el territorio de la Comunidad Autónoma de Extremadura, que desarrollen con carácter principal su actividad cooperativizada en dicho territorio, sin perjuicio de las actividades que realicen con terceros no socios, así como de cualesquiera otras de naturaleza instrumental, accesoria o complementaria que pudieran ser llevadas a cabo incluso fuera de dicho territorio. Asimismo, esta Ley será de aplicación a las uniones, federaciones y confederaciones de sociedades cooperativas, con domicilio en el territorio de la Comunidad Autónoma de Extremadura, que desarrollen sus actividades principalmente en dicho territorio.

Policy: Decreto Nº PCM-070-2018 ─ Fortalece el Programa Presidencial Crédito Solidario, para asegurar su sostenibilidad y continuidad de sus servicios.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto fortalece el Programa Presidencial Crédito Solidario, para asegurar su sostenibilidad y continuidad de sus servicios y así garantizar el cumplimiento de los objetivos de la Estrategia Nacional de Inclusión Financiera especialmente en los conceptos de acceso, uso y educación financiera. A tal fin, modifica el Artículo 2º del Decreto Nº PCM-05-2015, respecto a los objetivos del Programa, que queda redactado así: "Objetivos: 1) Crear condiciones de acceso al crédito, e inclusión financiera para la población en general, procurando atender sectores vulnerables como: Jóvenes, mujeres en situación de vulnerabilidad, mujer campesina, pueblos indígenas y afrohondureños, personas con discapacidad, personas en pobreza y extrema pobreza, adultos mayores, migrante retornado, organizaciones y empresas del sector social de la economía; y, toda persona en condición de exclusión financiera; 2) Generar mecanismos que permitan administrar el riesgo para lograr la sostenibilidad del Programa Presidencial Crédito Solidario y su patrimonio; 3) Crear una plataforma de educación financiera y construcción de récord crediticio, enfocado en generar hábitos de una cultura de pago, fortaleciendo de esta manera la inserción en el Sistema Financiero Nacional; 4) Fortalecer el ahorro como mecanismo complementario para la inclusión financiera; y, e) Formar parte del grupo de entes designados para fortalecer la estrategia de salida para programas sociales." Asimismo, modifica las atribuciones de su Comité Técnico.

Policy: Law No. 17.588 establishing the limits for planting exotic and native trees near the electricity supply network.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the limits for planting exotic and native trees near the electricity supply network. The Law specifies that the minimum safety range for planting exotic and other large trees along the electricity supply networks is 30 metres (15 metres on each side) for hardwood species, and 15 metres (7.5 metres on each side) for coniferous species. The tree planted in the security strip and cut by the concessionaire will be arranged in the place for the owner to give him the due destination. In areas defined as security range, the owner may: planting undergrowth; planting vegetation up to 3 metres in height; or pasture. Pruning and suppression of vegetation in the security (servitude) areas, provided for in this Law, shall be the responsibility of the concessionaire of the electricity supply networks. Existing native trees that are within the limits established by this Law may only be cut with the express authorization of the competent environmental agency.

Policy: Loi n°038-2018/AN portant Code des Investissements au Burkina Faso
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte code des investissements au Burkina Faso. Elle a pour objet la promotion des investissements productifs concourant au développement économique et social du Burkina Faso. La présente loi vise la création et le développement des activités orientées vers: la promotion de l’emploi et la formation d’une main-d’oeuvre nationale qualifiée; la valorisation de matières premières locales; la promotion des exportations; la production de biens et services destinés au marché intérieur; l’utilisation de technologies appropriées, la modernisation des techniques locales et la recherche-développement; la mobilisation de l’épargne nationale et l’apport de capitaux extérieurs; la réalisation d’investissements dans les localités se situant au moins à cinquante kilomètres de Ouagadougou; la réhabilitation et l’extension d’entreprises; la promotion de l’artisanat; la promotion des énergies renouvelables; la protection de l’environnement; la promotion de la recherche scientifique, technologique et de l'innovation; et toutes activités jugées comme telles par les pouvoirs publics.

Policy: Coastal Management By-law, 2018.
Policy_Content: This By-law of the city of eThekwini (Durban) seeks to ensure sustainable use and development of the coastal area by aligning municipal planning with the Act National Environmental Management: Integrated Coastal Management Act. The By-law, among other things, establishes the Municipal Coastal Committee, gives effect to the Municipal Coastal Management Programme established under this Act and aims at protection of the natural environment of the coastal zone. This By-law must be read in conjunction with all applicable legislation, including but not limited to Biodiversity Act, the Marine Living Resources Act; the Mineral and Petroleum Resources Development Act; the Mountain Catchment Areas Act, the National Environmental Management Act and the National Forests Act. The By-law defines the role of the municipality in  integrated coastal management. The Municipality must, in administering and implementing this By-law, give effect to and promote effective cooperative governance. The By-law also provides for public participation, alignment of the Municipal Coastal Management Programme and municipal statutory spatial tools and instruments with other coastal programmes,  powers of the municipality to regulate, control and restrict activities in coastal protection zone, general environmental protection in coastal zone, designation od coastal access land, and enforcement.

Policy: Loi n° 2018-938 du 30 octobre 2018 pour l'équilibre des relations commerciales dans le secteur agricole et alimentaire et une alimentation saine, durable et accessible à tous.
Policy_Content: La présente loi comprend 98 article repartis en 4 grands titres notamment les dispositions tendant à l'amélioration de l'équilibre des relations commerciales dans le secteur agricole et alimentaire (Titre I: art. 1er a 23); les mesures en faveur d'une alimentation saine, de qualité, durable, accessible à tous et respectueuse du bien-être animal (Titre II art. 24 a 92); les mesures de simplification dans le domaine agricole (Titre III  art. 93 à 95); et les dispositions transitoires et finales (Titre IV  art. 96 à 98). La loi a deux objets principaux: d'une part, des dispositions tendant à l'amélioration de l'équilibre des relations commerciales dans le secteur agricole et alimentaire (Titre I) et, d'autre part, des mesures en faveur d'une alimentation saine, durable et accessible à tous, respectueuse du bien-être animal (Titre II). Elle contient plusieurs habilitations du gouvernement à agir par voie d'ordonnances, l'annonce de rapports remis par le gouvernement au parlement, ainsi que des expérimentations ou des dispositions à application différée.
