Policy_Content: Article 22 defines competence of the authorized public institution in energy sector the Lithuanian Energy Agency in the sphere of development and operation of renewable energy plants: (a) elaboration of special plan; (b) environmental impact assessment (EIA); (c) assessment of impact on public health; and (d) assessment of feasibility and opportunities for generation of electric energy from renewable energy sources. Article 51 shall be amended to add the following wording: “The Ministry of the Environment, the Ministry of Energy, the Ministry of Transport and Communications, the Ministry of Education and Science, the Ministry of Agriculture, the public institution the Lithuanian Energy Agency and municipal authorities, in coordination of actions, develop and implement, in accordance with their competence, appropriate measures for raising public awareness, providing consultations and training programs on practical opportunities and benefits for the development and use of renewable energy sources, including the availability of renewable energy sources and the environmental benefits of different transport sectors. Policy: Law No. XIII-1466 amending Law No. XI-329 “On climate change management financial instruments”.
Policy_Content: Article 2 shall be amended to add the following wording: “New greenhouse gas emitting participant (facility) shall be considered a device the functioning of which is controlled by operator performing activities listed in the Annex 1 and authorized to emit greenhouse gases within the European Union the greenhouse gas emission quota trading scheme, which begins three months before the date of the submission of a new list of operators in the European Union greenhouse gas emission quota trading scheme and expires three months before the date of the next scheduled date.” Article 10 shall be amended to add the following wording: “The Climate Change Program (hereinafter referred to as "the Program") is being prepared for supplementary financing of climate change management measures. The funds of the Program are accumulated in a separate State Treasury account and in the planned state budget. The program's funds shall be used for: (a) energy efficiency and production efficiency improvement projects: modernization of dwellings and public buildings, other projects that enable the most effective reduction of greenhouse gas emissions in the fields of energy, industry, construction, transport, agriculture, waste management and other fields; (b) promotion of the use of renewable energy sources, the introduction of environmentally friendly technologies, including energy efficient cogeneration; (c) implementation of the objectives and tasks of the National Climate Change Management Policy Strategy; (d) restoration and prevention of erosion of forests; (e) provision of information and education to the public, research and dissemination activities, consultants and other stakeholders on the most relevant management and implementation of climate change policies, energy efficiency improvement, the use of renewable energy sources and the deployment of environmentally friendly technologies; (f) in the territory of the Republic of Lithuania and in third countries, in accordance with European Union legislation, the Climate Change Convention, the Kyoto Protocol, the Paris Agreement and other international agreements for the adaptation of measures for climate change mitigation; and (g) other financial instruments for the effective management of climate change policies.”

Policy: Regional state program “Environmental protection” for the period 2019-2024.
Policy_Content: Regional state program “Environmental protection” for the period 2019-2024 is a regional state multi-sectoral policy document aimed at environmental protection. Its objectives shall be as follows: (a) increasing the level of environmental security and conservation of natural ecosystems; (b) preventing harmful effects of waste on human health and the environment; (c) protecting the local population and the objects of the economy from floods, environmental disasters, and other adverse effects of water and rehabilitation of waterbodies to the condition favorable for living conditions of the population;(d) ensuring the conservation and use of wild fauna species, including hunting, conservation of game and protection of habitats; and (e) improving the efficiency of state management in the sphere of environmental protection.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 968 validating the Regulation on the procedure for granting subsidies for reimbursement of part of the costs for the purchase of energy carriers in vegetable growing.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for granting subsidies for reimbursement of part of the costs for the purchase of energy carriers in vegetable growing, targets, terms and conditions for allocation of subsidies, and the procedure for return of subsidies to the regional budget in case of violation of the conditions established for their allocation, reporting requirements, requirements for monitoring of compliance with the terms, objectives and procedures for granting subsidies and responsibility for their violation. Energy carriers in horticulture (vegetable growing) shall be intended electric energy and natural combustible gas used for vegetable growing. Subsidies shall be allocated to reimburse part of the costs for the purchase of energy carriers in vegetable growing for open field vegetable production, including greenhouses for growing seedlings for open field vegetable production. Recipient of the subsidies must comply with the following requirements: (a) the applicant must have no unfulfilled obligation to pay taxes, duties, insurance premiums, fines, penalties, interest payable in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation on taxes and duties; (b) the applicant must have no overdue debts on return to the regional budget of subsidies, budget investments granted also in accordance with other legal acts, or any other overdue indebtedness to the regional budget; (c) during the subsidized period the recipients - legal entities must not be in the process of reorganization, liquidation or bankruptcy proceedings, the activities of the recipient have not been suspended in accordance with the procedure stipulated by the legislation of the Russian Federation, and the recipients who are individual entrepreneurs have not ceased their activities as an individual entrepreneur; (d) the recipient is not a foreign legal entity, as well as a Russian legal entity, in the authorized (share) capital of which the share of participation of foreign legal entities, the place of registration of which is a state or territory included in the list of states or territories approved by the Ministry of Finance of the Russian Federation, providing preferential tax treatment and (or) which do not stipulate the disclosure or presentation of information related to financial transactions (offshore zones) with regard to such legal entities exceeds 50 percent in the aggregate; and (e) recipients should not receive other funds from the regional budget.

Policy: Regional Law No. 105-ZO “On village chiefs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes powers of village chief, and ensures the guarantees of his activities, regulating also other issues of his status. Village chief is appointed by the representative body of the rural settlement or the urban district, of which it is a part, in conformity with the proposal by meeting of rural residents, from among the persons residing on the territory of the given municipality of rural area and having active voting rights. Village chief can be vested with the following powers: (a) assistance to local government in setting up a voluntary fire brigade within the boundaries of a given rural settlement and ensuring application of primary fire-prevention measures; (b) assistance to local government in organization of recreational activities in rural settlement; (c) participation in drafting proposals for improvement of the territory of rural settlement; and (d) participation in organization and performance of arrangements for activities of rural youth.

Policy: National Framework for Air Quality Management 2017 (Notice No. 1144  of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Notice publishes the National Framework for Air Quality Management 2017 as contemplated in section 7 of the National Environmental Management: Air Quality Act, 2004 (Act No. 39 of 2004) and serving as the Department of Environmental Affairs’ Air Quality Management Plan as contemplated in Section 15(1) of the Act. The purpose of the National Framework is to achieve the objectives of the Air Quality Act, 2004, and as such the National Framework provides a medium - to long-term plan of the practical implementation of the Act. The Framework provides mechanisms, systems and procedures to promote holistic and integrated air quality management through pollution prevention and minimisation at source, and through impact management with respect to the receiving environment from local scale to international issues. The documents refers to the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs).

Policy: Order No. 436 of the Minister of Agriculture validating the Regulation on subsidizing of interest rates on loans and leasing of technological equipment, for the purchase of farm animals, as well as leasing of agricultural equipment.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the procedure for subsidizing of interest rates on loans and leasing of technological equipment, for the purchase of farm animals, as well as leasing of agricultural equipment within the limits of the funds provided for in the budget for the current financial year. The main purpose of subsidizing of interest rates on loans and leasing of technological equipment, on purchase of agricultural animals, as well as leasing of agricultural machinery shall be to increase the availability of financial services for the entities of the agro-industrial complex. Subsidization is carried out under a loan agreement for the purchase of agricultural equipment, including mounted and trailed equipment, as well as for the purchase of farm animals, the acquisition of fixed assets, construction (except for loans for the purchase of fixed assets for the production of flour, mineral water and soft drinks) under the following standards, providing for a reduction in interest rates: (a) by 10% (ten) per annum in the national currency tenge; (b) by 8% (eight) per annum in Russian rubles; and (c) by 2 % (two) per annum in another currency. The interest rate is reduced (through subsidies) to 4% (four) per annum, and it is not allowed to decrease below 4% (four) per annum. Subsidizing under the loan agreement is carried out for the entire period of its validity. In this case, under the previously concluded loan agreement - subsidy accrual begins from the date of the decision of the working body on the proposal.

Policy: Responsible Tourism Education Act of 2018 (RPPL No. 1-30).
Policy_Content: This Act introduces various measures for ensuring environmentally responsible and sustainable tourism in Palau so as to, among other things, prevent environmentally destructive practices by uneducated visitors. It, among other things, prohibits the importation and manufacture in Palau of reef-toxic sunscreens. It is hereby declared the policy of the government of the Republic of Palau to promote the development of a visitor industry in Palau consistent with the Palau Responsible Tourism Policy Framework and market Palau as a high-value tourism destination with a high quality tourism product, that envisions "Pristine Paradise Palau" and that is environmentally friendly. It is the responsibility of all visitor-oriented government and quasi-government agencies to assist and participate in the implementation of this policy, and to coordinate with the public and private sector businesses in furtherance of this policy.

Policy: Federal Act amending the Waste Management Act 2002, the Emission Control Act and the Water Act 1959 (Aarhus Participation Act 2018).
Policy_Content: This Act continues the implementation of the Aarhus Convention on Access to Information, Public Participation in Decision-Making and Access to Justice in Environmental Matters by amending the Waste Management Act 2002, the Emission Control Act and the Water Act 1959 in provisions dealing with the public participation process. The Act aims to give the public concerned (and in particular NGOs) a say in environmental approval procedures and subsequent review rights. Water law approval procedures shall be undertaken in accordance with the EU Water Framework Directive (2000/60/EC). If a project could have a considerable negative impact on the condition of a water body, recognised NGOs will be granted participation and monitoring rights. If negative effects can be excluded, recognised NGOs will have only a right of review.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Emissions,Public participation,Access-to-information,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,EIA,Non-governmental entity,Waste management,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Sustainable development,Pollution control

Policy: Ley VI-Nº 211 - Régimen Especial para las Escuelas de la Familia Agrícola.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto el Régimen Especial para las Escuelas de la Familia Agrícola (EFA), que abarca a aquellos establecimientos educativos públicos de gestión privada, de base asociativa civil y familiar o de mandato social, en los cuales las familias como coeducadoras, son las responsables junto al Estado en la formación integral y la promoción del proyecto de vida de la persona, desarrollando para ello acciones de gestión y administración, a fin de fomentar el desarrollo de sus territorios rurales o urbanos. El régimen busca propiciar el arraigo de la comunidad agrícola, para su valoración cultural y saberes propios; asegurar educación de calidad con igualdad de oportunidades y posibilidades, enfatizando y fortaleciendo los conocimientos agrotécnicos aplicados a la ruralidad; generar los espacios propicios para la transmisión de la educación rural, capacitando e impulsando a las generaciones futuras a trabajar la tierra, promoviendo los principios de cooperativismo y emprendedurismo con el objeto de disminuir los éxodos migratorios del campo a la ciudad.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Ley VI-Nº 210 - Programa Provincial de Huertas Escolares.
Policy_Content: Por medio de la presente Ley se crea el Programa Provincial de Huertas Escolares, el que se implementa en todos los establecimientos educativos de gestión pública y privada de zonas rurales y urbanas, en los niveles primario y secundario. Son objetivos de la Ley: 1) incluir la huerta como recurso pedagógico en las instituciones educativas; 2) implementar talleres teórico-prácticos sobre horticultura destinados a directivos, docentes, estudiantes, padres y a toda la comunidad educativa; 3) generar conciencia ambiental en los niños, niñas y jóvenes; 4) promover la agricultura familiar y enseñar el derecho a la soberanía alimentaria en el marco de las Leyes VIII - N.° 68 de Fomento a la Producción Agroecológica y VIII - N.° 69 de Agricultura Familiar; 5) promover la educación económica a través de la agricultura.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regional Law No. 303-OZ “On environmental education, awareness and formation of environmental culture”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal and organizational grounds for environmental education, awareness and formation of environmental culture. Main objectives of environmental education, awareness and the formation of environmental culture shall be as follows: (a) formation of careful attitude towards nature and increase of ecological culture of the regional population; and (b) preservation of favorable environment, biological diversity and natural resources. The main tasks of environmental education, awareness and the formation of environmental culture shall be as follows: (a) improvement of the level of knowledge, skills, abilities of the population in the field of environmental protection and environmental security; (b) information support to the population in the field of environmental protection and environmental security; (c) involvement of citizens, public and other non-commercial organizations in the participation in the implementation of environmentally significant activities; (d) involvement of children, youth and other social groups in environmental protection and rational nature management; (e) increasing the role of protected areas as environmental education centers; and (f) forming responsible attitude towards waste management, including separate collection of municipal solid waste.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regulation on the methodology for determining the reference prices of investments for the calculation of IPARD incentives.

Policy: Resolution n. 40/2018 approving the Water Sector Action Plan for the Implementation of the Sustainable Development Objectives 2015-2030.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Water Sector Action Plan for the Implementation of the Sustainable Development Objectives 2015-2030, is divided into two Volumes, focusing on the management of water resources as well as water supply and sanitation. Mozambique's Water Sector did not achieve many of the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) for water supply and sanitation and many of the strategic actions of integrated water resources management for economic development, poverty reduction and vulnerability to natural disasters, have not yet been fully implemented. The United Nations has defined for Objective 6 of water sector four indicators related to the management of water resources: (6.3) relating to water quality; (6.4) on sustainable use and reduction of the number of people suffering from water scarcity; (6.5) on the implementation of integrated water resources management; and (6.6) on the need to protect aquatic ecosystems and aquifers (pag. 2721).

Policy: Presidential Instruction of the R.I. No. 11 Year 2015 on the Improvement of Forest and Land Fire Control.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Instruction establishes the requirements for the Improvement of Forest and Land Fire Control. In particular, it improves forest and land fire control through the following activities: Prevention and extinguishing forest and land fires; Post-fire handling/forest and land recovery; Collaborate and coordinate to carry out forest and land fire control; Increase the participation of the community and stakeholders in this area; Improve law enforcement and provide strict sanctions against forest and land burning activities. Specifically in order to control forest and land fires; Report to the President on intensive control of forest and land fires and at any time if necessary. Develop guidelines related to agricultural fire control; Increase the quantity and quality of human resources in controlling agricultural land fires; Facilitate the application of agricultural technology that can improve efforts to control agricultural land fires and Implement offences and penalties for illegal activities.

Policy: Resolución Nº 162-2018-OS ─ Aprueba el listado de condiciones de inseguridad de criticidad alta en cilindros para Gas Licuado del Petróleo (GLP) envasado.

La presente Resolución establece que las Empresas Envasadoras son responsables por el mantenimiento y seguridad de los cilindros para GLP rotulados con su signo distintivo y de aquellos con los que exista acuerdo contractual de coresponsabilidad para su envasado, debiendo conservarlos en condiciones permanentes de seguridad para los usuarios. Asimismo, antes de la distribución para efectos de su comercialización, las Empresas Envasadoras deberán constatar la aptitud de los referidos cilindros, así como sus sistemas válvula-regulador en la forma dispuesta por las Normas Técnicas vigentes.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 942 validating the Regulation on the procedure for granting subsidies for reimbursement of part of the costs of interest on investment loans (credits) in the agricultural sector.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for granting subsidies for reimbursement of part of the costs of interest on investment loans (credits) in the agricultural sector, sets forth the criteria of selection of eligible legal entities and individual entrepreneurs related to credits allocated by the Russian crediting institutions, state corporation "Bank for Development and Foreign Economic Affairs (Vnesheconombank) and credits allocated by agricultural credit consumer cooperatives in accordance with concluded contracts. It also sets forth targets, terms and conditions for allocation of subsidies, and the procedure for return of subsidies to the regional budget in case of violation of the conditions established for their allocation, reporting requirements, requirements for monitoring of compliance with the terms, objectives and procedures for granting subsidies and responsibility for their violation. Subsidies shall be granted to reimburse part of the cost of paying interest on credit contracts (loan contracts) concluded for the implementation of investment projects selected by the Ministry of Agriculture of Russia until December 31, 2016 inclusive, until the date of full repayment of the borrower's obligations under the credit contract. Recipient of the subsidies must comply with the following requirements: (a) the applicant must have no unfulfilled obligation to pay taxes, duties, insurance premiums, fines, penalties, interest payable in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation on taxes and duties; (b) the applicant must have no overdue debts on return to the regional budget of subsidies, budget investments granted also in accordance with other legal acts, or any other overdue indebtedness to the regional budget; (c) during the subsidized period the recipients - legal entities must not be in the process of reorganization, liquidation or bankruptcy proceedings, the activities of the recipient have not been suspended in accordance with the procedure stipulated by the legislation of the Russian Federation, and the recipients who are individual entrepreneurs have not ceased their activities as an individual entrepreneur; (d) the recipient is not a foreign legal entity, as well as a Russian legal entity, in the authorized (share) capital of which the share of participation of foreign legal entities, the place of registration of which is a state or territory included in the list of states or territories approved by the Ministry of Finance of the Russian Federation, providing preferential tax treatment and (or) which do not stipulate the disclosure or presentation of information related to financial transactions (offshore zones) with regard to such legal entities exceeds 50 percent in the aggregate; and (e) recipients should not receive other funds from the regional budget.

Policy: Resolución Nº ARCONEL-042/18 ─ Regulación para  Generación fotovoltaica para autoabastecimiento de consumidores finales de energía eléctrica.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución emite la Regulación Técnica para la Generación fotovoltaica para autoabastecimiento de consumidores finales de energía eléctrica, que establece las condiciones para el desarrollo, implementación y participación de consumidores que cuenten con sistemas de microgeneración fotovoltaica -μSFV- hasta 100kW de capacidad nominal instalada, ubicados en techos, superficies de viviendas o en edificaciones para las categorías residencial y general determinados en el pliego tarifario en bajo o medio voltaje. El Sistema de microgeneración fotovoltaica μSFV, es el conjunto de equipos, compuesto generalmente por paneles fotovoltaicos, inversores, reguladores de carga y con o sin baterías o sistemas acumuladores, que permiten la captación de la energía solar para su conversión en energía eléctrica. Para efectos de aplicación de esta regulación, se determina que los sistemas fotovoltaicos de baja capacidad podrán tener una capacidad nominal instalada de hasta 100 kW y podrán trabajar en sincronismo con la red de distribución.

Policy: Resolution No. 115/2018 approving the Post Disaster Recovery Framework (QRP).
Policy_Content: The purpose of the Post Disaster Recovery Framework (QRP) is to provide guidance to the government and its partners following a disaster on how to conduct the planning and management of a resilient recovery process. This guiding framework for recovery is based on previous experiences and lessons learned in the management of prior recovery processes and should enable the government to be better prepared to manage and guide a process that brings together and optimizes the efforts and resources of all stakeholders. Preparedness for recovery aims to improve the capacity to efficiently and appropriately manage post-disaster recovery by establishing the necessary institutional, political and financial arrangements before disaster occurs and building the capacities to plan and manage recovery. The preparation process aims at identifying gaps and needs for effective and efficient implementation of recovery processes, as well as suggesting measures to strengthen implementation capacity at national and local level.

Policy: Resolution No. 114/2018 approving the National Strategy for Disaster Risk Reduction (ENRRD).
Policy_Content: The National Strategy for Disaster Risk Reduction (ENRRD) responds to and is effective in a number of national instruments and policies relevant to the implementation of disaster risk reduction. This strategy is interlinked and supported by other relevant national policies, plans and legislation for disaster risk reduction. The overall objective of this strategy is therefore to provide an effective framework for managing risks, preventing disasters, minimizing damage and associated losses, and avoiding the creation of new risks by establishing institutional mechanisms and capacity building to plan and implement disaster risk reduction to build the resilience of Cape Verde (pag. 1618). ENRRD promotes the integration of risk reduction and adaptation to climate change in all sectors relevant to food security and reaffirms the need to develop risk insurance as a measure of financial protection against risks of disasters (pag.1619). ENRRD is aligned with the objectives of sustainable management of agricultural and natural resources sector aiming to contribute to the resilience of rural livelihoods and infrastructures caused by disasters. For this, it promotes the integration in the sectoral planning and management the approach of disaster risk reduction and a resilient recovery of livelihoods affected by disasters (pag. 1628).

Policy: Law “On land reclamation”.
Policy_Content: This Law determines legal, economic and organizational bases for land reclamation and regulates relations arising in this area. Land reclamation shall be intended a complex of agrotechnical, hydrotechnical, forestry engineering, land clearing, chemical and other reclamation measures aimed at radical improvement of adverse natural (hydrological, soil, agroclimatic) conditions of land with the aim of rational and stable use of land resources. Land reclamation shall be carried out for the following purposes: (a) rational use and protection of water resources; (b) improvement of ameliorative condition of land; (c) increase of fertility and sustainable preservation of land; (d) increase of agricultural production as a result of restoration and stable preservation of soil fertility on agricultural land; (e) involvement of unused and low-productive land into agricultural turnover by carrying out ameliorative measures; (f) protection of land from mudflow and flood waters, wind and water erosion, increase of ground water level; (g) development of new land areas; and (h) ensuring watering of pastures. Land reclamation shall be based on the following principles: (a) state regulation of land reclamation; (b) state accounting of reclamation systems; (c) ensuring environmental safety during reclamation activities; (d) substantiation of reclamation activities; (e) introduction of innovative technologies during construction and operation of reclamation systems; (f) preservation and rational use of land; and (g) protection of rights and legitimate interests of users of melioration systems and other parties. The Law consists of VII Chapters divided into 29 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards state regulation in the field of land reclamation. Chapter III regards land reclamation. Chapter IV regards ameliorative systems. Chapter V establishes the procedure for the performance of land reclamation. Chapter VI regards registration and inventory of ameliorative systems. Chapter VII lays down final provisions.

Policy: Regulation on the Ecolabel.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays out rules for the establishment and application of a voluntary Ecolabel scheme intended to promote products with a reduced environmental impact during their entire life cycle and to provide consumers with accurate and science-based information on the environmental impact of products. Ecolabel criteria shall be determined on a scientific basis considering the whole life cycle of products with the aim of minimization of the most significant environmental impacts, in particular the impact on climate change, the impact on nature, biodiversity and human health. In this regard, this Regulation sets forth provisions on general principles and requirements for Ecolabel scheme; the establishment of Ecolable criteria; application procedures for eco-labeling; terms and conditions of its use; duties and responsibilities of the competent authorities; market surveillance and control of the use of the Ecolabel; and offences and penalties.

Policy: Ley 124 - Protección medioambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley prohíbe el uso del glifosato. La prohibición rige a partir del 1° de abril del 2020. Dicho plazo se establece con el fin de iniciar un cambio cultural de los sistemas productivos actuales hacia métodos más amigables con el medio ambiente. En particular queda prohibido el uso del glifosato, sus componentes y afines, en los ejidos urbanos del territorio provincial; comunidades de pueblos originarios; establecimientos educativos y sanitarios cualquiera sea su denominación o rango; Reservas Naturales de cualquier tipo y denominación ya sean nacionales, provinciales, municipales o privadas; centros turísticos; cursos de agua dulce que proveen para consumo humano o su utilización para la producción agrícola ganadera.

Policy: Law No. XI-1539 amending Law No.I-1613 of 1996 on nuclear energy.
Policy_Content: Article 32 shall be amended to add the following wording: “A security analysis and substantiation of the construction site of a nuclear facility must be carried out before the preparation of a project for a nuclear power plant adapted to a specific site. The results of this analysis and substantiation shall be inserted in the assessment report of the site of construction of the nuclear power plant, which must be coordinated with the State Nuclear Power Safety Inspectorate. In the course of this analysis and substantiation, all factors related to the construction site or its environment that could affect the nuclear safety of the nuclear facility, including physical security and emergency preparedness planning, and proposed remedies for deficiencies must be stated. The State Nuclear Power Safety Inspectorate coordinates the assessment of the construction site only after verifying that the results of the analysis and substantiation of the site meet the requirements of the legal acts, and having received positive conclusions regarding the assessment report of the site of the nuclear facility from the Lithuanian Hydrometeorological Service the Ministry of the Environment, the Ministry of Health, the Lithuanian Transport Safety Administration, the Lithuanian Geological Survey under the Ministry of Environment and the Fire and Rescue Department under the Ministry of the Interior. The procedure for reviewing the construction site evaluation report of a nuclear power plant is established by the Government. "
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Nuclear energy,Environmental audit,Early warning system/emergency intervention system
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Law No. XIII-1566 amending Law No. IX-2499 “On noise management”.
Policy_Content: Article 4 shall be amended to add the following wording: “The Aircraft Noise Certificate is issued by the Transport Expertise Agency in accordance with the procedure set by the Ministry of Transport, after verifying that the aircraft data conforms to the requirements of the legal acts and standards of the International Civil Aviation Organization. Airborne noise monitoring (assessment) systems must be able to monitor continuously the noise levels day and night for at least three consecutive days. The number of observation points and observation points and the monitoring procedure are set by the Lithuanian Transport Safety Administration.”
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: State Program "Agricultural Development and Regulation of Agricultural Products, Raw Materials and Food Markets”.
Policy_Content: State Program "Agricultural Development and Regulation of Agricultural Products, Raw Materials and Food Markets” is a cross-sectoral regional policy document aimed at sustainable development of agricultural sectors in the Rostov region; sustainable rural development; and ensuring the effective activity of public authorities in the field of agricultural development. It envisages the performance of the following tasks: (a) creation of conditions for increasing production of agricultural and fishery complexes; (b) creation of conditions for the preservation and reproduction of soil fertility of agricultural land, as well as the restoration and involvement of reclaimed agricultural land in circulation; (c) assistance in improving the quality of life of the rural population, including through improving the infrastructural arrangement of rural territories; and (d) ensuring the effective implementation of the measures of the state program, as well as state powers in the field of agriculture. Expected Results of the State Program: (a) increase in agricultural production and its processed products; (b) increase of the area of reclaimed land; (c) acceleration of technical modernization of agricultural production; (d) increase in the influx of investments in agriculture and fisheries; (e) increase in rural income through wage growth; (f) ensuring the financial stability of agricultural producers by increasing the profitability of production; and (g) improvement of housing conditions and infrastructure in rural areas.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Décret exécutif n° 18-264 du 8 Safar 1440 correspondant au 17 octobre 2018 portant création du centre de recherche en environnement (C.R.E).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée le Centre de Recherche en Environnement (CRE), en application des dispositions de l'article 2 du décret exécutif n° 11-396 du 28 Dhou El Hidja 1432 correspondant au 24 novembre 2011, fixant le statut-type de l'établissement public à caractère scientifique et technologique. Le centre est chargé de réaliser les programmes de recherche scientifique et de développement technologique dans le domaine de l'environnement, visant la résolution des problématiques liées: à la préservation, au développement et à la valorisation des ressources naturelles; à l'évaluation et à la modélisation des changements climatiques et leur impact sur l'environnement; à la prévention des risques liés aux pollutions et aux technologies de dépollution; au développement de l'économie verte; et à la gestion et à la valorisation des déchets.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Acuerdo mediante el cual se establecen los términos y el procedimiento respecto de la notificación a los propietarios y poseedores de terrenos forestales, o aquellos que resultaren afectados, para la ejecución de las actividades necesarias para evitar o reducir la situación de riesgo a los ecosistemas forestales.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo establece los términos y el procedimiento respecto de la notificación a los propietarios y poseedores de terrenos forestales, o aquellos que resultaren afectados, para la ejecución de las actividades necesarias para evitar o reducir la situación de riesgo a los ecosistemas forestales. La CONAFOR, a través de las Gerencias Estatales, emitirá las notificaciones a que se refiere el artículo 132 de la Ley General de Desarrollo Forestal Sustentable, con base en estudios técnicos para determinar la posible existencia de riesgo a los ecosistemas forestales

Policy: Land Affairs Management Amendment Law.
Policy_Content: This Law amends the Land Affairs Management Law 2017, to clarify a number of concepts and modify a number of articles. The Law expands the definition of state lands to all lands located inside or outside the urban areas and has been registered in the state-land book, including but not limited to gardens, water lands, abandoned lands, mountains, hillsides, fields, forests, and rangelands. The public lands are defined as all lands, either inside or outside of the urban areas and dedicated to public interests. With the approval of the Council of Ministers, and in order to provide for the public services cost, the Government may sell parts of its lands through auctions to domestic corporations or individuals.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Southern Asia

Policy: Regional Law No. 71-oz “On village chiefs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues of the activities of village chiefs as a form of public participation of the population in local government. Village chief can be appointed with a view of coordination between local government of the municipalities and the local population of rural areas for decision-making related to issues of local significance. Village chief shall have the following powers: (a) provides organizational and informational support to the residents of rural settlement when applying to the local authorities municipal entity; (b) holds a personal reception of residents of the rural settlement, sends appeals to local authorities based on its results; and (c) provides assistance to local self-government bodies of municipalities for the prevention of natural and technological disasters and mitigation of the consequences thereof.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Arrêté n° 9682 du 17 octobre 2018 portant attributions et organisation du département de l’économie et de la sociologie rurale de l’institut national de recherche forestière.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe, conformément aux dispositions des articles 55 et 56 du décret n° 2016-58 du 16 février 2016 portant approbation des statuts de l’Institut national de recherche forestière, les attributions et l’organisation du département de l’économie et de sociologie rurale de la direction scientifique de l’institut national de recherche forestière Le département et de l’économie et sociologie rurale est chargé de conduire toute recherche en rapport avec les missions de l’institut national de recherche forestière dans les domaines de l’économie et de la sociologie rurale. Il est chargé, notamment, de: mener toute recherche théorique ou appliquée pluridisciplinaire et participative en économie et sociologie rurale sur: les aspects socio-économiques du développement forestier durable; les systèmes de production forestière; l’environnement socio-économique et culturel de la production forestière et les principaux centres de décision; les problèmes de revenus et du financement des activités forestières; la valorisation des résultats des recherches et du savoir-faire local; la formation à la recherche et par la recherche des chercheurs et stagiaires de l’institut national de recherche forestière; la publication et la diffusion des résultats des travaux, du développement des connaissances et de l’information scientifique.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Arrêté n° 9680 du 17 octobre 2018 portant attributions et organisation du département changement climatique et implication sur les ressources forestières de l’institut national de recherche forestière.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe, conformément aux dispositions des articles 55 et 56 du décret n° 2016-58 du 26 février 2016 portant approbation des statuts de l’Institut national de recherche forestière, les attributions et l’organisation du déportement changement climatique et implication sur les ressources forestières de la direction scientifique de l’institut national de recherche forestière. Le département changement climatique et implication sur les ressources forestières de l’institut national de recherche forestière est chargé, notamment, de: organiser, conduire et exécuter toute recherche fondamentale et appliquée visant la promotion du développement forestier dans les domaines du changement climatique et de son impact sur les ressources forestières; participer à la valorisation des résultats de ses recherches et de son savoir-faire en matière de changement climatique et de son impact sur les ressources forestières; apporter son concours à la formation à la recherche et par la recherche des chercheurs et stagiaires de l’institut national de recherche forestière; publier et diffuser les résultats de ses travaux et concourir au développement des connaissances et de l’information scientifique en matière de changement climatique et de son impact sur les ressources forestières.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe, conformément aux dispositions des articles 55 et 56 du décret n° 2016-58 du 26 février 2016 portant approbation des statuts de l’Institut national de recherche forestière, les attributions et l’organisation du département écologie forestière de la direction scientifique de l’institut national de recherche forestière.
